description:
I've heard a lot about this restaurant and those garlic noodles and was curious whether or not it would live up to the hype. And it did! The garlic noodles at first bite seemed a bit underwhelming, but the more you ate the more addicting they became. When we were done we definitely wanted more! And the garlic crab was also very good. 

Our server was good, though tried a bit too hard with the jokes.
author: Kevin D.

description:
Crustacean definitely went down hill. As soon as our 1st party arrives, before our reservation time of 8:15pm, the Mgr. approached twice to rush the only party of our group to put in our order and says the kitchen closes at 8:15pm. Open Table had reservations available up to 9pm. If I know I would be eating in a rush, I would not have come here. I've been a long time customer of Crustacean and I've seen it gone down. The restaurant was barely 15% full. No host was at the front desk. I had to walk into the dining room to look for my party. All their staff just looks at me but no one offered to help me while I searched for my party. Eventually I found them but took at least a few minutes of walking throughout their restaurant. 

Our servers were attentive and helped to make sure our party's needs were met.

Although the Mgr. thanked us to dine at Crustacean, but the rush was not something I had expected. The garlic noodles were meh.  Looks like it wasn't prepared like how it used to be done.  Plus, there was a whole 1/3 bowl of butter soaking the noodles. I think that's excessive in comparison to how it was normally prepared in the past. Crab was alright. The Seabass was a tad fishy.

Thanh Long still kept their cooking consistently. I was at that location 2 months ago to celebrate my birthday and hands down, it as worth going to the outer sunset location for better tasting food than Crustacean. Thanh Long was a packed house on a weekday.
author: Betty L.

description:
FOOD.
The food at crustacean was definitely hyped for me so I thought I would give it a try for a friends bday. I think for what you get the price is expensive. I ordered the roasted crab with garlic which was pretty exquisite but for how big the crab is there was very little meat and a lot of effort. If you are not about cracking your own crabs you can ask them to do it for you. The crab Price was not listed on the menu and for us it turned out to be $70. I highly recommend that you get the crab as well as the garlic noodles. The garlic noodles were a great balance to the crab instead of just getting plain rice. I probably will not come back to this restaurant for a long time because it is pricey but for a special occasion I think it might be worth it. The food came out in a timely manner as well.

SERVICE.
As soon as we were seated around 7:30 PM on a Tuesday the server proceeded to tell us that we had less than 15 minutes to figure out what we wanted to order because the kitchen was closing at 8:30 PM. I was a former server so I understand that the owner may want to close on the restaurant if there are not that many customers that night but the way that the server message this was inappropriate and caused my guess to have anxiety around what they wanted to order. Throughout the entire dinner everyone was nervously eating because we didn't want to make the restaurant wait for us as we were enjoying our food. I would not have tipped the server as much as that I did but gratuity was already included with our bill. That being said it it was just one server that we did not feel did his job well everyone else including the kitchen were very accommodating and polite. The review would have had four stars if the service was better.
author: Eunice Y.

description:
Argh..Garlic Noodles...

When I went here recently I didn't know really what to expect until I saw the pictures on yelp. 90% of the pictures were either the Crab or Garlic Noodles; and for good reason. I ordered the Tiger Prawns with Garlic Noodles and I was in Garlic heaven. 

The prawns were huge and seasoned perfectly. The flavor really complimented the noodles extremely well. It's one of those things where you can eat something so simple but yet it's so good. I tasted a solid amount of garlic in every bite of noodles. However I really enjoyed the texture of the noodles as well. They have to be made scratch...they are too good man...Most of all, you do get a lot and can save half for a second meal!!

Anywho, if you live in the bay and are in the city you should definitely check this place out. Amazing food and service. Next time I just might have to try that crab!!
author: Anthony W.

description: My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on Friday. For drinks, I ordered the lychee martini and my man had the pina cachaca. The lychee martini was strong and fragrant. I'll order the pina cachaca since I really like fruity alcoholic drinks. I The salmon was crispy and full of flavor. Loved how it was crispy on the outside while moist and tender. The roasted crab was cooked to perfection,  but way too expensive for my taste. Still, a nice treat.
author: Thu L.

description:
Went there for the first time last night and made reservations for dinner again next week. Same owners as Thanh Long in Judah Street but nearer downtown San Francisco.

Love the Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shaken Beef! Also order the Calamari.
author: Benjamin S.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night for my birthday dinner. My bf claimed they had the best garlic noodles, so I def wanted to try this place out.

He made reservations originally for the two of us, but my family came into town, so we changed our reservations from 2 to 4. Then we invited my in-laws, so 4 to 6. My cousins and brother then decided to join so now we changed it from 6 to 9. This was all within one day and they were so accommodating! Thank Buddha! 

We arrived just in time for our reservation and was seated immediately. Our waiter was super chill and patient. First thing we ordered were drinks and boy were those shots fat. 

For appetizers:
3 Crab puffs (highly recommended)
2 Ahi tuna (did not like)
2 Lobster roll (highly recommended) 
Vietnamese carpaccio (highly recommended)
 
Entrees:
Shaken beef (pretty good)
Steamed Seabass (highly recommend)
Roast salmon (good)
3 royal tiger prawns (highly recommended)
Roast crab (good)
Ginger lobster with garlic noodles (eh, the tomatoes killed the garlic noodles flavor. Tasted like spaghetti)

The garlic noodles is very good here. I actually want to go back just for the garlic noodles. Service and food was 8/10.
author: Dalina L.

description:
Came here for a graduation dinner and loved it! The atmosphere is more high end than it's rival, ppq. The service and food was really good. We started out with a bunch of appetizers... the mussels, coconut shrimp, lobster roll, papaya salad, and Asian soup. The appetizers were fine but the coconut shrimp was very very good. The lobster rolls were a bit of a disappointment since they were more like spring rolls. 

In terms of mains, we got the roasted crab, garlic noodle, and garlic rice. The crab and noodle does not taste as decadent as ppq... but the crab was sweet and tender (tends to be more dry at ppq but also more flavorful.) I like that the crab had garlic and freshly cracked pepper on it. The garlic noodles were very delicate. However, I actually really really liked the garlic rice. 

For dessert we got the sorbet and the creme brûlée. Both were excellent. While I still like ppq better, this place is definitely more high end and the food is very comparable. It is slightly more expensive than ppq as well but it is also more respectable to bring out of town guest.
author: Jocelyn K.

description:
We're big fans of Thanh Long, and wanted to bring some visitors from the UK here for a nice meal.  

The food was fantastic, but our server disappeared halfway through the meal.  Someone eventually came to take our plates and offer coffee and dessert, but they took away all our remaining food without offering to box anything.  (There was a whole skewer of beef and a big pile of noodles that would have been great for next day's lunch!) . I'm not sure what happened, service was great at the start.  

Roasted crab and garlic noodles always rock. Shaken beef was yummy, and the creme brûlée cheesecake was terrific.  

I still recommend, but I was mad about my leftovers.  We didn't mind the delay in cleanup so much, as we were having a great conversation and weren't in a rush.
author: Linda M.

description: Great atmosphere and very good food! The menu is very simple but has enough variety to cover all the shell fish options. Full bar including hot Sake. I had the special Dungeness crab and garlic noodles and the flavors were so bold and nicely paired with the Sake. It is definitely a great food experience!
author: Sommer D.

description: Came here on a random Thursday night and we were quickly seated around 8pm-ish.  They are the same family restaurant as Thanh Long and have restaurants throughout California, I've seen Crustacean also in Beverly Hills while passing by! I'm usually not a big fan of garlic but the garlic noodles were SOOO good.  Also got the roasted crab and its delicious! goes well with some chardonnay and some shaken beef as well.  This restaurant is clean and the servers are attentive. Definitely want to come back here whenever I am craving their crab! This location is on polk street so there isn't much street parking unless you get lucky.
author: Ben Z.

description:
Roast peppered crab for the win!  That's their signature seafood entree!  Garlic noodles compliment the crab!  Nom!

They offer up other seafood delights like carpaccio and lobster ravioli, which was a favorite of mine as well!  Egg rolls, spring rolls, fried calamari and juicy mussels are must as appetizers!

The layout is upstairs of a corner kind of commercial space and atypical for the restaurant. Only one stall for the women's bathroom.  

Service was spot on.
author: Tiffany D.

description: Ate here twice and I'm not a Crab fan at all. But the second time, I tried it and I get it now. That crab was to die for. How could something be so perfect? It's like a party in your mouth. We got prawns and garlic noodles, calamari and salmon entree. I honestly don't think the garlic noodles are all of that. But I'm also not a huge Asian cuisine lover. At least not authentic, I'm the American bootleg Chinese food lover lol. But the crab is totally worth it.
author: Tiyah H.

description:
5 stars for the food and service. Our waiter was super nice and knowledgeable which helped ordering a dish very easy. We started with the fried calamari and he brought us his own special sauce which had an extra kick to it, it was so good. 
We ordered the garlic crab and garlic noodles. The garlic noodles were evenly flavored, perfect amount of garlic. 
The crab was huge! Flavoring was buttery garlic, salted and a lot of black pepper. I loved the flavor, there was a little bit too much black pepper for me but I still couldn't stop eating it. The portion sizes are decent so next time I might skip the appetizer and go straight to the crab.
author: Jessica K.

description:
First time here. Always wanted to try. Thought the entrance and decor is super cute. Friendly staff. My excitement got me a tour with a personal guide around the restaurant. There's a full bar. BUT SERIOUSLY, WHY THE HELL DID IT TAKE ME SO LONG TO COME HERE ?!

The price is insane. For 2 of us, we ordered 2 appetizers (mussels and calamari), 1 roasted crab, 1 garlic noodles and 3 orders of coke, the bill $150. Their coke is from the tap, as in it is not from a can/bottle that we have. Hence, their soda is very watered down + there is a ton of ice. So, to me, everything on the bill was totally WORTH IT except for the cokes. 

GET THE NEW ENGLAND MUSSELS! Just trust me and get it. It is sooooo soooo wonderful. The crab itself is HUGE, really good to share with 1 or 2 other people. Ask for gloves if you don't want to get down and dirty. They provide the customers with really good quality gloves, like the ones doctors/dentists use. Not the clear plastic flimsy ones at crawfish places. We arrived 6.30pm without a reservation and got lucky. The party of 2 behind us couldn't even sit at the bar because they are fully booked! On a Sunday night!

I seriously can't wait to return and try another dish.
author: Quynh N.

description:
Loved this place, it might be overpriced but that doesn't stop my 5-Star review. 

We arrived an hour early due to some free time before our original reservation, there was no problem seating us right away. Our waitress was very nice and patient with us as we had some questions on which type of crab to get. 

We had Calamari to start with Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles, those are all pretty much staple items. My dad had a beef dish which he enjoyed as well. If you're in town try this place or Thanh Long-it's about the same, in my opinion.
author: Dana C.

description:
My boyfriend and I celebrated our 2 year anniversary here and he was recommended by his co-worker to come here. 

As a high schooler, I always passed by this restaurant and always wondered what this restaurant with a giant ass crab on the outside is like on the inside annnnd 10 years later I got to find out!

Service: 
We made a reservation for 7pm and they didn't look too busy (but then again we came on a Monday night). The host let us choose where we wanted to sit which was nice. We got to sit in the booth which is my favorite type of table. 

Food: 
I didn't realize this place was a Vietnamese/American fusion restaurant until I opened the menu and saw "Traditional Vietnamese Salad" lol. So of course I had to get the salad. 

Salad - 3 out of 5. It can be better given that it was mostly just the papaya shreds and didn't have the other veggies that other Vietnamese restaurant has. Nuoc mam was on point though. 

Royal Tiger Prawn - 4 out of 5. The noodles were their house garlic noodle (An's garlic noodles) which were sooo good. It could've used a little less butter but still good. The prawns were nicely cooked/grilled but prawns are prawns (I can't really tell the difference between good and bad ones). I just liked that they were well cooked. 

Roasted crab - 4 out of 5. My boyfriend really liked the flavor of it. It was seasoned nicely and the sauce went very well with the crab. We normally eat crabs with lemon and pepper to get rid of the "fishy" taste but they were able to mask that with just garlic and butter. 

Lychee Martini - 4 out of 5. This drink was STRONG. There is a slight lychee taste but it was mostly alchie (which I'm not complaining because more bang for my buck). 

Overall: 
I give this place a 3 out of 5 because the service was slow even though they weren't busy. It is also pricey for the simplicity of the food and you can definitely find a better seafood/garlic noodle place in the city. But it's worth a try if you are around the area.
author: Annie V.

description:
THIS RESTAURANT HAS COCKROACHES! Had reservations 8-18-18 for dinner and discovered the pest issue immediately in the dining room after being served ice water by waitress! Inside my friends glass was a LIVE cockroach!! Omg how can they miss that dark brown cockroach and serve it to him ?! The waitress was there at the time and witnessed the whole ordeal!  She saw the rockroach and quickly took the glass away from the dining room.  My friend handled it very calmly, and we asked for the manager. The manager was Daniel and he was kind enough to order us a uber as we requested to go quietly to another restaurant instead.  Sadly for the diners who ate there that night, had no idea of the conditions of restaurant. 

I don't like leaving negative reviews, but under the circumstances I have to let the public be aware what's going on in the kitchen! If there was a cockroach in a glass of ice water imagine what's in your dinner plates! Issa no from me, I would never eat at this establishment nor recommend it to anyone.
This restaurant needs a an exterminator and the city health inspector!

I appreciate the owners response. Still doesn't change the fact that there was a COCKROACH served in my friends glass of water !! 

Would not recommend unless you don't mind cockroach's.
author: Lily S.

description:
This venerable San Francisco seafood restaurant has never lost its mojo. One of the Bay Area first Asian Fusion restaurants. Our usual order includes the best roast crab ever! (hence the name: Crustacean). The neighborhood has seen better day but basically it's as safe as any in big cities. 

What prompted this review was the superior service we received from Andrew during our last visit. His recommendations and suggestions helped move our evening from a 9 to a perfect 10! We've received excellent service from other restaurants but our night with Andrew was most memorable. As  if he can read our mind. Thank you, Andrew!
author: Trevor N.

description:
AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! Go to Thanh Long instead. I would give NIL STARS if i could. Here's why...

If something terrible happens to you, like a severe allergic reaction in the middle of dinner, the managers DGAF. I emailed once and called back 3x over the course of 2 months. Ken, the main manager I initially spoke with, does not return messages. Only Daniel was sort of able to help. At first, I wanted to see what they could do for me (maybe at least comp the appetizer that gave me an allergic reaction). At this point, it's super upsetting and I want the entire meal comped just because Ken is unprofessional and lacks service. It's about principles now.

So you're probably wondering -WTF why would a person with a shrimp allergy would eat at a seafood restaurant. Because I am 30 years old, absolutely love seafood and have lived with this specific allergy a majority of my life. After eating at countless seafood restaurants, this is the ONLY ONE I have experienced an unexpected allergic reaction. I know my body and what I can eat. I even eat shrimp sometimes because I like to live life on the edge. Cross contamination with shrimp is totally fine. Ingesting shrimp meat is what gives me hives all over my face and body. 

So imagine we have 4 cocktails, 2 appetizers, garlic noodles and a whole crab. This dinner was not cheap nor was it too expensive. We are more than willing to pay. Even if both the Lobster Rolls and Vietnamese Carpaccio sucked, we won't ask to take it off the bill because we took that chance. Of course the crab is amazing. I will absolutely give credit where it's due. It is roasted in mounds of butter, garlic, sugar, pepper and chicken bouillon. But that is besides my point!

Apparently, the so called Lobster Rolls appetizer is not all lobster so if you have a shrimp allergy, beware! Even if you don't have a shrimp allergy, just don't order it. It is underwhelming and bland. It looks and tastes like ground imitation crab with fillers ... rolled in a won-ton wrapper and fried. But it's a secret family recipe so they can't tell you what's in it! They just kept denying no shrimp was in it... OKAYYYYY sure.
author: Sydney H.

description: Have been attempting to call to change our reservation for 30 minutes and no response. They said they will be available after 2 and are obviously not. They charge 25 dollars per person if you miss your reservation which we are attempting to change due to a delayed flight. Will update my review if they decide to answer their phones, but definitely off to a bad, unprofessional start.
author: Eric V.

description: The roasted crab was even better than I expected. It was amazing. The noodles were really good too. It is very pricey but I was full the rest of the evening after my dinner. I wish I lived in SF to visit more often. The location is in a sketchy area and could look better inside, but the food is worth it. Glad I went.
author: Rum B.

description:
Best crab and garlic noodles in SF.
Great service, food always awesome, ambiance is family style, not formal.  Make sure you make reservations because they are always booked!
#2018KxALfavs
author: Ka'ili H.

description:
I read many good things about Crustacean when I was searching for a restaurant for crab. I decided to make a reservation for Father's Day and treat my dad to some crab! 
We ordered the salt and pepper calamari, crispy rice paper roll, roasted crab, tiger prawns, steamed seabass, roasted salmon, and garden vegetables. 
Everything was good tastewise, but the seafood was overcooked! The crab and tiger prawns were rubbery and stuck to the shells, which was so disappointing! 
Service was great, but I wouldn't recommend coming here for crab when there are a couple other restaurants that can cook crab better.
author: Anita W.

description:
I could eat here every week. Garlic roasted crab + garlic noodles. If you're eating with someone, the best strategy is to split one crab first. Then order a hot, second crab as you start to eat the first one. Otherwise the crab gets a bit cold as you work thru it. 

How do they make the garlic noodle? I heard it was a secret recipe. Looks really easy to reproduce, but it's just right. Thicker noodles. Use your fingers to eat it if you'd like. 

I've tried the other versions of crab (eg drunken) but I always regret not getting the original. 

The exterior of the place is in an older building. It could use a refresh. The interior is nice and the outside doesn't do this place justice.
author: Young Y.

description:
This restaurant is truly a spin off from the Netflix series Amazing Interiors. It outer appearance will have you walking in circles your first time there. 

Reservations are highly recommend. We arrived shortly after 5pm on a Sunday only a few patrons at that time. The maître d'mentioned if we'd arrived 20 minuets later we'd have a wait. Sure enough within minutes the restaurant was completely full and standing room only in the front.  

Garlic noodles , ensure you eat them while their hot. Once they cool, they're just noodles. The roasted crap tasty. I'd order it several times in a row! Seasonal Vegetables were fresh and full of flavor.

Full bar and great service.
author: Mek U.

description: It had the upscale atmosphere, which made me feel less guilty about eating all the garlicy food. :q The crab was juicy and solid, I took my parents there and they also enjoyed the dinner too. Minus one star for the garlic noodle, it was good but not so much better than other non fancy restaurant noodles.
author: Diana C.

description:
Features:
-We came here in a group of 8 people with reservations.  When we arrived, our table was not ready yet so we had to wait about 15 minutes.  We ordered the grilled calamari with peanut-mustard sauce which was crunchy and a good kind of salty.  This was really delicious and I remember wanting more.  I shared the royal tiger prawns in garlic noodles and roast crab with garlic spices with someone and to be honest, I was not that impressed with the garlic noodles.  I've heard people rave about the garlic noodles but it was extremely oily.  All I could think about was having high triglycerides and high cholesterol after.  The royal tiger prawns ONLY came with four prawns and they were not as big as the pictures on Yelp.  The roast crab was good and although not top notch delicious, it was well roasted and well salted.
-I had a taste of the skewered beef tender slices with lemongrass and this dish was nothing special either.  It tasted like something I could make myself at home.
-The customer service was not bad here.  They explained everything well and went over the menu with us.  They offered a lot of water refills and gave us time to decide.  

Improvement:
-I was not impressed with the over oily garlic noodles at all.  I only ate maybe a small portion of it and continued on with the prawns and crab.
-The skewered beef could use better taste improvements, maybe add some vegetables on the side? 

Tips:
-This place does get packed so make sure you make a reservation.
-CC and cash accepted.
-Restroom near the front where you check in.
author: Kristy L.

description:
two words:  Roasted Crab

Sooooo good! I liked the garlic noodles (which is practically a MUST accompaniment). We also had a delicious ravioli dish that was great too. We did have the salmon that was recommended by the waiter but I was not impressed with it (a little overcooked) - but everything else we had was great! If you haven't been - you should go at least once. Yum!
author: Dee T.

description: Just get the garlic roasted Dungeness Crab and the noodles....you will thank me later!
author: Jermaine P.

description: Good crab. i suggest the garlic fried rice over the noodle. Very tasty!
author: Kks78 S.

description: Every time we come to San Francisco this is a "must have" . We are from Southern California and have experienced the Sister restaurants in Beverly Hills and Costa Mesa also. They all have their own appeal and flair! Great  food, great service and great ambiance! Definitely recommend!
author: Vaunda J.

description:
I love crustacean it's one of my favorite places . The service was good . We made reservations right when it open because we got to San Francisco early. The garlic noodles are my favorite !!!! So good & a must have . I always get the crab . This was my first time eating at this location , Beverly Hills has better decor and much cleaner restroom. 


4 stars only because the restroom was a bit dirty and smelled too :x .
author: Carla R.

description: This place is amazing! Their garlic crabs and garlic noodles is a must! Food here is great and will not disappoint! If you love crab then this place is a must! Tastiest crab I ever had! Everything was so delish! Service was great too!
author: Rissa K.

description:
This is my favorite crab restaurant.  I always take my guests from out of town, state and country to dine at either Thanh Long or Crustacean. 

Food to order:  
garlic roasted dungeons crab 
Garlic noodle with prawn  
Sea bass  -- optional 

Environment:
Low light ambiance, good for chat and hang out.  Kids / toddlers can be accommodated.

Service:
A - this is a semi fine dining restaurant, service is averagely awesome.

Since I come here pretty often, I have a mixed experiences
author: Nick K.

description:
WoW!!!!!!! Can't believe how this place treat their guest. Came here for my niece birthday and spent my hard core working money and Can't even get serve right!!! Service ain't right like it use to be but food was still good. Folks at table order crab and got their bib after crab came out and had to ask for a bib/ ask for to go order along with putting my order to eat in and server telling me to put order in later and when I did the kitchen is close now even through I was already told kitchen is closing up/took awhile to be serve/order was taken but no order comes out/no hot towels for those who order crab. We ask to speak manager let him know what was going on and only took $74 off the bill!!!!!!! THIS JUST AIN'T RIGHT WORKING TO HARD FOR MY MONEY TO BE TREATED LIKE THIS!!!

~NEVER WILL EAT HERE AGAIN~
author: Jeberechiah S.

description:
One thing is for sure here.

Fresh seafood.  And if you love crab, then Crustacean needs to be on your list.

But there's no denying the subject of a lot of hype at this restaurant for decades.  That would be their famous garlic noodles.

And this is one of those rare occasions when you can believe the hype.

Consistency is so important, & you can rest assured that even after all of these years, the garlic noodles are still some of the best in town.  Texture & flavor do not disappoint.  Hot & zesty, kissed with more than a hint of garlic but not so much that  crosses the line to rendering yourself unkissable!  A bowl of garlic noodles here is what carb loaded food wishes are made of.

Whole roasted crab, garlic noodles, & a nice bottle of wine will satisfy your craving for tasty crab, gold standard noodles, & a more refined dinner than you'd get over at the wharf.  The digs can feel a bit dated, but for a delicious crab meal Crustacean still delivers.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: I got the roasted halibut and it was cooked perfect! I also tried Helene's shrimp ravioli and it was a different taste for me but I still very much liked it. I took my Dad here for a birthday dinner over the weekend and the overall ambiance was nice.
author: Shannon P.

description: I finally went to Crustacean's for the first time, and I have to say it was alright. Their garlic noodles are not as good as Thahn Longs. I like Thahn Longs better. I ate the noodles and shrimp. I have to admit that their calamari was very good, I really enjoyed it. Surely its pricey, but you can go just to say you went. I think Thahn Longs gives you a good amount of food also!
author: Alaya W.

description: It was our go to place. We visit 10+ times. The crab and garlic noodle was the best. We loved the crab until one day we got a very non-fresh crab. Smells like bathroom along with chemistry. We were so scared and never visited again.
author: Anya C.

description:
I was thisclose in missing out.  I've never been a big fan of crab so I was set on ordering the shaken beef, but as I sat with my dinner mates and listened to them go on and on (and on) about how amazing the roast crab is, I made a last minute decision that changed my life...that night.  

It's funny how you think you don't like something.  But it might easily change if the food is prepared or served a different way...or if it's just better quality.  I totally learned my lesson as I tore through that crab.  It was delicious!

We also enjoyed the garlic noodles and the garlic rice.  While the neighborhood is a little sketch, the restaurant was very nice.  The service was awesome.
author: Nadia K.

description: The garlic roasted crab is amazing! The only thing is that it is extremely expensive for what you get. We were told it was big enough to share with another person but if you're really hungry, I would not recommend sharing. We were recommended to get the fried rice with shrimp but it wasn't anything special, tasted bland, and I regret not trying the garlic noodles many yelpers mentioned on their reviews. Our server was not very attentive and provided very very slow service. I did not like how our server said we could not split up our checks separately between 5 people and instead we had to calculate exactly how much to charge on each card. For it being an expensive place to eat at, that was ridiculous to even make us do that. On top of that, no one came to get our payments and exact amounts for about 25 minutes. Customer service is definitely lacking and being from out of town, it was a bad experience.
author: Rebecca L.

description: Seriously love their Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles! No place I have been to in Europe and Asia comes close. Everyone I have taken here too over the decades have love it too, even people who don't like crab!
author: Tony D.

description:
Great for whole garlic roasted crab (they give you a bib and all) and garlic noodles. Bf tried the shaking beef last time and he said it was delicious. Nice wine menu. 

Slightly prefer their sister restaurant in Outer Sunset - Thanh Long. Menu is slightly different but you can still order the crab and noodles there. 

Must try the baked Alaska dessert as well  you can't get it at Thanh Long.

4/5 as seating is too close. When your elbows are up from cracking crab you don't want to feel like you'll bump your neighborhood.. ugh. You can hear everyone's conversation.
author: Ashley Renee B.

description: The best thing here is the customer service. Second up was the prawns and garlic noodles. Although it was good it isn't $38 good. I had the corn bisque which was supposed to have crab in it. Didn't really taste or see any crab. If you go to the grocery store pick up a can of creamed corn. Heat it and eat it and you've basically got the flavor of this bisque. I then had the creme brûlée which is one of my fave desserts and it was in the top 3 worst creme brûlée that I've had :-(. The crustacean cocktail was good though.
author: Tramaine W.

description: Danny service was GREAT.  I came way 2 San Fran from Long Beach Ca just 2 rat here.  The flavors taste just like Beverly Hills.  Beverly Hills wait is 3 weeks.  I got right in.  Everything & Everyone was NICE 2 us.   THX u ALL.
author: M M.

description: They have the most amazing fusion food. The garlic noodle is extremely simple but flavorful. Every dish is huge and worth the price.
author: Dinh B.

description: 3 things you will remember about Crustecean 1) Royal Crab 2) Garlic noodles 3) Baked Alaska.   Full bar is nice and cocktails are creative.  Their menu is quite extensive, but everything else we ordered (been their twice) wasn't memorable.  You'll need a reservation and pro tip, pay the extra $5 to have them crack your crab for you.
author: Jas S.

description: This is the 4th time I have enjoyed this restaurant and I think it just keeps getting better! I love crab and their crab is to die for! It is messy but worth the work. Service is very fast!
author: Lynn S.

description: Ambiance isn't as great as their Beverly Hills location. Location was a bit sketchy. Food is always great and consistent. Always order their specialty which the crab and garlic noodles.
author: June E.

description:
Debated between giving this 3 or 4 stars. If you're not a huge fan of crab, this restaurant may not convert you (as it didn't for me). But my fiancé and other friends loved their crabs and devoured all of them. 

For apps, we had the papaya salad with calamari (not bad), the crispy rolls with chicken and mushroom (yummy), and some type of shrimp and cucumber salad (which was really good). The garlic noodles are yummy - def will want to order one between two people - and we also ordered a side of garlic bread which was great to dip into the crab butter as well.  If you're super hungry, I would order a whole crab, but I ended up not eating most of mine. So if just with another friend, I would suggest getting one noodles/crab/some apps to share.
author: Gina B.

description:
I've been coming to CRUSTACEANS for 16 years annually, on my birthday and in between birthdays (all by myself on birthdays)! I love it. I read the Yelp reviews this time before going and I must say, they were daunting and discouraging. 

However, my experience was great! 

Food: I had the Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles! I asked for extra seasoning like pepper! It was really good! I have never had my crab pre-cracked before today. It was worth it. I think I'll be doing this from now on! The crab was very meaty and the pepper seasoning + pieces of roasted garlic were on point today!!!!

Service: Mr. Lee took me back to my seat and even gave me a complimentary drink to say Happy Birthday!!!! 

My waiter Andrew was very personable and cute! Hehehe. No, but he was a really good waiter and he new just when to stop by and he had really good conversation with all of the tables that he waited on, that I could see. These perks make you wants to spend your money! 

I can't wait to tell family and friends about the wonderful exprience that I had at CRUSTACEANS!
author: Ulysha R.

description: I was stuck between giving this a 4 or a 3, I woulda gave it a 3.5 because of the pricing but I'll go with a 3. First off let me say it is a very nice, delicious and friendly restaurant. In order to make reservations they'll hold your cc and if you don't show there's a $25 fee for each member of your party. Now they did allow me to call and change the timing of my reservations which was nice of them. So we got there had some time to kill ordered some drinks at the bar which were fairly priced but the bartender didn't seem like he was interested in serving us maybe because he had judged us? I'm not quite sure. The waitress was very friendly. We had a table of 9 and everyone ordered an appetizer to split per 2 and their entree. We had a drink or two each with dinner as well. I split the chicken and beef skewers which were both AMAZING. Perfectly cooked meat which had such a distinct flavor. Highly recommend this appetizer. My entree I got th jumbo garlic prawns with garlic noodles. The entree was the most popular throughout our table as 5 people got it. It was amazing, the garlic noodles were delicious. Overall the food was absolutely amazing. Now I have been to many restaurants before, for the portions of these plates and what kind of food we ordered they deff jack up their prices due to the celebrities/popularity of the garlic noodles which is why it is getting 3 Stars. I would love to try more things on the menu in another visit to San Fran but will deff be smart about the pricing on the menu.
author: Jatin K.

description: The food was excellent. I had the Drunken Crab my wife had the Lobster both were amazingly delicious. It's a bit pricey but, well worth it. Definitely a good place to celebrate your anniversary.
author: William G.

description: I was told to visit this location because of it's cousin restaurant "thanh long." Well Thanh long may be small but the food is much better! The service was alright considering the waiter kept forgetting our orders. The whole Staff was charming to say the least because He gave me a free double shot of Hennessy for my troubles. Not to crazy about the location either because it's kind of grimy at night and it smells bad out front. the inside looks really nice though. The decor was mostly of crocodile and bamboo  the food was alright. I ordered garlic noodles, roasted crab and a kale salad. The Kale salad was to die for! The crab and noodles I'll never order again! I'm not sure if the food was bland and stale tasting. Was it like this because we came in at 8pm and they close at 9pm? My experience was nice because I was with family and friends but I'll be heading back to Thanh Long... PS I did clean my plate but it's not like I was drooling for seconds.
author: Tamu V.

description:
2.5 stars

Many years ago, when I was a student at Berkeley, Crustacean was the epitome of the ultimate dining experience. Despite its lackluster reviews, and somewhat outdated cuisine, I did make it a point to visit Crustacean on a recent foray in SF.

I lunched here with my sister. Reservations were plentiful and the dining room was empty.

The lunch wait staff here was weird. A man and a woman, in particular, were strange. They spoke to us in a strange cadence, kept trying to clear our table, and moreso, impeded on our dining experience. In addition, our dining patrons to the next table over were disgusting - they belched loudly, left food on the floor, and made a ruckus - which of course, is something the restaurant doesn't have control over, but still, gross.

The Crustacean shrimp toast was good but definitely not the $12 dollar price tag. You get three freaking tiny pieces of toast. What the heck?! It was good, but not memorable and definitely not worth $12 bucks.

We ordered the the roast crab ($55) + garlic noodles ($12). It was super, super oily. Everything was enveloped in oil. The crab was marinated in oil + garlic. There was little to be desired. The flavors combined with the noodles couldn't justify the costs.

I feel like Crustacean is past its prime in food trends. They don't care enough to keep their wait staff on par and overall, the dining experience felt outdated and lackluster.
author: Trung N.

description: This is a lovely place that's been around for a long time. Friendly service, and the food is really very good. Ordering a crab is a must (but there are plenty of other things to choose from if you don't like crab). My absolute favorite thing on the menu is the Garlic Noodles. Get those. I have never had better, though I have looked high and low. I've even tried to make them, but they do the best. It is worth noting that the same family also owns Thanh Long out in the Sunset, so if you like one, you're bound to like the other. Oh, and both have the garlic noodles. Yes, I've eaten plenty at both locations.
author: Jason P.

description: OK, the other reviews have said it, the roast crab is delicious and we ended up getting like 4 orders for our party of 6. Our appetizer was likewise delicious but the disappointment was not having a selection of sides other than a shared garlic noodle dish. It was delicious but we were missing some veggies to offset this rich crab and noodle fare. If it weren't for the excellent service provided by our server, this might be a 3 star review. Indeed in my experience when you have less than 4 stars in a restaurant with food normally this good, it's because of inconsistent service.
author: Vasanth B.

description: Just celebrated a "big" bday here... what an amazing time! Floored with the kick-ass service (thank you!, Danny, Erwin, and Colin)! Food was superb (garlic crab, beef carpaccio, kale salad, garlic noodles, garlic rice, and EVEN the garlic bread! Definitely worth putting on that silly bib! We'll be back celebrating the most important celebrations. An SF staple... historic. Check it out!
author: Color C.

description: My Wife's Birthday was yesterday and when we arrived for our 6 o'clock reservation early we was seated right away and our waiter was great in excellent he was very professional and mindful and the food was exquisite. We are definitely going back.
author: Tony S.

description: We had early dinner at 5 pm.   Not busy at early sitting.  Service was excellent and so were the crabs, seabass, and garlic noodles.
author: Ron C.

description:
Visited in Feb 2018 still good as ever!
when visiting this I need nothing more than their famous roasted crab which was mind blowing good!!!!! , service excellent! . 
They just need to clean up the outside of the place which was a little unattractive .
Overall: 5***** Excellent!!!
author: R F.

description:
My first few visits here were top notch! But my visit this evening was very lack luster. The service was poor requested beer twice and it didn't arrive. Requested a second bowl of the amazing Garlic Noodles also didn't arrive. The staff seemed to be very young and inexperienced in what this iconic establishment was founded. The food however was just as I remembered, fantastic! 

It has lost some of its charm and slow food atmosphere.
author: Gary M.

description:
The garlic noodles and shrimp toast were incomparable, but have dropped somewhat recently in taste and care: the shrimp toast is sometimes soggy these days. Still, the tiger shrimp is the best of its kind anywhere.

Please note that prices have soared: the famed crab will set you back 70 dollars or more, which is kind of tough to swallow when one sees crabs such as this at Lee Wing on Clement at about 8 dollars. I know that it takes skill to prepare good food, but just how much is that skill worth?

Sorry to rant, but I have been going to their other place ( Thanh Long ) since it opened, and I guess that I am still in past century as far as prices go.
author: George T.

description:
My family and I have been coming to this restaurant for years and it is still my favorite! This place gets pretty crowded so I recommend making a reservation. We went on a Saturday night after a long day of Christmas shopping and the food here hit the spot. For appetizer we got the Salmon Carpaccio and the calamari. The Salmon Carpaccio was very yummy, but the calamari was unevenly seasoned. My first piece of calamari was packed with flavor, but the second piece I picked up was so bland. 

For the main course we of course ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles. The trick is to order one crab for your party of two, and then when you're almost done with the first one, order the next crab so it's piping hot when you're ready. Nothing worse than having a cold crab. The garlic noodles were so flavorful as always. They come on a plate and look so plain! but looks can be deceiving because these noodles can pack a serious punch. 

I thought the service this last trip was extremely attentive. The second our bowl of shells were full a waiter or waitress came by and changed the bowl. 

My family will definitely continue coming here during the holidays!
author: Hillary C.

description: My husband and I have been coming her for over 7+ years, and have introduced a lot of friends and family to This restaurant. Words can't explain how AMAZING the roasted crab and garlic noodles are. This is a MUST do date night. I also highly recommend the New Zealand mussels for an appetizer. My cocktail of choice was a lychee martini
author: Sabrina F.

description: Very disappointing. Overpriced for what you get. My tiger prawns were over cooked and rubbery . The service was veryyyyyy slow we waited 25 mins for the bill ... i was over it !!
author: Lisa P.

description: Wow!! First time eating here and the roasted crab was so so so good. The restaurant is on the second floor, but you can take the elevator. The place looks very nice, I can say semi formal casual.hahhaha! I can't wait to go back. Oh! and valet is only $13.
author: May F.

description:
Great crab!! Great cocktails too! 
Service was great ! 
Garlic noodles were yummy, sautéed bok choy & sugar snap peas were great too!!! 
Would come back again when I'm in SF!
author: Soyeon J.

description: We heard great things about this restaurant so we had to try. What a disappointment! We had the shrimp toast which wasn't even warm by the time it got to our table and was dry. We also had the mussels which were pretty tasty. The lobster roll was basic, nothing special. I ordered the halibut which was dry and my boyfriend had the crab which he said wasn't great as well. All in all, the food is mediocre and way over priced. Our dinner with two drinks each was a little under $250. Not worth the money. Service was great and atmosphere was cool.
author: Liz O.

description:
A delight! Just had dinner here and it was a great experience.

Crustaceans/Thanh Long is like a fancier Boiling Crab. They are known for their Roasted Garlic Crab and Garlic noodles. We got the Roasted Garlic Crab and the Tamarind Crab and both were good but the Tamarind Crab more delicious to me! The Garlic Noodles were amazing as it was a perfect compliment to the crab, full of butter and garlic but not overwhelming.

Service was also on point. And I got to witness a proposal. :)
author: Catherine T.

description:
We celebrated Father's Day here because of the good things that we hear about the restaurant. Unfortunately, 2 out of 5 adults and 1 ( age 7) out of 3 children got sick. One of the adult was pregnant and had to go to emergency due to vomiting and diarrhea. I informed the restaurant the next day and spoke to Ken. He said that he would speak to the manager on duty that day and definitely call me back. I called back because he never called back. He said that the other manager ( Daniel) did not have any other complaints . Its very disappointing how food poisoning complaint can be disregarded just because no other tables had the issue. Will they really tell a customer if another complaint was filed? I don't think so. I will not recommend this place and all the other restaurants associated with this company. 
This does not even deserve a star but you need to put one.
author: Mari A.

description:
5 stars for the garlic noodles. These are so good that I somewhat suspect the primary ingredient is crack. Kidding, I know it's a ton of butter and a ton of garlic. All goodness. 

5 stars for the roast crab. It's really, really good. It's also quite buttery and peppery. But thankfully not too hard to eat. 

Minus 1 star for the price. It's MP, and the day we went it was $55 for the crab, which seems like it's on the high end. There's a nicer ambiance than your typical hole in the wall, but honestly I would be happy eating this in a hole in the wall at a lower price.
author: Sally C.

description:
As someone who grew up eating at Thanh Long semi-regularly growing up in San Francisco, I have a hard time being bowled over by the decor and polish of Crustacean. For those that don't know, the original Thanh Long in the Outer Sunset district was a hole in the wall vietnamese restaurant that gave birth to Crustacean. 

For me, the quality and freshness of their dishes is most important, then comes the rest. I grew up on their garlic noodles, and of course their Roast Crab, and over the years their recipe feels diluted, not as flavorful with less punch from the spices and garlic. The garlic noodles and crab feel more drenched in oil, which is not a good thing to me. 

Crustacean provides a level of service and sophistication that didn't exist with Thanh Long but I have a hard time giving this place anything higher than 3 stars because the food by itself is not worthy of anything higher. It's a shame because there is such a rich history behind this family's work.
author: Angela L.

description: Absolutely delicious food. My girlfriends and I shared at least 3 appetizers and I ordered an entree of crab cakes and I didn't have one morsel of a leftover which is uncommon for me. Highly recommend this restaurant to people who love fresh and great tasting seafood.
author: Tanya B.

description: The food here doesn't disappoint. The garlic noodles are a signature item for a reason. I ordered the Royal Tiger Prawns which are served over the garlic noodles. It's a very tasty dish. Phillip was our waiter and took very good care of us. The exterior and interior aren't very beautiful but the food is the essence of this restaurant.
author: Renee T.

description: Wayyyyy over rated. Food is ok. Ambiance is ok. The servers are excellent and very friendly. Guys leave your jacket at home. Was expecting way better food.  I ordered the cosmo.. Could have had just vodka. But if you mix the cosmo with the sunset rum drink..its perfect.
author: Mj J.

description: The garlic noodles and crab is awesome. I've heard about this place and I finally had a chance to go. Its a good place for date night as well
author: Adena E.

description: Just order the roast crab and garlic noodles! A heavenly combination! Tip: Always use the bib they offer! And request the hot towel (for use while you crack the crab) they usually provide at the end of the meal. You will get messy, but it is SO worth it!
author: Leann F.

description:
One thing... The Garlic roast crab!!! 

I've been coming here since I was a child with my fam now I bring all my friends! Dropped in for my honeys birthday dinner. Had a last min reservation for 9:30p really saved the day because they were booked online-glad I called. 

We were seated in about 3 mins, per usual. Restaurant was still busy at 9:30p...Crazy!

Our waiter was amazing great welcoming personality! Mad I didn't get his name but blame the Pinot Noir! Very generous pour btw. Babe ordered a Sapporo beer he really enjoyed it. -very smooth and refreshing he says.

For dinner I ordered the Garlic Roast Dungenous crab ($50) with a side of Garlic noodles($12) Baby ordered Tiger Pawns with Garlic noodles ($28) (he's not big on having to do all that work for your dinner.-but I am lol) The amount of Garlic noodles on his plate was so small like a kids portion. They could of added one more spoon full. All good because honey grabbed Golden Boy pizza after. 

The food came out extremely quick but it is seafood. It came out so fast.. before my glass of wine but the waiter compensated for the wait so the Pinot was on the house. I will keep returning again an again an again.
author: J'Wel V.

description: I believe this is the sister restaurant of Thang Long. I always order the same thing when I come here. You can never go wrong with the crab and garlic noodle. I don't have a favorite sauce, they're all so delicious! A bit pricey but guarantee meaty crab.
author: Annie Y.

description:
As always ,  delicious garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles! 
Had a birthday dinner for my husband here.. he was happy as always.   This remains his favorite restaurant.
author: Shayla D.

description:
All Seafood Lovers, aboard the Crustacean train!!!

Initially, I am very impressed that there's a fancy Vietnamese fusion restaurant #wevecomealongway Because most Viet shops are casual with notoriously infamous service. Crustacean, pretty good foods, great variety...but minus the expected attentive excellent service. The terrible service impressed more upon me than the food itself, which albeit was mediocre.

[[BACKGROUND]]
My friend had a surprise birthday dinner here and there were 11 of us. Our party made previous reservation and hopped up to the third floor of a dilapidated building. Inside, the restaurant layout was confusing. It seemed to be a weird loop with random stairs and levels and walls around. Luckily, I went to the back of the restaurant and saw my party. 

[[SERVICE]]
Forewarned, if you have a large group, 18% gratuity tip is automatically added to your bill. This is normal and expected, but failing service is not. Our server seemed frenzied, unorganized, aloof, and just entirely not there. The other employees were friendly but also seemed overwhelmed at the same time. A few instances, we requested lemon that never came and I requested a regular water cup 3x and that never came either...Seems to be a trend that requests go unanswered. I had to steal my friend's water cup and once in a while, the servers would come around to refill towards the end of our experience.

They also were missing a crab order and we had to flag them down to bring out another Roasted Crab. When my friend asked for the check, the server told her to just wait cause she had other things to do. I just don't get why doesn't she say "Ok" and be on her merry way. What other things do you have to do? Serve?...Apparently not tonight. It was my first time and my friends' first time experiencing such nonchalant, apathetic service at Crustacean and that's an awful shame. 

[[FOODS]]
Food? We ordered the following: Fried Calamari, Papaya Salad with Shrimp, Vietnamese Carpaccio, Seafood Cakes, Roasted Crab, Tamarind Crab, Garlic Noodles, Butterfly Prawns, and a ton of desserts. Notably, the calamari was AMAZING! If you love squid as much as I do,  order it. The seasoning was flavorful with a peppery kick! The breading was also light and crisp, however it came out lukewarm. I suspect they made it a while ago but the server did not bring it out until way later. 

The crabs themselves were okay, mediocre at best. The crab meats were not juicy, moist, or flavorful. It's like they boiled it too long and some of the ends shriveled and browned. Roasted is more savory and umami, and oddly, Tamarind was sweeter and lightly flavored. In my previous experience, tamarind crab is supposed to be salty and savory so I was perplexed by this course. However, the An Garlic Noodles are THE BEST I'VE EVER HAD. Yasss queen! It was so garlicy, soft, and supple. I could've eaten a whole plate by myself haha. Honestly, the crab was an accompaniment to the great garlic noodles entree for my dinner. 

Overall, a sad 3 stars I have to give for the terrible service, mediocre food/preparation, and odd ambiance/location. I'm sure they've had better days but today was just not it.
author: Donna T.

description: The food was over the top great. We had the crab and one of the steak dishes.  Both exceptional.  Phil our waiter was a real professional.  A little privy but well worth it.
author: Larry K.

description: Favorite restaurant for crab! Fantabulous! Excellent service
author: Ac H.

description: Crustacean never disappoints. The crab was deliciously served hot, buttered and garlicy.  The garlic noodles were consistently perfect.  Our out of town cousin couldn't remember anything about her previous San Francisco trip but, "those noodles", and she was completely satiated this evening.
author: Victoria F.

description:
Of course anytime I think about having some lobster anywhere in the Bay Area I always have to hit up Crustaceans. The flavors are as rich as they were 20 years ago.

Oh you have to remember to get the roasted garlic crab
author: Brother B.

description: The salt and pepper calamari and grilled shrimp with garlic noodle was just ok. Found a piece of hair in the calamari and the waiter took it off our bill. Place is nothing special. Best dish was the roast crab and the baked Alaska dessert. Overpriced but will probably come back for the roast crab.
author: Denise T.

description: I know everyone's already said but I'm going to say it again, best crab ever!  Garlic roast crab with garlic noodles. That's all you need. The crab is perfectly cooked and that butter sauce it's sitting in, is heaven.  Flew here from Hawaii to eat the garlic roast crab. Funny thing, we sat next to another couple that also flew from Hawaii to eat at Crustaceans. Hawaii people love Crustaceans. And so does everyone else. So, be sure to make reservations. It can be done conveniently through the yelp app so that's a plus.
author: Jessica E.

description:
Great food, great service!
My friend and I had a crab, sea bass and prawn. 
They didn't have lobsters the night we went but it's not their fault. 
Definitely I'll come back again :)
author: Iya T.

description:
If you're looking for a great restaurant to grab a decent crab dinner, definitely hit up Crustacean. Not in the mood for crab? Look elsewhere to satisfy your seafood cravings.

I made reservations for two for a Friday night via Yelp reservations. Everything worked out perfectly. We really didn't need reservations though. We went around 9pm and there was plenty of tables available. Ambiance was a little old school, classy. I felt like I had stepped back to the 90s. Service was okay, nothing amazing. My friend ordered extra sauce with her crab, and they never brought it despite asking the wait staff twice. I had to flag a waiter down for more water. I tried the halibut, and let me just say that I am not picky with my fish, but it was not good. The flavor of the sauce just didn't pair well with the fish, and the fish itself was overcooked and dry, which is the worst thing you can do to fish. My friend really enjoyed her roasted garlic crab. Of course we had to try their famous garlic noodles. Those were really tasty and flavorful. They were probably the highlight of the meal for me. Dinner was pricey at just over $120 for two people. For how much I paid for my meal, the quality could have been better.

I probably won't be back to Crustacean, unless I have some extra cash to spend, and will definitely stick to the crab.
author: Emily C.

description:
The garlic noodles were good but the rest of the items weren't.

We weren't in the mood for messy hands so we ordered the prawns and crab cakes. The prawns were over cooked and too dry. The crab cakes were decent but a little too much filler and they were soggy.

For dessert we tried the chocolate "lava" cake. Both were supermarket grade and bland. The server brought another (complimentary) dessert but that was even worse.

Overall the service was good, the server was attentive at the beginning and end of the meal and was friendly and courteous. He disappeared for most of the meal without refilling water or checking in though.

Noodles -    
Prawns & crab -   
Dessert - 1/2
author: Corey C.

description:
I went to Crustaceans twice in the last 30 days and had SEVERE FOOD POISONING both times!!
This place has lost its standards!! While the crab has the best flavor, if you end up in the bathroom all night!! It is NOT worth it!
author: Sally S.

description: Food was delicious. Garlic noodles are to die for!!!! Also had the skewered chicken and was really good. Highly recommend this place and the garlic noodles, my favorite for sure. My man had drunken crab and ate every bit of it. Suggest to make reservations beforehand if you can, always is busy but worth the wait!
author: Jessica P.

description:
This was mine and my husband's first time at Crustacean. We easily found street parking across from the restaurant at 730pm Saturday night (4/21). 

I'd advise to take the stairs if you can. There are two elevators. The one that's directly under the building was very small, barely fit 4 adults & was pretty wobbly. You also have to press the "Door Open" button to open the door when you got to the restaurant. The other one on the other hand, was outside was a lot bigger fit 6 Adults comfortably. 

Our waiters were very knowledgeable & never let our drinks empty. PS. If you're looking for a good cocktail, the Malibu sunrise is sweet & doesn't at all taste like alcohol. Which is very dangerous ;) 

We basically ordered everything our waiters had told us about. The roasted crab was absolutely delicious. I definitely recommend it to everyone. The crab puffs were also very good with or without the sauce it comes with.

All in all, I highly recommend coming here at least once. Great food, even better service.
author: Melanie N.

description: Great wine options. Garlic noodles are decadent. Crab was nice also. I am from Houston. This was my second time there. Enjoyed the experience.
author: Darin T.

description: Put away your smartphones--If you cannot stop texting or accessing your social media for a few hours then you will not understand the culinary experience of Crustacean!!!  Vietnamese food has always been challenging for me, as I have always needed the help of friends for a high quality Vietnamese meal.  As a true Marylander I have always wanted to visit one of Helene An's California Crustacean institutions.  I am hoping that they return to Las Vegas one day.  I loved meeting my wonderful CAL friends OD alums of CAL Berkeley and Houston.  NYC is not a town where people love crabs like my beloved state of Maryland.  We had the classic dishes last night: roasted Dungeness crab, garlic noodles, and Shaken Beef.  The Dungeness crab rivals R&G's legendary salt n pepper Dungeness crab.  The garlic taste to the crab gives it a divine flavor, but certainly messy for your hands--you cannot have a great crab meal without bibs and some real work. I loved the simple garlic noodles, and the flavorful shaken beer also.   Very few places exceed my expectations today.  However, Crustacean serves up a powerful meal, in a simplistic, family-style.  It certainly is not cheap, but then again this is San Francisco where many of my favorite restaurants reside.  If you come to Crustacean and you are a true crab lover you will have quite an experience.  So if you are an Asian crab lover you must make a visit here.  If you have a group of friends who just want to spend some quality time ripping apart some Dungeness crabs--It does not get any better than this.  Crabs Baby!!!
author: Thomas W.

description:
I haven't been here in a long time so I forgot how good they were. The crab was fresh and hot, garlic noodles were better then others. I have no complains, not to mention it was a early birthday dinner.

My dad is in town from GA (where they only have blue crab) man he Was in silence the whole time not one word lol. I enjoyed my dinner and also Happy to see my dad enjoy his crab!!

I would definitely recommend this place for any occasion, especially if you're a seafood lover.
author: Irene'Na P.

description: Okay.  I garlic noodles changed. I went here 20 years ago and I distinctly remember the garlic noodles with chopped garlic cloves and butter dripping from the noodles. It was a mind-changing experience.  Got a feeling they are cutting corners here. For the price which is med-high priced, they can do much better! The service was good and drinks just okay. For newbies, it's cool to check out. But for us foodies, we can find better quality someplace else in the Bay Area.
author: S H.

description:
The roommate's cousins were in town from Chicago. Any time they are here, we always go out for something they can't easily get back at home. Remembering we had dungeness crab last time, I suggested we do the same thing. Since I'd never been to Crustacean, I figured I could also check a place off my list. I called a couple days before and made a reservation for 4 for Tuesday, March 8th at 7:30pm.

*Crispy Rice Paper Roll: filled with chicken, mushrooms, carrots, mint and vermicelli, served with daikon cole-slaw ($8.95)
*Grilled Calamari: marinated in a savory peanut-mustard sauce ($11.75)
*The Roast Crab: an entire dungeness crab roasted with garlic and spices ($53.95) ×2
*An's Garlic Noodles: egg noodles infused with An's famous garlic sauce ($11.50) ×2

The appetizers were okay. The only reason we ordered them was because I figured we should try some dishes other than just crab and garlic noodles. The imperial rolls were hot and crunchy, although it was kind of a small serving. I actually really liked the slaw that came with it. The grilled calamari were just eh. For some reason, I thought it was going to be fried even though the description clearly says grilled. I'm such an airhead sometimes. I didn't really care for the sauce as I'm not a big fan of peanuts, but the calamari was tender.

The stars of the night were the crab and garlic noodles. I had a disappointing experience with Thanh Long's crab last time. This totally made up for it! The meat was sweet and tender. The sauce, nice and garlicky with a slight peppery kick. And the garlic noodles? Al dente with delicious garlicky flavor. I was in heaven! I was keeping it chill, so I just had one glass of Honig Sauvignon Blanc, Napa Valley, 2013 ($9.50). It paired well with the dishes we got.

Great place for crab and garlic noodles! Crustacean totally redeemed the lackluster House of An experience I had from Thanh Long.
author: Elena N.

description: Roasted crab is good that you'll want to lick your hands clean.  No shame. I think of it as a delicious butter manicure.  Tried the shaken beef for the first time this visit and it was delish also.  Loved the traditional green salad too, flavorful and fresh tasting.
author: Wendy M.

description: Great place service and food meet all my expectations. We didn't get to take pics of the food but when I say presentation was nice....it was. My hunni's birthday dinner, he loved it.
author: Danyell C.

description:
The dinner was supposed to be a nice surprise for my bf on our one year anniversary. I didn't feel that the restaurant did anything to make the day special. It was noted in our reservation..... that in itself was a huge disappointment.


Our waiter Andrew was awesome. He did his best at accommodating us and offered great suggestions for different options. 

We ordered the ravioli which was okay... kind of bland. Not a huge recommendation from me. The garlic noodles as always was a must but did feel a little bland and not garlic tasting at all. The last thing we ordered was the crab. I had to say that it was a very good crab and we did pay extra to have it cracked.... the only problem was the fact that I got food poisoning. Happy anniversary to us?
author: Kristine P.

description: One of my favorite places to eat in SF. Always get the vegi, whole crab, and noodles. Can't go wrong!
author: Laura M.

description: Always an amazing experience. My dad used to bring me here as a kid, and now I do so with my kids. All the food is so fresh and the service is always great. It did get a little pricey, but it's worth paying for great food and service.
author: Kristinna B.

description: First time here. Crab was great, but butter taste like cooking oil. We ran into a few bumps at the beginning of our service, but mgr gave my girl her tiger prawns for free. Crab was not worth me going back. I can get it closer to home for cheaper and just as good!
author: Richelle B.

description: As expected everything was perfectly done about this place. Crustaceans has been an icon for decades to eat delicious Vietnamese crab and garlic noodles.  And for at least 2 decades, the owner of this property has done absolutely nothing to keep up the appearances of the exterior. I'm not a "high maintenance" person but I do have a little pride in where I go to eat. My son thought I was kidding when I told him we were eating here because he didn't believe there was a restaurant upstairs. Crustaceans needs to move the hell out of this place and find another location that is not UGLY, DIRTY, and BROKEN.
author: Bebe L.

description:
We were recommended this place by one of my friends. We didn't make a reservation, but we decided to go there. We got to the restaurant around 17:10, and the receptionist said all tables were booked by the reservation for the night. However, the bar was open for the main course, so we sat there. 
We ordered the roasted crab, seafood cakes appetizer, and shrimp fried rice. 
When we got the seafood cakes, I got very disappointed because I was thinking like crab cakes but the seafood cakes were nothing like crab cakes. They were okay. I didn't like them. On the other hand, the roasted crab was very tasty. We shared one crab, and it was still a lot of good. The shrimp fried rice was okay. Nothing exceptional.
I may go back here when I'm in town but I want to try other restaurants where serve the crab.
author: Mai N.
Acilegna T.

description: The person who showed us to our seat should take into consideration that people like a little privacy, we were sat down right next to a couple so close we could here each other breathe while there were a ton of empty seats elsewhere. It was an awkward silence almost the entire meal for us and the couple next to us. Not cool at all. Food was good as always. Sitting so close to people with barley anyone in the restaurant to drown out our conversations sucked!
author: Tony R.

description: Food was outstanding... was little drafty in there , other than that . Awesome experience
author: Sha B.

description:
My ultimate favorite crab restaurant in SF. 
I always get the Roasted Crab here and of course NOT TO MiSS is the the Garlic noodles. They are just to die for! 
Once in a while I get an appetizer like Calamares and soup but almost always I just wait for the crab and noodles- that is all you need. 
I asked the waitress if the rumor that the chefs are forbidden to share the 40 year secret recipe for the Garlic noodles and she said Yes! 
I heard that they add lard but I don't really care anymore. It's just too damn delicious. 
Staff are nice and ambiance is great. 
Sister restaurant Thahn Long is equally delicious but more casual style.
author: Jen O.

description:
The building is filthy and the restaurant is run down.
The price for a crab was $55 plus $5 to break it.
The sauce was oily and the famous noodles greasy.

The bill therefore was horrendous and a big no no.

Ate there there years ago and was much better and I believe they must have new owners and they a milking the place
author: Cees B.

description: The outside of the building is very unappealing, thankfully it was much nicer inside! Our calamari was delicious and the garlic noodles were good too, but definitely could use some protein added. Our server was very attentive and kind. Overall our experience was good but not great.
author: L. J.

description:
I returned my once absolutely favorite restaurant (been a loyal customer for 25+ years) after a five year absence, as I no longer lived in the region. Sadly, our crab (party of three) was not up to par.  One of my friends has visited the weekend before and enjoyed her meal so much she actually packed her shells and body of the crab to go so she could pick through it at leisure at home (yes, she actually did this). Reluctantly, we shared our experience with the manager, as I had been looking forward to my absolute favorite crab in the entire world. I mean, this is the one meal I gladly plop down my credit card and pay.  

Things took a turn for the worse when we shared our experience. Rather than the manager valuing our input, he defended the company's product telling us something to the effect, 'We've served 200+ crabs today with no complaints.'  To say I was a bit put off is to say the very least I was shocked, particularly since we made it clear we were not requesting a replacement crab, rather we simply wanted to share our experience of the crab we were served.  

 Honestly, I would have returned but due to the poor customer service, I've lost my appetite, so much so that I'm actually sharing my experience publicly.
author: Paige S.

description: The place smells a little fishy so that's scary but i didn't get sick lol. The salt and pepper calamari is great, the rest of apps we tried where underwhelming.  The real star of the show is the crab and the garlic noodles. Both where amazing ! Between those 2 and the jet lag I was out like a light by the time I hit my pillow.
author: Daniel R.

description:
This place was hyped up a lot by a friend's family, which is why we came to try it. They said that the crab and garlic noodles were really delicious and so we came for those items in particular. I went with a group of five people so we got to try a lot of different things. My overall impression of this place is that its like a P.F. Chang's of crab and garlic noodles. By that, I mean the food is decent quality, but not decent enough quality to justify the prices. Also, there are other places where you can get similar things for much cheaper - I list them at the end of this review. This might be a good date place to take a date if you don't mind garlic breath from the noodles, wearing a bib, and getting crab juice all over your pants. I actually saw a decent amount of people who looked like they were on dates here.

We ordered the following items:
- Lots of the garlic noodles
- Prawns with garlic noodles (~$39.99)
- Drunken crab (each crab was about ~$50)
- Roasted crab
- Seafood salad
- Shaking beef
- A vegetable and tofu dish

The garlic noodles were good, but at $10.95 per order, I was expecting something phenomenal. As far as the crab, I'd recommend the drunken crab over the roasted crab. The drunken crab was more flavorful. The crab was good, but I was also expecting phenomenal here. For a steamed crab, it was decent though. 

I would recommend the seafood salad, though for the price, I felt like they could have loaded up on the seafood a little more. The vegetable to seafood ratio wasn't great. The shaking beef was very good, I'd definitely recommend that dish - the beef was really tender and flavorful. And finally, the vegetable and tofu dish we got (I can't remember what it was called) was also good, but the price on this dish was also a little steep for what it was. This place must have an insane profit margin. 

If you want good garlic noodles at a much cheaper price, check out Ben Tre in the Bay Area. You get a huge portion (with protein) for a much better price - I'm talking less than $20. Also, for better crab (but unhealthier cause it's deep fried), go to R&G lounge. Their crab is insanely delicious and better than what Crustacean serves.
author: Lin Z.

description: YES YES YES! One of my favorite restaurants of all time. Can't go wrong with the roast crab and garlic noodles! So good and flavorful with all kinds of garlicky, buttery goodness! We took family there for the rest time and they both said it was the beat meal they've ever had. If you're a crab lover, you have to try this place. It's great for dressy night out! And I'd definitely suggest making a reservation ahead of time!
author: Jasmine M.

description: I was expecting great things from this place but all we received was really an experience we would never choose again. The crab is mediocre at best (nothing special or tasty) and the noodles were oily. I paid for myself and two guests for a grand total of $270. And no, we did not have drinks besides water nor did we have appetizers or dessert. That was for lackluster crab and oily noodles. Proceed at your own risk!! I give them one star for being able to keep this place running at this price point with lackluster food.
author: Jeanae K.

description: I was spending some time with my Son and We Both wanted some Good Garlic  Crab ! And since All the crab feeds was Sold Out !!! For that day .. We decided to go to Crustaceans .... and Let Me just Say We was NOT Disappointed  Everything was Exceptionally Good !!!! ... Every was for a reason and the end Result was Excellent ... Thank You Crustaceans .
author: Sporrt S.

description:
I love crabs but there's not a lot of restaurants that can cook crabs the way I want. Crustaceans comes very close - very tasty while preserving the natural flavors of the crab. And, don't get me started with the garlic noodles! I try to avoid carbs but for this dish, an exemption has to be made!!!  

Sadly, we tried their sister restaurant but the experience was not the same - dripping in oil, crab is over cooked, flavor is over-powering.  

Verdict: Crustacean is the right choice.
author: Maricel C.

description: Celebrated my 7th wedding anniversary tonight at Crustaceans. It was the hubby's first time eating here and it had been years since I've eaten here too. We ordered the roasted crab and the garlic noodles. Everything was delicious. I will definitely visit again.
author: Anitra H.

description: Went here for dinner this week.  An's Garlic Noodles were DELICIOUS.  I got the Dungeness crab, which was fantastic.  My tablemates had the garlic noodles with prawns and another had the garlic noodles with a side of chicken skewers. Note that they couldn't put the chicken on the noodles for some reason, which I thought was odd, but my friend said she liked the chicken even without the noodles, which was pretty impressive given it just looked like grilled chicken on a skewer.  We also had one guest at our table with a shellfish allergy.  I believe he had the Szechuan beef and he loved his food too.  Great experience and after trying several other places on this trip to San Francisco, I would definitely go here again.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Crab lovers who frequent San Francisco are probably already familiar with Thanh Long in the Outer Sunset by now, as that family owned restaurant has been serving crab feasting hordes for generations. Crustacean, its more refined and polished big brother comes complete with slick interior, central location, and even a valet parking option. What this means is you can get more or less the same food you could order from Thanh Long but in a more upscale environment. 

Now that we've gotten these simple facts out of the way, there is something that bothers me as an individual who has frequented Thanh Long for many many years. I'm only speculating here but it distinctly feels like they've subtly altered their recipes for their garlic noodles and Roast crab in particular. More oily, less of the secret concoction of spices? All of the above? Maybe, either way, it feels diluted and less pure.

Is Crustacean a nice change of pace dining option if all you've been familiar with is filet mignon and chicken cooked up 50 ways? Of course it is. However that magical exotic feeling I used to get coming to this family owned franchise feels as hollow as how I now feel about their core recipes.
author: Dennis W.

description:
Oven roasted crab with garlic - amazing! The crab was perfectly cooked with a nice garlic taste baked in. The crab comes on top of a pool of garlic oil with some salt and pepper in it so you can dip the crab if you want. 

Garlic noodles - while they were above average, it is a simple dish, literally just noodles and garlic oil. I saw some people complained about all the oil, but that is what garlic noodles are...
