Everything else - the muscles and shrimp wontons were kind of pricey for the quantity and were average. Better to save room for the crab. The garlic rice was simple and again kind of pricey but it was great to soak up the oil from the crab. 

Service was good, not great. Server was very busy. 

Decor was nice, but the surrounding businesses are not as nice and it takes away from the experience a bit. The tables are too close so you have less privacy. I wouldnt say this is a nice place you have to dress up for. I saw people in t-shirts, but they try to present a more upscale look.
author: Greg S.

description: Crab is great. The noodles are overrated. This place used to be really nice but they've definitely let it go. The restaurant needs a make over. Paint is chipping, water stains on ceiling, bathroom is outdated, elevator smells like urine... Just not want you want to see when you're dropping 150.00 on dinner. They keep the interior pretty dim. Perhaps you hide the chipped paint, nicks on walls, ect..
author: Mama B.

description:
We ate here for my husbands birthday last week.  We have not been here for many years.  The building and elevator that take you to the restaurant have gotten very run down and dirty.  Actually kind of scary.  


I had called ahead to ask for a birthday dessert to be brought to our table.  It never came but a dessert my daughter in law ordered came.  So too late to run up and fix.  VERY DISAPPOINTING!!!!  I mentioned to host when leaving and clearly he had not even looked at the request.


Inside the restaurant was nice and the host and servers very welcoming.  The food was very very expensive and just ok.  Many tables were full so they are still doing well.  For us there is better restaurants to get crab.  

We do not plan on going back.
author: Mary Ellen T.

description:
It was good... but there's just a lack of some things that could have made it great. Like,

1) It was a very nice looking restaurant, however, it could have used a little more cleaning. Some of the decor had a good amount of dust on them. Also, it did smell like they used an old rag to clean off all the tables. 

2) Our waiter was pleasant, however, not as attentive as we would have wanted. It would have been more understandable if it was a busy time, but it wasn't. 

3) The food was delicious, however, I've tasted better garlic noodles. And though the crab was very flavorful, it didn't come with much meat. I was surprised to see that the actual crab body was only used for decor and under the shell was not as much meat as were hoping for, especially for the price paid. 

Would I be back? Maybe not. But, I will say that it is one of those at least try once.
author: Heather S.

description: Garlic noodles weird off taste ,prawns over cooked dissapointed, large crab was good and nice. This place more hype than it's worth $36 for 4 prawns and noodles no way I could cook this at home way better taste and price, $56 crab and noodles just overpriced for no reason. I guess their rent and the fishing season reason to over charge. I would say other SF places to eat that are better I will eat at them next time. And you have to ride a dirty elevator or.hike lots of stairs to get to the top, the plaza it's in seems to be a produce markets and a karate gym. Not the vibe I care for.
author: two c.

description: Been going here for at least 15 years.  Although the place is a bit run down from what I remember long ago, the crab still hits the spot.  It was because of Crustacean I started liking crab.  There's really nothing more I can add that no one else has ever shared.  But to affirm, their garlic roasted crab and noodles are unmatched.
author: Ricky B.

description:
Great dinner with great food and service!!
The garlic noodle was absolutely gorgeous.
The crab was decent.
Crab puff was also nice.
Best dessert ever
author: Joyce C.

description: Tiny crab and the place smelled terrible and unappetizing. Avoid.
author: Mathilda P.

description: This place has great delicious seafood.  Everything is delicious and tasty. The waiters are friendly. They make you feel at home.  I highly recommend this place.
author: Annabelle E.

description:
My boyfriend took me here for my bday dinner. 

MUST: order the roasted crab + garlic noodles! You won't regret it.
author: Patricia A.

description: Disappointed in this fine restaurant we order appetizer, drunken crab, shaken beef and garlic noodle. which all came out lukewarm, like it was sitting under the heat lamp. The shaken beef was chewy good flavor but it was cold outside and warm in the inside same as the rest of the dish crab had no flavor. The bill came out to be $124 without tips.
author: Philip W.

description:
Called in and seated within the hour. Fast service, bad wine, good noodles. 

Ordered drunken crab + garlic noodles. 

If there were another restaurant in SF serving these noodles, I'd probably go there instead. Bill was $100 for two dishes, dine-in.
author: Maudre Y.

description:
Reservations : weekends - yes , weekdays - no
Parking - no more, valet only. Catch uber or lyft.
My review is for the crab and garlic noodles only.
Bottomline is your coming here for garlic crab and garlic noodles. They do have a lot of other items on the menu too (e.g., shaking beef, calamari, prawns, different preparations of crab). Just keep it simple, 1 garlic crab $60, 1 garlic noodles $15 , 1 glass of wine, talk story with uncle khai le your good to go. Have a nice night !
author: Dub C.

description: Really sad that they changed the whole ambience! Walked in and didn't even recognize the place. I used to love coming here and didn't mind spending $$$. But now I don't think it's worth the money since it's not fine dining.
author: Sonia D.

description: Food was fantastic. I brought my wife and my mom here to enjoy some good seafood. We all had the roast crab, crab friend rice, garlic noodles. It was my mom's first time while I've been there a few others. Service was spot on, quick refills on water. Bad thing was small cups of soda and no refills. I would come here again without a doubt. Great crab.
author: Jay D.

description:
I was truly disappointed with our visit to Crustaceans SF. My granddaughters 18 th birthday was the occasion. Myself and 11 others decided on Crustaceans's for her special dinner. In all fairness the communication prior to our visit went smooth! The response time was minimal. The manager recommended that since there were so many we do a prix fix menu. It would include an appetizer and their famous garlic noodles and a crab for every person. I informed him that everyone would not be eating crab (including myself) and one of our party is vegetarian. In that case he stated those individuals could order off the menu. We arrived 30 minutes early. Elevator broken.... exterior in need of cleaning at minimum the windows. No problem. Waited at bar and had delicious cocktail!! Seated, and requested wine that we brought. Orders taken, appetizers brought out timely. Not many vegetarian choices so loud friend ordered rice and a bowl of veggies. Due to breakdown in communication waiter assumed the other half of the table all wanted crab. That was not the case . But ok. No big deal. Then came dinner. NOT AT ALL AS I REMEMBER! I ordered garlic shrimp. The noodles were dry and lacked flavor. They actually tasted sweet. The shrimp ...ehh. Nothing special. So dinner okay. Maybe I should have ordered the crab. The 9 that did were happy with it. Fast forward ..... Dinner finished..... server way to chatty. Jumped in our conversation a few times. Ok.. but didn't ask for his opinion. 
Bill arrives!! $1100.00. Yikes!!!! So why?? I expected the crab to be 89.50 per person. But the shrimp, and "vegetarian meal" (steamed rice and veggies) the same price?? I was told because we agreed to prix fix menu. No way Jose!!!   The killer was that there was no manager on duty. They had to keep going in the back getting him on the phone supposedly. 30 minutes later they reduced the bill by 90.00. Okay.... lets just go.  We paid and left. 
Really what I'm trying to say is..... for $90.00 pp you can eat really good in a lot of places with impeccable service and desert. The experience was disappointing as was the food and service ..... most important my granddaughter was happy. 
Don't think I'll visit or recommend again. I'll try to remember it as it was in the 90s.
author: Curley M.

description: Tucked away in the heart of San Fran is a little gem! Crustacean specializes in roasted Dungeness crab...and it is not to be missed! Rich and delicious the crab is roasted in garlic, butter & herbs, and it is heavenly. Garlic noodles are the perfect accompaniment. Service was great.
author: Julie Z.

description: Had a great time my mom b day she loved the food and ambiance.  Garlic noodles was everything.
author: Cola M.

description: My top favorite when it comes to eating Dungeness crabs in San Francisco. Every time I dine at Crustacean, the crabs are cooked to great consistency and taste. Perfect dining experience when paired with Californian white wine.
author: J W.

description: I ate at this place on Monday night with my friends.  Three hours after I got home I started vomiting every hour for the entire night and early morning.  I had to call the doctor so they could prescribe some medicine for me. I'm sure I got food poisoning from this restaurant!  I will never go to this pace again!
author: Yvette B.

description: This post is a little late but last Sunday was the day that I went to Crustaceans in this has had to be the worst experience that I've had here. The waiter was super rude to begin with. He was bossy and he didn't want to explain the menu to me when I asked questions. Then he tried to rush us out there once I sent my food back because the sauce on my ravioli was nasty because he didn't take the time to explain to me what was in the sauce when I was ordering when I asked him nicely to explain for that reason. The meal was taken off the tab but after traveling back home the next day we noticed that we were double charged for the tab. Not cool. I will not be returning
author: Sincere W.

description: Wasn't too impressed, the crab didn't taste too fresh, especially for the amount of money it costs. Fried rice; no, don't do it. Good mixed drinks & had a good time with my family. The host was nice, but the Gordon Ramsey type that came to the front with a major attitude because our party of 5 was now a party of 6, made for an unpleasant experience. He was rude to the host and rude to us. Pretended like we should/could join the party of 20 African Americans who came in after us, I'm guessing because we are also black. Such a weird experience.
author: Mika J.

description: This is probably the best restaurant to have crab. Love it always. Nice atmosphere good service.
author: Ludmila C.

description: Haven't been here in awhile, this is my second visit within a week. The service has really gone down & ambiance isn't what it once was, highly overrated.
author: Nathan S.

description:
It's a good thing I liked the person I ate here with, because we indulged in the garlic noodles and it was oozing out of my pores after.  It is by far one of the most heavenly tastes I have experienced from a restaurant.  If I was a spice girl, I would be Garlic Spice, and this is the place you would find me dining at to live up to the name.  The Stinking Rose doesn't even come close to the garlic goodness that Crustacean has to offer.

On top of the garlic noodles, we had the tiger prawns, which were a delightful consistency, the whole dish, moist enough, but fluffy, with a slight crunch.  It was perfect.

We also liked the corn bisque, the Vietnamese salad, the banana dessert, and our sake to wash it all down with.  The surf 'n' turf rolls were the only thing I would have ditched- didn't live up to everything else we had.

The service was decent and the ambiance unique.  The bathrooms were wacky, especially having only one stall in a somewhat upscale and spacious setting, but it certainly did not ruin the overall experience.
author: EL H.

description:
This is the place you can have one of the best crabs in San Francisco! The crabs are nicely seasoned with garlic, and the quality of the crab itself seems very good and better than other places. I am not a big fun of garlic noodle, but it seems it's pretty popular.

This was the 2nd time for me to visit here, and I found that I should order only the garlic crab, in my opinion. I came here with my colleagues and we shared calamari and garlic bread, then we ordere a garlic crab for each. The calamari was not geeat, it was ok. I think I will not order again. The crab was big so it filled my appetite completely. The garlic bread was also ok.

The atmosphere of this restaurant is a bit ethnic, and gorgeous. This is a nice place for a date night, if you don't care your oily hand after eating the crab. And also, maybe it would be the most important point, you should take care of your breath for the next morning!
author: May T.

description:
I decided to come here despite the mixed reviews. My family and i ordered the most popular items: tamarind, drunken, and roasted crab, the garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari, seared ahi tuna, and the shaking beef. We had high hopes considering they were the most popular items on the menu but to be honest, nothing was really spectacular. You can get these dishes at an authentic Vietnamese restaurant for half the price.

TLDR; average food, okay service, definitely not worth the $300 tab
author: Renee B.

description: Delicious, amazing food!  Be sure to order the hot crab with salt, pepper, and butter.  Also, the garlic noodles are a must!  Would highly recommend their food.  Location is alright, but not much parking around.
author: D C.

description: My sister and I decided to patronize the restaurant because we haven't been here in a few years. She's moving to Paris so we figured we go and enjoy some shellfish and garlic noodles. Approaching the restaurant I saw that the light on the crab outside wasn't entirely lit. Upon entry there was a chair and a broom in the entryway. Once we got to the front desk not only did the host not greet us but he also spoke to us with his head down and only brought it up after we called it to his attention. All in all this place had gone down hill
author: Brandy S.

description: Came here with friends cuz they like seafood( I don't). Anyways, as we're entering the upstairs outside was really dirty don't understand why they can't sweep it or wash the piss off the walk way. So my man ordered  crab and so did the other friend I just got fried rice cuz I didn't see anything I liked, it tasted like it came from a frozen bag, yuk! My husband crab was dry and he didn't like it. Food is not worth the $$$$$ you spend here.
author: Sasha L.

description: This place was as good as advertised. In the words of my server "If you do not get the cracked crab and the garlic noodles you are a fool". Truer food words were never spoken. This place is fantastic. Good whiskey selections. Delicious old fashioneds.
author: Aaron M.

description: I have been here a million times. It is one of my favorite places to eat. The garlic noodles, crab and tiger shrimp is usually what I order.
author: Brandy W.

description: This place is quite expensive.  The steam fish is good but very average. The service is good. And the decoration in the restaurant is nice.  If this place weren't this expensive, I will definitely give it a higher rating but the price point is too high for this quality.  We also had some appetizers which were not very remarkable either.
author: Byron L.

description:
If you're craving crab and garlic noodles, this is the place to go!! 

My husband and I decided to eat somewhere nice after a long day of shopping in Union Square. I was looking on yelp and remembered that I always wanted to try this place. I suggested it to my husband and he agreed. 

Once we got there it was a 30 min wait since we had no reservations. My husband took a little walk to check out the bar area and he noticed a table for 2 that was in a comfortable spot. He asked the host if we can have that table. The host said, it was actually reserved for a guest who had reservations. About 5 mins later, the host said we can have that table since the couple didn't show up. So we ended up waiting 10 mins! 

We started with a bottle of Moscato. We ordered a glass each first and then decided to get the half bottle. We already knew we were going to get the Garlic Noodles and Roasted Crab, so we decided to look at the list of appetizers. There was a few that caught our eye, but we went with the Shrimp Toast which was a toasted bread with shrimp and melted cheese on top. Then we got the Fried Spring Rolls. Both were delicious, but the portion size was a little small for the amount you pay for. 

The we ordered the crab, garlic noodles, and rice. It was so delicious that I could not stop eating! I left with a belly full of food!! 

.... We still ordered dessert! We ordered the fried banana and the creme brûlée! It was pretty good. 

The only down fall besides that over priced appetizers was that our waiter really smelled like armpit! We got a little whiff every time he passed by.
author: Darlene M.

description:
Disappointing. All of it. Especially for the price. Let me describe what $175 buy two people at Crusty Asian:

Setting: The crowd mostly consisted of bigger parties who seemed to be out to celebrate. Happy Birthday was sung a few times, which gives you an idea of the classiness of the place. Call me a snob if you must, but for a place that claims to enforce a dress code "in order to ensure a sophisticated experience" this place attracts a decidedly NOT-upscale crowd. I'll leave it at that. Our table was in a heavily trafficked, very drafty location.

Appetizers: The shrimp toast was tasty, but not as good as what you can get at any hole-in-the-wall dim sum place in Chinatown. The Vietnamese beef carpaccio was pretty flavorless. May I suggest the chef makes a quick trip to Yummy Yummy on Irving Street for an education. The secret is in the temperature of the meat and the amount of lemon juice.

Wine: For around $50 a nice Alsace Sylvaner. No complaints there except it arrived after our appetizers and was too warm. So I guess I do have complaints.

Entree: The house specialties, the roast crab and garlic noodles. Both were fine and obviously the reason the place is relatively popular. Still, for $40 you get a pretty spectacular crab at most places and this was just good but not spectacular.

Desserts: Bread pudding was great, the baked Alaska was served far too cold, but overall the dessert experience was passable for a bill worth half the amount.

Service: I already mentioned the poor timing of the wine service (which was repeated for the espresso) and overall the server was inattentive. And I mean that. He needed repetition of our order and it was only two of us. The only time he wasn't slow was when bringing the check - which arrived in the middle of dessert!

Overall: Passable food, but way overpriced, service and atmosphere worthy of The Olive Garden. Likelihood of repeat visit: 0%
author: Erika A.

description:
The food here is super greasy. Everything was just covered in oil and unappetising. When we went the restaurant was empty and the wait staff seemed to almost match the number of patrons yet the service was abysmal. 

We ordered the signature roast crab and asked for it cracked yet the crab arrived swimming in an oil slick. The side dishes were also too oily. Even when I got home my face was still covered in oil and I barely ate a third of my crab. 

No one asked us what we thought of the meal either.
author: Tony S.

description: Visited this place based off previous reviews and was pleasantly surprised that it lived up to the hype. My girlfriend and I were a few minutes early to our reservation but the hostess ran (literally) to accommodate us anyway. We ordered the Roasted Dungeness Crab and Garlic Noodles, both of which we'll be dreaming about for a while. Food was served almost immediately and our waiter, Philip, was extremely helpful at answering all the menu questions we had. The staff kept a keen eye at our discard bowls for the crab shells and replaced them as soon as they filled. Friendly service and a romantic atmosphere really set this place apart. I only wish we lived in San Francisco so we could come here more often.
author: Darrell M.

description:
"The Roast Crab and An's Garlic Noodles".....The BEST combination of dishes I have ever tried! The crab, presented in its entirety and cooked with garlic and spices, is beyond words. Delicious. And the garlic noodles, although simple, adds a perfect touch when paired with the crab. Definitely two signature dishes at this restaurant!!

Crustacean has always been a choice for dining whenever we vacationed in San Francisco and I was so happy to return. Once again, it didn't disappoint. Everything was just as I remembered. The service was excellent, the wine selection was superb. Everyone in our party agreed that our dinner was fabulous. 
 
Can't wait to return. I won't even need a menu: Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles!!!
author: Kanoe I.

description: Crustaceans May 19 2018 my 59th birthday dinner was late one hour, we were sitted down at 5:40 we didn't get our dinner until hour later,  three different couples came in and ordered their dinner and got their dinners before we got ours Two couples were finished and they were leaving when we got our dinner the reasoning was we order Hors d'oeuvres we only had fried calamari didn't really understand why ?
author: Carol W.

description: Anthony Bourdain must have been totally wasted out of his mind when he rated this place superb. Had dinner here tonight and it sucked.  The fried calamari was greasy and rather cold.  I sent it back.  I then had prawns and garlic noodles. The noodles were way over cooked and mushy.  The prawns were over cooked and tough. I have fished with shrimp larger than the ones I was served.   Price to eat this shit $39.00 plus tax.  i had rather stick needles in my eye than ever eat here again
author: Ken B.

description:
My wife loves to come here for her birthday so every year we come!

She loves to get her crab, so she got the roasted crab and I got the Saigon beef since I am allergic to shell fish. 

Staff is always very nice and helpful.

Even though parking is a challenge (they do you valet) it is worth it. 

Good drinks and a nice bar. 

Guess we'll be back next year
author: Greg W.

description: We use to be a huge fans of Crustacean. However, recent experiences has disappointed us. Last night we went there due to old friend who has left Bay Area for years visiting SF, and he loves Crustacean. As usual, we ordered Deep Fried Calamari as appetizer, Garlic noodles, Snap peas, They were all great. 6 of us ordered Entree either Lobster with Angle Hair or Garlic Roasted Crab. My husband ordered crab and I tried, it was less garlic flavor as before. Lobster with Angle Hair used to be my favorite is totally plain last night. Not sure if it is a dead lobster or not, it is just not as tasty as before. It was so delicious for the last two times, made me dropped Garlic Roasted Crab. Also, service was bad. No one came adding water for our table, had to ask for. No lemon served with water. I changed to 3 stars from two is after read my previous review, found there is one positive side, the interior has been improved, look better than before.
author: Shrabbit A.

description:
I love this place! We had the garlic crab, garlic noodles, and calamari. Delicious!
If you are ever in San Francisco...make sure to stop there. Best dungeness crab I ever ate!
author: Cynthia K.

description: Best service by Philip! Food was excellent! The garlic noodle compliments the roasted crab! First timers will be back again on our next visit!
author: Jus D.

description: The food was better than the service, but all in all, it was a decent place.  I would eat here again, but I dont know if I would search it out.
author: Bryan F.

description:
Came here for a friend's bday. Service was ok, but the food is over priced and too oily.

We ordered a bunch of the crabs and the garlic noodles. Which were about $50 each. The Roast crab was sitting in a pool of oil, and the noodles were also super oily. Which made it hard to eat.

We did order some non seafood dishes like the shaken beef and papaya salad. Those items were pretty good.

Pretty disappointed about the seafood and crab since that was the main reason why we came here. I would rather make the drive out to boiling crab for seafood next time.
author: Jessica S.

description: I ordered a papaya salad with calamari and the roasted garlic crab and garlic noodles. The papaya salad was okay, too much cilantro which I didn't care for. The crab was amazing! I shared it with my friend so it's enough for two. The garlic noodles were very flavorful but a little mushy in texture. I also had three lychee martinis which was pretty good but quite pricey for what it was ($11). Ambiance is a plus if you're looking to go for a date night. Service was decent but nothing memorable.
author: Kacy O.

description:
My friend took me here for a pretend "date night" dinner. He searched on Yelp for "romantic restaurants" and this placed popped up.

The restaurant itself is located on the top floor of a building with other random businesses. It is pretty large in size and has a few different dining rooms. The ambiance is upscale Asian fusion vibe.

We ordered grilled calamari for starter, and their famous roasted crab entree with garlic noodles side. Grilled calamari was the best dish of the night. Came with 4 large pieces and it was sooo tender. 

Unfortunately, the crab dish was very disappointing. The market price was $50 and there was barely any meat in the legs and claws. Absolutely no meat at all underneath the shell. Also pretty much ruins date night because 1) there is no graceful way to suck crab legs and 2) the garlic sauce, although delicious, gives you major garlic breath. Plus, trying to break through the shell was hard work and messy. I don't remember the last time I had to work so hard while eating at a restaurant. The noodles were good but expensive. If they had a garlic noodle dish with giant lump crab meat pieces already taken out of the shell for us, I would very much prefer that.

We did spot football player Marshawn Lynch of the Seattle Seahawks dining next to us, so that was pretty cool.
author: Jessica C.

description:
FOOD
Roasted Crab
This is the flagship dish at Crustacean. Market price was $50 per crab. The crab is huge, and we really enjoyed the long process of eating it. Don't be afraid to sit there with a bib sucking away at the claw- no shame. The roasted crab was by far more flavorful than the drunken crab. This crab is drenched in garlic, butter, and a ton of pepper. The flavor is infused into the crab and is just so good.

Drunken Crab
The alternative to the roasted crab. This one is in a wine sauce with veggies. The broth is more delicate, so it just doesn't infuse into the crab the same way. I would recommend this one if you don't like strong flavors or prefer just the clean, fresh taste of crab on its own.

Garlic Noodles
Way overpriced at $10.95. The noodles don't have much presentation. It is literally a plate of noodles and all just one color. You could just get the garlic noodles at Yamo. However, they do taste good drenched in the sauce from the roasted crab.

SERVICE
The waiter wasn't rude, but he wasn't friendly either. He just didn't really seem to care for us. It would have been better if he just smiled.

LOCATION
On the third floor of a random plaza in Nob Hill a few blocks from Trader Joe's. Pretty large restaurant with plenty of seating for large parties.
author: Alice T.

description: As always I had a great time and the food was delicious. It wasn't too crowded so we were able to get seated quickly. The service was great and the bartender was amazing.
author: Ro L.

description: Amazing dungeon crab. The tamarind sauce is amazing, but so is the roasted option. The house garlic noodles are great too. Had an old fashion cocktail which was nice too.
author: George T.

description: I really wanted to like this place being that I'm from the bay, and heard nothing but good things regarding the food. It's my cousins birthday and we decided that that's where we wanna eat. We arrive to the restaurant, get out to valet our car and right away we hear a man yelling from the top of the stairs telling us we can not park there and to hurry up or they won't service us. The whole time I'm looking at my cousin like wtf is going on and let the man know we we're there for dinner, and I need him to Valet my car and right away he gets in my car and starts moving my vehicle like it was a bumper car. I'm like nah you're not about to drive my car like that, you're gonna scrape my rims, those are 7k rims. He then tells me "then you can go park it across the street," like wait, what?? Mind you it's a team of us looking to drop a check at this place and we're being told to hurry or we won't be served and to valet our own cars?? come to find out this is the owner who's handling us this way. He chose to right away act out soon as we pulled up. I don't understand where the hostility came from but I had to leave, for the sake of the two of us. This was racial profiling. We didn't do anything to receive such a hostile welcome; we we're looking to drop a dime and eat with my family & friends. Fuck this place, you don't treat people like that and then continue to antagonize them, that's you asking for shit to escalate. It was racial profiling at its best, and I refuse to ever give my business to a piece of shit place like this. Fuck Crustacean's.
author: Dania L.

description:
Dinner ( Roast Crab and Tiger Prawns with Garlic Noodles) was delicious as always. 

For dessert I selected the baked Alaskan which was mostly good though I did not enjoy the crust (cake maybe) part of it.

Quite busy for a Tuesday night so reluctantly I grabbed a seat at the bar. Service was prompt. I appreciated that. 

San Francisco favorite I'm sure I'll be back - there's nothing like it not ever their sister restaurant Thanh Long.
author: Jennifer J.

description: I can't take my mom anywhere else to eat crabs but here. To her, all the other places are nasty If you say crabs you better be taking her here and already have reservations. She ready on time!
author: Stephanie J.

description:
I've been coming here for years.  I've been to this location, Thanh Long, the Beverly Hills location and the one they used to have in Las Vegas.  This must mean I love it and oh how I do.

I brought a new friend here for dinner because he had never been.  I only ever get the Roast Crab, garlic noodles, garlic toast and maybe an appetizer.  I was appalled when he ordered the salmon.  Who passes up crab?  He let me have a bite and I have to admit it was delicious.  But... not as delicious as my crab.  The waiter told him to get the garlic noodles and it was going to be enough for two, I quickly butted in and said he wasn't sharing my noodles.  He had to get his own.  When they arrived my friend agreed, the noodles are a one person dish.  But we both love garlic so we might just be greedy.

Anywhoo.  I love this restaurant and I anytime someone says they love crab and or garlic I refer them here.
author: Aleta T.

description: We enjoyed the crabs!  Completely different from Japanese delicious crabs. Amazing experience!
author: 秀和

description:
When our group of 6 entered the restaurant, we should have turned around and run.  The fishy smell was nasty, however thr reviews were wonderful so we decided to stay.
I must say the service was great.   The food not so much. 
The prawns and garlic noodles were way over price and not good at all.  The 4 prawns looked like they had been run over by a steam roller and were so overcooked they were dry and tough.  The garlic noodles were mushy, dry and blah. My overpriced  $38 meal ended up costing over $51 after tip, tax and city fee.  So disappointing. 
The folks who had the baked crab were also very disappointed.  
This restaurant is definitely not on our go-to when we come to San Francisco.
author: Peggy B.

description:
We got the Steamed Seafood Dumplings and Calamari to share. The seafood dumplings were good. They were a bit hard to eat as the wonton skin was very fragile. We got the calamari fried and it comes with onions and bell peppers. Some of the calamari had a bit too much pepper on it but overall it was delicious, especially with the sauce.

Their popular item is the Roast Crab which is an entire dinginess crab with garlic and spices. It has a nice flavor and the meat was juicy and tender. The butter on the plate flavors the crab well and isn't too overpowering. The crabs we got were a good size. The waiter told us many people order An's Garlic Noodles with the crab. The noodles were alright in comparison to the crab. It was just good as a side, not a meal even though it costs about $10.

We also ordered the Steamed Seabass. The sauce that surrounds the fish is delightful. I believe the sauce it comes with on the side that looks like butter is actually like a citrus sauce which gives it an interesting flavor. I prefer to eat it with the sauce that's surrounding the fish. They steam it well as the fish just falls apart nicely and the meat isn't chewy at all.

We got lucky and were seated when we came in. The atmosphere is nice. It looks pretty fancy but people here are dressed casually. The wait staff is fantastic and very attentive. There is about a 1.5 hour time limit but definitely enough time for a good meal.
author: Arianne C.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. Every time I'm in town I have to stop by. I suggest the drunken crab and garlic noodles to anybody that's a first timer.
author: Trevor P.

description:
I've been to Crustcean 1-4 times a year since moving here in 2009, and I've never had anything but a great experience with the food as well as the service. I usually attend for Thanksgiving each year and this year was nothing different. We get the roast crab or two, the garlic noodles, and the snap peas for some crunch and color. All are excellent. I've been to PPQ but there is just something about Crustacean that feels higher quality and the service is definitely better, so I suggest this especially for special occasions. 
This year we also had one of our favorite waiters, Philip. He is exceptional, with a great sense of humor and lots of knowledge about the food and drinks they have to offer. I love that he takes his time with us and really makes the experience feel all the more special, as well as getting some laughs out of us too. 

Will definitely be coming back for years to come
author: Shawn H.

description:
A tradition for my boyfriend and I... Crustacean is just down right amazing. It started off a little questionable. We had a reservation at 7PM and when we arrived around 7:05PM (city traffic in union), we were told we needed to wait. (perhaps hiring another host would help speed up the process?) We were in no hurry so we didn't mind too much. 
When we were seated around 7:15 it took a while for us to get our host's attention. I had to make it clear at one point we were ready for some water and for our wine to be open. As the night progressed, so did our experience. The big parties made it difficult for our waiter which we can understand being in hospitality. As the night trickled on, he turned out to be amazing and attentive and we shared a taste of our wine with him.
The food was amazing per usual - garlic noodles and crab is a MUST. It is what we get every time. We had an order of crab wontons - those are a must as well. 

Definitely a fun experience! If you're not too hungry, share a crab and a side of garlic noodles. Also - you might want to take an extra serving of garlic noodles to-go (we did!)
author: Rachel K.

description:
Came here with a party of 4 for my best friend's Birthday. We ordered the garlic noodles and two Dungeness crabs. The garlic noodles is my favorite I'd recommended ordering it on our table. The Dungeness crab can feed two people. My GF and I shared one and it got us very stuffed. The size of the crab is fairly huge and has a whole load of meat. There alcohol drinks are tasty as well, and not watered down. I had the Malibu Sunrise and it was really good. 

Customer service was great! Our waiter was very nice and took care of us at our table. Location wasn't hard to find just the parking. Valet was $12 I decided to do it rather than kill lots of time looking for parking after 6pm. Overall, We had a splendid time here. It was my first but I'd come again!
author: Cheryl Ann B.

description:
I was told about this place by a colleague who has come here for many years. The moment he mentioned crab served asian style, I was hooked and had to try :-))

The place is located three floors up in the building and not obvious from the street. It's reasonably big and had the seating divided across three or four rooms making it look small and cozy. 

The food here is 4 stars and the service 5 star. Overall value is also 5 stars. It's overall 4.5 stars for me. I loved it and would go back anytime for crab.

We ordered a salt and pepper calamari (special for the day) and salmon carpaccio for starter. OMG the calamari was amazing and both my friend and I had the exact same reaction ;-)) The carpaccio was also exceptionally good. For main we ordered tamarind and chilli crab. The crab was cooked to perfection and the sauce was nice but could have used a bit more heat. I was in heaven :-) This type of food is simply not available in Munich and I devoured it lol

Our waiter was excellent and I left him a big tip. He kept us entertained through the evening and checked up on us frequently to make sure everything was fine. 

I would come back here is a heartbeat and eagerly look forward to the next time :-)))
author: Sam S.

description:
We go to Crustacean in Beverly Hills. It is great.
The location in San Francisco was very 
Disappointing.  The service was slow.  Entrees came out with the soup and got cold.
I always look forward to my carb splurge of garlic noodles.  Mine came out after everyone finished their dinner.  I don't quite get why this restaurant 
went down hill.  
Maybe they are focused on the food truck.
author: Janice R.

description: Food was awesome. Sidecar cocktail was perfectly balanced. Roasted crab and garlic noodles is the classic choice here. Other patrons were loud.
author: Jenna D.

description: I've always wanted to go here every since a little  kid ... me and my wife of 7 Years went here for our anniversary .. for starters we ordered deep fried calamari and for the main course we order the whole crab and garlic noodles .. the service was impeccable one of the waiters name Andrew recommended a more flavorful sauce to go with our calamari that was infused with chili sauce , I think should be in the menus, he also recommended a beautiful wine they was very tasteful, now back to our food the crab was cooked perfectly with just the rite amount of garlic and butter there noodles are to die for my wife ordered one to go ... lol ..to sum it up this place when it comes to crab is top notch .. I would give them five stars but everybody and everything has room for improvement
author: LaVelle M.

description: Amazing place. My family that lives abroad would always ask me to bring them for dinner at this place. Mega-Delish
author: Jing S.

description: Melt in your mouth sea bass and delicious noodles. Definitely an overlooked place. Doesn't have the most attractive entrance. A bit overpriced but hey we live in SF.
author: Fahmid K.

description:
Still our favorite San Francisco restaurant for GARLIC NOODLES, ROASTED CRAB AND TIGER PRAWNS  for main courses.
Great appetizers are the CRAB PUFFS AND THE MUSSELS.
We can't wait to go back again when in San Francisco1
author: Bernard K.

description: My hubby and I shared a roasted crab and got 2 orders of the garlic noodles. It was sufficient for us and SUPER delicious! $56 for the crab was so worth it and it had plenty of meat to share! Service was good, nothing spectacular. The ambiance was nice on the inside, on the outside not so much. Lots of trash in the area. But the food was well worth it!
author: Dominique G.

description: The food was ok with the coconut prawns being my favorite, drinks were great will probably visit more as a pop in for appetizers and drinks. Service was attentive considering they seem to have a high turn over,
author: Rae T.

description: Drunken crab was so good.  Try that and garlic noodles along with champagne. Best dinner I had in SF.
author: La P.

description:
I've been a San Francisco resident for over 25 years, and I've always wanted to try Crustacean. Well tonight, I had that opportunity and was looking forward to it. Unfortunately my excitement was met with a very disappointing culinary experience. This sentiment was shared by everyone in our party of six. I am going to be brief because the "meh" experience doesn't warrant a more expansive dissertation. Honestly, I wanted to give this a one star, but I don't want to be taken as a hater as I was genuinely looking forward to dining at Crustacean.

Ambience--nice decor, but a bit tired

Food--subpar and didn't hold a candle to many of the much more reasonably priced local Vietnamese restaurants throughout SF. We ordered their House Specialties which included the following:

--Royal Tiger Prawns with Garlic--Four Prawns were anorexic and chewy (overcooked) not to mention a bit cold. They were filleted on a bed of unexpectedly bland garlic noodles. The noodles reminded me of a plate of spaghetti I could make at home mixed with butter and a pinch of garlic salt. 

--Roasted Crab--My table mates were hard-pressed to extract any meat from this house specialty. You'd do better at the numerous other crab joints in SF. The measly portion (lots of messy work for very little crab meat) was served on a plate of butter and the only redeeming aspect of this dish was that everything tastes good with butter.

--Crab cakes--Served two crab cakes with a small salad garnishment. The crab cakes were flavorful, but the portions were on the small side especially given the price. 

--Calamari--like the crab cakes, this was the only other redeeming, somewhat satisfying dish we ordered. We order calamari whenever it's an appetizer on a menu as our kids love it. Crustacean's calamari was four out of five stars. It was cooked well and had just the right breading and texture (not overly soft and not too crispy). The thinly sliced red peppers and onions were a nice compliment to the calamari. The dipping sauce was tasty as well.

Service--Service was okay. Nothing to write home about, just okay. One noteworthy item is that they will bring out hot towels if you ask for them which is nice touch. However, the towels were scalding hot and were too hot to pick up. If this is typical, the servers should warn customers in advance as someone could easily burn themselves. We had our 93 year old great aunt with us and she grabbed towel to warm her cold hands and literally threw it back as she recoiled from the heat. 

Price--$$$$$ way over-priced for what you get and the quality. I can enjoy a garlic noodles dish at our local Vietnamese restaurant that is immensely more flavorful and satisfying for less than half Crustacean's "price upon request" of $40. C'mon, $40 for a plate of butter spaghetti with four anorexic, cold prawns. Similarly, the Roasted Crab was $55. Crab of superior quality and quantity can be had for 50% to 60% of that price at many fine restaurants around town. The Crab Cakes were again twice the price for what you're getting...$27 for two small portion crab cakes. My oldest who loves crab cakes asked if we could go to In 'n Out afterwards.

All in all, I honestly don't know how this place stays in business as it was a very disappointing experience. Hopefully, Crustacean will take this review to heart and make improvements. It was a $300 bill for six people with no drinks except one beer, one coke and a cup of tea, and food that was for the most part, barring the calamari and crab cakes, very unsatisfying and left a lot to be desired. As a "dining" fisherman with expectations for a good "catch" today, this is one crustacean I'd throw back.
author: Lawson C.

description:
I know of this restaurant long ago from frequenting their Beverly Hills location in LA. Arguably as good as any place you can find if you thoroughly enjoy eating crabs prepared by their secret crab recipe. 

Some folks comment on their lack of customer service, ambiance, etc. and I agree generally on those thoughts. However if your goal is to eat a yummy tasting crab you can't go wrong shelling out your $$ here.
author: andrew v.

description: First, this place is in a lousy part of town and my Uber driver said that we shouldn't try to walk back to our hotel from here! This place was so loud and the staff was rushing around and making you feel like you were supposed to hurry.  I think we were in and out the door in less than 35 minutes!  The crab was barely edible, oily with no taste, noodles were just garlic and oil with an outrageous price of $56 for 1 crab and $14 for a small bowl of noodles, $5 to crack crab and with 2 beers and tax, over $100.
author: Ken A.

description: I've been coming to crustacean since I was just a little girl with my daddy and mommy then as I got grow older I came with my aunties and cousins then my friends I have always loved this place I love their food their noodle there crab their prawns and appetizer the whole thing is really good back then kid dress in regular clothes now you have to have a dress jacket and dress pants I guess that's not too bad since it's a pretty classy place but I recently came there and have my cell phone and the waiter told me no cellphones while dinner is in progress took me by surprise but I kinda get it you should interact with the people you're having dinner with your not always checking your phone so I guess that's a good thing I still love this place and I always will come back
author: Michele T.

description: Had the Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles. The crab was alright. It was very big which was exciting, but parts of it wasn't fresh. The set of plate and table cloth in front of me had a strange oily smell so bad that I had to request a change.
author: Aria C.

description:
Read the reviews and had the roasted crab and garlic noodles. Left with a full stomach and a huge smile on my face. Not to sure on pricing cause the menu said market price,  but figure that means pricey and someone else got the check. 

Would definitely come back again when I'm in San Francisco.
author: Rob F.

description: Probably the very best tasting Dungeness Crabs are found at An's restaurants. Crustaceans tops the list with service as great as the very best restaurants.  The Roasted Crab and the Garlic Noodles are the go-to's.  Don't be put off by the declining exterior, the restaurant inside is attractive and very clean.  Definitely pricey, but if you want the tastiest, you gotta pay for it.  Worth the drive from San Jose.  We parked on Polk just 1/2 block away on a Sunday at 4:45.  For a less-expensive alternative  with wider hours, try PPQ on Clement St.
author: Ed D.

description:
We had a party of twelve and they mussed some of our orders. We ordered several appetizers, the favorite of which was the fried calamari - not on the printed menu.

I got the pan roasted miso salmon with corn & mashed potatoes over greens. 
Fish: cooked properly
All else: bland

The drinks were great, though!
author: Ce O.

description: The crab was delightful as expected, the garlic noodles... not so much. A little disappointed that the noodles didn't quite taste the same
author: Dee T.

description:
Things I like about Crustacean:
roasted garlic crab, garlic noodles, the drinks.

I've had a lot of the appetizers, and some of their other man dishes, and not so impressed by it.  

Service can be hit or miss. Anytime I make a reservation for special occasions, it's never acknowledged., even though the request is in the reservation. I've had times where the wait staff is 100% on point, and other times where the wait staff has literally forgotten everything on my order. 

It's not going to stop me from coming here though. :)
author: Kim T.

description:
This place definitely lived up to the hype! The garlic noodles alone are AMAZING! I had the tiger prawns w/the noodles and it was perfect! 
I'm sitting here waiting on my Baked Alaska for dessert just had to write this while the "yummyness" is still fresh
author: Kimberli G.

description:
Roasted Crab and An's garlic noodles are good. Other plates are below average.
I dined at Anqi in South Coast Plaza, Orange County. Wines and fried rice are better.
author: Ha C.

description: The best crab I have ever had!! You must check it out, order the garlic noodles and roast crab. Great experience over all and I can't wait to visit again soon.
author: Paige P.

description:
ROAST CRAB.  garlicky buttery peppered goodness. you gotta crack it yourself but it is DELICIOUS.  and of course you gotta order GARLIC NOODLES and put it in that crab juice!  

Lobster Salad with Miso Dressing - MMM warm savory umami-ish dressing with sweet tender lobster meat.  can't beat that

service was attentive and friendly. basically perfect.

i only have to say that the garlic noodles were plain and overcooked, no where near as good as other places in the city.  it also tasted slightly like plastic saran wrap.
author: Tina A.

description: It's always great to visit Crustacean when I'm in SF. Service and food were excellent!
author: Venessa P.

description: I have been coming here for over 25 years.  I always get the roasted crab and garlic noodles.  It's absolutely incredible.  I have learned how to make the garlic noodles.  I'm still experimenting on the roasted crab.  Clearly the best roasted crab I've ever had.
author: Christopher F.

description:
I went here for the first time a few weeks ago with my girlfriends for dinner. The service was great, loved our waiter. 

Location and Decor is very lackluster, that part gets no stars.

The food was very good, LOVED the crab. Pricey but really yummy.
author: Sam M.

description:
Recommend me a better roasted crab restaurant in San Francisco
I noticed crabs were low quality still charge me the same price. Recently I found the change of the owner. Not an Ann family owns any more. I am afraid but the new owner does not care the crab quality.
I really appreciate if you could recommend me a better (roasted) crab restaurant.

Thank you.
author: Ted S.

description: I had a little weekend getaway and had to come by for some crab and gralic noodles! Love the service and the noodles and crab and delicious!
author: Kim D.

description:
Perfect very fresh whole crab delivered quickly, just cooked, and piping hot in a very delicious butter garlic sauce.

Dungeness crab just doesn't get any better than this!

Efficient and attentive service but not overly friendly.
author: Michael M.

description: Amazing food!!! Fresh, flavorful, great portion sizes.  My server was very knowledgeable about the menu and helped with our selections.  The restaurant lived up to its reputation.  So glad I went.  It's a must visit in San Fran!
author: Nicole S.

description: The Garlic Noodles and Crab Rangoon were the best I've ever had. The Roasted Crab was good but just too buttery/oily for my taste. They fit us in earlier than our reservations and the staff was great.
author: Cassandra K.

description: One of my favorite restaurants, amazing food and great cocktails also. Highly recommend the roasted garlic crab, garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari and the carpaccio.
author: Rose D.

description: While the garlic rice was my favorite thing, I preferred it to the garlic noodles, I felt like everything else was simply okay. With all of the great things I'd heard about Crustaceans, I had my expectations set high, and they were not met. I expected bolder flavors for the quality and price of the food.
author: Olivia M.

description: After a friend recommended the garlic noodles,  we came here to try it and fell in love with it. Such immense garlic flavor that left us wanting more. We also had the Vietnamese salad that was very refreshing. These 2 dishes were definitely a must try if you are planning on going here.  We also ordered the Saigon beef which tasted horrible. It was under seasoned and the beef was wrapped around a piece of union which did nothing to add to its flavor. We ended up just eating the salad that came along side it only. Definitely not going to order that again but we would def return for the garlic noodles and Vietnamese salad. The ambiance was very romantic so it would be prefect for a date night or a special occasion.
author: Karen K.

description:
This review is mainly on service.  Food overall was good.  Salt and pepper calamari, roasted crab and garlic noodles was on point. The recommended shaken beef by the waiter failed, way too sweet. 

Negative:
Had a reservation at 7pm. We ran late, we called of course to let them no and got there at 710. But we had to wait.... about 20 mins to get seated. 

The waiter.... she clearly did not want to be there. Probably have been there so long she just don't care. She was not attentive.  Forgetful when we orders our drinks. Got our beer and pour like a sample size in our cup.   It's not wine, I don't need to taste it. Plus the glass was not cold. She bought us bowls for our crab shells and just left it behind us. We reached for it ourselves. Never asked how are meal was and if we needed something else. She was so rude that we didn't even want to ask for anything else.  Then when the bill came we did half card and cash. She came over grabbed it didn't say anything. Came back then proceed to ask us how do we  want to pay. Came back handed us the recipe and walk away. No thank you. No enjoy your day. Nothing!  I wish I had her name! Pixey cut Short haired, older white lady. Honestly, she ruined our meal. With her no smiling face, she should be in the kitchen or something where else.  The only nice person there was the server who gave us a bib and served our food. We were able to joke around with him and he was polite! Promote him to be a waiter. 
 
Another failed.  There's only 1 bathroom and 1 stall for the whole restaurant.  Are you serious!!!  Of course the women's bathroom is always a line. Stupid concept! 

Last note.  Put some money into fixing the crab sign outside the building. We wouldn't be able to tell that it's a restaurant. No sign beside a one claw crab light up sign.  

So experience was a failed.  Food was good.
author: Maria V.

description: Went there for my Birhday with my wife and the waiter was great, we asked for help with selecting an appetizer and he was the best. Came by and checked on us regularly  we first got there the staff sat us down right away. I have been here before quite a few times and it's always been great !
author: Rudy H.

description: I'm so happy they had chicken! LOL! I don't eat seafood but it was my mans birthday and I took him out it's one of his favorite restaurants and they were absolutely amazing from the moment we stepped in till we left they really cater to every customer and I appreciated that since it was his birthday. He had the crab & garlic noodles (loved it) and I had the chicken and veggies & garlic noodles and it was delicious!! The only thing that sucks is the parking!! Lord it was a struggle!!
author: Howa Z.

description:
Crustacean was one of the restaurants recommended to me for my 2015-April trip to San Francisco by friends who used to live in San Francisco. I'm always up for interesting eats, so the mystique of their having a "Secret Kitchen" where family recipes are prepared away from the prying eyes of "outsider" staff intrigued me. That, plus people raving about their garlic noodles. And Crustacean sounded like such an old family restaurant that I didn't think it merely a marketing gimmick. Certainly the one staff person I chanced to run into on my way up the stairs confirmed the Secret Kitchen protocol did in fact exist.

First impressions of the place were good. The maître d' gave polished, professional service and was patient with noob questions. The restaurant is elevated over the street, giving you views of the city. The dining area is also tiered, so even if you are not sitting at a window, there's still the possibility of good views. The dim room of dark colours offered a nice retreat from the bright sun outside if you are dining early in the evening.

My reservation was for 5:30 PM and one of the first ones in the restaurant that Sunday evening. They are apparently supremely busy come sundown (the timing of which is therefore influenced by Daylight Savings Time adjustments). That, and if there is a convention in town.

The basic Roast Crab is one of the restaurant's original (and now Secret Kitchen) recipes; the Tamarind Crab and Drunken Crabs were added later. The "extra time" required for the crustacean recipes from the Secret Kitchen was estimated by the server to be just about 15 minutes more, though one should expect it to be even longer once the restaurant gets busy later in the evening starting around 7 PM.

As is my wont, I arrived early. The restaurant was basically empty. The protocol apparently was that I could wait seated at the bar, or I could wait in the lobby; either way, they would seat me once 2-3 persons had arrived. (Why?) Anyway, I complied, though eventually they did seat me alone. Of course during this time I did not idle, but perused the menu.

Once at the table, I started with a drink. They had non-alcoholic ginger beer. It was disaster (how can a restaurant mess up a bottled drink?). Once my friends arrived and our first appetizer orders showed up, they still hadn't redeemed themselves from this FAIL:

Ginger Beer ($6)
- Tasted weak. The reason is probably because at least 2/3rds of my glass was ice cubes. I paid $4 for ice and $2 for maybe a 1/3rd of a glass of ginger beer that didn't taste anywhere as good as the four-pack I bought from Trader Joe's that cost less than $6.
- Crustacean is a "fancy restaurant" and a popular one. I get that. I've eaten at even more posh or pretentious restaurants in Vancouver. But this much ice is disgusting for a $6 drink.

More detailed reviews of the 10 things we tried can't fit in the 5000 character limit here, but I've blogged it at http://lower-mainland-bc.blogspot.ca/2015/04/hit-and-miss-at-crustacean-restaurant.html  For the moment I'll just mention the Roast Crab:

Roast Crab ("quoted price", for us it was $48.95)
- Looked like a baked crab sitting in a pool of oil sprinkled liberally with pepper.
I thought maybe the flavour here was in the oil (roasted with the crab?). I mixed some of the garlic noodles in that oil. Nope. Now my garlic noodles just tasted oily.
After cracking open the leathery shell, the crab meat tasted like crab.
- I even licked the shell for any flavour that might be crusted on (e.g., in the matter you would definitely lollipop the shell of a Singapore Style Chili Crab https://youtu.be/jrUpFdS74LI?t=8m16s ). Nope, no flavour to be savoured here.
- Total waste of time (and money). Just get a crab from the market and steam it yourself and use whatever condiments you like.

Despite a really lousy start with the $6 for ice with a splash of ginger beer plus a couple of dish duds, Crustacean would still get a passing score because:
-Prices for many items are actually good. A great way to get a filling meal at a reasonable price is to share fried rice ($8) or garlic noodles ($10.95) and a main with a friend -- i.e., treat Crustacean like any other family style / for sharing Chinese restaurant and go with several people.
- Items are hit and miss, but there are good items on the menu. Do not just go with the hype and order Secret Kitchen stuff.

However, BEFORE the end of the meal -- BEFORE we had even finished dessert -- I got the bill. WTH? Sorry, points off for that. Including the debacle with the Ginger Beer, I am tempted to just give them 1 star.
author: Simon S.

description: Don't get the papaya salad with calamari. Very little seasoning. 5 pieces of calamari sitting on top of plain papaya. Garlic noodles were soggy.
author: Sofia J.

description: We had a great meal at Crustaceans! The service was excellent and I really appreciated the restaurant's concern for my husband who has a shellfish allergy. They made sure everyone who was servicing our table knew about his allergy. He enjoyed his short ribs and the calamari. The rest of us had roasted crab and garlic noodles. Creme brûlée and fried bananas ala mode for dessert. Excellent wine list as well.
author: Shawn N.

description: I made a reservation 2 months in advance for my birthday and they sat me in the bar when I was expecting a nice table in the dinning room. When I asked why I was sitting in the bar the manager was making me feel like I was bothering him. Very disappointing experience.
author: Cynthia S.

description: First of all, we SHOULD have ordered the roast crab (even though very pricey) because after we ate our mediocre meal the guy next to us was going to town on his plate and I've never seen a happier man! We ordered the crab puffs (amazing), lobster roll (pretty good), the corn bisque (not my cup of tea) and the surf and turf roll (worst thing I've tasted in my life... NEEDS to come off the menu! It was a horrible combo of textures and flavors and it's so chewy you can't just eat it really fast and swallow to get rid of it...). Atmosphere was nice but the lobby smelled like old crab and the "elevator" smelled like urine. All-in-all an interesting experience but not great. The vanilla bean crème brûlée was awesome!
author: Danielle M.

description:
So I'm a self confessed foodie!  I truly enjoy experiencing different food in different places. However I realize now that I'm an amateur. What self respecting foodie would admit that they'd never heard of Crustaceans!!!  Well folks that would be me!!

My wife and I went to San Francisco this past weekend with our son. I've always wanted to experience San Francisco food scene. Typical tourist traps like Fishermans Wharf was on my list of places to go to get some of that bay area seafood. A friend recommended that we bypass the "Groto" and instead go to Crustaceans. So we decided that this place would be our first stop. As it turned out the restaurant was on the opposite block of the hotel that we stayed in Nob Hill. 

We arrived just after they opened for dinner so we didn't need a reservation. We were seated quickly and immediately were impressed by the atmosphere and ambiance. Although this is definitely an upscale restaurant it had a cozy relaxed feel to it. My wife and I were wearing jeans and my son had on shorts and a sweatshirt (typical SoCal teen attire).  Our waiter was a French gentleman who recommended some great appetizers and an awesome Chimay (I had a few of those).  

We ordered a crusted Ahi Tuna appetizer with a spicy sauce and garnish. Perfectly seasoned and seared!! It paired really well with the Chimay and the drink my wife ordered. 

For my main course I ordered the staple of this restaurant,  Garlic Pepper Roasted Crab and their famous Garlic Noodles. My wife order the Tamarind Crab. My son ordered the stuffed calamari and rice. The food was prepared relatively quick and was brought out steaming hot. My mouth immediately began to water. Just the smell and presentations alone hand me spinning. 

Let me say this EMPHATICALLY....that Garlic Pepper roast crab was THE BEST CRAB I'VE EVER TASTED!  I'm from the south "y'all" so for me to make such a bold declaration isn't made lightly. I seriously spent the last few days scouring through my taste bud memory bank and I honestly can't remember EVER eating a crab and wanting to chew the shell also!!
I tried my wife's crab and it was also delicious but no where close to that garlic-pepper-roasted-master crustacean-beauty!!

I will be trying the restaurant in Beverly Hills real soon for comparison but honestly I don't think I can top this. If you are traveling to San Francisco you MUST go to Crustaceans in Nob Hill. You will not regret it. 

Eat, Drink, and Be Safe!!
author: Roosevelt S.

description:
I eat out a lot.
I havent eaten here in 15 years because I live in another city. Thd food was awesome then. Just as good now. Had Crab and garlic noodles plus Halibut.
Tipped the waiter 30%.
author: Daniel B.

description:
I ate here twice, first experience was okay but the second one was quite memorable!
So therefore, I am going to write about my second time dining here. We loved our garlic noodles and their crab. Ohh my GOD! Their crab was way better than R&G Lounge. Super flavorful and well worth every penny. Garlic noodles was sooo good to a point that I stopped by at Crustacean and just wanted Garlic Noodles, too bad I came during their closing hours lol Freakin lame. I was trying to convince them, can I just buy it? And they replied, "Sorry, ma'm, but we are still closed." Desperation indeed. I wanted those garlic noodles soooo bad!

Overall, love this place and recommend it to everyone who are not allergic to seafood.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Been to Crustacean many times, always good service and amazing food. I ordered "The Roast Crab" and Garlic Noodles as always. The two best items on the menu! Definitely will go back. Although prices are a bit pricey to me. The crab was about $56 before tax, but the garlic noodle seemed reasonable being around $12. Definitely worth it for the price though!
author: Samantha L.

description:
Don't bother coming here.  The place is old and dirty, and generally the food lacks flavor.

That being said, the Roast Crab (market price--$48.95 tonight) is very well cooked--consistent through the entire thing, from the wider to the skinny parts.  The spice used for the Roast Crab consisted of garlic, butter, salt and pepper--nothing very tasty, but again, the crab is well-cooked.  Shaken Beef ($27) is also good, however it probably is not for everyone--it is cubed in the stir-fry of green beans and onions, and on the sweet side, similar to (but not as good as) Asian beef jerky--I like sweet, so I thought it was decent.  The Shaken Beef dish also came with 3 raw cherry tomatoes for color...odd plating since they could have easily put a few slices of orange or red bell pepper in the stir-fry instead.  The food also comes out very quickly, which was nice.

PASS on the garlic noodles ($10.95).  I have no idea why people rave about this Crustacean version to this day--the noodles were mushy and in serious need of any kind of flavor.  I'm a carb/noodle lover, but these hyped up noodles fell far below expectations.  They needed more garlic.  They were very oily (not even buttery, which would have probably made them taste better).  You're better off having garlic noodles at literally any other place in SF--all other places we've tried have been on an entire other level compared to this one (Chubby Noodle, Perilla, or even make your own easily using some fresh noodles from any market in Chinatown).  These must have been good once upon a time, but believe me--they are not anymore.

Tip: If you still decide to get the garlic noodles, and similarly find them to be lacking, you can do as I did, and request fish sauce and chili paste--that will make the noodles more edible and definitely more flavorful.

The place is filthy by the way--the entire experience from the elevator ride up to the lobby area, to the tables, to the utensils and plates.  I'm fine with dirty at a cheap and tasty asian restaurant--but at this price point, that's just unacceptable.  They used to have water features throughout, which have since been turned off (permanently?), and only add to the old/dingy vibe with hard water stains and even visible ceiling leak stains in the lobby.  Others have mentioned that the carpet is gross/smelly--which is also true.

Service was solid by the waiters and busboys.  Managers, however, were loudly telling others what to do and moved tables in and out 3 times while we were there, to weirdly try to accommodate parties.  Odd for a place that has a "dressy" attire.

As for attire....not sure why some Yelpers stated that a collar is required--the dress code is casual, with jeans, sweaters, and tennis shoes all around.

It's easy to get a reservation even calling at 7pm on a Saturday night.  It's no wonder why.
author: Vanessa O.

description: We came with a large group. The sea bass was average. However, the crab was excellent. Be sure to get the garlic noodles and mix with the crab, unreal. The appetizers were all pretty average, but the crispy chicken role was the best. The wine options were not great, but they have a full bar. The staff was helpful, but moved pretty slow.
author: Ryan M.

description: EASILY the best pho I have ever had. The broth was absolutely incredible! I also loved the garlic noodles.
author: Makenzi B.

description:
If you like creamy coconut flavor drinks get the "Crustacean "- made with Coconut ciroc. The mussels are to die for. It is best to make reservations.  Also,  please valet. By far a time saver
 If you have reservations and don't valet (fair priced, dont worry) you could easily spend 15-30 mins looking for parking and may lose your reservations  depending on how late you're running and how busy they are. I would definitely recommend this place
author: Tara L.

description: Overall pretty good food. The garlic noodles was fantastic. The crab was pretty decent. Being from MD the saying is "crab and football. It's what we do".  I think my grab tastes have spoiled and I definitely prefer Chesapeake bay blue crabs.
author: Alex H.

description:
I'm always down for great food but I really don't see what they hype is about. I hear celebrities eat here all the time. I tried the food. It's just okay. The famous garlic noodles. Had them before somewhere else. The overpriced seafood? Had it before somewhere else. I'd only come back if a group of friends chose this restaurant. I would not be the first to say, let's go to Crustacean.

During this dinner date, we actually had a poor experience. The server / manager did apologize and remove the dish off the check but it left a bad taste in our mouth - literally. I ordered the lobster and my date ordered the dungeness crab. 5 minutes later the waiter came back to me and said they just sold out of lobster. Boo. So I changed mine up to the shrimp. Food came out REALLY fast. I mean in like 5-10 minutes. That was crazy. As I'm enjoying the jumbo shrimp with the garlic noodles, my date was questioning his. He asked me try it as he said it tastes like he's eating ammonia. I took a bite and it smelled like my nail polish remover. I know I did not just do my nails. I then took another bite and didn't taste it. I told him if he's iffy about it - to just tell them. He looked around and felt bad. Saying everyone is eating this dish and that it's going to make him look crazy. So he's just not going to eat it. Well I ended up getting the waiter's attention and we secretly asked him in whispers as to not disturb other guests. He said it happens to crabs. One out of 1000 will change and taste like that. And he can take it off the check. Weird reasoning but we said okay. Then we asked if anyone else has complained tonight. He said no. He then came back and said actually I spoke to the manager and 3 other people have complained tonight. Aha so we aren't crazy. It still was a bad rep to have. Don't think we'd be coming back. For my 4 pieces of shrimp & noodles, and 3 cocktails the bill was $90+. Pretty pricey for decent food.
author: Emily T.

description:
We went here for Valentines Day for the first time and it was amazing! I will say they have the best Calamari that I've ever had before! The Salmon was really tender and flavorful so I was really excited about that. The best part of visit was the banana al la mode!!! That was the best desert EVER!

I was a little disappointed with how close the seats were. It was also really hard to get a servers attention after we had placed our order.
author: Shauncy J.

description:
I came here with work.  The 6 of us ordered - 1 crab per person plus garlic noodles for the table to share.

Oh. My. Gosh.  So delicious.  I would say it's similar to PPQ (in Outer Richmond) but fancier.  I am definitely a fan but would probably only come back for a nice occasion.  PPQ is just fine for me!
author: Joyce C.

description:
Very surprised at how LARGE this dining establishment was. When description said "casual" I think it was a bit more classier than what i'd expect when described as Vietnamese seafood restaurant. It's located on the 2nd floor and very accommodating for large parties.

So it goes, seafood is expensive but the food and service was nothing short of amazing. We started with the fried calamari (which is so boring) but pleasantly tasty along with sautéed onion and green onions. The green lip mussels were small portion but 6 SUPER decadent pesto garlic flavored it surprised me. Finally we ordered 2 whole boiled crab for 2 people which was a crap ton! Super good buttery sauce served on bottom of dish for dipping. ** Everyone reviews the garlic noodles and so we had to order. It came with the crab and it's good for a filler but it was honestly top ramen garlic flavor noodles that look plain -- at best. 

Total with extra tip $240 for couple appetizers, 2 crabs, their popular garlic noodles, and 4 vodka cocktails. Nice date eh.
author: Grennan K.

description: We had a disappointing experience tonight. This was a restaurant that we had not been to in over 10 years but because our 14 year old son loves crab and it was his birthday we decided to treat the family. Food presentation did not meet the price point, service was a B, they didn't have the wine we ordered off the menu and the building was sorely in need of repair. It was sad to see what I would have characterized as a 5 star place 10 years ago to an average spot with a very high priced menu. We won't be back. Too many nicer menus and venues in the Bay Area for this price point.
author: Frances R.

description:
Perhaps I'm just spoiled by the crabs that I steam at home, but I really think that Crustacean overcooks their crabs. We had the Roast Crab, Tamarind Crab, and Drunken Crab, and all of them were OK, but overcooked. Unfortunately, the drunken crab tasted a bit fishy, which can imply that the crab wasn't all that fresh. (Because crabs go bad pretty much immediately, it's important to cook them live)

Of the three crabs, the Roast Crab was the tastiest, and it's their signature dish. The roast crab is super buttery, so you might want to try the other crabs if you're not into tons of butter. The Drunken Crab was steamed in some sort of wine sauce, but it tasted slightly off, perhaps it wasn't too lively when it was steamed. The Tamarind Crab was prepared in some sort of sweet and sour sauce.

We also ordered a side of garlic noodles, which were very tasty and kind of buttery, and sauteed snap peas. If you like crab butter (aka the yellow guts), you can try mopping the body shell clean with the noodles. Yum!

My dinner companions were also crab enthusiasts, and they seemed to like the crabs, except that they also noted that one of the crabs was fishy. I like my crab barely cooked, while Crustacean cooks them too well done for my tastes.

The crabs were pretty good size -- a bit over 2 1/2 lbs. I'm not sure where they get such large crabs this time of year, but at least they were big. 

In my opinion, the black bean crab and the ginger crab at Yuet Lee is the best crab in the city, besides the crabs I steam at home.
author: Allen T.

description:
As many apparently do, I ordered the roast crab. It was succulent and perfect and there was a LOT of it. I fed my wife and our friend large amounts and still had tons for myself. There was not a piece of shell or meat left on my plate when I was done.

We also got the green lipped mussels (cooked perfectly; not at all rubbery), the lobster salad (excellent balance of flavors; very savory), and the ahi tuna (unfortunately, not as tasty as one would hope; served cold and the flavors didn't come through).

Aside from the ahi tuna, the food was excellent. The thing that sealed the deal, however, was our waiter Philip. He was exceedingly professional, friendly, good sense of humor, offered excellent wine suggestions, and just a good guy.

I don't expect to be back, because we're moving out of state in six weeks, but we had a great dining experience and happy to recommend to others. And if I do go back, I'm gonna sit in Philip's section.
author: Mike A.

description: I told my BFF I've gotta take you to the best crab & garlic noodles spot! She said who orders noodles at a fancy crab restaurant? Now when she visits the bay, it's automatic request for Crustacean's!
author: Kimm B.

description:
Unfortunately I cannot give Crustacean a good review. We ordered the lobster salad and the salt and pepper calamari for appetizers as recommended by our waiter. Though the salad was overpriced we enjoyed it but ate very little to save room for our entree. I told the waiter this much and to "bring the entree and we would take the leftover appetizers with us. At the end we were told they tossed our food and our only recourse was to take one of our appetizer selections off the bill. 

This kind off ruined my Father's Day dinner. Wonder if this happens frequently here?
author: Jesse S.

description: Roadt crab & garlic noodles. That's all you need to know. 10 star meals all year long. Whoever rates lower than 5 stars should be evaluated. !!
author: D W.

description: Thank you for another great and tasty dinner in Crustacean Restaurant.
author: Gregory F.

description:
Mmmmmm, the crab, the lobster, those garlic noodles!  I had never been to Crustacean's, but I'm going back soon.
Our waiter was really helpful with his suggestions, and the staff was very attentive.
This was a great way to celebrate Mother's Day!
author: Bev H.

description: Wow! We were recommended this place and I must say that it was the best crab I've had. Must order the roasted crab and garlic noodles. Enjoyed it so much. On top of the food being great our server Paul was just awesome. Love this place!!!!
author: Majda R.

description:
This is the best place to get crab ever. Period. I've been coming since I was 15 and I'm 27 now. The fact that this restaurant maintained it's high quality for so long is absolutely amazing.

The Oven Roasted Crab is wonderful
author: Mikey M.

description: This was an incredibly fun experience that really impressed my girlfriend. From riding the elevator with the giant neon crab on it to sitting in the expansive dining room with exposed brick walls, the ambiance was festive. We were treated like royalty by our waiter Paul. They had 3 of my favorite Sauvignon Blancs on the menu, one of which went incredibly well with our meal. Of course you must order the garlic noodles and the Roast Crab.
