We added snap peas to the meal for a little green, and they were sauteed to perfection. The Baked Alaska dessert was a decadent party of textures and temperatures that tickled the senses. Have fun!
author: Ian V.

description:
I was at The crustacean Restaurant Yesterday Sun Nov 27th 2016 for my Birthday The crabs were outrageous  $54.00 each at 2 lbs a piece when you can but them 5.99 a lbs but we wanted the flavor so we knew what we were in for untill we got the bill which they added a 4%tax which we asked what is that for no one seemed to know the answer the Host/Manager who was extremely rude Johan Van Rooyen should'nt be working with the public he was insulting because we asked about the tax. never go back there Thanh Long is better,The crabs were small and not meaty. I forgot to mention I have been going to both locations for over 20 years.and the crab this time was oily and had little flavor like it use to local crabs are not as good as up north at this time.

C De Losa
author: Cindy D.

description:
Best lobster to date. I had it on a bed of angel hair with a delicious creamy red sauce. The crab puffs and shrimp wontons were bomb! Crustaceans didn't fail my expectations at all. The drunkin Dungeness crab was Cooked perfectly . Sweet full of meat and tasty with some type of oily garlic sauce that went great together. 
I'd give this place 5 stars but the bar experience was lack luster. The bar tender wasn't friendly and his drinks tastes like soap. We had the side car , and some vodka based drink with prosecco. 
The valet parking here is a must, otherwise there no parking whatsoever .
author: Jaleel H.

description: I am giving a three stars, I have been coming here for a while and last night had to be the worse service ever by our waiter. He never came and asked us if we needed anything we waited a long time for our food which never happens. We had to ask twice for a refill on drinks. It was just horrible. The food though was still amazing I am not sure if this was a new waiter but I hope next time we do not experience this again.
author: Anna F.

description: It was a wonderful experience yet again.  My Japanese guests were impressed.  It caters to Japanese clients by giving the menu in Japanese as well.  Wine selection is apt for the food they serve.  Standard selection by every visitor is the highlight of the restaurant.  You will never go wrong in selecting this restaurant.
author: Satya D.

description: The garlic roasted crab was sensational.  It's worth the extra 5 dollars to have them crack it for you as it's very messy and I frown on licking my fingers in public . Combined with the garlic noodles it's a definite must try experience.   Service was solid
author: Jim D.

description: Came by here to try out the sister restaurant (thanh long). This place has a similar menu compared to thanh long but has a more variety of options. We ordered the salmon carpaccio , roasted crab, and the lobster w/ angel hair pasta. The salmon carpaccio came out and id like to say that is the best appetizer I have ever had... It tasted like heaven, the famous roasted crab was great as usual tasted exactly like thanh long , but the lobster w/ angel hair pasta was bomb! I like how the lobster was peeled from its shell already and the presentation was nice. The service was amazing I would definetly recommend people to try out this place if they're craving seafood.
author: Johnny L.

description:
I come here for one reason and one reason only... the ROASTED CRAB. The garlic noodles are okay, but are a nice complement to the crab.

We made reservations but it didn't seem necessary. The restaurant was barely filled with guests. It's very dimly lit and the tables are way too cramped together, making seating very uncomfortable. We took the elevator up and there was a trash cart in there. The odor was very unpleasant to say the least. What a way to start our dinner...
author: Mindy D.

description: I loveeee the garlic noodles here...soo good and i always get the crab which is really good too...cant really tell you too much about the other menu items here those are my go too's and must haves when i come here!
author: Melissa C.

description: You have to get the BASIC STUFF: BLACK PEPPER  ROASTED CRAB, GARLIC NOODLE, VIETNAMESE SALAD........the first two are a must!!!!! Don't be bothered with other stuff, although the Shanking beef also good, Crab fried dumpling good, occasional chicken meatballs good, sea bass good.
author: Clemencia S.

description:
Crustacean does not disappoint! 
The food is beyond amazing! 
The crab it very well flavored, cooked perfect and the presentation is nice. My favorite is the crab with a side of garlic noodles! Yummmm!!! 
This place is a must try if you're in sf area. We don't come to often, but at least twice a year. 
They have valet right on California street, very convenient and cheap! Only $12!
The food is pretty pricey but it's well worth it. Come with an appetite! 

They do not have a great dessert selection and the couple I've tried have been less then mediocre... I would say pass on that!
author: Holly R.

description: Terrible service and over priced. Ordered the Royal Tiger Prawns over An's garlic noodles and Shaken Beef. Royal Tiger Prawns "quoted price" $38.95. $10.95 for garlic noodle and $28.00 for four tiger prawns. Famous Garlic noodles over cooked and no garlic flavor. End of the night maybe ran out of garlic. Tiger Prawns were burnt. Not worth the price of admission. My bad for not asking the quoted price. Shaken Beef was $25.95. Better than the prawn dish. Waiter Jim 871 was rude and unfriendly. Made a complaint to management. Not sure where it went from there. Crustacean was once a great place to dine. We won't be back anytime soon.
author: Lester W.

description:
Garlic noodles could be addictive. Melt in your mouth comfort food.
Location is a bit strange in a small upright mall(?)
But, the food is incredible. Very good staff.
author: Robert F.

description: I had the roast crab and garlic noodles. This was amazing but I couldn't finish it all! Large portions! I had the Crustacean cocktail which was delicious & refreshing but be careful it sneaks up on ya! I'll definitely be back here.
author: Alexandria W.

description: Very good- quite pricy but we knew that going in. Our server Roy had great recommendations
author: Sarah L.

description:
If the quality of the food matched the price, Crustaceans would be outstanding.  However, it is not.

Arrived at the restaurant and immediately noticed an unpleasant fishy smell.  The food was less than average.  Ordered the roast crab with garlic noodles as the reviews all suggested.  The waiter even suggested this meal!  The crab arrived and was okay, nothing special.  The noodles were gummy and flavorless.  The others at the table ordered the tiger prawns and roasted halibut.  The roasted halibut looked beautiful and the diner said she enjoyed it.  The prawns were pounded so thin.  The diners who ordered this entree said they were flavorless, and their garlic noodles were sticky and lacking in garlic flavor.

The two stars are for our wonderful Waite, even though he steered me toward the roast crab. There are MANY other restaurants in San Francisco worthy of your hard earned money.  Don't waste your time here.  Just not worth it.
author: Katie R.

description: I'm not a shell fish person so I can't help you out there. I do love the sea bass here. It's super light and flakey with a ginger flavor. A bit pricey, but I leave feeling pretty "healthy" about my over all decisions, except for the beers I usually have with it. Joe is my favorite bartender.
author: Kaila L.

description:
Horrible food and demoralizing service. We arrived at 7:41pm for 8pm reservations. We were finally seated @ 8:22pm. Our party of 9 were seated in the bar areas, outside the kitchen (what was the point of reservations for a group event?). The food was tasteless. The few times our server, James, made it to the table he would insult us. He began asking if anyone wanted appetizers. Everyone said no with exception of 1 member of our party.  James took it upon himself to tell our table...'appetizers are orders for the whole table'. WTH!!!! His insults continued when a member of my party stated she wanted to order later.  James told her if she didn't order now that he had other tables and that he wouldn't be taking her order until he completed orders from the other tables. AND that would be whenever.  During the order taking process, James says, "really...this is how this evening is going to be."...just one of his many unprovoked comments.  A guest in our party asked for her mojito to be well muddled.  When he finally brought the drink to the table, James sarcastically says "here Ms. Muddle." The glorified garlic noodles are spaghetti noodles which are textured and flavored like ramen noodles.  I'm pretty sure the food was prepared and cooked in a dish washer.  Other than the cliched name...THERE IS NO REASON TO EAT HERE!!!  

Paying the bill was a fiasco. The bill came, but take go orders were not delivered. James says the 3 items were comped because we did not receive them. When it was pointed out the items were on the bill. James (virtually instantaneously) stood on the inside of the kitchen door and then placed the orders on our table.  How long was that food cooked? Why was it still in the kitchen?  The bill was paid in cash.  James took the cash and bill to the bar to count. He counted at least twice, then had 4 other servers count the money.  Unbelievable, so the money is laying across the bar; James brings money to our table saying we overpaid (mind you he left the cash laying across the bar). He returns to the bar and recounts 2 more times. He talks to another server then comes to our table and says the money is ten dollars short. We hand him the $10.  He counts. At this point, the whole evening is intolerable. Management is contacted.  Two members from our party updated the management on the disaster of the night. During that time, James, comes to table again saying the bill is $8 short.  

The management had absolutely no concern. We asked for information to get in contact with the owners.  Of course, the information a miscarriage convoluted information.  

The common complaint of yelpers regarding this restaurant is the poor service...absolutely and the food sucks!!! I reviewed this restaurant before my visit, but thought the negative feedbacks might could be unjust. HELL!! I was wrong. 

Crustacean can take lessons from the P.F. Changs restaurant chain on providing customers...good times, excellent food, and awesome service. 

Only highlights were the valet service and staff busing tables were considerate and properly timed.  

No one should lose their job for a bad day at work, but this is the exception. James was unprofessional. Obviously, his standard of service is acceptable for Crustacean's because the service complaints are bountiful.
author: Yava B.

description: Been wanting to try Crustacean for years since I saw a show featuring this place.  There were 4 of us, all haven't been to Crustaceans before. Ordered two roasted crab at $60 a piece, they charged an extra $5 for cracking the shell for you, which I thought was weird. We also ordered the sea bass and garlic noodles. The food tasted great.  The place was very small and felt tight.  The group seated next to us kept bumping our chairs that they eventually requested to move tables. The service was sub par. Our server had minimal pleasantries, almost to the point that it offended my guests.   We got better service and smile from the guy who bussed our table. I would have given a 3.5 stars but Yelp didn't provider .5 star options. So 4 stars, it is.  The round up was mainly for the food, the busser and the fact that we were seated right away, even though we arrived 15 minutes early from our reservation time.  Disappointed with the service.  Too bad.
author: Milena A.

description: I really don't get how this place does not have 5 stars! The food was phenomenal. The moment I stepped to the entrance from the stairs and the Whiff of delicious crap hit me hard. Oh man was I in for a real treat. It's the best crab I have EVER had. A big whole crab cooked in garlicky butter with salt and pepper. Very simple and fresh and oh soooo mouth watering. I kept dipping the crab in the sauce in the bottom of the plate and drizzling it over the garlic pasta. Oh and that garlicky pasta was amazing! This place is definitely on my favorite list. Will be definitely back again and again and again. After we were done, the waiter gave us hot towels to wipe our hands with, Nice touch!! It was a messy meal so that's definitely a great idea. Messy but so worth it.
author: Sherihan E.

description:
We haven't been to Crustacean for at least 3 years since we usually go to Thanh Long, but they didn't have availability for reservations for our party of 5 so I tried Crustacean and they were available! The hostess was very helpful on the phone when I had to change my reservation from 4 to 5. Valet parking is convenient if you can't find street parked, such as in our case. We ordered our usual roast crab, tiger prawns, and garlic noodles, which were all delicious as expected. Our server Danny was awesome - attentive and friendly - and we even tried other menu items that he suggested. The salt and pepper calamari and the shaken beef were delicious!

So what I really appreciated about Crustacean was the pace of our meal and when the food was brought out. Normally eating at Thanh Long, we have become accustomed to their very fast pace, almost "get you in and out" feeling, yet still satisfying that craving for the roast crab and garlic noodles. Crustacean was definitely slower paced and not rushed - perfect for catching up over dinner with our cousins from out of town. It was their first time at an An Family restaurant and they were excited to try the famous crab and noodles that they heard about from friends. We all really enjoyed dinner and it was a great start to our night in the City.
author: Francis R.

description: Overpriced for what it is. The calamari appetizer was average. The roasted crab was meaty but lacked flavor- just a lot of oil & pepper. The tiger prawns were dry. And the garlic noodles were over cooked and tasted too sweet..
author: Joyce W.

description:
From what I've heard from friends and family, I expected this place to blow me away with excellent tasting food and great service, however I experienced the complete opposite.

First off when you call to make reservations, they tell you that they offer valet parking for $12. That seemed reasonable and I had no issues with paying that. We arrive and the valet attendants just stand there like statues. They did not open the door for us or even greet us. I had to approach them in order for them to actually move. Once they got into the car all they did was park it across the street so I highly suggest you save yourself some money and park across the street for free.

Service: The only friendly person in the restaurant was the host. He was very polite and respectful asking if my grandpa was able to climb up a few steps to the table and if not he would find us a table where he wouldn't have to climb any stairs. Our waitress and other staff were extremely rude and unfriendly. 

Food:
     Roasted crab- 1 star. I've heard that this is their specialty so I've been wanting to try it out. I thought it lacked a lot of flavor. The sauce for the crab was very light and it seemed like they didn't put much seasoning on it at all. For being something that they are known for, I was very disappointed. 

     Garlic noodles: 3 stars. Something that actually had flavor. A mouthful of rich garlic noodles in every bite was delicious. I love garlic so I enjoyed this dish. 

 According to my mom and sister, the ladies restroom was very messy with trash all over the floor and the stalls had toilet paper all over it. For this restaurant supposedly being a nice restaurant, I was very disappointed with everything from the food to the service provided. 

Never coming back to this restaurant again!
author: Ryan W.

description:
I've been going to this restaurant for over 30 years.  First I'll start by saying the cosmetic upgrades are great!!  The place looks fresh, modern, updated and cleaner. It was long overdo for a makeover and while they are not done it's an uplift to the dining experience!
Now - lets get to the food. 

The garlic crab and garlic noodles never disappoint. Why go there for anything else???? This time was even better. I noticed more fresh cracked pepper which uplifted the already beyond delicious crab to a new level. 

Dessert was the creme brûlée - excellent- an because it was a birthday the fried banana and ice cream was delivered free and with a candle.  It's our favorite dessert there. 
When you can go to a restaurant for decades and it doesn't ever disappoint you have to give it a 5. 
I brought half a crab and a full order of garlic noodles home. Can't wait!!!
author: Pamela S.

description: It was good but I was not impressed. We tried the crab, salad, noodle and beef. I was very excited about going there because of the hype. I will try again.
author: Jeeyoung K.

description: Have many great memories of this place but not overly impressed tonight. My crab wasn't something memorable (as in the past). Don't really think it was worth the price. Had the snap peas as a side dish. While they were good-they also were too soaked in butter that I lost their true flavor.
author: Chris c.

description: One of my all time favorite in SF.   Garlic roasted crab with garlic noodles is to die for!
author: Gino C.

description:
If zero stars were available I would have selected that! Let me start off by saying this used to be me & my wife's favorite place. We used to fly to San Francisco just to eat here....that's how great this place used to be...8 years ago    that was. And this was our 1st visit since 8 years ago and it has really gone down hill....way down hill...like falling off the cliff bad. The stench of fish when we entered the restaurant was the first sign and then to see flies in the lobby was the second. Here's a bit of important info: If crabs smell like ammonia when you're eating them...they're bad....Our crabs smelled like ammonia but we weren't sure why at the time..( I think we were in denial). I Googled it after I got home and found out that I ate bad crabs. I surprised I didn't get sick. 

The decor and lack of cleanliness of this place is despicable. It should get one star just based on that.  The service left a lot to be desired. I waitress really tried but she was just overwhelmed and was struggling to keep up with her tables. Needless to say, we will never go  back there nor would we recommend it to any of our enemies either. FYI - The place has been in business since 1978 and I think it's time to close shop and re-focus on their other restaurants.
author: Christopher Patrick H.

description:
I am extremely disappointed in this restaurant. This restaurant used to be a special place for my boyfriend and I because we have been coming here since one of our first dates 5 years ago. We used to bring all our friends here every time we visited the city. The food is amazing, but this review is one star because just last night we came here before my boyfriend's daughter left on a plane the next day and I left my wallet at the restaurant. My boyfriend had asked me if I had any extra dollars in my wallet to give our server a better tip because we had such great service and great food, so I grabbed my wallet out of my purse and got some money out for him. We went straight to our hotel from there, and when we got to the hotel my wallet was gone. I had realized I left it on the table, called back the restaurant twice and they said they never saw it. This means somebody from that restaurant STOLE my wallet and I really want it back. Even if whoever from this restaurant took every cent out of my wallet I just really want the actual wallet back because it is really special to me. I would love to be contacted from anyone that works here with information as to who took it. If that person gets a guilty conscious please send it to me on my address listed on my license that you now have! Again I am extremely disappointed because I used to think so highly of this place and always told people to try their amazing crab. Sadly I will no longer recommend anyone to go where thieves work. 

I will take this review down immediately if my wallet is returned.
author: Emily T.

description: Excellent food. Good ambiance. Good customer service. Amazing time.
author: Miguel M.

description:
Date: March 10, 2014
Ambience: sweet dim light, 6th floors high, nice city view 
Attire: causal/ dressy
Must haves: mussels, ginger lobster garlic noodles
Company: My boyfriend 
Occasion: birthday 
Food Style: Vietnamese/French fine dining 
This is the place to satisfied your seafood cravings! Great service, quick staff to accommodate your needs.
author: Chelsea T.

description: You have to try the famous garlic noodle with black pepper and butter crab! A match made in heaven! It is so delicious!! The restaurant is a little small but it's SF so yeah. The service is good and the end of the night, you received a nice warm cloth to wipe your hands from the crab! I love it!
author: Maggie V.

description: Celebrated my birthday dinner here, the food and the service was fantastic. We had garlic roasted crab with garlic noodles.  The food was amazing but you do have to be willing to get your hands dirty:-) We had a party of 8 and we were very well taken care of.  Highly recommend for a great dining experience.
author: Linda V.

description:
The garlic noodles tasted similar to that of something you'd find at a Cajun Restaurant.  It honestly wasn't anything to write home about.

The Tiger Prawns ordered were overcooked and had a rubbery texture.

The roasted crab tasted bland with little seasoning.  I tried to drench the crab in its butter sauce with seasoning, but to little avail.  Just felt way to difficult.  The food here was just not up to par.

All in all, I think people are better off going to a different place.
author: Aaron C.

description: OMG!   The Roasted Crab is to die for!  Butter drippin everywhere, nice and flavorful! Garlic noodles!!!!  Lobster Salad!!!!  Crab puffs!!! Wine flowing!!!  Actually got nice and full.   Yes, definitely a place to try out! We'll be back!
author: Larry M.

description:
Crustacean, similar to it's sister restaurant (and original) Thanh Long, has exactly 2 good dishes - the roasted crab, and the garlic noodles. 
both are very tasty. but if you look beyond that on the menu, it's relatively lackluster. but really, when you do 2 dishes so well, do you even need the rest of the menu? they should just dispense with the menus, and when you sit down they automatically bring you crab and noodles.
author: Xander C.

description:
I first went to Crustacean 4 years or so ago when I was an undergrad at a Bay Area university, and because I remembered the crab as being so good, I made sure to come back here on my recent visit. 

Yes, the Roast Crab was as good as I remembered - it was wonderful. It had great flavor and it was cooked just right. Yes, you have to crack the crab to get the meat out, but that is part of the fun. Of course, In addition we got the Garlic Noodles, and they also live up to the extreme hype. Our waiter was great and knowledgeable about not only the menu items but also about the other locations of restaurants that are related. Also important to the experience, we weren't rushed out by the waiter and he always made sure our drinks were full and the bowl for the crab shells was never full. He came by a lot. The dining experience in the restaurant is 5-Star. The restaurant is very clean and has an upscale atmosphere. 

The reason I am taking off a star is because of the location and the neighborhood around it. It is kind of far from Bart which makes it harder for people like me who were college students to get there - Really you need to take a cab or Uber if coming from Bart - the cab ride was about $11 each way. The walk is long quite long and up and down big hills. The other reason is because of the buildings around it. They don't have much eye appeal. Crustacean is like a super nice upscale restaurant and it seemed a little out of place given the surroundings. Yes, I know it has been in this location for a long long time, so I can't knock it much for that. 

So this is a 4-Star review - But how does it compare to my other reviews? Well I gave Flemings and Roys of Newport Beach 5-Stars, because everything about my most recent meals there were absolutely perfect. This was not quite that, but it was a great meal still. This 4-Star is a higher 4-Star than the others I have given, if I had the option it would have been a 4.5-Star review. 

Bottom line: Of course I would be excited to go back any time I am in San Francisco or even the East Bay (if ever) and I want a special meal. The dining experience is worth the slight travel inconvenience in getting there. 

I can't wait to try the one in Beverly Hills!
author: Ryan M.

description:
After hearing about Crustacean for so many years, I finally got the opportunity to go for a work dinner. That ended up being a good thing, since the food here is on the pricey side. I was able to make reservations easily over the phone, but I did call almost two weeks in advance for a dinner on a weekday night. Our table was ready when we arrived, but we were a little squished in a booth for 7 people, and that was with 3 extra chairs. We ended up ordering a bunch of dishes to share:

-New Zealand Green Lip Mussels (Broiled w/Asian Pesto & Served w/Garlic Crostini, $12, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/crustacean-restaurant-san-francisco?select=UYtLkprdp9MYI0pDfhDT_A#UYtLkprdp9MYI0pDfhDT_A): Pretty good, but not amazing. I liked the flavor of the Asian pesto, but the garlic crostini were overbaked and too crunchy for my liking.
-Crab Puffs (Dungeness Crab Meat Wrapped in Wonton Shell, w/Peanut Mustard, Greens, $10, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/crustacean-restaurant-san-francisco?select=UYtLkprdp9MYI0pDfhDT_A#JZtSK84vaRuWQwtMb1SRXA): Good, but there was too much wonton shell. Skip.
-Sashimi (Thinly Sliced Salmon w/a Daikon Radish, Citrus Soy Ponzu Dressing, $16, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/crustacean-restaurant-san-francisco?select=UYtLkprdp9MYI0pDfhDT_A#k5wbcONnW9uGshWbd8ejvg): Yum! The sashimi was really fresh, and I liked the ponzu dressing. It was pricey for the portion size, but worth it if you're expensing the dinner.
-Shaken Beef (Filet Mignon Cubed, Flambéed in Burgundy Wine, Served w/Red Potatoes & Roma Tomatoes, $30, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/crustacean-restaurant-san-francisco?select=UYtLkprdp9MYI0pDfhDT_A#0LrAzTcD_PaiF2HQl59gwg): Ok, but again expensive for the portion size. I wouldn't order this again.
-Rice Ho-Fun Ravioli (Pacific Prawns, Braised Fennel, Caramelized Shallots, Soy-Sesame Emulsion, $21, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/crustacean-restaurant-san-francisco?select=UYtLkprdp9MYI0pDfhDT_A#7zlFTJ9NyBCUEt1iqwm_CQ): Yum! The raviolis were really good, and you'll like this if you like creamy sauces. Recommended!
-Braised Short Ribs (w/Port Wine Glaze, Roasted Portobello Mushroom, Wasabi Rice Cake, $28, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/crustacean-restaurant-san-francisco?select=UYtLkprdp9MYI0pDfhDT_A#EdB7LWb_DS9jCRt-6ilxSw): Good, but nothing special. I wished that the short rib was still on the bone, instead of this boneless kind which I don't think is as flavorful. Skip!
-Herb Roasted Halibut (Sautéed Sweet Onions, Asparagus, Portobello Mushrooms, $39, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/crustacean-restaurant-san-francisco?select=UYtLkprdp9MYI0pDfhDT_A#bHKg3qmo8brm4rXsEn1l-g): Eh, so-so. The fish was a little overcooked, and I wouldn't get this again.
-Charbroiled Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns (Served w/An's Famous Garlic Noodles, $42, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/crustacean-restaurant-san-francisco?select=UYtLkprdp9MYI0pDfhDT_A#F1q_xSdEGrb9BVaf3K0J5Q): Just ok. The prawns were a little overcooked so it was difficult to peel off the shells. They only give you 4 prawns, so I wouldn't get this again.
-An's Famous Roasted Crab (w/An's Garlic Sauce & Secret Spices), Tamarind Crab, Drunken Crab ($50/each, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/crustacean-restaurant-san-francisco?select=UYtLkprdp9MYI0pDfhDT_A#4e9nAVNS_m0RHhEwD5HAZg): Our favorite version was the famous roasted crab, but it came sitting in a pool of melted butter which solidfies towards the end of your meal, so make sure you eat this quickly! The drunken version and tamarind were good/ok, but not as good as the roasted in my opinion.
-An's Famous Garlic Noodles ($12, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/crustacean-restaurant-san-francisco?select=UYtLkprdp9MYI0pDfhDT_A#79W6s7DQ9SlIxlzISP2gGQ): Good, although it wasn't as garlicky as I was expecting. However, this is still a must order.
-Peanut Butter Chocolate Mousse Cake? (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/crustacean-restaurant-san-francisco?select=UYtLkprdp9MYI0pDfhDT_A#rdCNn_KdK4h-GCWQS0LXCQ): I can't remember the exact name of this dessert, but it was good.
-Some Sort of Cake w/Ice Cream (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/crustacean-restaurant-san-francisco?select=UYtLkprdp9MYI0pDfhDT_A#9uWdEO6sFO4Mc1xbs50K3w): I can't really remember this dessert but I think it was pretty good.
-Baked Alaska w/Bananas Foster (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/crustacean-restaurant-san-francisco?select=UYtLkprdp9MYI0pDfhDT_A#Z96HAHYB61CZ3rRzMvLXng): This was interesting since the baked alaska is essentially like an ice cream cake. It was good but not amazing.

I'm still glad I finally got the opportunity to try Crustacean, but am not sure I'll be back due to the high prices and just ok food. Although I enjoyed a good amount of the dishes, there wasn't anything that I would go out of the way to eat again. Service here was also VERY slow, so be prepared for a long wait for your food, and having a long meal overall (our meal took 2.5-3 hours). Parking is also tough to find in this area.
author: Amy D.

description: Awesome food, awesome atmosphere, awesome customer service. No complaints whatsoever!
author: Thomika K.

description: We were in San Francisco for vacation, and someone recommended eating at Crustacean.  It was delicious but pricey.  Our food server was very engaging and had good suggestions for us.  Fortunately for us it was within walking distance of our hotel.  The traffic in that city is CRAZY!
author: Julie D.

description: I have been to this place once before and to other seafood places, but I can't remember having had crab as good as this one. Garlic noodles and green papaya salad complement each other and complete the whole meal. Add to that a glass of spicy margarita for starters and dry Riesling wine with your mesl and you're in heaven.
author: Elpi M.

description: Came here based on a rec from friends, and was very surprised not knowing anything about the restaurant. First off, you're immediately transported back into the late 60s (with a touch of modern flair) with the classic decor and polished waitstaff. I love the layout of the place with the split level style allowing for a ton of tables! We knew exactly what we wanted based on previous reviews...garlic noodles and whole crab! We split a garlic noodle and got the roast and drunken crab for 2. The noodles are out of this world!! It is so simple but bursting with flavor! The roast crab definitely had a better flavor profile compared to the drunken crab, which was more traditional with strong notes of pepper and celery. Overall, the crab meat was very juicy and it was steamed well, but it wasn't perfect. I did love hearing that the crabs were in the water that morning, and on my plate hours later! Definite 5 stars was the service. The waiters are impeccable with replacing the shell bowl and clearing napkins as you eat. You never feel messy! This is a place to go if you're wanting some warm, comforting food on a cold night. Everything about this place is inviting and welcoming!
author: Nazia H.

description: I have wanted to try the place forever. We ordered lobster rolls to start and it came with four. Why did I only get one? I am disappointed becuase they were so succulent and my dining companion is a nice guy but apparently  very very selfish! ! He justified it eating three becuase  he had to park....cant wait to try the crab!
author: Roslyn G.

description: I have been to Crustaceans a few times and I love the roasted crab. The first time I went with my friend for dinner... I received amazing service from my waiter Phillipe, and I was tickled pink to be able to speak French with him, will be going back...bon appetite!!!
author: Yelper 5.

description: Literally my favorite restaurant EVER. Doesn't get better than this. Impeccable service and quality. This is my go-to restaurant for birthdays and any kind of celebration. Thank you Crustacean keep up the good work!
author: Haley H.

description:
I'm not going to write a long drawn out review...we ALL know that if you want some great crab and garlic noodles that will knock the Yard House out of the water, then go visit Crustaceans.  I have yet to try their L.A. location but I hear they all use the same secret sauce.
Great Ambiance...I have had many date nights, and birthday's here...they never disappoint!
author: Demi A.

description: Birthday Dinner for my husband w/friend (friend-first time) and unfortunately, the place needs to be renovated. The restroom was dirty and smelled pee all over, the fact that they just opened at 5PM. We were there at 5:30PM. All the wine glasses were dirty so they had to replace it. The water glass had lipstick and the other water glass dirty. The roasted crab and garlic noodles (requested for less salt) were OK. The appetizers went downhill. The place looked so old and run down. Please do not use the torn up chairs. Throw them out. Manager did not even come to our table so we can address the issues. We have been going to this place for 20 years and more at Thanh Long Restaurant. I even tried the Beverly Hills Location. So disappointed! Please close down the place for renovation since this is fine dining (expensive). Would come back if place has been cleaned and renovated. Finally, my thoughts...No wonder the place was emplty. I remember years ago that it was hard to get a reservation and the restaurant was packed every time we were there. Has this restaurant been sold or has new owner?
author: Tita M.

description: The food is amazing staff is friendly everything was great from small plate threw dessert.
author: Emilia M.

description: Dinner was great. The roasted garlic crab and  garlic noodles were brok' da mouth delicious.  We also had some appetizers and their lava cake. Yummy!  The servers were very polite.
author: J G.

description:
My family and I went to celebrate Mother's Day and my daughter's 22nd birthday.  I have to say the food was delicious.  For starters we had the crab puffs, prawn wontons, salt and pepper calamari (every crumb from the calamari was devoured), and coconut prawns. For entrees' we had their signature garlic noodles and roasted crab, roasted tiger prawns and crab cakes.  I have to say that everything was seasoned and cooked perfectly.  We had reservations so there was no wait and we used the valet parking ($12) for the convenience - one of or party members found free parking right across the street.

I had not been to this restaurant in years so was unsure about my past experiences.  I am so glad that my daughter wanted to try it for herself.  We had a great time thanks to our EXCELLENT server DJ.  Thanks again DJ for making our experience exceptional!
author: Tisha D.

description: The food is fantastic. Had the crab (of course). I have only visited once but definitely on my list for my return to the area.  The staff is great, being optimal hosts even with a jam-packed restaurant.
author: Chris M.

description: The garlic noodles are very good and the food is decent. Service could be better though. We called the front desk and they told us that there was no wait Fri evening (surprising). But when we arrived they told us the wait was an hour. Then the host forgets to put our names down on the wait list...
author: Roger P.

description: Amazing experience!! Our waiter was superb. The food was great and the drinks were stiff. We had roasted crab and garlic noodles with tiger prawns and it was Devine. The appetizers were ... meh. Unless ur starving you can skip those. We tried the lobster rolls, shrimp toast and calamari (pretty good). The garlic noodles are to die for! Its pricey-our bill was over 300.00 for three people... but worth it!!
author: Thee J.

description: Been here so many times ., I don't see any difference from the waiters and the food , please tourists people if you're expecting fresh live crabs and shrimp go to the wharf!! I guarantee that you tourists will not complain about freshness on the crab etc .. Garlic noodle is good and the crab !!
author: Ray G.

description: I have been once in SF location and like the garlic noodles and crab. I have been in Beverly Hills 10-15 times and the decor and service is better.
author: Arpine M.

description:
Mehhh.

Service was bad, the lady attended to her other tables more than us. I mean I get we look young but we obviously had the money to come here, I mean if not, we would've ate somewhere else. 

The roast crab in my opinion was not that great, I thought it was too greasy and bland. 
The beef dish with the pesto rice was meh too, the beef was salty and the rice was okay.
Garlic noodles was yummy, I really liked it. 
Garlic bread was okay, nothing that special about it. 

Based on service and food being okay, I probably wouldn't come here again but I would definitely check out their food truck for their garlic noodles.
author: Kelly L.

description: The Roast Crab was the best I've ever had! Perfect combination of garlic and spices. The service was great and the ambiance was cozy. I highly recommend.
author: Kathy A.

description:
First off, the crab is off the hinges and will have you reaching for syringes if you wait too long in between visits!!!
No question, the crab and garlic noodles are to die for!!
But if you aren't done in 2hrs they will let you know! Granted, most of the time I'm outta there in less than 2, but if your hanging with the fam or a bunch of friends, it may take a little longer:(
I went there on New Years one year and they had a 2hr. Limit! WTF!! We had a $500. bill (5 people) and they were like hurry. Up!!
Lucky the crabs good or I would write them off.
author: Al T.

description: This will be my first and probably my last review.  Normally I would not bash a business but my conscience will not let me stand by and let tourists get duped into getting their most supposedly famous dish. We ordered a few of their small dishes that was mediocre. We were excited about their crab. The first one tasted like a crab that was dead about a week. We returned it and got a second one. It was a little better but we could not finish it. Sauce did not have much flavor. I have to say that it was the most disappointing thing so far on our San Francisco trip. Here's their line "people only come for the crab and maybe the tiger shrimp with noodles". Be warned! TOURIST TRAP
author: Hung N.

description: The ambient was good. The layout likes a maze! The food is Asian fusion. Overall is Fine. But I wonder if anyone experienced this: the next 2 nights, I had dreams of meeting my death relatives (died over 25+ years)! They were pleasant dreams, but it still weird! I woke up and could not go back to sleep! I had a glass of Merlot, and a Drunken crab, my friend who had a same experience had Tamarin crab and same Merlot. I wonder what did they prepare the food with which triggered my deep memory place!!! It is spooky.
author: Tom V.

description: If you are looking for Dungeness Crab, this is THE place. I had the roasted crab and it was juicy and delicious. Other items on the menu were so so, not great. But I would definitely come back for the crab.
author: H. H.

description:
The food here is pricey but good, though I like Than Long better. My dinner party shared the grilled calamari and they steamed seafood dumplings. Both were good as a starter. Can't go wrong with deep fried and steamed food.

My main was the Saigon beef while my partners the Shaken Beef.  From the two, I enjoyed his dish much better.   The sauce really made the dish come alive.  It was salty, a bit sweet, and hot. I found my dish to be lacking in flavor. The meat in the roulade was well done and didn't have any flavor. The caramelized onions were good though. 

Our party left stuffed, but we did save a small portion in our stomach for dessert from Bob's Donuts.
author: Marck N.

description: Used to love this restaurant.  Frequented the location in Beverly Hills and this one in SF also. Driving back from Sonoma today I got a notion to go here for dinner tonight - the garlic crab memory kicked in and It was just what I wanted.  Started calling at 3pm to see if I could get in for dinner.  Called more than 10 times over the next 3.5 hours - no answer.  Phone message says no one is available.  Very poor business practice.  Guess this place isn't what I remembered it to be.
author: Taylor S.

description: The many times that I've been here the food is ALWAYS amazing, but I'm rating this experience because the host was AWEFUL. We arrived a little beyond our 15 min grace period because of an accident ( I called to notify them) on the way. When we arrived the host attitude was terrible. It was Valentine's Day so I could understand some frustration if there was a huge crowd of some sort but there was NOT. No one in the waiting area and when we were seated there were at least 4 tables in our area that were vacant. When we sat down we heard the host say to make sure we were gone by 8:30 which I feel is horrible and unprofessional to hear as a customer. Throughout our dining experience Paul was EXCELLENT. Very attentive and didn't rush us at all. When it was nearing 8:30 the host began to come to our area often. Shortly after we received our bill the host approached Paul backed him into the corner and began giving him a hard time about us leaving. We had eaten pass 8:30 however there are multiple factors as to why we were still dining past that time most importantly the kitchen staff getting the food out quickly enough along with an entire restaurant to cater to. I thought it was totally uncalled for, disrespectful, and horrible customer service to over hear some things the host said to Paul and for an employee to talk to another in such a way . Paul handled the situation with poise and very respectfully. Everyone ask for Paul as your server and as for the host I will be calling to complain tomorrow.
author: Adrienne F.

description:
Food  = 4 stars
Service = (-) 2 stars

We had a party of 11, advance notice that we were celebrating 2 birthdays. It was acknowledged and was told they'll give us two free desserts.  Provided a credit card before I sat down to make sure the bill was charged to me.  No problem, I was told.

Dinner came out after drinks and appetizers, missing an order of roast crab and 3 orders of garlic noodles.  After waiting 10 minutes, we told the waiter.  Waited 15 more minutes for the noodles, still no crab (birthday girl's order).  We waited thinking it'll be coming. Another 10 minutes past, still no crab. Told waiter again.  He left, came back, started counting the crabs on the table (WTH!). Left, came back and acknowledged one missing crab.  HELLO!!!  This is over 30 minutes after everyone's got their entree.  We told the waiter forget it.  

We ate, waited for dessert.  Waiter came and we thought he was handing out the dessert menu.  It was the damn check!!!  And, he gave it to the wrong person!  At this point, we lost our appetite for dessert. 

For what they charge for the food, I expect a lot better service than what we got!  Not organized and definitely need more training!

This put a big damper on our anticipation for a happy celebration!
author: The Q.

description: The Roast Crab was the best crab I have ever eaten in my life!  The flavor of the crab is unbelievable.  We dipped the garlic noodles into the Roast Crab sauce over and over again so use it like a sponge.  It is so great there!
author: Dwayne Y.

description:
After several years of hearing so much about this spot, I finally got to try it out:

Seared Ahi - this was a nice a delicately flavored dish and a good way to start a big meal

Beef Skewers - a tasty appetizer that was recommended by several people - a good amount of savory, sour and sweet

Wok Egg Noodles with Chicken - this dish was good...rich flavor from the egg noodle and savory chicken 

Shaken Beef - a very tasty dish...tender and flavorful beef with well-cooked vegetables

Garlic Noodles - a very rich noodle with lots of garlic and slight sweetness, it goes well with anything on the menu

Chocolate Cake - this was a surprise...very moist and chocolatey 

Baked Alaska - a very good version of the popular dish...rich and tasty

Fried Banana - this was great...sweet and flavorful, this was a great way to end a meal
 
Lychee Martini - this was a great cocktail to have along with the dinner since it wasn't too sweet and had a mild and fresh flavor

Honestly, I thought the food was very good - everything tasted very good - great.  My real problem was the ambiance and décor...considering the price-point, I would have expected a better atmosphere.  This looks like the kind of place that looked great about 25 years ago, but it doesn't seem as if anything has been done since to keep it looking great.  This is a fairly upscale spot to visit and with its popularity, it's a bit of an occasion to go, so I would think that some money could go into maintenance to make it a bit more interesting...honestly, I've found some divey places in the Tenderloin to be just as comfortable as this place.

This a very popular place to visit in San Francisco and there are many people who will continue to dine here...I just feel like a younger/newer generation of people could discover this place if a bit more effort went into the aesthetics of this place.
author: Ken G.

description:
Oh how i missed your garlic noodles Crustacean..

thank goodness we had some to go and I was able to enjoy them throughout the weekend :)
author: Kathy D.

description: Nice place with great food and service. Had my dinner reservation done the same day and when we got there, everything was ready for us. Location is ok, and parking is a headache.  But it's worth the trouble since the food is great. They have a awesome selection on the menu and everything we order was great.  Only thing I wish they had, was my Pina Colada.
author: Aliya C.

description:
Their roast crab is some of the best that I have ever had. While the interior is a bit dated, their food is my favorite in SF (saying a lot given the options in the city). Their garlic noodles are without a doubt my favorite of any garlic noodles that I have tried. 

Honestly I never order off the regular menu, it is just Crab and Noodles every time we go, that is how amazing the food is. Prepare to get messy though, as you use your hands to crack and eat the crab!
author: Seiyonne S.

description:
Got crabs? Crustaceans does!

Located upstairs of a plaza. The plaza looked kinda sketchy without any businesses open.  The ambience inside was a bit dark so dont really know what the place looked like, but the food made up for it!

This place was recommended to us, so we didn't even look at the menu.  We went straight for the crabs.  We ordered the Roasted Garlic Crab, Drunken Crab, and the Garlic noodles. The carbs are at quoted price, but we got them at $39.95 each.

Roast Garlic Crab (Highly recommended, A Must Have):
So delicious!  Covered with lots of garlic, salt and pepper, the crab was cooked to perfection!  There was a mysterious flavor that the crab had that made it extra tasty, so my boyfriend asked the waiter:

"Is there any MSG in this?"

Waiter: "Nothing thats not naturally occurring."

Wikipedia defines MSG as: Monosodium glutamate, also known as sodium glutamate or MSG, is the sodium salt of glutamic acid, one of the most abundant naturally occurring non-essential amino acids.

Wow, way to fool the uneducated!

Drunken Garlic Crab:
Cooked in three different wines, it tasted exactly how it was described.  Nothing special to this dish.

Garlic Noodles:
Noodles were sweet tasting and was just needed to balance out the meal filled with lots of crab.

The portions of each crab were big but my boyfriend and I were able to finish a crab on our own.  Thinking about the Roast Garlic crab just makes mouth water!

Get your bibs and gloves ready to get down and dirty!
author: Bao Jun L.

description:
Great food, good service. We did show up dressed down while
most were dressed for a weekend dinner affair. Good experience,
Just not 100% for me.
author: Oyo B.

description:
I would have never heard about Crustacean if it wasn't for my sweetie. He took me here for our Valentine's Day dinner after a long day of walking and shopping in the bay. 

We arrived around 6:30PM and we were greeted and seated immediately. We ordered the Vietnamese Carpaccio, roasted crab with garlic and spices, and An's garlic noodles. The Vietnamese Carpaccio came out quickly along with my sweetie's beer and my Lychee martini. The carpaccio was very good. The beef was sliced thinly, served with capers and a mild sweet dressing, almost like a tamarind dressing. Soon after we finished our appetizer, the crab and noodles arrived at the table. It was a whole crab smothered in garlic, lemon, better, and spices; it was awesome! Roasted to perfection! The spices were amazing. I probably could have eaten two, lol. The noodles were super garlicky and delicious with no actual garlic in them. The garlic must have been infused with the sauce. Very, very tasty!

Our server was excellent! He checked up on us and refilled my water and was very attentive.  The restaurant is pretty crammed. We were seated at this tiny table with my back literally up against the wall. I couldn't even move my chair back. Anyone larger than me would not have fit in that chair! The large plate of crab and noodles barely fit the table with our glasses of water and cocktails. 

Crustacean: TWO thumbs up for me!
author: Latda V.

description: This place is over rated bathrooms are ugly and dirty. Kind of a public bathroom on the streets. Food didn't taste fresh anymore kind of pre- heated and shrimp was very hard. They use to be good I always thought Thanh Long was better !!! Entrance is dirty too...
author: Veronica P.

description: The only reason I'm giving it a one-star is the service was terrible. Actually it was beyond terrible. This was my first time here with a couple of friends and I know everyone has a bad night, but the table next to us also commented how terrible the service was. They were extremely busy and looked as if they could have used more help or perhaps help from the managers. They seemed very disorganized. On the positive, the food was great. Had the roasted crab, garlic noodles and the baked salmon. Another plus is there is valet parking after 5 on the California Avenue entrance that is only $12.
author: Sandi W.

description:
Surprised this place has such a low rating. I go here regularly and have always found the food delicious, the ambiance lovely, (Well, they are remodeling so it's not as nice in interim right now) and the staff to be attentive, helpful, friendly, and on point. It's expensive but wtf do you expect for high quality seafood restaurant in SF...? 

I read some reviewers complain about having to walk upstairs to get to the restaurant...um....what? If walking up three flights of stairs ruins your evening you must have health issues, or seriously need more exercise. Also read complaints that the "body of the crab was used for decoration and there wasn't much meat inside." Again , WHATY The SHELL of the crab is used as decoration as most people don't consume all the innards inside the shell. I assure you, if you like the brains/organs/fishy bits they will bring them to you. (A server promptly removed my fathers shell which he set aside and my father commented he was going to eat it, the waiter brought my Dad two fresh ones) You can do the traditional Portuguese thing of pouring your wine in there and slurping up the sludgy fishiness. Most people don't like that. There isn't "meat" in there. If you think there is you are ignorant. They do serve the meaty body of the crab, the claws and legs. That's where the meat is. Nuff said.

All of their crab is yummy, roasted most simple hence more crab flavor, drunken has more flavor from the wine and tamarind obviously is sweet and yummy but can't taste the actual crab as much. Garlic noodles are tasty but not as fantastic as some people thing, imo. But, I'm not really into noodles. sea Bass, Stuffed calamari are tasty. Seafood salad. My daughter is obsessed with the baked Alaska. Their wine pairing suggestions especially for dessert are on point. 

I think this place is a gem, check it out.
author: Christina P.

description: I came here with my family last night and the food was really good. I enjoyed the crab puffs a lot and my grilled salmon was very nice. The restaurant had valet parking which is definitely a plus. However the elevator on the way up was a bit scary as if I was going to break and we would get stuck inside. Overall the dining experience was really good.
author: Hasan K.

description: First of all, we arrive at this restaurant that appears to be closed or under construction. I was confused to thinking this was a somewhat upscale place. No parking lot and drove around for a while to find a parking. We had reservations and no one mentioned that the elevator was out of order and we had to carry a stroller up 3 flights of stairs. We were seated almost elbow to elbow next to another family which made the experience kind of awkward, the waiter was nice and helpful to the questions we had. I ordered the lobster that was very bland and what appeared to be like 8 oz of meat. I've had better lobster from multiple places at almost a third of the price. The angel hair pasta it came with was bland as well, almost immediately our waters were refilled then never again. I've heard a lot of talk about this place and it's disappointing to experience this the way we did. High priced , bland and no elevator, so if someone is disabled no crustys for them? Awful, save your money and time and look elsewhere
author: Joey G.

description: My family and I came to this restaurant while we were in SF for the day and stopped in for dinner. Even though we had a reservation at 6:30 we got there 30 minutes earlier and asked if we could be seated earlier and the host said we would be seated in a couple minutes. The ambiance of the restaurant is very romantic with dim lighting. We got seated and ordered a Riesling wine to start. We ordered the two special appetizers, a lobster salad and the salt and pepper calamari. The lobster in the salad was delicious and the dressing that went on top went perfectly with the mango in the salad and added a nice light touch that tied in all the ingredients of the salad. The calamari wasn't greasy and was nice and crispy with the perfect amount of breading so that the taste of the seafood wasn't overwhelmed. There was also a nice dipping sauce on the side. We ordered the famous roast crab, the drunken crab, garlic noodles, garlic rice, tiger prawns and the tamarind crab to share amongst us. The roast crab was DELICIOUS and I can see why it is their famous one. The tamarind crab was recommended by our waiter and it did not disappoint. The drunken crab was the least flavorful in comparison to the other two and I would probably recommend the crabs in the order of: roast, tamarind then drunken. However, the crab meat in all of them was cooked to PERFECTION. The meat was tender and delicious and easy to crack open. The garlic noodles were phenomenal as was the rice and the prawns. The prawns also came with garlic noodles underneath them which was nice. We finished with a dessert to complete our meal. In addition to our food being delicious, our waiter, Paul was also awesome! He definitely was very attentive and offered great service from the start to the end. This place gets 5 stars for excellence all around. I will definitely be returning with my family as this place offers a great meal that is hard to find, along with exceptional service.
author: Nicole Y.

description:
Garlic Noodles (~$10): mmmmm garlic
Roasted Crab (market price ~$40): soaked in butter, pepper, and garlic.
Baked Alaska (~$10): dessert to cleanse our pallete

Amazing Service... probably the best I have ever had. You are definitely paying for the service. Parties of 5 or more pay automatic 15% (they completely earn it though with their excellent service).

My family of 4 could have finished all our food if we ordered 1 garlic noodle dish and just 3 roasted crabs. But we took the advice of our waitress and went with 4 roasted crabs and 2 garlic noodles (we practically took 1 whole crab home and almost a whole order of the garlic noodles).

I also ordered an appetizer which was 4 spring rolls basically but I can't remember what it exactly is... It was a special of the day and I don't see it in the menu.. **I don't think the appetizers are very worth it for what they give you.

Baked Alaska (~$10): Side of Caramel & Banana, Chocolate Ice Cream, Chocolate Cake (?) and topped with a Meringue... DELICIOUS. Just what I needed to cleanse our pallete which reeked of garlic.  

Tax & Tip was about $255. Expect it to take a small dent in your wallet.
author: Lauren K.

description:
THE BEST CRAB YOU WILL EVER HAVE!

DECOR:I warn you to not be swayed away from this location based on the looks of the outside. When you pull up to the restaurant the area does not look very nice and the restaurant is pretty small. However, if you are familiar with the SF area you know not to judge a book by its cover. Some of the most upscale spots are located in not so pretty areas. Once you get inside you are greeted with an elegant atmosphere. Lots of Vietnamese art and dim romantic lighting. I think they made great use of the space they have.

FOOD: No questions asked you must get the roasted crab and garlic noodles. I have yet to taste a crab that can measure up to AN'S FAMOUS ROASTED CRAB. The flavors in this crab are mouth watering. My fiance and I love love love the garlic pepper sauce on the crab. That stuff is the bomb, it makes you just want to dip your fingers in it (we have a few times. haha). We ALWAYS pair our crab with the GARLIC NOODLES. As simple as they look I have again yet to find a place that can even compare to the rich flavors these noodles have. We typically dip our noodles in the garlic sauce from the crab. LOL. Sometimes when I am craving something different I get the CHARBROILED COLOSSAL ROYAL TIGER PRAWNS. They too are packed with rich flavor. I think the prawns are a great dish because they come with garlic noodles, you do not need to order them separately. Lately we have been ordering the beef skewers as our appetizer. Really amazing with a grand amount of flavor as well. 

SERVICE: Very great service. You can tell that the entire Crustacean's (House of An) team is dedicated to providing superior service to all of their customers. I am really impressed by how well Crustacean's (House of An) takes care of their clients. I have no complaints. 

Nothing can compare to this place. It is by far one of the best places to eat in San Francisco. I will most certainly be back!
author: Staja J.

description: I went here expecting the experience I always get when visit the Beverly Hills location...it was not at all. I love the drunken crab and get it whenever I go to the BH location (even though they've stopped serving it) I was excited to see that it was on the menu here. The dish was cold and not great...In fact all of the dishes were cold. My friend got the chicken breast which was also cold. Our waiter appeared to be too busy to remember anything. It was not a great experience and I'm slightly bothered that I feel like I wasted my money.
author: Glen T.

description: Cooks were not willing to accommodate a customer with gluten and dairy allergies. The hostess wanted to accommodate our needs but the cooks did not want to. We ended up eating down the street where the place was clean, the food was great, gluten free, dairy free and organic.
author: Anna M.

description: Hmmmm $58 for a crab in a dirty, old restaurant? I don't get it. The extra star was for the good service.
author: Alessandra N.

description: Just like Thanh Long, get the Roast crap for maximum flavor.  Our crab was a little over cooked as the innards within the shell was a bit too tough and was almost unfresh.  Here's a tip tho, if you've got the taste for the yellow gooey innards/brain/roe, throw some garlic noodles and just eat it straight up mixed.  Probably my favorite part about going to these places is that.  Short Ribs and calamari was good but EXPENSIIIIIIVEEEEEE.
author: Vince L.

description:
I've been here several times since moving to the bay area. It's still pretty good, though it is a bit pricey. Try their sister restaurant, Than Long, which I think has better prices. 

I had the shaken beef which was packed full of flavor. I think next time I'll have their famous crab, but I'll have to try it at Than Long or it'll break my wallet.
author: Kenson K.

description: I love to come here for dinner, and you must try the fried calamari. It's by far the best seafood restaurant I've been to in the Bay Area.
author: Nataliya M.

description:
You MUST, MUST, MUST get the Roast Crab if you decide to venture into Crustacean.  And then get An's Garlic Noodles to accompany it.

Many thanks to the concierge at the Hilton on O' Farrell where I stayed for recommending this place when I asked where I could get the best Dungeness crab.

I hadn't had crab like this since I was a kid and my grandparents brought these back from the west coast.  What a treat.

There's nothing bad to say here.  The crab is absolutely huge, swimming in garlic and spices and the noodles are a great companion dish.  Ask anyone that knows this place and the first thing they mention is the noodles.  They are very good but I still think the crab is the star.

Eating this monster is time consuming in order to pick it clean but it is well worth the effort.  You WILL be amazed how good this dish is.

I was on vacation when I visited so I didn't have a chance to try anything else but please look at their website.  They have so many outstanding Vietnamese fusion choices that if I lived out there I guarantee I'd eat here once a week.  

The service is outstanding and this is definitely a more upscale kind of place yet it has a casual feel.

So go here for crab paradise, not the Wharf.  Go where the locals go-  keep it in the neighborhoods!
author: Paul P.

description: Good portions, we had crab. Someone recommended as a place to eat in SF. Nothing too extraordinary though.
author: Edward L.

description: Heard about crustaceans from a friend. Made a reservation several days in advance before coming to the city. Got the roasted crab and garlic noodles since that's what they are known for. Best crab I've ever had hands down! Amazing! Service was great too and the waiter was very attentive. Worth the trip to eat here and the price!
author: Megan B.

description:
3.5 star...so close to 4 star but just didn't make the cut

Ordered the Baked Crab and Garlic Noodles off the Secret Kitchen Menu.

Market Price that day was $40 I believe + $7 for the noodles? Needless to say, its not cheap so try to split one crab per 2 people. While you won't get full, the flavors sorta make up for it.

The crab meat was sweet, delicate and fresh. The pepper and salt seasoning was simple yet delicious. As for the noodles, they were good but I didn't get why my friend was so infatuated with them to the point where she tried to go home and replicate it several times before. 

I can see why my friend has been thinking about this place for over a decade but at the same time I can't help but wonder if its more nostalgia and less about the food. Don't get me wrong, I liked the food but I felt it didn't leave a lasting impression like it did for my friend.

Oh, I forgot to mention we received a complimentary order of Shrimp Wontons due to waiting longer than expected. There was a bathroom emergency which our waiter had to tend to before seating us which is why he prompted to give us a free appetizer. 

Service was attentive and friendly.

Overall Thoughts

If willing to splurge Crustacean isn't a bad place to try but I'm not sure how long the appeal can last.
author: Eddie W.

description: My husband and I used to frequent this restaurant. It was our all-time favorite. We haven't been here in a couple years. Took my husband here last night to celebrate his 40th birthday. Was very disappointed on how much butter was used on the roasted crab just drenched. I definitely understand this is the recipe but it was overboard for $55 a crab I was very very disappointed. However the garlic noodles were still amazing The service was phenomenal.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
This review is actually a 2.5 out of 5 for Crustaceans.  Seriously, how dare they butcher up those Garlic Noodles?  That's something they're known for!  You don't butcher up what you're famous for ... that's like saying In-n-Out isn't good at making burgers.  Simply put, Crustacean's ... you disappointed.  They're located on the 2nd or 3rd floor of a plaza-like area so you'll definitely have to climb up some stairs.  We still waited a solid 30 minutes even though I had made reservations two days prior.  

We ordered the Miso Ginger Glazed Beef, Shrimp Toast, Papaya Salad and the famous Garlic Noodles they're supposedly known for.  In terms of taste and quality, everything fell below the norm: over-buttered, too much time spent in the fryer, not enough zest, not enough marinade, etc.  The Garlic Noodles were a gloppy, over-buttered mess.  No time was spent on the plating or presentation.  I thought to myself: they must be REALLY good if they don't spend any time caring about that sort of thing.  Then when I dug in, it tasted like I was putting pure butter in my mouth.  The garlic essence was barely existent and the noodles themselves were boiled a tad too long.  

The bill rang us up somewhere around $80 for two people (no alcoholic drinks, but includes tax & tip).  At least our server was really nice though.  

PS - don't order the coffee.  I was in need of a caffeine kick so I ordered it; I won't be doing that again.
author: Crystine W.

description:
About 2 weeks ago, my BFF posted photos of crab, prawns and garlic noodles on FB.  I was drooling all over my iPad from staring at the food.  So, I booked reservations to eat here with another GF that I typically eat crab with.

There's a bit of snootiness when you book your reservations.  It almost feel like they are doing you a favor for allowing you to eat there, the dude on the phone said, "We only hold taaaables for 15 minutes after your reservaaations".  I was like, okay sure whatever.  Even after the snootie-ness, I still want to eat there and was actually appreciative that I got reservations.

After being seated, we both rolled our eyes to the sky because the restaurant was practically empty.  How dare they make me feel like I was the luckiest girl alive to get reservations!  There was plenty of open tables.  Sheesh.

So, we ordered the roasted crab, buttered prawns with garlic noodles and a pot of hot green tea.  The food came out quickly.  We were crackalacketing, slurping, wiping,  and shoving food bits into our big mouths...simultaneously trying not to look barbaric. Which is impossible to do.  I don't know what they do to those crabs but the favors were deeply infused into the meat.  The prawns were butter.  The noodles licikity smacking garlic and butter.  We washed everything down with the green tea.  Lemme tell ya, Im a big green tea drinker and this tea was flavorful and bold.  They don't serve the cheap stuff here, no sir-e-o-bob.  Oh yummy.

Then the big shocker came...the bill.  We knew the crab was pricey already but the prawns with noodles... OMG.  So, expensive.  There was only 4 prawns on top of the noodles and the price was close to the crab price.  Sooooooo expensive and we are sooooooooo not ordering prawns anymore.  We both don't think it's worth it for that price.  

If your in the mood for crab and letting all your cash go from your Chanel wallet, come here for a bite.  It's delicious and worthy of eating at least 1x per year.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Love this place!
This place is popular for two very good reasons: Crab and Garlic Noodles!

The ambiance in this place is really nice and asian inspired.  The lighting is dim and the staff is very friendly.

We ordered:
-Shaken Beef flambéed in Chardonnay, sautéed green beans, cherry tomatoes and red onions ( beef is extremely tender!)
-The Roast Crab an entire dungeness crab roasted to perfection with garlic and spices (perfect for one!  Trust me, this crab is so delicious, you won't share)
-An's Garlic Noodles egg noodles infused with An's famous garlic sauce  (super famous and delicious!  This is a must!  People book Crustaceans for their wedding cause of this fabulous noodles!)

You will get a bib for ordering the crab.  Don't be ashamed.  Just put it on!  It will save your outfit. Your hands will get dirty! But its all worth it.
author: Ying F.

description: The service from begging to end was excellent. The food was fabulous had the crab with garlic noodles. the wine choice was superb. Excellent choice.
author: julie n.

description: The service was great but what happened to the food there? The drunken crab used to be my favorite dish but it was really ordinary. The roasted crab would have been a better choice. The garlic noodles seemed limp and lacked the intense garlic flavor I was used to.  Frankly it was disappointing and the crowd has changed too. Someone didn't send me the memo.
author: Bruce F.

description:
I made an early reservation for 2 at 8pm the day before going here.  Upon arriving 2 minutes before my reservation, I was unexpectedly informed that there was no reservation listed under my name.  As this is my first time here, starting this off on the wrong foot does not do good for the business as I'm already getting a bad first impression.  

The guy told us he can seat us anyway and that we were more than welcomed to stay by the bar as they prep our table.  We went to the bar and got some drinks and eventually transferred our tab back to the table.  We got seated in a corner, next to a loud birthday party of 8.  I could barely keep a conversation with my friend unless I practically shout at him across the small table.  

The service for our food was good.  The waiters came by to check on us a couple times.  We ordered 2 roasted crab and the noodle.  The noodle is good to dip into the sauce of the crab, but be careful not to flood it.  The waiter was constantly changing our bowl of crab shells even if we didn't even fill up the bowl, sometimes barely even had one scrap in there.  This could be a good or bad thing, but I personally thought it was annoying because they were constantly interrupting my conversation.  

Our bill came out to be $125.43 and I gave a $19.57 tips (which would ultimately add up to $145 EVEN).  I don't care if you're expecting a normal 25% tip in SF, I will give you the tip you deserve.  The waitress came back and told me I did the math wrong, that it should have been $150 instead.  Seriously?  If you're looking for more tips, you can ask me if the service provided was less than expected, but don't come back telling me I did my math wrong.  

Overall, food was good but the service just spoiled it for me.  Probably won't come back.
author: Teresa N.

description: So I didn't read the reviews first so I didn't know you are only supposed to order the whole carb and the garlic noodles. My bad. Instead I ordered the corn crab bisque and the coconut prawns.  The bisque was terrible- very thin and not even hot.  The prawns were excellent however - very large and crispy with a great dipping sauce and the portion size was excellent.  I will say also that the service was outstanding, and I was greeted in a friendly way by every employee that I passed or that passed by my table. I would definitely return, especially now that I know what to order!
author: Rebecca O.

description:
We came here hearing the crab and garlic noodles are amazing. It was pretty quiet when we arrived but the food came very fast.

We ordered the Famous Roasted Crab which was delicious. The garlic noodles was so yummy. Lingering garlic breath was well worth it. We also ordered the tiger prawns.

So good!!! :)
author: Daphne H.

description: Been here twice and highly recommend the drunken crab and garlic noodles. I came back the second time just for those amazing noodles!
author: MaryBeth C.

description:
Long time patron, first time disappointment. We've been coming here for years and we absolutely love the food. Until now we've always had a great dining experience and the staff has always been prompt and courteous. We came to enjoy another birthday celebration with our family but were sorely let down by our server and support staff. They were basically inattentive or MIA. For example, they did not bus or reset the table as expected at a restaurant of this caliber, we should never have to ask for simple things such as water refills, new bowls for shells, or to bus empty plates and glasses between courses, that should automatically be part of the service, effortless, seamless. Service was slow too, which was odd since there were empty tables all around. Lastly a word to the support staff..."HEY MAN" is NOT an appropriate way to address your patrons.

Unfortunately with the standard practice of automatically charging gratuity for tables of +6, I believe has caused a negative complacent behavior. Don't get me wrong at one point in my life I too waited tables, but I EARNED every tip I ever received I've never just kicked back and let the policy pay me.
author: Cliff A.

description:
I'm a little iffy when it comes to Crustaceans. I think you are mainly paying for the atmosphere. The food is good, but not fabulous. The service is good; the prices are high. It's a nice place that you can go if you want to dress up and go somewhere special for an anniversary, birthday or other occasion. 

Another downside is their tables are pretty small and crammed together. Last two times I went, we were seated at a small table that you could barely fit our plates on. :(
author: Chanel J.

description: We shared the garlic crab and garlic noodles and it was more than enough  enjoyed every bite, was moist and not overpowering with all the garlic. Looking forward to our next visit.
author: Nicole D.

description: If the waiter asks all the men in the party what they are ordering before the lady at the table he's a moron!!! I will never entertain the thought of spending over $500 for a table and three bottles and every item on the menu lol and still be treated like that!!! Does anyone know table etiquette???? A waiter should.   I will enjoy spending money else where, go to a higher end establishment, this place was like a wanna be ritzy pf changs meets le cheval... Yikes yikes yikes
author: Halina F.

description: Everything we ordered was amazing! We got the muscles and lobster egg rolls for appetizer. Main course was garlic noodles with prawns and the garlic roasted crab.
author: Lucy N.

description: Amazing! Love the Roast Crab and garlic noodles. You can't go wrong. Brought 3 friends from out of town and they all thought it was one of the very best meals they ever had.
author: Jeff F.

description: Best crab I've eaten in my life. Lobster egg roll appetizer was very good too. Definitely my go-to spot when I'm out in SF.
author: Justin S.

description: The service was superb compared to other restaurants in San Francisco. Although I enjoyed my"Roast Crab",my peers were not as satisfied as I was.All in all, my experience was not only enjoyable but eloquent. 4 stars
author: Jimmy C.

description: Expensive, but worth it. Made reservations same day, Saturday am, for evening, made it on time ten mins prior to seven, seated immediately. Party of two. Restrooms clean!. Roasted crab garlic noodles and fried rice, very delicious! Had wine and water, No complaints. Server was on it. Table was cleanliness. 100 tab for two. Expensive but worth it. Biggest tip i ever left 20.
author: Paris S.

description:
I just want to say I always go to the An family for crab @ Thanh Long (@least once a month sometimes twice) and I'm never disappointed!! I tried to show some love here and hoped to get the same great roasted crab and I was TRUELY disappointed! My crab was all beat up and missing legs!! There was black slimy soot between the shell and the meat of the claw and I fell like my crab was already dead before they "killed" it! 
But the highlight of the meal was the lemongrass marinated beef skewers and dessert! But I couldn't really enjoy my dessert because I was wondering if I should complain or not.... Not an all around good experience but I did discover something new I liked and that was the beef!! That was my silver lining!!
author: Tammaneka B.

description:
The best crab I ever had.  And garlic noodles are fantastic!
Had dinner this evening and it was very enjoyable overall.
author: Alex K.

description: Time for a upgrade for this once upscale restaurant. Needs a remodel. The crab and roasted crab still taste good. You can ask to have your crab prepared without the msg, but won't taste the same.  They add about 18% gratuity charge on the bill so watch out for that.
author: P D.

description: I have been going here for years and I went for my birthday, they still don't Disappoint. My crab and noodles were excellent. The service was excellent. Its always been worth it and it still is. Yes I have been to almost all the crab restaurants or places that have tried to duplicate the crab here, there us no other.
author: Dina B.

description: The Corn and crab bisque was just what i wanted after a day on a wine tour, then followed by the light and creamy prawn ravioli made with rice paper which was delicious. They make a great Bloody Mary and the service was excellent. My first SF dining out experience is a good memory.
author: Elise C.

description: I researched best and cool seafood restaurants in San Francisco before our trip from Arlington,TX. This place, its story and its menu was too intriguing to pass up. My high expectations were met and exceeded. Our server Daniel was thoughtful, prompt and honest...he was a delight...he made sincere recommendations and choices based on my girlfriend's likes and dislikes...all in my group were thrilled with their entrees! We had so much fun that we even ordered a follow up "family style" entree of the incomparable garlic noodles which I must say may never truly be explained here in adjectives so I will just say order some when you go.
