My Roast Crab was something special as well! The evening was a perfect 10 on a 10 scale...highly recommend you visit!
author: Dave T.

description:
We had a difficult time deciding how many stars to give this restaurant.  

The first thing to know is that the food was incredible. We has the seafood dumplings and crab puffs for appetizers - both were unbelievably delicious.  For entrees we had the roasted crab (best meal he's had in years), an order of garlic noodles (which are nothing less than divine), and a rather unique (and delectable) panko crusted crab cakes.  We has no room left for dessert!

The reason we didn't give this location five stars is the decor was average, the bathrooms were messy, and the service was good but not mind-blowing.

Would definitely recommend if you're looking for some good crab!
author: Veronica J.

description:
I would give 3.5 stars actually.

My friend and I were craving for crabs and ended up.
We got in the area early so we lucked out with parking.
The outside part of the restaurant is weird and kinda filthy..definitely needed some rehab.  The inside: small and crowded.

With no reservations, we ended up being seated in the corner. Not comfortable at all.

We ordered:
 drinks:  very bland... needed more alcohol to be called cocktails.,
salt & pepper calamari: recommended by the server, a bit too salty
drunken crab - tasty
and roasted crab also tasty
, garlic noodles - not too bad.
coffee- pretty good.

The crab were really good. the rest of the food-decent.  Definitely not cheap.
Service was good.

Although the service and food were good, I'm not sure my experience is a 4-star one.
author: Learnee L.

description:
Yes, the crab is delicious.  Don't even bother with anything else until you've tried the roasted crab.

Please stop the hype over the garlic noodles.  It's a bowl of spaghetti with minimal garlic flavor.  They are simply not that good and nowhere close to being worth $10.  Skip the garlic noodles and go for the garlic rice.  It had 5x the garlic flavor..
author: Mike T.

description:
I hadn't been to Crustacean in years.  Either I've changed or they have, but it was just mediocre and definitely not worth the price.  I used to say it was the best crab in the city, but no more, not by a long shot.  We had their specialties the garlic crab and tiger prawns with garlic noodles.  The crab wasn't as special as I remember, the prawns were overcooked and rubbery and the noodles were mushy.  The service was good, but this restaurant has gone downhill.  

I've been more recently to Than Long (about 2 years ago) and their crab was still really good then.  Maybe expanding to more restaurants has affected the quality.   With so many other great restaurants in the city, we won't be back.  We could have gotten the same meal for much less or a much better meal for the same price.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
will always be one of my favorite restaurants. 
Garlic roasted crab is a must, along with the garlic noodles!
author: Paola A.

description: Roast crab was decent.  Snap peas were good.  Shrimp fried rice, average.  Service very average.  We had the one server who was very indifferent about being there.  The other servers seemed to be much better than ours.  Too bad.  We asked to move to a larger table because they put us at a small table for 2 and we ordered 2 crabs.  The place was empty but they said it would be full later.  Unlikely we'll be back..
author: Peter L.

description: We had the garlic crab and garlic noodles!  Very yummy and tasty! Great food and lovely company to spend on a rainy Sunday afternoon in the city! I'm enjoying all the seafood I can eat before baby comes! Woo hoo!
author: K S.

description: Great meal. Great service. Must order the Roasted Garlic Dungeness Crabs and the Garlic noodles. Highly recommend.  Paul was our Server. Super nice and very professional.
author: Celeste G.

description: We came here for my birthday lunch on a Sunday afternoon. I agree with most of the other reviews, the roast crab and garlic noodles are the way to go! The crab and noodles were a perfect meal to split. We also had the salt and pepper calimari and it was cooked perfectly. The crab is definitely something I can see myself craving on a regular basis. Delicious!
author: Michelle H.

description: We were the last reservation of the night, and they were very accommodating with all the changes I had to make, but service was very slow. As if they forgot us in the corner up there. The waiter was nice but he just didn't check on us enough. The staff made it very obvious they were packing up and closing for the night. The food was delicious nonetheless. But I would steer clear of going that time of night!
author: Ginger A.

description: We had the tempura coconut prawns, roasted salmon entree, roast garlic crab and Helene's ravioli. All three dishes were good but not really memorable. The crab was certainly well cooked, moist and sauce was good but in my opinion not worth the $55+ price tag. The rest of the dishes were about at the appropriate prices. Decent service, good food, I'd say it's a one and done for me. Not memorable enough to try again.
author: Sun T.

description: I had heard great things about this place. So my husband booked reservations for my birthday.  We arrived early and we're  seated at the bar. Our tables were ready pretty quick.  We started with garlic noodles to share and the wonton prawns.  They were truly amazing especially the noodles.  For our entrée we ordered the roasted crab and chicken and shrimp fried rice.  I really enjoyed every moment.  I love the service we never had to wait to ask for anything.  The atmosphere was very romantic with the dim lights. I definitely will be back but only for special occasions.  This is a very special place.
author: Sequoia M.

description:
wow, crustacean how u disappointed me today..It's been a while since I'd been back and now I remember why.
came here to celebrate our 20th anniversary and we were so looking forward to our usual roast crab and 2 garlic noodles.

why 2 stars u ask...we arrived at 6pm for dinner, was seated... waiter comes gives us two glasses of water... doesn't introduce himself as our waiter and doesn't mention the special of the day. 

I know I haven't been here in a while, but what happen to the nice, quite ambience... for dinner ur allowed to wear tshirts and hoodies now? I'm only complaining because the last time we were here my wife had a dressy sweater that happen to have a  hood and she was asked to wear one of their shirts that had a collar!!! because there is a dress code... 

remember the quite ambience well there was none one of the maitre d, was hella loud... we were next to the bar and all we heard was him yelling in the kitchen... can I have a quite dinner with the wife? 

food...
roast crab and garlic noodles were not the same.... garlic noodles didn't have much of the sweet garlic taste I remembered and the crab looked like they rushed it smack some black pepper and here u go... not their best...
author: Charlie N.

description: This is my favorite restaurant the garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles are the best! The food is fantastic and melts in your mouth!
author: Carla L.

description: Their crab and garlic noodles are legendary. I have been to this and their original Thang Long location in the Outer Sunset for over 20 years, and their food has been consistently good. I like to take out of town guests here. I didn't give 5 stars because their wine list selection and stock are not great and they are not very gluten-free friendly (for my wife).
author: Wilson T.

description: First of all, this place is amazing!  Beautiful and peaceful ambience.  Very accessible.  Crab, garlic noodles, calamari, beef carpaccio and veggies... everything was a WOW!  Second, the staff are wonderful.  We were catching up with friends we had not seen in 16 years and celebrating a birthday.  I have a small service dog and another group of 6 at the opposite end of the seating area started yelling and screaming about the dog and saying they were going to call the health department.  The staff were incredibly patient, asked them to calm down or leave, and adamant that they were not going to eject us because of my hearing dog.  (Who was not even visible to the other party except when we walked by them to our seat).  It was a bit jarring for a few minutes, and hard to believe, but thanks to the wonderfully professional and kind management and servers at Crustacean, we did not dwell on the incident, and had a wonderful eveing with our friends.  I would HIGHLY recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a memorable meal that is special in every way thanks to staff that are inclusive and welcoming.
author: Deborah D.

description:
Crustaceans never leaves me CRABBY v^_^v

My BFF and I found this place for the first time Spring Break 2004.  We went with a group of friends for dinner and we loved it so much that we went back for lunch the next day.  When we called about lunch they told us no t-shirt and jeans so my BFF and I headed over to nihon machi and bought yukatas to eat lunch.  

8 years later I found myself in SF for the weekend.  Guess where I wanted to eat?? 

We got reservations on Easter Sunday for lunch and it was just as good as I remember it.  

Our Server was excellent.  He told us about the specials for the day.  
Lobster mango salad - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=hJzmamPlZrUMts6QDLKS2Q&userid=8WGMxB_JKe2Cxd-wcbxtyw
 
and salt and pepper calamari - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=QEgVnddpgL19AVlFFezeJg&userid=8WGMxB_JKe2Cxd-wcbxtyw

Both were awesome.

We also ordered:
Roast Crab -  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=bE2qLSi4gFSFymJfC5C4kw&userid=8WGMxB_JKe2Cxd-wcbxtyw

season veggies - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=kvbfvkkO3mc6Z8vv9XEAIw&userid=8WGMxB_JKe2Cxd-wcbxtyw

Garlic Noodles - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Sv6LVRxic-8t-g5zCBHK_A&userid=8WGMxB_JKe2Cxd-wcbxtyw

Baked Alaska for dessert.  - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=YQR-QxfXd6q9Np269rPu_Q&userid=8WGMxB_JKe2Cxd-wcbxtyw

The Baked Alaska was too die for.  It had a layer of cake caramel and chocolate ice cream and toasted marshmallow on top.

It's expensive but to splurge once in a while it's worth it.   

Oh Crustaceans, how I love thee.
author: Jasmine N.

description:
Love, love, love the garlic noodles, roasted crab, prawns and calamari.  If you love garlic...YUM this is the spot!  It is definitely finger licking good.  It's totally worth the drive and the parking hunt, but if you don't have time just valet it.  

Nice, nice, nice ambiance, servers, and hosts.  You really can't go wrong with this place.  A lot of people say it's pricey but I really think it's worth it.  I admit, I have made a few attempts in trying to make their garlic noodles but no luck.  It's so worth it to just  buy the real deal.  Sometimes, I just order the noodles to go.  Valet will let you park in the front to get to go orders.  Well they let me at least.  Just ask.

They will also go above and beyond if you call ahead of time for a special event.  I arranged for my parents to celebrate their anniversary there and my parents loved the service.  Aside from that I've gone here for birthdays to my girls and I just happened to be passing by and couldn't resist.
author: Margaret T.

description:
LOVED the roasted crab, which is a misnomer as the crab is boiled not roasted, but it is devine!   The garlic noodles which don't sound exciting at all are probably the closest thing to heaven you can get if you are a garlic and pasta lover which I am.  The mixed salad was even yummy and special with a unique dressing and toped with asian pear.  The food was amazing the service was friendly but I only gave it 4 stars as there are a couple of cons that go along with it.... 

1) the overpowering old musty fish smell as you enter the restaurant.  it's pretty unappealing  but your nose will get used to it and it's not worth missing out on the crab for.

2)the decor is very old, outdated, dingy and shabby, but again, don't miss out on the crab for that reason.

3) the seating is too close together and it makes it loud and a bit uncomfortable so it's not the place to propose to your favorite someone.. that's for sure.

Otherwise, try it!!!   We will return next time we're in the city!
author: K And D G.

description:
Save your money. There are way too many restaurants in SF to waste your time on this one. Our large group made reservations and we had to wait an additional hour. There was no acknowledgement from the hostess. When we asked her, she just simply said "we can't control how long people stay at the tables." Hellllloooo! A simple apology would have been sufficient at least. 

We finally got seated and here is my assessment of their dishes.

- Roasted Garlic Crab...they charge an additional $6 to crack the crab for you on top of the hefty $42. I'm lazy so I was the only one in the group who paid for it. But when the crabs came, the waiter didn't even identify or asked who ordered the cracked crab and gave it to my friend. We didn't figure that out until later. Of course they didn't remove the $6 off the bill, they just made my friend pay for it. 

- Stir fry vegetables were pretty much soggy veggies tossed in oyster sauce for $18.

- Salmon Carpaccio was not fresh and not worth the $14 for 4-5 pieces of salmon masked in sauce (the salmon was a brown tint). It was probably to hide the fishy taste since it was not fresh.

- Corn bisque with crab was really my dessert. Who serves soup all the way towards the end of a meal? They served this to me towards the very end. And I couldn't help myself and I said out loud that this tasted like school cafeteria food. It was awful and there was no crab at all, just some white flakes floating on the top. This was the most disgusting item on their menu.

Overall experience was very poor. The waiter had to have known we were dissatisfied with the wait and the food but chose to be ignorant to it. The manager never checked up with our group once to see how we were doing. You would think that's their job. They might have been good in the past but that has certainly change. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone!
author: Wendy L.

description:
In an alternate universe one Saturday evening, I was Ryan Philippe and Crustacean was Studio 54 - "Not with that shirt," they said. No... I didn't take off my shirt to reveal a glistening 6-pack like in the movie. Reality is harsher. Luckily for my fat sorry ass I was wearing a crisp white shirt under said offensive hoodie. 

I really have no qualms with dress codes at restaurants. I just ask that if you believe yourself to be that type of establishment, then have the balls to strictly enforce it. We would have easily turned away and gone somewhere else instead of being made to feel awkward despite dropping hundreds of dollars on dinner. 

We stumbled in to celebrate 2 birthdays (obviously not knowing there was a dress code ... hey I didn't even Yelp it before hand) and while I was made to take my hoodie off, others were told to keep their jackets on becuase they were wearing t-shirts underneath. It's very arbitrary and if you look around the neighborhood, very misplaced. Crustacean is still stuck in a distorted, 80's view of fine dining. 

Alright, dress code rant aside, Crustacean's did surprise me. The decor was nice and the service, attentive. Special props go out to our server who was really cordial and balanced out the occasional look of disdain from the maître d'. 

We started out with several small plates - lobster salad (special for the day), crab puffs, grilled calamari, and the "famous" garlic noodles. The crab puffs were the star of the apps. Light and fluffy, we devoured them in an instant. The rest of the apps were decent - fresh seafood and flavorful dipping sauces but nothing you can't find anywhere else. 

I had the catch of the day for my entree which was a pan-seared Vietnamese Basa over rice vermicelli (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/BahDyzswTsdaSa8jnOaK-A?select=xgUxBL08bNgv__mXrcenpg). I was honestly surprised by how flavorful and well balanced the dish was. Other entrees on the table included roast chicken, crab cakes, shaken beef, and the "signature dish" - roasted crab. Folks seemed to like the food. 

They did bring out an ice cream dessert for the birthday boy, and then a second (somewhat begrudged) when they realized there were 2 birthday boys. 

In summary, the food at Crustaceans is good, but not one-of-a-kind great. Is it worth to get "dressed up" for dinner here? My answer is no. Then again, their rules are so flexible a polo tee might suffice since its got a collar. With that said, there are just so many better places to go spend your money on a great dinner so why bother.
author: Jon L.

description: The food was a total disappointment. My noodles were cold and the crab was dry! I haven't eaten here in years. Don't plan on going back anytime soon.  Not to mention the bathroom was disgusting.
author: Latasha L.

description: This place came highly recommended by Chef DeJoie in ATL. He recommended the Dungeness Crab, Garlic noodles, and the shrimp toast. We had it ALL! And it was incredible! Come prepared to be WOW'd! I loved my food so much! I'm headed to LA after I leave San Fran, so I might just try the Beverly Hills located too! Yum!
author: Alicia B.

description: Good atmosphere, excellent service, but foods are just okay.
author: Yoshitsugu O.

description:
The food here is great!  Need to try the garlic rice and roasted garlic crab.

At first it doesn't seem like much but let me tell you, you'll leave needing to unbutton your pants.

The noodles as well are awesome!  Service was a little slacking but that's probably because they had an unbelievably full house.

The prices are a little high but well worth it.
author: Ryan V.

description:
Finally made it to Crustacean, a classic SF crab place.  Plus it was a business lunch meeting, so didn't have to worry about paying. Well the crab was pretty good as expected....garlic noodles just okay. Also came with some decent stir fry vegetables to complete a well balanced meal.

The outside setting is kinda grimy/urban, but of course this has nothing to do with the food.
author: Philip L.

description:
This PLACE SUCK BALLS (STRAIGHT UP)!!! We made a reservation for 10 people at 8 and i kid you not we didn't even sit in our table til 9:10PM. We kept asking the front desk lady and she kept responding with the same answer... YES THE GROUP IS PAYING THEIR BILL RIGHT NOW. I heard this is the ideal HOTSPOT for tourism of what a crab and garlic noodle should taste like right?!?!..... ABSOLUTELY NOT!

Now to the best part, as you can imagine all of us were HUNGRY and Tired and to top it off the waiter had to be obnixously RUDE!!! I wanted to cuss and talk so much smack to the upper management and being that we were all asians we kept it calm!!! We asked politely if we can get at least a discount for waiting that long but instead he ignored us and asked if were ready to order!!

I can assure you that This Will be my First and Last time visiting this shitful HORRIBLE place. SCREW YOU CRUSTACEAN!! your service SUCKS!!!
author: Ronald G.

description: The roasted crab was very good. Fresh crab for about 60 bux. We orderes the shrimp fried rice the portion was very small but we managed to share it perfectly fine. We ordered the shrimp wontons they seemed more like a shrimp egg roll. Litterally a a piece of shrimp wrapped in deepfried paper. Thy do offer vallet service for 12 bux also. Overall food was fresh and hot. Portions are small. The setting makes you feel like your at some nice 5 star resturant but its very laid back and casual. Service was good enough for a tip. For the price and location very satisfied.
author: Johnnie M.

description:
I really wanted to post this review. I ate here before I received my shellfish allergy news. I cant eat here now, but read below. This place is so good. 

Visited November 2011
Yes, this is now a top pick for me. I loved the garlic Grab and the noodles. I took a client here for dinner and we were not disapointed. The Crab was massive and cooked perfect. The Garlic was so mouth watering. Yes this is a must stop if your in San Francisco. When we got their it was empty, but when we left there was not a seat open in the house.
author: Joe M.

description: Crustaceans SF has been a long time favorite of ours! Yesterday was no exception as my wife and I celebrated our Valentines Day early. I ordered the Saigon Beef while she had the signature crab meal and mussels with the garlic noodles, rice, and bread. Waiters take care of everything timely and with precision. Parking was a cinch as well if you know the area.
author: Michael M.

description: The host was accommodating..got us a different location of seating than being in an awkward walkway..and not to mention a bigger and better table.. The food and cocktails are always delicious...we had the chicken skewers,jumbo wonton prawns,roasted crab, shaken beef and garlic noodles...The ambiance is great for any type of celebration..the wait staff is awesome and attentive....Yay!im a fan
author: Glads E.

description:
Do you ever get that feeling after you bought something...that you might have paid TOO MUCH for?  I did =/

First, I want to say that the waitstaff here is perfect.  Great service, speed, and attention.

Now for the food:

The whole "roasted crab" thing isn't really new to me, easily found at any Vietnamese (Cua rang muoi, cua rang me) or Chinese Seafood restaurants.  But after hearing about Crustacean, I thought I'd be wow'd by some magical flavor that isn't found anywhere else.  I was kinda disappointed =(

Here's what I ordered:

The roasted crab: $38.85 .  All I could taste was butter.  Not much flavor....argh what a waste!

Pan roasted halibut:  $28.  One of the better dishes of the evening.  Fish soft, moist, and cooked perfectly.  The mashed potatoes served with it was kinda...wet.  Over all, the sauce was on the sweet side.

Short-ribs:  $23-ish.  3 ribs, tender, ok flavor.

Garlic-noodles: $9.5.  As overrated as the crab.  Nothing but noodles drowned in butter and a hint of garlic.  Actually, couldn't really even taste the garlic.

I'm sorry, but were my taste buds off?  Seemed like everything was just coated in butter, butter, and more butter.  Didn't know Paula Deen worked here.

I dunno if I'd come back...
author: Thien N.

description: This was a great crab experience. I ordered the roasted crab and it was so delicious. I recommend eating it with lots of butter and rice.
author: May M.

description: Have you ever watched a nature documentary showing ravenous hyenas devouring a gazelle?  That is what came to mind as my girlfriend and I attacked the roasted Dungeness crab and garlic noodles.
author: Mike B.

description: Enjoyed our meal. We ordered roasted garlic crab, beef carpaccio, prawn wontons, garlic noodles, fried rice & shrimp toast . Next time , we would skip out on the shrimp toast. It tasted as if it was left out for a while. Other that that, everything else was delicious  The fried rice and garlic noodles need a littttttle more flavor. Still yummy .
author: nelly p.

description:
Good good good garlic noodle and crab. Best to arrive with your whole party together or you'll have to wait. 

Parking is a little tough to find but a few blocks away is a parking garage if you don't wanna do valet. 

Servers are very chatty and wanna make sure you're having a good time. 

If you take group pics after you order, food will arrive faster. 

Was pretty busy when we went, so busser took our leftovers to be packed instead of our server. Check your 'to go' boxes before you leave to make sure they weren't mixed up.
author: bcast b.

description:
If you can find a place to park...  and if you have some money to burn... this place will rock your socks off.

I love coming here. For me, it is one of those places that I know I am going to over spend and over eat and have a great time with friends, but that it will be worth it. I never feel cheated or upset the next day... no buyers remorse here.

The garlic noodles are my down fall, I could eat just plates of that stuff. Of course you want to make sure your date has lots of garlic too, so no one can be blamed for garlic breath later. LOL.

I love crab and there is nothing better than crab when it is done perfectly and seasoned perfectly...  my mouth is watering just thinking about it again.

It may not be the best place for a first date or even a second, but once you know each other well enough to blow garlic kisses across the table and eat like Henry the 8th, this is the perfect place for you.

YUMTASTICAL!
author: Corey Tess T.

description: Finally made it here! Worth the wait. A nice place, feels old though, not necessarily a bad thing though. The elevator was old and crickety but it worked so eh. Nice view also if you're seated by a window. Also had a large bar area in the back. I was tempted to get the crab cakes cause they sound so good but had to try the crab since thats what they are famous for. Saw on the website that the crab was like $50 but turned out to be about $40. Still pricey but it's seafood, so it's expected. At first I was scared of getting the crab, but my friends reassured me the body was just for shove. The body was empty, just placed on top of the legs. Whew... comes on a big plate with juices and butter to dip the crab in. They give you the cracker tong things, makes it a little easier to open the crab legs. It was really good, my tactic was take out all the meat, then feast. Also got the garlic noodles, about $10. It's all individually priced, guess we could have shared the noodles one order for two people but they reheat really well, so why not have leftovers. Would definitely come back.
author: Courtney K.

description: Really nice restaurant, good crab, bad service.
author: Lynn T.

description:
Very nice. Funny thing is I don't like crab or prawns, really. However, my cousins from out of town love this place so much they insist we always come here for dinner.

My dinner was practically just the garlic noodles and I am not ashamed of it at all. Their drinks are stellar, too. I can't remember the drink I got that was so amazing (had Ginger liqueur in it). The raspberry lemon drop was yummy as well, but a little too sweet for my taste.
author: Ariel Z.

description: Crab was the bomb, wife had the tiger prawns with garlic noodles and damn they were good! Met my expectations big time.
author: John N.

description:
Yes I am finally doing this review. I don't know why it took so long. Wait...maybe it took me eating crab at several other places including my own preparation of it to kick start this review and tell the world that it doesn't get better than Crustaceans. The An family does it right. Heck yes it's pricy for Vietnamese food. But heck yes it's worth every penny. So let me start by saying you need to be prepared to spend $55 to $64 per person. You don't do it all the time and you're crazy or mad rich if you do so enjoy it.

I will tell you that everything on the menu is great and everything should be tried once. But if you are going here for the first time you must have the roast crab and an order of garlic noodles. It's the supreme pairing here. Garlic on garlic on garlic. The garlic is actually kneaded into the noodle dough so you get garlic with each bite. The crab also soaks up the garlic butter/lard concoction that they rub all over the crab body. It truly is finger licking and don't be pretentious, enjoy your plate and get gritty.

So I see some bad knocks on the reviews here. I don't know where these bad reviews come from. My wife and I have been coming here, and their sister restaurant thanh long for many years now and we have never been disappointed. The two restaurants pretty much have identical menus. You are not saving much with thanh long so my preference is to just eat at Crustaceans. I like it better inside and it's just finer dining to me. If I'm spending over $50 anyway, my logic is another $10 shouldn't kill me.

I would recommend trying all their crab preps. The drunken and tamarind are also very tasty. The baked Alaska for dessert is the business and "drip" all over your face yummy. They have an awesome wine and bubbly menu and some cocktails too. One anniversary the wife and I shelled out $700 here. Yes, we sure did. It only takes a couple good bottles to get there. When we go, we normally order a crab a piece and garlic noodles each. We also share one other entree as our appetizer. Then we share the baked Alaska. It's a lot of food and the bill normally comes to about $180 or so with a drink or two. Crab is always market price but hovers around $35 - $48 each. 

To me this has become a part of SF and is definitely a spot to go and check out at least once. C'mon would I lead you astray? I think not. I know my one positive vibe can't over power some of the negatives here but seriously I think the negative knocks were not in it for the right things. If you want the tastiest garlic crab and garlic noodles in the world you need to come here. The end!!! Mamba out!
author: Ryan C.

description: When I had first come in, they greeted me and asked for my reservation, which was (Mary Dang). To proceed we then went to our seats. The waiter was very kind and had helped us out as we needed, when we needed. The garlic noodles was good, the shaken beef was very tender and the garlic rice was  amazing too and the carpaccio was astonishing.  As for the crab, the tamarind sauce was good, but seemed to be a little salty on some areas of the sides of the crab and same for the shaken beef as well. Once we cracked the crab, the inside didn't taste as expected. The texture tasted as if it was old/dead crab or not fresh.  Usually the crab does not have that texture nor have certain spots that were very salty on it,  that's why I was very shocked for the first time ever. Very powdery/dry inside. At the very end of it all the service was good and food was okay. One thing we did not get as we seen everyone else get was a hot wet towel at the end. This experience yesterday night was okay, but in the morning today, my boyfriend and I had very upset stomachs and felt a little sick/nauseated...not good.
author: Alazae P.

description:
WORST MANAGER (SEAN) IN THE RESTAURANT INDUSTRY. NEGATIVE REVIEW!

This is actually a NEGATIVE star review.  No matter how great the food, when bad management is involved that leads to an unpleasant experience, it will inevitably bring the business down!!!
.
Sean is the WORST manager I have ever encountered in any business. Sean is unprofessional, unpleasant, and simply RUDE.  I have dined here quite a few times and have loved the food every time.  I don't enjoy giving bad reviews, this rudeness just crossed that line!

After the 49er's victory yesterday, we arrived 8-10 min earlier than their opening hr.  Trying to make the experience short, I asked if  we can simply sit and enjoy the view at a table and have some private conversation, not asking for service or anything else,  whenever the kitchen is open, we will look at the menu.  Sean rudely responded with a snip in his voice "NO, We're not open, you can wait outside"  OKAY.

SEAN, YOU ARE NOT DOING ANYONE ANY FAVORS BY US DINING THERE.  YOU NEED TO LOOK FOR ANOTHER PROFESSION THAT DOES NOT REQUIRE PEOPLE SKILLS, WHICH YOU CERTAINLY LACK!  

WE WILL NOT RETURN OR RECOMMEND THIS PLACE AS LONG AS SEAN IS THERE!  

He said " I'm the manager and my name is Sean that's spelled S.E.A.N."  At least  you can spell your own name!  Good start, now go back to school and get yourself some edumacation!!
author: Michelle A.

description: Went here for Valentine's with my girlfriend; The 3 course meal was worth it. Twas so delicious!!!
author: Jason T.

description:
Had a double date here while we had one of our frequent visits to the city.  Classy joint for a place where you dig in with your hands - we liked it!  

We got An's Garlic Noodles egg noodles infused with An's famous garlic sauce 9.50.  The noodles were lacking a garlic taste as in their description.  On the bland side with perhaps more of an oily taste than anything flavorful.  

The Tamarind Crab in a sweet and sour sauce with of tomatoes, fresh dill, Vietnamese chili, and fresh herbs not be a great combination for some, but it was perfect for me.  I particularly enjoyed this dish because when I usually dine on crab, it is with simple seasonings, either steamed alone or dipped with salt/pepper and lemon.  This interesting twist with tamarind sauce gave it variety and went well with the crab.  
 
We ended the night with a Baked Alaskan.  It does not compare at all to Boston's Steakhouse Grill 23's baked Alaskian (a standard in which I now compare all of the Baked Alaskians in the world to).  It was barely even a baked Alaskan and I strongly urge them to renaming the dish to avoid misunderstandings by the patrons.  I was expecting a baked Alaskan but found myself eating something more along the lines of a slice of cake with ice cream on the side. 

All in all a good place for their seafood - a bit on the pricey side, but it makes up for it in ambiance.  You could probably get more money's worth at Boiling Crab or places like that, but here you can get your hands messy on a pristine white linen tablecloth :)
author: Theresa V.

description:
Roasted crab and garlic noodles...the 2 items that one needs to order here. Buttery, garlicky, peppery goodness. Everyone ive introduced this crab to has fallen in love with Crustaceans. The garlic noodles I can do without but the crab is really the true winner of the pair. 

Since I found a copycat recipe online to this dish that has come pretty darn close to the actual thing, I havent been patronizing. But if youre not a whiz in the kitchen and dont want to bother then I'd head over here.

FYI they do have a dress code. No sports attire and the guys have to wear a collared shirt. I know, such a pain since youre going to get messy eating all that crab. If you dont want to deal with that shiz.. head over to their less prissy sister restaurant Thahn Long. Bon Apetit!
author: Cynthia A.

description:
Eating here for over a decade - flying in from NY it was always the first and last dinners of the trip. Back in 2007 we brought our son who said it was the best meal he'd ever eaten. Last year we moved to Nevada and spent four nights in SF - two meals again at Crustacean! Food is amazing and the service is like family.
So this is a shout out to Paul B and Matthew who made those dinners (and my birthday) the BEST EVER. The BERGERS will be back again in NOVEMBER!
author: Lin B.

description:
Yay! Crustacean!

That could be the end of my review but I'll continue...

Knowing that SF is where the original Thang Long legend started, I had to dine at the SF Crustacean. It wasn't too different from the LA one and I enjoyed it just the same. Opted for a little calamari to start out with with a Grey Goose Greyhound (made strong). Main dish with the royal prawns and garlic noodles of course. Also had a little tasting of the halibut - fresh and light just like I would have it.

No dessert this night, had to reserve some space for the holiday meals for the weekend.

All in all, a great place. Would love to try Thang Long (probably will also be the same though). Similar to Crustacean LA and similar to Anqi in OC.

To the poster who complained about having the Chilean Seabass on the menu - you're protesting ineffectively like your Occupy SF brethren. If you really have a problem with having this on the menu, boycott the restaurant and give your seat to one of us. Also if you have such a problem, wouldn't talking to the OWNER make more sense than the "head of the restaurant" which arguably was just the manager? Why not make flyers and petition the city council? Complaining at a restaurant is about as effective as pooping in their bathroom and not flushing...ooooh scary!
author: Julia P.

description:
Came here with a large party and had their famous roasted crab and garlic noodles.

Enormous garlic roasted crab was fabulous. Not enough butter remaining though for the garlic noodles (which was fair, but not as garlicky as I'd liked).

Roasted mussels and some of the BEST Salt and Pepper calamari I've ever had.

I've had better garlic roasted crab, but this place is definitely a big hit in my book.

Very pricey for what you get though.
author: David H.

description: The roasted crab and either the garlic rice or garlic noodles are the staple of this restaurant. They deliver the same above excellent quality of food and service for the last 14 years I been coming. Whether with the wife alone or business friends in from out of town, if you never had dreams on how good something can taste, give it a try and find out.
author: Paul G.

description: My dinner at Crustaceans was great. We celebrated my son's 35th birthday, so it was very special for me. It didn't disappoint, the food was presented beautifully, the food was delicious, and the service was wonderful. Our food server  Dan was awesome. My son had the lobster, with the garlic noodles. I had the halibut very tasty. This has become my favorite restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Clarceen C.

description:
The service here was great. The waitstaff was remarkably attentive (about 6:30 on Sunday evening, so there were only a few dozen tables seated) and quite nice. 

Our food was brought out practically instantaneously. 

Our waiter recommended the Dungeness crab and garlic noodles (which is what everyone recommends) and we loved them both. Really, really tasty. Definitely get both, and come HUNGRY!

For an appetizer we had the prawn spring rolls. Nice. 

If I return to San Fran again, this is definitely a rich, filling meal that I would enjoy again.
author: Helena M.

description:
My boyfriend and I actually came here on accident, we were looking for Craw Station because our friends said it was good but no one told us how the place was spelled. Oh my.

Anywho, it was raining and since we're in San Francisco: it was freezing too. We stepped in and I felt instantly confused because our friends said this place was like a crab shack but it was the complete opposite ! I felt like I was going to an opera, the place was so dark and grim, I could barely see the host that was in front of us. We were instantly seated down, there were groups in front of us: this place is definitely a place to go with a big group. 

We were seated down and got our menu. I was still confused how our friends said this was ANYTHING like Joe's Crab Shack, nothing on the menu was as cheap as a regular crab restaurant. I told my boyfriend to contact one of our friends who went and they told us "Craw Station", I was a bit upset because I was hoping we could get down and dirty with our shrimp, but in this restaurant: I think you'd get kicked out for that. Haha. We decided to just stay because we paid $15 for parking (which was up the street from the restaurant) and we were starving so here we are with my review.

Our waitress was nice, I'm glad she didn't judge us by our attire because I certainly felt under-dressed while everyone walking around were wearing suits and dresses. We ordered the roasted crab (I don't remember seeing a price for it, I think it just said "marker price") and a "large" bowl of their garlic rice, which was $8. 

The place is for sure slapped "fancy" labeled. Some guy came to our table and put our bibs on us ! I started laughing because I think people should just put it on, not have a designated person put on bibs. Very fancy, rich touch but very unnecessary. He also gave us 3 bowls for our shells, the crab cracker and a itty bitty tiny fork. I laughed at the fork too because I've never eaten crab before (the actual crab, not the meat taken out already like in sushi and soups) but I have seen people just pull the meat out with their fingers. I asked my boyfriend what the fork was for and he told me it was to get the meat out of the crab. 

Our crab arrived and our "large" bowl of their garlic rice (which was as big as 2 egg holders put together). The crab smelled delicious though and it tasted delicious too. A bit too salty for me but it was fun to finally break my own crab and pick out the meat myself. The garlic rice didn't taste bad either. Maybe the crab got to me but everything later on started to taste WAY too salty. I had to keep drinking water, our waitress lagged on our water a couple times which got my a bit frustrated because I couldn't continue eating my food unless my tongue revived back to life with their water. When I got closer to finishing our crab, I gave up on the fork and just pulled the meat out myself. I also asked for a small cup of butter, I wish I asked earlier because it tasted delicious with their hot butter :)

So our meal was done and I'm pretty sure we were the messiest people there but I could care less. The bib guy came back and removed our bibs, oh my. Haha. Our bill came and WOW our crab was $39 itself. I mean, it was GOOD but NOT THAT GOOD for $39. Oh well! It was a good experience but I wouldn't come back. I felt like our food could have been stolen off our table without us knowing because it was so dark. Make sure to bring a flashlight ! :)
author: Grace Anne D.

description: It's been about 10 years since we last ate here and it'll definitely be our last.  We came here for my birthday and regret this decision.  This used to be a very high class dining destination. It's converted to subpar service with ultra fine dining prices.  Everyone including the staff were dressed incredibly casual.  I gave it two stars only because the garlic noodles were good, but the portion was cut in half.  The roasted crab tasted different too. Next time, we'll dine at their sister restaurant, Thanh Long instead.
author: Nate C.

description: Came here after hearing that their specialties (specifically the garlic noodles and the crab) were amazing. After ordering the garlic noodles ($12) and the beef ($25) however, I was disappointed in the quality. Big pricetag for what I felt was "decent" food- the garlic noodles are basically your standard buttered noodles and the shaken beef was good, but nothing special (I am Vietnamese and my mom could very well make the same beef). Very nice place, great and accommodating staff, but overpriced and overhyped food.
author: Vũ H.

description:
This place is nice from the inside. From the outside it looks like a hole in the wall kind of place, but the food was GREAT. The garlic noodles were my favorite!! It had a great taste. The tofu roll with the bean sauce was Good as Well.

The food is average perhaps like cheese cake factory or less depending what you get so it 's not that bad.

The only thing i did'nt like was that we waited about an hour to get out food, so go before your at the point of starving haha!!!. Our reservation was at 7:00p.m and we received it at 8:15 but at the same time it was 10 of us so that might have been the reason why.

P.S!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

If you have a large group, check your bill, they over charged us 2 extra crabs.
Mistake or not!! We lucky caught that! Saved $85 dollars!
author: Sandy G.

description:
Family and I went out to try these amazing crabs, we decided to order the druken, roasted, and tamarind crabs and I have to say they were amazing. It paired nicely with a  white wine and the garlic noodles. I would have to say of the three choices the tamarind crab was the best it has a nice sweet flavor and really makes you wish there was more hanging around. 
Overall, it was a great experience, exceptional service, and wonderful time. I would highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Sasan J.

description: Bad flipping service. Never going back there again. Waiter didn't even come check on us from time to time. Looked at us as if we didn't have money. NEVER GOING BACK THERE.         Ps. I didn't give tip at all.
author: Atit V.

description:
In a random location but nonetheless, I'm a fan of this place.

When you come here you only order two things:  the humongous crab and the garlic noodles.  So deeerrrriiiiiiiiicccciiiioooooooussssss!!!  BUT super pricey.  I think the crab alone was $45+.  Don't think it's worth that much but if you're out to spend that $$$$.  If not, stick to thanh long.  Way cheaper and it's still pretty good.
author: Criselle O.

description: excellent service. the food was great. crustaceans did pave they way for other restaurants to copycat their garlic roasted crab--- for a cheaper price as well. but it doesn't matter because for those extra couple dollars, crustaceans do crack and clean it up for you. more tasty.
author: Lisa V.

description: My second visit and amazing as ever! The Roasted Crab is always a crowd pleaser...along with the famous garlic noodles! Yum! I also had the Vanilla Bean Creme Brule which was torched to absolute perfection! A+....our French waitor was extremely helpful and classy.
author: Maria M.

description:
Isn't there a dress code for this place?  Upon walking in I noticed the attire wasn't what I thought it'd be.  I felt a bit overdressed for this place.  

I've been a long time fan of Thanh Long and when I heard about Crustacean's I knew I had to book mark it and save this restaurant for "special occasions." Today my boyfriend and I headed out to the city.  I wanted to surprise him with a romantic dinner since their ratings say that it has "classy" for the attire and the "ambiance" was romantic.  

First, the parking.  This place is located in a complex that hides Crustacean's from the street view.  It's either you go valet or drive around 'till you find a spot.  It's similar to TL, but TL is located in a less busy street.  Also, one big difference is the constant begging on change by the homeless around the complex, which makes it a bit uncomfortable when treasure hunting for the roasted crab.  

Second, arrival.  Walking from the main floor up three flights of stairs was no problem for me.  We walked by an abandon supermarket on the first floor that had rotting vegetation and soggy cardboard boxes in the mid section, the stench was intolerable. It nearly reeked of homeless piss and garbage.  

Third, the meal.  We were seated relatively fast since it was just the two of us.  Sadly, the dining room was laid out pretty confusing.  The food, however, was just as I remembered it from TL.  My boyfriend was impressed as well.  The service was up to par. 

Fourth, the bathrooms.  There's only one toilet in the woman's latrine.  You're essentially screwed if there's a ton of woman that needs to piss in groups.  

The facility was lacking.  It's an old, over ran complex that definitely needs an upgrade.  Took a bit too long to get my check.

I think i'll stick to TL.
author: Lea M.

description: The roasted crab and garlic noodles is a must! Little on the pricey side, but at first taste, you're hooked! Can't wait to eat there again. The pear martini... Ahhhhmazing
author: Jessica D.

description: Shocked this place even has 3 stars - such a bizarre, disappointing experience. Located in a pretty beat-up mall-type building, it is a weird spot. The inside is surprisingly nice considering the exterior, but the positives ended there for me. Such an odd mix of people, lots of tourists it seemed. Food was honestly gross, there is no other way to put it. I got the prawns and "famous" garlic noodles - the prawns were nearly impossible to eat, hardly any meat on them (I left starving). So greasy and flavorless, same for the garlic noodles. Heaps of grease, barely edible. Got the check and was further shocked, so expensive for the quality! $150 for two people? Seriously? Sub-par inattentive service, took ten+ full minutes for our waiter to pick up our check once we put down a credit card. Will not be back, would not recommend.
author: Taylor A.

description: Pretty under average and overpriced!  We ordered the "famous" crab, shaken beef, fried calamari and tiger prawn and were very disappointed. Well there was a first time for everything and this will be the last!
author: Stanley N.

description:
The food is pricey and it was just A-OK.

Roast Crab: ok
Garlic Noodles: Good flavor. Would be good with some ingredients?
Steamed Seabass: Lacking flavor and not tender.
Seasonal Veggies: Some beans? Uh...I was expecting something leafy...

And the desserts were also just ok.
author: Minako S.

description: Just don't. Please don't waste your money! I literally never even write reviews, but I feel the SF community needs to know that this place is a total scam. Oily, greasy, terrible quality... My crab cake was cold and disgusting after the waiter had claimed it was whole Dungeness crab but it tasted like artificial cat food. When I sent it back (literally never done this in my life) he wasn't even surprised... IN FACT. when I asked him what I should get instead he had a nervous laugh. I tried to order the ahi tuna and he refused me. I literally asked him what he orders off the menu and he gave me a blank stare. Just. Don't. Even. BOTHER. DISGUSTING.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Oh Crustacean's, it's been too long since we last were together and I promise that I shall never be absent from you like that ever again. Had a a belated birthday dinner here last night and although it's literally been YEARSSSS since I last ate here, the meal was just as delicious as I remember. 

Excellent service, beautiful surroundings and the food was delicious. We weren't hungry enough for appetizers (In previous years, we used to always order the beef skewers, shrimp toast, coconut prawns and papaya salad with calamari...ALL those appetizers were excellent). But last night, we stuck with the basics: crab and garlic noodles. My friend had the roasted crab and I had the drunken crab. Both were fabulous. I will stick with the roasted crab in the future. Loved the flavor of the drunken crab, but I love the roasted crab more.

We shared the fried bananas for dessert, and because I was a lucky winner from a Twitter contest, we got our dessert comped. Yay! :) 

Definitely go for valet parking because finding parking in this area is a PITA.
author: Christine R.

description: Really great place, great place for a date night! Took my girlfriend for her birthday! The garlic noodles and the crab is AMAZING!!!! I must admit, it is very expensive(our bill was $173) but it's worth it to me!
author: Corey B.

description:
I just want to say to all my family who read what I am about to write, please forgive me if I offend you!

Overview:
Gonna keep this real plain and straight to the point. Overpriced, garlic noodles are ok, and the location of this place was...a bit different. Furthermore, the wife and I bought us some live crab months after coming to this place and we made up our own recipes. cooked, seasoned, and cleaned the crabs ourselves! delish!! If it wasn't for the company that we were with when we went to Crustaceans...I wouldn't have gone. 

Likes:
The ambiance, the service, good appetizers......hmmm this is tough. cant think of nothin' else. pretty sad!

Dislikes:
The price. what we paid for dinner could have covered a third of my car payment. I couldn't even see the Chef or the cooks....."you-hooo, where is the chef. just felt like I was in a building and food would appear from out of no where...Chercher la cuisine (look for the kitchen) next time you go, youll see what I mean.

Final words:
This is a nice place for bragging rights to me! everyone that mentions the name "Crustaceans" either knows that they've experienced the pricey restaurant foo-foo thing, or they dont know whats coming.
author: Nova S.

description: I had a friend who came into town on Tuesday. She mentioned that she wanted to go here and that the food was so good. Since we were both here on business, I thought, let's go. I made reservations. The food was so good. I had charbroiled shrimp and garlic noodles (we both did). Our server was fantastic. I will definitely go there again.
author: MzPrizzy S.

description:
My boyfriends family took me here for my last night in California. It's located in a pretty unique center in downtown SF. The BF's dad dropped us off in the street to head up first while he found street parking. We didn't realized there was an elevator and took the stairs up to the third floor. It wasn't a bad walk up and I was pretty mesmerized with the jujitsu going on the second floor.

Don't judge the restaurant by the appearance of the plaza outside. It might look a little shabby but the inside looked pretty upscale. I didn't think there would be as much seating from the outside but it's pretty specious with tables inside. Some tables are located in tight corners and you have to move chairs to get to your seat however. The lighting was a little dim but not to the point where you couldn't see.

I was reassured by the BF's dad to choose whatever I wanted. We basically family styled and picked a whole bunch of dishes. I didn't get a chance to snap any photos since we were eating with his family. We had two calarmari appetizers, lobster and pasta, crab cakes, shaken beef and noodles, and three of the garlic crabs. We didn't realize that most of the entrees would come with the garlic noodies. His mom had put in an extra side order for one beforehand. So if you order the entrees they come with their own side so make sure you read before you put in any extra orders. The crab under the special menu doesn't come with any sides however.

The calamari was amazing and lobster pasta. I didn't care too much for the crab cakes since I've had better. The crab inside to me didn't taste too fresh. The garlic noodles was pretty delicious but the shaken beef was tender and juicy. Our waitress beforehand had told us she'd save the crabs for last since we'd have to use our hands to eat it. The sad part was by the time the crabs came out I was so stuffed from our entrees. I couldn't enjoy the crab as much as I had wanted. I ate one section of the crabs leg but that was the duration it took everyone else to attack the three crabs. My boyfriend couldn't help but laugh when I told him I had eaten this single section while he had already tackled three sections. 

Oh, I forgot to mention they really prep you before you eat the crabs. You're provided with plastic bibs, cute tiny forks and claw crackers. Someone is always there to remove dishes you've cleared out and replacing your small plates with new ones. You're left with tons of bowls to put your crab shells as you eat. By the end of the meal you're given a super hotly steamed towel to clean off your hands. 
I can't say it's the best crab I've had since I'm from the south but for California it was pretty darn good. 

We settled for some dessert to share (vanilla bean creme brulee, vanilla mango cheesecake, and flour less chocolate cake with ice cream) which was all delicious besides the cheesecake.  Everyone came out pretty clean besides poor bf's dad. He was stuck doing claw duty for the mom and sister and was splatter with crab meat and juice. His family loved the food and we had lots of fun and laughter the whole time. The host struck conversation with us at the door and asked us how the meal was. My bf's dad had been to Vegas the night before admitted his winnings covered our meal for that evening. As we left the host recommended we come back after his next Vegas trip with winnings.
author: Lina T.

description:
Besides receiving a Michelin star, I swear I was making sweet love to my garlic pasta and sea food raviolis.  But that was me, if you want to know how delectable it really was,  you should have seen  the two tables in front of  me because they were doing a lot more than that.

See while I was making sweet love  with my food each of those tables had ordered a whole crab; perfectly normal, but instead of breaking the legs open with there hands or using a  tool to break them open, they used there teeth; even the body.  I have  never seen a crab devoured from shell to meat with a set of teeth before.  

If  that doesn't say it all, I don't  know what does. 

I gave it a two dollar sign because that was the price  of  our meal.. they obviously had more expensive  food.  Well worth it though.l
author: Tammy B.

description: compared to thang long, this is unacceptable, just ok... wasn't satisfied at all for the money and 18% gratuity, for non attentive service, never again....,thang long #1, hate i came here and didn't take the extra drive
author: connie c.

description: SO GOOD! You can seriously spend a few hours here eating and drinking. Not exaggerating when I say that everything I've ever ordered here is delicious. My favorites are definitely the Garlic noodles and Roast Crab
author: Riley P.

description: I heard about this place a few times and wanted to eat there during my first trip to San Francisco. I got the Crab Puffs and Roast Crab. Both had no taste. Also the other two people in my party didn't eat all their food and complained about not really enjoying their food either. This visit to this restaurant was my first and last, and did not meet my expectations. It's too over priced to have food that does not meet or exceed expectations.
author: Sasha B.

description: We really loved this place!  I think I may have liked their Dungeness crab more than R&G Lounge.  Though it was very close competition.  Their crab seemed to be either boiled or steamed and it was in a salted butter sauce.  It was absolutely delicious! I eat a lot and could barely finish my meal.  The meat was fresh, flaky and tender.  They seasoned it all the way through.  The garlic butter sauce was addicting.  My husband drenched all his crab meat in the sauce and ate it as a soup, lol!  That is how good it is!  We also ordered a lot of sides, such as fried rice and a very other items.  I was not impressed with their sides, but it was a good compliment to the crab.
author: Tam J.

description: Lovely dinner.  Best crab I have had in a long time.  Garlic noodles are DELISH.  Service was super attentive and the environs were nice and updated.  I have come here off and on over the years...the last couple of visits had been disappointing...but they are definitely back to the quality of service they always used to be.
author: Amy M.

description: I'm in town very often and I find myself here a lot the crab and noodles is the BOMB!!!
author: MissDiamond H.

description: If I could rate a 0 I would at this point. My boyfriend & I drove over 1hr to have dinner on 7/8 I made reservations for 7:30pm we arrived punctually & were seated almost immediately. A family came in at the same time as us and they mentioned to be arriving early for their 8:30pm reservation and were seated at the same time as us. We were first to be seated after 3 more groups were seated around us and first to order yet why were we the last to be served our food. After watching people be served garlic noodles and crab exactly what we ordered we felt disgusted by the service. Maybe it could be because we were the youngest in the crowd or maybe because they felt their money was worth more than what we were willing to spend. Who knows!? When we decided to leave and complain to the manager & explained our feelings he said "I'm sorry you feel that way". I will never return even though this place was truly once our favorite!
author: D H.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to go for a special occasion. All of the seafood is cooked to perfection so you really can't go wrong with anything you choose!

Do not leave without trying the garlic noodles they are to die for!!!!

Note, there is a dress code...guys make sure to wear a sports coat...

Classy atmosphere, exceptional food, y good cocktails, celebrate your next anniversary here.
author: Maya-Luisa G.

description:
U BETTER BELIEVE IT!!!!!
I love this place, have been here ALOT.  
this is the bomb, the food and the ambiance is EXCELLENT.  The service is SUPERB.  Validated parking at the Holiday Inn.  

start off with the Coconut Prawns = the bomb
soft shelled crab, mussels, crispy rice paper roll = the bomb.
garlic noodles = the bomb
ROASTED CRAB = THE SUPER BOMB
ROYAL TIGER PRAWNS = the bomb

This is a must go to place before you die.  THE END
author: Nic C.

description:
Heart Dine About Town, and it was a perfect place for my co-worker friend and I to meet in the middle between Pac Heights and Nob Hill to have dinner one June evening.  I got there early and enjoyed a nice rose sparking wine, sunny evening view, lots of people.  Awww...

I had:
* Chicken skewers (just the right amount, yummy taste, very tender - mmm!  I would get this again in a heartbeat!)
* Prawns and garlic noodles (I could always eat more prawns, but those garlic noodles were quite garlic-y, just the way I like it!!)
* Fried bananas (huge! just had some at Le Colonial a few nights ago too - these were bigger but a little heavier, good taste, but I like them on the lighter batter side)

We had a great time catching up, and they didn't rush us out the door after our meal.  It was a nice relaxed time over a lovely dinner with really nice, friendly service.  

Thank you, Crustacean!  :)
author: Maile N.

description:
We came here on a Friday night to celebrate a friend's bday.  The restaurant was pretty empty, and they had no trouble accommodating our table of 6 on the same day.

Service: A++ 
The servers were very polite and prompt to fill our drinks.  They were on top of cleaning out our plates and making sure that we had what we needed.  The waiters also help you put on your bibs!

Food: A-

Lychee Martini: delicious! I asked the bartender to make it stiff as lychee martinis are usually way too sweet for me and he made it just perfect.

garlic crab: as the feature of the night, i was afraid that it would not live up to its hype.  However, it was as good as everyone else described on Yelp!  The crab had a lot of meat and it was very fulfilling.

garlic noodles: I had high hopes for the garlic noodles but it was a bit disappointing.  it wasn't garlicy enough for me.  Also, about 30 minutes after its been sitting out, i noticed that the noodles were sitting in oil/fat and it was kind of disgusting.

seabass: i love seabass and Crustacean did it right.  I probably won't order this again though because they're endangered species... eek!

overall the food was great!

Price: B
It always amazes me how expensive Vietnamese Fusion Cuisine is.  Crustacean is no exception.  Be prepared for a high bill, but you can't escape from it no matter which Viet fusion restaurant you go to.
author: Jenn G.

description: Have been coming to this place for years now. The garlic crab and garlic noodles are amazing. So is the garlic tiger prawns.
author: Dianna S.

description:
Came here with a big group about a week ago. My boyfriend had the crab and I had the halibut dish. The crab was good and the halibut was ok- seemed too salty. Our server was great considering the size of the group. 
I was not overly blown away. To me, it was just ok.
author: Kirstyn V.

description: SO GOOD. If ur not a fan of garlic go for the drunken crab. My go to place for crustaceans!
author: Jesus B.

description: I live in Georgia so we don't get much seafood restaurant so this place is amazing! I just love the Dungeoness crab.  It is the most amazing food I have ever tried!!!
author: Chris H.

description:
I came here for one main reason - Garlic noodles. I checked out the menu ahead of time and saw that most items on the menu are super expensive. I figure I could keep some control on the cost by sticking with the noodles. It's also rated as very expensive on Yelp, but it's actually located in a sort of dingy place downtown next to the Holiday Inn (great hotel, btw).

The first impression from entering the restaurant from the elevator was set by the maitre d in an expensive suit with a weird stuffy snobby accent. It was very noticeable in his manner of speaking and I noticed other suited staff had similar mannerisms. 

Our waitress was quite enthusiastic about the menu but like I said we wanted to keep our dinner light and quick. My friend noticed her enthusiasm wane immediately when we said that. 

The garlic noodles are interesting -i'm told they're very unique. They were good but not mindblowing. I think thats just my taste. I have seen them on other menus so if you're interested in trying those, I'd venture to say that there are other options. We did have some other things. The lobster roll was lacking in lobster meat, the Saigon Beef very good - especially the marinated peppers. The grilled calamari had a weird taste to it, I fear that it wasn't the freshest that day. 

On the way out I saw most people were eating crab. The crab looked HUGE on other people's tables - and by the sounds of it, the other reviews are quite positive about the food - so I'd say average on the food, but -1 on the unnecessary snobbinesse
author: Lawrence L.

description:
Food is comparable to Thanh Long. The garlic noodles were good. The garlic roasted crab was delicious. My only warning... beware of the decor! The couches/dining seats are quite nasty as of a few yrs ago. But hey, at least I didn't run into any cockroaches! =P  It needs a major decor and furniture make over. I could see the dried crab and food juices on furniture. The curtain decor was thinned out and semi ripped. It put a damper on my appetite. You're better off driving to the sunset district for Thanh Long where ambiance meets superb pricey food.

I give the place 3 stars for the food here. Service was kind of slow on a weeknight.
1 star for ambiance.
author: Sandra L.

description:
Food:
Let me start with the good. The roast crab is a must have! If you aren't planning on having it, make sure there is someone on your table who won't mind you stealing a claw or two. The crab is easily a 5/5. Sadly, the good ends there (at least for my most recent experience).
I was at Crustacean for my post-birthday lunch in April, and almost nothing that came to our table was hot. We didn't order any cold dishes. I usually look forward to the shrimp toast and calamari at Crustacean, but that day, the center of the shrimp toast was cold, almost like it had been in the refrigerator, and the calamari was warm at best. Even the garlic noodles came out half cold, half warm. Every single dish except for the crab had to be sent back to be heated.

Ambiance:
Lunch at Crustacean feels a bit weird. The restaurant is almost empty and the dark surroundings make it almost eerie. For dinner, the ambiance is much more natural, as the dark interior doesn't clash with the outside like it does during the day.

Service:
The service we received was very good, and has been consistently good every time I go. Our server did seem a bit flustered after taking dish after dish back to the kitchen--I would have been too, considering how servers seem to get blamed for things they don't have control over.

Overall:
My last experience at Crustacean was simply embarrassing. I was looking forward to having a great crab lunch with my family, with piping hot shrimp toast, calamari, and garlic noodles. Instead we got a lot of disappointment. This isn't a case of one messed up dish. It is a case of an entire meal ruined because the kitchen couldn't heat our food properly. I hate to say it, because I used to love Crustacean, but the next time I'm in San Francisco, I might have to avoid Crustacean and find another crab place.
author: Stanley H.

description:
Unfortunately, Crustaceans did not live up to my expectations at all. After my husband and I decided to have dinner here one night, while I was pet sitting in the area, we felt the service was very poor as was the attitude of the people who worked here.

This is supposed to be an upscale establishment, revered for it's awards and well known for it's quality and service. The food isn't cheap and so I would expect that the atmosphere reflect the price tag. Although, we did not have reservations, it was a slower weekday night and we managed to get seated at a table for two, unfortunately, along side another couple who seemed to have forgotten they were not dining at McDonalds but at an upscale eatery.

From the moment we were seated, the other young couple behind us was not only on their cellphone the entire time but had it on SPEAKER phone, set on the table while carrying on a conversation that was both loud, vulgar and disrupting to everyone else. I had notified the waiter of the situation and at first they assured me that they knew and the manager was going to take care of it. We decided to be patient at this point and ordred our food while the conversations persisted. After about 15min of waiting for the establishment to tell these people to turn off their speaker phone or carry on the conversation elsewhere, my patience became to tire quickly as I was trying to enjoy a romantic dinner with my husband and we could not even hear ourselves over the swearing and laughing going on behind between that couple and whoever was on the other end of the speaker phone. I decided to get up and seek out other staff regarding the situation and asked to speak to the manager when they had notified me he was not available at this time and most seemed unaware about the situation. Our waiter had assured us originally that the manager was aware and was going to do something about it as well as reassuring me that their policy did not allow for cell phone conversations to be carried out in their dining room. Considering, this was not just someone answering their phone to say a few quick words but rather an immature couple of kids, carrying out an on going conversation on via speaker phone, you would think that the staff and manager would have been on it within minutes. Clearly, that was not the case and we were given the run around for a good 20min before we even heard the option of being seated elsewhere, which I felt was rather rude and unprofessional. I feel they should have asked the loud couple behind us sitting there to turn off their speaker phone since they were the ones bothering us and I'm sure other diners as well.

Once we were moved, it was more quiet, however, after placing our ordered we felt rather ignored. I can't even begin to talk about how disappointing the food and service was compared to Thanh Long's (the sister restaurant.) In fact, the garlic noodles were extremely mushy and overcooked and the shaking beef entry we got for nearly $30 was an extremely tiny portions, with 2/3 of the plates filled with green beans and a few cubes of tough and chewy beef in the middle. After the waiter finally came by, we declined any dessert and asked for our bill. They did absolutely nothing to compensate us for the miserable first half of the evening by giving us a discount on the bill or offering free dessert. We were rather, quite shocked..that the tea we ordered was $7 for us to share a small pot with a single tea bad and absolutely no refill of water. I've paid less to drink loose leaf tea. I just felt so underwhelmed by both the food and service that my husband and I vowed not to come back and are glad we booked Thanh Long for our anniversary instead. The person who owns both establishments should be aware of how differently customers are being treated at both restaurants and should do something to change that quickly, if they want customers to ever return.

So folks, if you want roast garlic crab and garlic noodles, head over to PPQ's Dungenous Island or Thanh Long instead, otherwise, you and your date will not have a memorable experience.
author: Petra S.

description:
Good, food .Pricy drinks,  I crab dinner ,Ahi Tuna small plate .a little dark $118.00
plus tax and tip. No doggie bag needed. We will be back :)
author: Lynne R.

description: We had a Great experience at Crustaceans. The service was prompt, the food and drinks were excellent and so was the desert. We started off the meal with some fried Calamari. It was not as crispy as I would have liked but that's just a personal preference, but it was still really good and the dipping sauce had great flavor. Following our appetizer they brought the main course our Garlic Crab and Garlic noodles. The Crab was was wonderful, very flavorful and very full with meat. The Garlic noodles that they are "famous" for as described by the waiter were just ok. I heard a lot about them so maybe my expectations were just to high. But they had good flavor but I don't see why they are so famous. Overall great experience and I am looking forward for a chance to return.
author: Jeremy H.

description: I came here after a long fun day of hiking and an escape room in San Francisco all day with my girlfriend and a group of her friends. We all saw the prices ahead of time and got scared but gave it a shot anyways! No one out of us 7 even slightly enjoyed their food; for what reason? Not a single person got even half full and none of the food, honestly, was even "good." You usually say quality or quantity at most places, this place had neither one. As I ate, I wondered why so many people were eating here. The crab was nothing but hot water, salt, and pepper. The fried race could have been prepared at home better, they forgot an order of food, and speaking of which, customer service was terrible. Considering we had to raise and wave our hands multiple times. Everyone was disappointed and got mad about the waste of time and money and it ruined everyone's night by eating here. Seafood from anywhere is served better, with more flavor, and larger portions, with better customer service. Garlic  Noodles were not worth it compared to claw shack or kickin crab and again, overpriced anyways. We were forced to pay gratuity as well... we were literally wondering if we ahold split tables because the service was horrible and didn't want to tip their undeserving workers. Never eating in this area f San Francisco again after this incident.
author: Perry P.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place out since EVERYONE always talks about here.  I went with my boyfriend for Valentine's Day, and besides their famous roasted crab and garlic noodles, I'm not sure if it's worth all the hype.

SERVICE:  we made reservations and when we arrived we were seated soon after.

WAITER:  disgusting.  When he first came to get our drink/wine order, he smelled of alcohol.  If you aren't working in a bar, you shouldn't be smelling of booze, especially when customers are there celebrating valentine's day.  When he came by to bring our appetizers, he then smelled of booze AND cigarettes.  

APPETIZER:  I had the corriander crusted ahi tuna salad.  It came with arugula.  I was not impressed.  I tried to give them the excuse that they prepped everything EARLY for the vday rush, but I could tell my tuna wasn't prepared fresh.  It seems like it was crusted the night before, frozen & then left to defrost the day of.  My arugula wasn't crisp and fresh; it was wilty like it had been sitting out for hours.

ENTRE:  Of course I got the roasted crab with garlic noodles.  This had made up for our stinky waiter and crappy appetizer.

DESSERT:  I had the baked alaska.  It's a layered dessert with choc cookie on the bottom, ice cream, choc mousse, and meringue w/their immitation of a banana foster on the side.  I love ALL desserts, but there was nothing special or fancy about it.  And their banana foster was just sliced bananas with carmel drizzled on top.

Valentine's day was a prix fixe menu at $80.  With our wine it came to $320 by the end of dinner.  If you are a decent cook, surely you can make their roasted crab and garlic noodles at home.  For all the hype and craze, I didn't eat anthing I couldn't make myself at home & for this reason, I wouldn't go back.
author: Sara T.

description: That's a done deal folks! Delicious! Great service and food. Everything and more than I expected. We saw it on a food show and finally made it there. Of course we had the famous stuff and more. The (what looked to me like spaghetti with butter and garlic and I'm not a spaghetti fan) garlic noodles were awesome. The dish is unique. I wasn't surprised because of their reputation. Our server Roy was awesome.
author: Dawn S.

description:
How do you expect to be high class while dining with a plastic bib on? 
It just doesn't work. 

Crusteacean was created to cater to the yuppy crowd, the original Thanh-Long is better.

The food was good, but the servers need an attitude adjustment.  Just because we don't order 1 crab each, we shouldn't have our food tossed at us, the plates were actually rocking on the table.

Crustacean you are trying too hard to be something that you are not, a snooty fine dining restaurant.  It's time for you to check your roots and remember where you came from.
author: Liz T.

description:
Had a reservation for 7:45 and got there at 7:20. Host would not seat us because we were early. Thats understandable, but a different host next to her let us know seconds later that he could seat us in a few minutes. What? So why did the first host say she was unable to seat us if there are tables open?

Despite the female host not wanting to seat us for some reason, I would come back because the food is good.
author: Nancy W.

description:
3.5 is the perfect rating for this place overall. I gave it 3 because it didnt quite deserve the 4 stars in my book. 

While everything was fairly priced, the appetizers were not spectacular - they merely kept me from starving while we waited for the crab. 3 stars here

The garlic noodles - 3 stars. I was actually looking forward to this because of all the hype yelp generated! However, I was kind of disappointed when I actually tasted them; its nothing special. 

The roast crab - 4 stars. The garlic and butter was great - I definitely wanted more of the garlic sauce though! Kind of bummed that they don't offer or give you a separate dipping dish for their garlic sauce because its bomb. Other than that, this would be the only thing that would get me to come back here.

Deserts - Get the Baked Alaska over the cheesecake. The cheesecake was horrible, but the Baked Alaska was worth my 8 bucks.

At ~$50/person, I don't think we will be coming back here. It was a fun experience and all, but this place did not live up to it's hype, especially because we had to drive all the way from the south bay.
author: Joey L.

description: an SF staple that I have been eating at for the past 12 plus years. Garlic roasted crab with garlic noodles is a must have!!!!! Cooked perfectly each and every time. The fact that the cocktails were pretty tasty didn't hurt either.
author: Dmitriy G.

description: Food is absolutely delicious. ...four star because the sofa in the waiting area is dirty.
author: Michael N.

description:
Ahhhh I really wanted to like this place!

Crustaceans is a Vietnamese fusion Restaurant located on Polk Street on the third level. We had a chance to sit at the bar and the bartender was very sweet and did a great job with the recommendations.

We ordered, the Salt & Pepper calamari, Roasted Crab, Tamarind Crab and The Shaking beef.

The food was okay, honestly nothing special. The Calamari was kind of salty and the crab was okay.

The Market Price for the crab was $43.00 Which is kind of steep.
author: Patrick N.

description:
For years, I've heard how amazing this place is, so I knew it was one of the first restaurants I wanted to eat at in San Francisco.
