The service was great, but the prices were a bit outrageous for the amount and taste of the food.  The crab dish was insanely expensive.

Personally, the best meal I had was the cheapest item on the menu - garlic noodles.  I'd go back for those noodles, but not much else.

I'm wondering, what item on the menu is the most spectacular?  I tried the salmon carpaccio, crab cakes, and crab with garlic noodles, but I wasn't able to share the same enthusiasm.  

I didn't think the ambiance was all that spectacular either for such a high-scale restaurant.

Maybe I was too hyped up before coming.  

I'd love to try it again and to see if I feel any differently.  I must be missing something if everyone swears by this place!
author: Mary B.

description:
I'm just so happy right now, people. I had probably one of the top 5 dishes of MY LIFE: The Roasted Crab. It was so delish that it turned an otherwise 3.5 total experience into a five. I can't wait to burp-taste the memories.

Our meal:

Garlic Noodles - 3/5 - meh, my ladyfriend dug it, but it felt like filler
Corn Crab Bisque - 3.5/5 - fresh tasting, but no chunks! I want me some chunks of crab and corn. it was more of a watery puree
beef skewers - 5/5 - PERFECT, chunky, medium rare, juicy
Roasted Crab - 8/5 - see above
Drink 3/5 - We got the something sunrise, it was tasty but light on the alcohol.
author: Sandeep P.

description:
Yay, this is our another favorite restaurant in SF.

We always order same menu(let me know if you recommend something else!)....garlic crub, garlic noodle, garlic bread and carpaccio. I think all of the ppl in here ordering garlic crub. we went few times and feel the garlic noodle dish getting bigger and bigger everytime.lol First time when we went, the garlic noodle was served in tiny square bowl like 4"x4". and we finished in a few second.
The last time when we went, the noodle was served in about 7"x7" bowl. we were happpy but why? Anyone complain? then you did great job!lol
author: Oso S.

description:
True masters of crab in endless varieties. Ambiance is inviting and lets you enjoy your time with friends or friends to be. If you like crab, garlic, noodles this place is second only to heaven. This restaurant has a twin in beverly hills which is quite good.

This is one of the if not the best restaurants for crab in San Francisco. Try the appetizers and don't forget to Oder Ann's garlic noodles with your roasted crab.

Areas of improvement: service, which felt impersonal, and value, still borderline, particularly if you decide to indulge in wine picking.
author: Bella B.

description: Great service and food. The waiters were always within sight and checked on us periodically. They were courteous as well as quick. The food was delicious! We had the roasted crab and tiger prawn garlic noodle. The mixed salad was excellent as well. The dressing was not too strong but just enough for taste.
author: Piggy S.

description:
Please dont eat here. This place has some of the worse food I have eaten. 
why:
1- The bar can only make basic drinks or drinks off of their drink menu.
2- Over cooked pasta. The pasta that comes with these entrees is OVER COOKED! supper mushey.
3-Shrimp--SO over cooked I could not remove the Shell. Only got 4 only "ate" two.
4- IT was wayyyyy tooo expensive for what we got.  2 entree and two cocktails 150 bucks really.  Do you know what I can eat in New Orleans for that amt of money at a 4-5 star rest?! OMG!

What was good...The roasted crab but not good enough for the price to raise it to two starts.  If I could give it half a star I would have rated it 1/2 stars. 

UGHH save your money go somewhere else. NOT WORTH IT!!!
author: Aloysia E.

description: The food here was not good. My boyfriend and I were disappointed in the quality. The seafood cakes were not cakes at all. I picture a seafood cake similar to a crab cake with the breading etc. These were bite size, weird & a rubbery texture. Not good. We didn't even order a main dish. That's how unimpressed we were. Service was decent though.
author: Sofia F.

description:
A good 3.5 stars. From arrival with the valet staff to the wait staff- they were all friendly. I came in about 15 minutes late from my reservation but we were still seated immediately... 

Same story, yummy and meaty crab... good garlicky noodles... yummy creme brulee... everything overpriced... Although, I was being treated for an early birthday dinner, so I can't really complain. 

For a "fancy" restaurant, a lot of customers are no longer fancy. Jeans are OK to wear. While waiting for valet to get our cars, an Asian couple got all ghetto on the valet staff. Mind you, the girl was barefoot- heels in hand talking about, "Ways my Yexus at doode?" I'm assuming she was saying, "where's my Lexus at dude?" haha. Her bf was as short as me, lookin up at valet sayin, "How long it take to get a car, mayn?" STFU. Have some effin class, seriously! We were only there for about 5 minutes, and they came after us. 

I'd rather go to PPQ for the same food, cheaper price, and less stupid ass peeps!
author: S Y.

description:
Was visiting San Francisco and came here to try the famous prawn garlic noodles.  Way overpriced.  Prawn garlic noodles had 2 tiger prawns cut in half on a bed of noodles.  Tasted good but not $38.95 USD good.  Interestingly enough, the review below with the picture of the bill shows the price of the noodles with prawn listed as $27.95 (still overpriced in my opinion).. the date on that bill is 10 days prior to when I ate there.  The market price of the dish went up 30% in 10 days?  Sketchy...

Manager/host was very friendly and polite when we were seated.  Server was very cold and abrupt. Felt like we were in his way.  

Had an appetizer (beef carpaccio - tasted good, priced fairly) and the prawn garlic noodles, a cocktail and a glass of wine - $85 USD before tip.  Not worth it at all. So many other restaurants to choose from.
author: Hugh G.

description: Meh. The service was good, but the food was bland. We had crab puffs and stuffed calamari. Add in two sakes and the bill was $45 before tip. It probably could've been better spent elsewhere.
author: Allison L.

description: Ignore the low stars! This place is DELICIOUS. Drunken crab, seasonal veggies and jasmine rice. That's the classic order my husband and I have gotten for years. Delicious Vietnamese twist on fresh, steamy food. Also good are the lightly pickled veggies that come with the rice paper rolls. Hands down my favorite place ever for steamed crab.
author: L E.

description:
Snooty service and delicious crabs pretty much sums up this place. I guess the thing to do is get the roast crab and garlic noodles - crab was moist and perfectly peppery flavored, noodles were overgarlicky, overbuttered, overcooked filler but very tasty. I feel like I ingested an entire stick of butter with dinner, and my hands are still slippery 2 days later. My capirinha was mediocre at best. My bf and his dad ordered a mai tai and they couldn't make it. huh? Would have thought that's a standard.

I would say this is more of a special occasion place. Old school steakhouse meets Vietnamese seafood fusion. With British/foreign wait staff? Very odd combo. Very rude hosts.  Very dark. Very expensive. When the 5 of us were seated (ok, 20 mins late) we were told we MUST vacate the table by 9:15 for another reservation. Literally never been told that before. Don't come here as a walk-in; I heard them saying 60-90 min wait. 

4 stars for the food and cool experience of ripping apart a crab with my bare hands while wearing a plastic bib, but 2 for service so we'll just make it an even 3. Won't be back unless dinner is paid for again...
author: Natalie H.

description: I wasn't overly impression with the restaurant, location, or the menu. My family and I order the house/ salt and pepper crab and the garlic noodles. Both dishes were recommended from various review websites. The crab was in a bath of oil... ick. Tasty, but too oily. The noodles were delish, but not spectacular. I had a lychee martini and had had better. Service was good.
author: Lenore A.

description:
This is one of our favorite restaurants to eat at in San Francisco! We take BART into the city and then jump on the trolley that takes us up the hill to our destination, that way we don't have to worry about parking in the city. The outside of the restaurants leaves much to the imagination, and is almost hidden behind another corner shop. The outside flags are falling apart and the inside restaurant is in much need of renovation, but don't let that turn you away! 
The crab and garlic noodles are out of this world! It gets messy with all the butter, so dont wear something that you care a lot about. They do give you the nice plastic bib to wear to protect yourself. Don't worry about how you look in it, everyone is wearing one. 
I tell people about this place all the time. It is one of my favorite restaurants to go to. I've see the Beverly Hills Crustacean on TV before, but this one is very different in the looks department. That is my only critique, that they would spend some money on renovations or even move to a better location and make it look fancy, because the food is worth every penny.
author: Alicia K.

description:
Wow wow wow!!! Went here just as crab seasoned opened last year. Incredible crab! Somewhat upscale, very pricey, and our server was outstanding! I was a bit on the load and obnoxious side due to waiting at the bar a little too long... He dealt with me with expertise, and professionalism.. ;) 
Great time had by all!! Will repeat...
author: Mr R.

description:
damn haven't been here for a few years, decided to go with my homey since it crab season.  OMG was the crab awesome!  melted butter wonderfulness all over the bottom of the plate is perfect for drenching the garlic noodles and garlic rice.  its greasy, my hands and face are greasy LOL, high octane cholesterol meal, but totally in heaven for 2 hours.

had lobster egg rolls and jumbo prawn wonton, very nice for apps.

TIP:  mix some rice into the crab's shell once it arrives and make sure all the rice is mixed well with the buttery oil and crab shell caviar.  take a bite and your day will be increased with happiest.
author: Kevin L.

description: Celebrated our anniversary at Crust. Experience  was amazing , Greeted by An and served by Erin. All time favorite menu item, roasted crab, came out hot and was full just the right amount of flavor.  We will be looking for reasons to come here before our next anniversary
author: John L.

description:
I have been going to the crustacean for probably 15 years. It's always the same, excellent. My wife recently took me for my birthday, and it was no exception - excellent.

I have read many of the mixed reviews for this restaurant and I do see some of the points raised about various dishes not standing out, the service being poor on the weekends, and the cost. I will now weigh-in.

This is basically a roast crab and garlic noodle restaurant, and that's it. But that's what they are known for and that's all you need when you go there. Just order only those two items and nothing more and you will be rewarded with unbelievably tasty food that has stood the test of time for me over 15 years, always consistently excellent.  Actually, we also had some sautéed snap peas this last visit and that was great too but I would never sit here writing a review recommending anything but crab and garlic noodles at the Crustacean.

About the service. Just don't go on the weekend and you are fine. This restaurant is likely in guide books and a lot of tourists are sent here.  Go during the week when it is still busy but not crazy and it's fine.

Lastly, the cost. Crab is expensive, cost us $46 per crab. Sounds nuts right? However, guess what, PPQ charges THE SAME $46 and so does Thanh Long! It's like all the Vietnamese restaurants price fix the crab or something. The point is, PPQ may seem cheaper because they offer that dinner for two for $65 but they only give you ONE CRAB !!! So, Crustacean is not any more expensive.

The atmosphere of Crustacean is relaxed. The decor is certainly a bit dated but I feel relaxed when I go there and always, yes always come away satisfied because I know what to expect and they always deliver.
author: Doug C.

description: When my boyfriend decided to have dinner here I was a bit skeptical due to the price. I yelped it and there was mixed review which made me even more skeptical. We made reservations for dinner at 5pm and when we got there, it only took a few minutes before we got seated. We ordered the New Zealand Green Lip Mussels for appetizers and I must it was delicious. This appetizer consists of 5 crostini and 5 mussels in a delicious garlic and parsley butter. The mussels were perfectly cleaned too. For our main course we got the Roasted Crab and the Garlic Noodles. The two paired nicely together. The crab was cooked to perfection. The crab was rubbed with garlic and a spice blend that made the crab meat so flavorful but kept it light. As if the crab was not delicious enough you have the garlic and spice blend butter you can dip your crab in. I mean everythings better with butter right? The garlic noodles is one of the best I've had. It had a great amount of garlic but it didn't overwhelmed the dish. Now onto customer service. As i mentioned before there was no wait time when we got there. However I think a reservation would be best. We were seated quick and once we ordered, the food came out fast as well. Our waitress was wonderful! She came and checked up on us several time to fill our drinks but not so often that it was a bother. At the end of our meal she brought us hot towels to clean our hands. You get what you pay for and I'm glad my boyfriend made the decision to have dinner here. It was a great way to end our time in Frisco. I will be a returning customer who'll drag some friends to enjoy this wonderful place!
author: Liew-Kym S.

description: despite the timid waiter telling me everyone comes here for the crab and trying to push me to get that i opted not to as wasn't in the mood, ordered the dish titled, helene's ravioli which was a great choice, wow.  not true ravioli but something like spring roll wrappers stuffed with shrimp and veggies with a great beurre blanc sauce.  they had duckhorn chardonnay by the glass as well which was fantastic
author: Jeff H.

description: So delicious, we had the Roasted Crab and the Garlic Noodles. The food was truly perfect.
author: Vivi S.

description:
This is one of my wife's favorites places for crab... Overall the food is good, her concern has to do with the fact that this, and other restaurants in S.F., are not giving us what we pay for... For example, we ordered a whole Dungeness crab, however, when the crab was served we notice that half of each cluster was missing.  The cluster is the upper (body) part of the crab where the legs attach, the choicest portions.

It appears that most of the restaurants specializing in crab, or at least the two we visited this weekend, make it a practice of taking these choice portions even though we pay for the entire crab.  It seems to me that this is dishonest and certainly unethical, especially considering that the crab cost nearly $50!

I have one question for this, and all the other restaurants practicing or participating in this dishonest practice---is it worth it?  Are you willing to lose your customer base for the sake of a few extra dollars.  I assume that taking part of the crab provides them with the meat needed for their crab cakes and other crab based dishes... But why steal from your customers?
author: R. L.

description:
Roasted Garlic Crab- MUST eat!~

Garlic Noodles- yummy accompaniment. 

Beef Saigon- pretty good as a 2nd meat dish.

Papaya Salad was good and refreshing. Beef Carpaccio was ok. Not that great.

1 crab, 2 noodles, 1 salad, 1 carpaccio, 2 cocktails, 1 beer = $53 pp (3 of us total)

Yes, it is pricey. Come for the CRAB and forget about everything else. Wait, crab and noodles. That's all.

3.5 stars.
author: Angela D.

description:
UMMM MORE PLEASE!!  My bf and I stopped in a couple of nights ago to give Crustacean a try. We have been to the other An Family Restaurant "Thanh Long" and couldn't believe that we had never been to Crustacean - esp. since we only live a few blocks away!  

Long story short - GET THE GARLIC NOODLES AND ROASTED CRAB! We've had other dishes from Thanh Long, but they really didn't compare to the noodles and crab. So, we ordered two crabs and the garlic noodles. I almost finished my crab and my bf still had about half of his left (light weight!) We took his remains home and made Crab Louie for breakfast the next day.

All in all... I want to go back - like NOW!
author: Noneya B.

description:
I will admit that I've been a fan from afar for several years. Sadly, as if with life, kids, work etc. I don't get to travel to San Francisco more than once every two years or so. However, no matter how short the trip or where in the Bay Area I may be traveling to, I head to Crustacean for an order of the Tiger Shrimp which comes with MY MOST FAVORITE garlic noodles. If I only have the time for takeout then it's an order of the garlic noodles to go. 

Sunday 4/13/14 I flew into SFO and headed out to Sausalito for a couple of days with the plan to head into the city at least once to indulge in a meal. I didn't make a few hours before I decided to cab in solo. I've read some of the more recent reviews and admit I had a few trepidations and yes, when I arrived the aging of the venue is very apparent. In terms of the interior décor-*shrugs* sure, it is dated and reminds me of many Asian restaurants in the city as well as in Seattle or London that look the same. I was greeted right away and while the restaurant was full as you would expect on a Sunday evening, I was able to get a seat in a smaller section. Eschewing anything else I ordered the tiger shrimp with garlic noodles and waited. It was perfect and once again the garlic noodles are addicting and literally what draws me back each and every time. My server was attentive without being intrusive, as they sometimes can be when someone is dining alone, and my water glass was never empty. 

I can't speak for others that dine there but I was pleasantly surprised that the food, which is what I was there for, was still as delicious as I recall. To be fair Hoping to be back in the area with the hubster later this summer and Crustacean will be a stop as he has never had the pleasure.
author: M P.

description:
There are so many things wrong with this restaurant that I'm amazed it's packed all the time. Look, the garlic noodle is good. That is where it stops though.

These guys charge 5 star prices but everything else is strictly 1 star. The service is appalling. The waiting sofa is nasty and stained. I mean why would you not put some of the money into making the restaurant looking nice?

We asked for bibs. They didn't give us one. However all the other tables got them. We ordered two crabs but apparently that's not enough crabs to afford us those cheap bibs. Even boiling crab gives us bibs for to-go orders. The customer shouldn't even have to ask for it. Service people, it's a lost art at these overpriced joints.

The "live crab" prices got us crab that is either dead or half dead as it tasted off. The waiter forgot about us for the second half of our dinner. Then get this, he gave us a bill with a charge for an extra bottle of wine. He tacked on an 18% charge for table of 6 or more then proceeded to give us a bill that stated that gratuity is not ncluded. After we complained about the overcharge he gave us a corrected bill with the same tip plus the same gratuity not included bill. How do you go from overcharge to corrected bill and yet the gratuity stays the same? Once we complained to the manager, they gave us a corrected bill that shows gratuity is included and the tip scaled with the prices. Obviously, the waiter added the gratuity as a line item rather than charge it as an automatic gratuity.

They obviously don't pay their waitstaff enough for them to resort to outright lying and cheating the customer. I will never go back to this joint. Too bad this review won't do anything to affect their business. Overpriced seafood, disgusting and dirty decor, and appalling service. 5 star prices for Asian service. You've been warned.
author: Kevin D.

description:
Crustaceans is the dingiest nice restaurant I have ever been to. The once impressive decor is now faded and in need of replacement or a good deep cleaning. Alas, the food is so delicious that Crustaceans is a must-do every time I'm in San Francisco. 

The garlic noodles and roasted crab are HEAVENLY. I have heard the recipe is such a closely held secret that waiters aren't allowed in the kitchen. Instead, they receive the crab through a narrow window slot. 

The roasted crab arrives sitting in a little pool of garlic butter oil. There is no way to eat it with a fork and knife - you have to dig in with your hands. Don't worry about getting dirty - the waiter will bring you wipes later. 

Each order of crab will set you back about $45. Despite the price, make sure to order one per person. Otherwise you may have to fight your dinner companions. Dungeness crabs are sizable, but trust me - you'll want the whole crab to yourself. 

The garlic noodles are a nice carby complement to the crab - make sure to order about 2 portions for 4 people.
author: Cindy T.

description: I had been to Crustaceans about 7 years ago and had been jonesing for some Roasted Crab, so on this recent San Francisco trip I talked my friend into going and splurging for the Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles.  Our reservations were for 7pm, the place was hopping.  The service was great, our waitress, Giselle was great, very friendly and the service was timed perfectly.  We started with the Green Mussels and they were yummy.  We were able to chat through the appetizer, but when the crab and noodles arrived, all conversations stopped.  I am not sure that I have ever had such a quiet meal.  The only taking happened when Giselle stopped by to see how we were doing and then there were only monosyllabic responses... 'great' 'hmmmm' 'yummmm' 'yes' 'no' etc.  Needless to say, we enjoyed ourselves.  For 2 people with an appetizer, 2 roasted crabs, garlic noodles, and a beer, it was about $110... that didn't seem outrageous to me, I left beyond full and totally happy.
author: Lyssa D.

description:
Best Crab of my life!

Highly recommended by someone in our group who promised it was the best crab we would ever have and they did not disappoint.  Came here on a weekday around 6pm, noticed we were the only one's in the restaurant, although an hour later it was fully packed. We ordered two platters of roast crabs for our group of six.  Also tried the garlic noodles which were SO flavorful.  2nd favorite next to the crabs.  The crabs are also easily cracked, no major work here, the meat literally falls out of the shells.  This is a must-do for anyone visiting San Francisco.  Only a few miles from Union Square and touristy areas, located on the 2nd floor of a very non-descript building.  It almost felt like we were sneaking in the way this place was tucked away in the back.  Waitress was very friendly and accommodating with your large group's requests and although the restaurant got crowded we never felt unattended to.
author: Betty G.

description: This place is decadently delicious! Fireworks and explosions of flavor in your mouth. You will be amazed for sure. I ate salt and pepper calamari appetizer which is on the secret menu: delicious, lightly batter, flavorful, and crispy - a must get. Got entrees we got roasted crab and Royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles! Both were amazing!!! The garlic noodles look deceivingly simple and plain in pictures but the infused garlic flavor is out of the world good. The royal tiger prawns were $39 but it is a good deal because the tiger prawns are a delicious treat and the portion size of the garlic noodles are double in this entree vs just an's garlic noodles on the side, and trust me you will want the extra noodles. the entree came with 4 huge tiger prawns that were perfectly cooked and super tasty and a good portion size with the garlic noodles, totally worth it! Next is the Garlic roasted crab for $52, and it was mmm mmmm mmmm good. Need I say more? Perfectly cooked, good portion size, super flavorful, and nice presentation. One appetizer and these 2 entrees were fully fulfilling for 2 people. We left feeling great and well satisfied with the delicious food and attentive customer service. Highly recommend!
author: Nina V.

description:
Over-rated and over-priced.. Came here because of the Dine About Town. I choose this place because of all the rating that it had from fellow Yelpers, boy were they wrong. 

So the building itself is kind of ugly and a place that is difficult to find parking. We were not seated until all of our party arrived. The bar was small and really was trying to sell their hard liquor considering the choices. 

Looking at Dine about Town Menu, there was really only Prawns with Stir-fry noodles as a seafood choice in a seafood restaurant. Just something wrong with that. So I still ordered it while others spent the $37 for a crab. 

The rice paper shrimp roll was a single spring roll made with salad shrimp chopped into 5 pieces. While the Skewed Chicken was 6 good pieces of chicken on 3 skewers. 

The Shaken beef was stir-fried beef with teriyaki sauce, place in a plate surrounded by green beans and a few tomatoes. It came with a bowl of jasmine rice that I mistaken for mash potato, considering it was overcooked. 

The Prawns with Stir-fry, look like shrimp chow mein. The whole plate had only 6 small prawns. 

The last course was the fried banana with ice cream. The taste of the banana batter, one could tell that they have changed the oil in the fryer for awhile now. 

I had also ordered the Garlic Bread and it was just a few slices of a baguette covered in oil and butter, not a single taste of garlic for $2.50.
A friend ordered the Garlic noodles. It was good, just not $9.95 good. 

Overall experience, I would not return to this place. Paying $37 for a cooked frozen crab is ridiculous. Have an Asian fusion restaurant that couldn't even cook rice correctly, is just wrong. Then spending $50+ for food I that is better at any other Asian restaurant.
author: M C.

description:
Taking the elevator up to the second floor and getting off on the landing that is Crustacean Restaurant makes you feel like you are on of the waitress in the sitcom "It's a Living." The dim, 80s lounge feel doesn't exact evoke thoughts of great eating, but man does the smell. The only way to describe the smell of all the seafood in the air is HEAVENLY.  Everything smells fresh and delicious.
As I turned the corner to sit down, I was confronted with tables and tables of bib-clad patrons.  "Bibs?" I asked.  
"Yes," my hubby and cousin said in unison.  
I sat down. "I don't do bibs."
"You will need it," my cousin chuckled.  I was not amused.
No fine dining should require a bib.  What kind of place WAS this? Well - let me tell ya, I sure was happy for that bib at the end of my meal because I tore those crabs up.  I mean, really... like NO MERCY, DESTROYED them!
I got the Tamarind crab w/ sweet and sour sauce made of tomatoes, dill, Vietnamese chili, and herbs.  It was the most amazing way I have ever eaten crabs and I live in Maryland, so I know good crabs.  Couple that with the garlic noodles and I was too through. I could have died on the spot, it was so good.
My hubby and cousin both got the roast crab and garlic noodles, which they loved.  There was so much food and the drinks kept coming. 
I am not going to lie: the bill will wind up just as large as the portions, but you know what?  it was worth it for sure.  Go there.  Wear the bib.  Leave happy!
author: Elsa M.

description: 1.5 stars. Everything was mediocre and I've had better crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, and chicken satay and other places for at least $10 less for each item
author: Daniel L.

description:
First, let me say that this used to be my favorite restaurant in SF and I had a staple order of Sicilian mussels, vietnamese salad, garlic noodles, and roast crab.  Haven't been back for a while since we moved, but the place has gone REALLY downhill.  It started with a broken elevator, then wood paneling in the waiting area which still looks like it is being renovated.  The host never really greeted us, and after the meal never asked how everything was.  The waiter  was awful - never smiled, never came back to ask if we needed anything and was always out of the restaurant on smoke breaks.  We literally had to pull other waiters aside to ask for the basics like plates, more water, our check.  This is really disappointing because service there used to be excellent.
The food also seems to have changed.  It was decent, but the level of attention to detail was gone.  The mussels used to be more flavorful.  The vietnamese salad was too sweet.  The crab was so so with less meat (I give them a pass on that one since it has to be shipped from Oregon right now). We tried the shaken beef as well and it was terrible - the meat was overcooked and hard and the sauce was not tasty.
Very disappointed that this restaurant has dropped in quality so much.  We were really looking forward to it after a few years, but it was not nearly as good as it used to be.  Hopefully the owners will see the reviews (especially the service) and make the necessary changes to improve.  I used to recommend this restaurant to all my friends visiting SF, but will no longer be doing so.
author: H Y.

description: I had a great time at Crustacean :) I followed the advice from other yelpers and ordered the roasted crab, my date had the tiger prawns. The food, service, and drinks were great. The seating was a bit cramped...I really don't like being that close to strangers during an intimate dinner. I also thought the $15 de-shelling fee was a bit much but I would pay it again because I know I can't get all the crab out by myself!!
author: Grace C.

description: the crab and garlic noodles are okay, but a bit overrated and overpriced for what it is
author: Vivienne K.

description: Great tasty lobster salad.  Garlic crab was very tasty and larger than Fisherman Grotto #9 at the Wharf.  Spicy, but not as much as the garlic taste as the crab at Fisherman Grotto.  Some garlic and slightly spicy go to Crustacean Restaurant.  If you like garlic go to Fisherman Grotto.
author: Dan G.

description:
There's something sexy about rolling your sleeves up and diving right in....  Right?!  Depends on what your diving into I guess... But, what if you were diving into a delicious dungeoness crab?!  Mmmm....  That sounds tantalizing, doesn't it?  

Sorry Jason G., I realize the crabs are frozen but it's still pretty darn good.  Of course it's drenched in a bowl full of garlic and butter and even served in it too!  I don't understand why they charge an additional $5 to crack the pieces for you.  It doesn't seem necessary.  

And, what's with all the hype regarding the garlic noodles?  I didn't find it amazing.  It was ok.  You can get much tastier garlic noodles for the third of the price in Chinatown.  

And.... what's with the tiny bathrooms with only 1 tiny sink?!  For a busy restaurant that specializes in dungeoness crab where you have to get down and dirty to eat... Don't you realize that everyone will be going to the bathroom to wash their hands?!  Even if you give us the steaming hot towels (which was quite nice by the way).

Oh, and do you really have a secret kitchen that's only for family members?  That's pretty darn interesting!
author: Danny L.

description:
We enjoyed a very nice meal at Crustacean this past weekend.  I hadn't visited in many years, and it was the first visit for my wife and our friend who joined us.  The first thing I can say about Crustacean is that you shouldn't judge this book by it's cover- it is located in a very old-school retail structure on the corner of Polk & California, and its appearance is a bit 'seedy'.  The structure conceals the restaurant hidden at the top, and perhaps even discourages the walk-up crowd- but don't let it scare you off.  My friend was pleasantly shocked by the inside of the restaurant after we entered from the elevator...

The interior of the restaurant is laid out in a sprawling and bizarre manner.  It's probably in need of a face-lift internally as well, but it's not too shabby.  Somewhere in the 'retro-chic' Asian fusion category, circa late 90s decor.  I'm not sure I even know what that means, but if you walked in, you would have a tough time categorizing it too.  Not romantic, not casual, just overall pleasant.

Anyways, let's get to the food.  The menu is 'crustacean-heavy', the place is named Crustacean, so you're a damn fool if you go and order steak and say it sucks.   Go and order the Roasted Crab, get a side of garlic noodles, and you will be in absolute heaven.  This is what my wife and I did, and we couldn't have been happier.  

The whole dungeness was $40ea- pricey for sure, and there may be other restaurants (PPQ?) which can rival this in price, etc.  But the sauce it was bathed in was a true flavorful bliss- garlicky/salty/peppery seasoned paradise.  There are several varieties of whole crab on the menu- but it would be hard for me to try them as this one was such a winner.  As I cracked each crabby chunk from the shell, dunked and bathed it in the sauce, and stuffed my face- I couldn't remember an occasion that I had enjoyed a dungeness crab feast more than this.  Rewinding a bit- we ordered a lobster salad special, a corn chowder with crab meat, and an order of garlic bread- and while all were good (but not great)- they really were a waste of space which should have been exclusively dedicated to this delicious crab.  Our friend ordered a tiger prawn dish with garlic noodles- and while he enjoyed it - I know we were the big winners with our crab.

Did I mention the crab was amazing?  :-) 
One full crab was adequate for me for a feast- I finished it but was slowing down towards the end.  My wife couldn't finish it- she left a leg or two and was pushing herself.  The garlic noodles are 'required'- they are fabulous and a great compliment.  I can really see this restaurant being a 'one trick pony' for me in the future- where I go with the crab in mind, and don't/won't screw around with anything else.  No salads, apps etc.  Bring me the bib, bring my crab, and turn me loose.

Anyways, I'm very happy to have revived my interest in Crustacean.  This would have been a 5-star experience if the crab was a bit cheaper and if the other appetizer/supporting dishes were a bit more exciting.  Needless to say, I will be back for sure.
author: Andy S.

description:
Food:  I love the roasted crab.  Garlic noodle is ok.  What' surprising is that we were charged for tea!  Most Asian restaurants we've been to give tea as complimentary..or would charge us at most $1 per person.  I guess I shouldn't expect the same.  
Nearly fell over when I found out that we were charged $7.5 for a pot of tea (that's an entree at most restaurants!).  Please beware of this if you're ordering tea.

BF and I had the roasted crab, garlic noodle, corn crab bisque, and pear tart.  Of the four dishes, I will come back for the crab and the pear tart.

Service:  I guess we were lucky enough to have had a decent waitress.

Ambiance:  Romantic and upscale.  But the seatings were super tight.  We were seated by the window, and I had a hard time squeezing into the chair.  The back of my chair was pushed against another chair of the the table behind us.  There's no room to "wiggle". Not very comfortable.  next time, I will ask for either the bar or a larger table.
author: Xuan N.

description: First lets start off by saying this is not my first time eating at crustaceans. Ive gave 5 stars before but thats when the other manager Sean was still working. The manager thats in charge now is very rude and has no respect for customer service. My family and I have been eating here for years, and even sometimes 3 times a week. Sean would treat us to a appetizer usually on the house because of the amount of money and guest that we always bring here. Tonight the manager told me that our reservations were not showing up and we had to wait for 30 minutes. They lost a good customer. Off to thang long we go!
author: Samuel L.

description: prefer the price of PPQ but the atmosphere may be worth the money. little bit elegant. service is very good. food is good. quantity is a bit on the lower end but otherwise good establishment. thanh long supposedly has a leg up on quality of food. prob agree. good place tho.
author: Drew H.

description:
Whenever the girls and I have a special occasion to celebrate or a holiday to spend the evening together, we always come to the city, and you can guess who usually picks the place =).

It takes us about 40-50 minutes to get to the city from where we live, so more often than not do we ever arrive on time for our reservations. As usual, we took a few wrong turns and already knew we were running behind schedule. Our reservation was at 9pm, it was already 9:15pm and they close at 9:30pm. I had one of the girls call in to let them know we're on our way and we know we're late but we were coming from SJ, and to our surprise...the person on the phone said it was not a problem and that they will be waiting for us. Nice.

When we arrived, we were greeted by the host who immediately knew it was us that called in. He smiled and took us to our table. There were still a few tables still dining and taking orders so we were left not feeling rushed at all upon deciding on what to order. I wanted to try so many things from the menu but between four girls, we ordered: salmon carpaccio, new zealand green lip mussels, seared ahi tuna, shaking beef, two roast crabs, and garlic noodles. Everything was so tasty, cooked to perfection and the aroma was just blissful. The four of us were all stuffed and very satisfied! 

This is definitely a place you would want to check out if you're ever in the city. Great service, great food and super friendly staff!
author: Dung N.

description: I know everyone is boasting about this place, but I thought the food was just ok with the price you pay for. Garlic noodles, crab cakes, rolls were nothing special. I've also had better desserts. The Vietnamese salad was probably the best I had. My party wasn't very impressed either. I won't be going back.
author: maria u.

description: Service was excellent and the guys will engage in banter. We enjoyed the evening very much. The mussels starter is worth the taste. The crab cake was so so. The beef skewer was tasty as well (4 of us). We had drunken crab, prawns, beef shallots and lobster over angel hair. Of course we had an extra order of garlic noodles. Plated well and tasted excellent. For a $300 night you expect timing and delivery to be impeccable. Apps came before drinks and 2nd/3rd round came a little late. Main course came too quick. Otherwise an excellent evening. We asked to go back to the kitchen... hah! Even the waiters are not aloud to ensure the Family recipe secrets! Enjoy!
author: Matt B.

description: Holy Mother of Moly! Husband and I went to dinner here for the 1st time, perfect date night spot! We enjoyed EVERYTHING! We started with the crab puffs & crustacean's toast as appetizers. Both were so divine that we devoured within minutes so we decide to order another appetizer. This time we went with the lobster roll, which again was sooooooooo good! Heck we could have ordered all appetizers and been happy. Our main meal was the roasted garlic crab (to die for...still dreaming about it). We also had the shaken beef and garlic noodles. Our meal was superb! We will definitely be returning! Staff was great, very responsive and on top of the service. We were very pleased.
author: Valerie L.

description: I have known about Crustacean for years, but finally had the opportunity to go: honestly, it was amazing!!! The roast crab and garlic noodles are insanely good. I was practically licking my plate. The service was beyond impeccable. From the moment we sat down, Philip was outstanding! The manner by which he presented himself, made recommendations, assisted us with wine selections- he is of the highest caliber! A very rare find, and a very delightful experience. Definitely going back and will be certain to request Philip.
author: Brandi D.

description: Before our reservations I was looking forward to eating there but after this short experience I will never return. We had made reservations three days in advance for a party of three. At the time of making reservations there were multiple times open. Upon arriving at the restaurant one of our party members returned to the car due to feeling under the weather and still might have showed up later. Instead of seating us at a table big enough to accommodate 3 after letting them know of our situation they sat myself and the other member of our party at a small table for two. We explained the situation again to the hostess who refused to help, she was rude and had an attitude, not a friendly person like a hostess should be. She left us in mid sentence to grab her manager who told us the same thing. He offered to parade us through the restaurant to a bigger table in mid meal if our third member returned while we were eating. He was also very unaccommodating and quite rude. He also stated that they were over booked and could do nothing for us even though they should have had a table big enough for our requests considering our reservation. Like I said earlier there were many times open for reservation only days before and multiple vacant tables around us at 7:00pm, which causes me to doubt his sincerity and the ethics of the restaurant it's self. This service was awful and very disrespectful to a customer who would have spent over $100.00 a person. If I could give them a zero I would. I will make sure to advise any person I meet to stay away. Although the food is good (having been there before, with bad service then too) it is not worth the trouble or the insult to deal with the unaccommodating staff that work there.
author: Sean O.

description:
This is by far the best crab I've had in my life.  My husband and I both ordered the roasted crab  and we are still dreaming about the succulent flavors today.  For our appetizer, we shared fried salt and pepper calamari which was good but it was a bit too chewy for my taste.

We also ordered some cocktails at the bar and for fans of sweet drinks, I recommend the ohio punch.  It was mixed with dark rum, pineapple and orange juice and topped with amaretto.  

Eating the crab was a messy task so they offer a bib...thank goodness!  we didn't order any sides but the crab was superb.  Nice size and good flavor, you couldn't ask for anything else.  I've been to crab boils in Maryland and Seattle and they only seem to use old bay but this was soaked in butter, pepper, and garlic. they cost $40 each.

As for the décor, it was pretty dated which is why I'm giving them a 4. The seating was also cramped and I could hear everyone's conversations.  The waitresses were average, they only asked for your order and that's about it.  Lastly, it doesn't seem like you have to dress up for this place, it was very casual when I went.
author: Tia W.

description: Grossly overpriced for what you get - the food was too salty and the seafood did not taste fresh. Portions are very small. Service was decent. Interiors seemed a bit dingy, tries to be upscale but fails in too many ways - peeling paint, dirty windows, shabby bathroom. You should expect way more for +$40 a person.
author: Jackie W.

description: Roasted garlic crab, to die for! Our favorite flavor. We've tried the other flavors and now all we order is the garlic roasted crab. The garlic noodles are good. I feel they use to be better a few years ago. The last couple of times we were there, they were mushy and I didn't like that. I like that there is a great variety of appetizers and their baked alaska dessert is one of my favorites!
author: Jeff W.

description: Crustacean always pleases.  The star of the show is the big delicious crabs but the garlic noodles are excellent.
author: Jeffrey W.

description: This place has gone downhill. Lost its touch not alot of flavoring in the food. The crab was over cooked, the garlic secret sauce was at a minimum. The garlic noodles also lost its flavoring. The tiger prawns didnt have alot of flavor and was over cooked as well
author: john j.

description:
My sister recommended this place and she has lived in SF for about 20 years, so I trusted her opinion. 

When I went into the restaurant, the tables are very close together and you don't have much room. The service though, was amazing and they were very quick and attended to my every need.

I loved the food here! My favorite was the tamarind crab. It is very messy because they crab is in this large tamarind sauce, so wear a bib! 

Despite what others have said, I was not fond of the garlic noodles. When this dish came out, it was very cold and bland. 

I have tried other dishes including some small plates and I have loved all of them. Besides the garlic noodles, I will definitely come back for everything else and recommend this place to anyone going to the city.
author: Alexx B.

description:
Believe the hype! 

After years of hearing about this place we finally went on Saturday. We didn't have a reservation but only had to wait about 20 minutes when we got there at 8. We shared a roasted crab, garlic noodles and garlic bread and saved room for a baked Alaska. The crab was absolutely delicious but kinda pricey ($42)! We dipped the bread in the buttery, garlicky goodness and the garlic noodles were amazing! The baked Alaska was the perfect size since we were beyond full but needed something sweet. Next time we're taking a to go order of noodles with us.
author: Joy D.

description: I went here for my birthday. The food was great no complaints at all. The beef was very flavorful and tender and the garlic crab was very tasty the only thing that was a bother was my party could not be seated because one person did not arrive on time. The food awesome though.
author: Rena R.

description:
This used to be a family favorite (for the past 15years), "UNFORGETTABLE" we'd used to say! 

Tonight, FAIL. 

The ever so infamous "Roasted Crab" tasted old as if the crab was caught and stored for use months ago and just now pulled out to be drenched in melted butter. As for the once highly raved and unforgettable "Garlic Noodles", looked like something my mom makes to feed my nieces and nephew toddlers. It tasted like over-microwaved saturated chow mein noodles. This was surreal.

The service? 
My party and I were seated along the aisle against a wall that divided the dining area from the center where the bar met the dishes and glasses stocking area, a very noisy area indeed, especially for fine dining.  Many of the waiters passed our table consistently.  As for our waitress, she was not amicable, rather she exuded arrogance and her nonchalant attitude was almost disappointing. When I needed service, I raised my hand (more like my arm as if in grade school), and was still ignored. The Maitre D finally acknowledged my need for service and notified our waitress.

The hot towels at the end were super hot; be cautious. Be sure to either let them cool or blow to cool it faster before use.

The best thing at this place was the part where this guy asks you if you want a bib and does the honor to put it on.

I don't think it was worth driving an hour and walking up the flight of stairs in the pouring rain nor will it be a family favorite anymore. It's forgettable. Just food for thought.
author: Miss E.

description:
Crustaceans is one my favorite go-to restaurants in San Francisco. While opening in 1991 Crustacean San Francisco is the epitome of Fusion Cuisine. Located in the heart of Nob Hill, will resemble its more formal sister restaurant in Beverly Hills in design while offering a dining experience close to the Bistro style that includes outdoor patio dining, rare in San Francisco.  Crustacean San Francisco, Beverly Hills, and Thanh Long to name a few are a tradition of the AN Family.

Whenever I go to Crustacean I really can't help myself but to order the Garlic Noodles and the Roasted Crab. The Garlic Noodles are unique, very flavorful, and more or less comfort food. Being that other restaurants try to emulate the garlic noodle experience. Crustacean has set the bar high. The Roasted Crab is succulent and messy.  It is drenched in butter, garlic and other tasty ingredients. A bib is advised or you will walk out of there with oily grease stains galore. 

Crustaceans is great for group parties or just a casual date. Being that I have been here more than once I know what to expect, where to park, and how to approach the meal. I would consider this a nice casual to semi-formal restaurant. I have yet to have a bad experience here and until that day comes I will be coming back.
author: Alastair G.

description:
GARLIC NOODLES!!

i love this place when i want to eat some yummy seafood.
the garlic noodles and crab are awesome. u have to not mine getting down at this place, bc the crabs can b work.
the attire is a little dressier than u would expect if your gonna b crackin some crabs. so dress up a bit, no sweats or bball shorts thats for sure.
make a reservation bc this place gets busy fast, although last wk the bf and i came in early at 5 when they open and we got seated quickly.
author: francis c.

description: I visited with my boss and business partners there. In addition to fantacstic crubs and garlic noodle as main dish, appetizers (ex. spring roll, fried caramari etc..) were delicious. I highly recommend to make a reservation because the restaurant is always crowded.
author: Yukiko N.

description:
We went there and I saw the endangered and threatened species - Chilean Sea Bass (aka Patagonian Tooth Fish)  on the menu.  I went to talk to the head of the restaurant.  I explained to them that this fish is on the endangered/threatened list due to over fishing and the fact this fish takes decades to reach maturity and reproduce given their habitat is the very cold/icy waters near the tip of South America.  

Their response was "Thank you" and that was it. The waiter came by later and told me it sold so well so they doubted it would come off the menu.

Sickening.
author: Jacque P.

description: I first came to crustacean many years ago when there was a dress code and it was relatively hard to book a table. Unfortunately my most recent visit was completely disastrous. Long story short, our drunk waitress was fired in the middle of our dinner for stumbling around and messing up everyone's orders. The food was tasty but overpriced for the service
author: Adolfo P.

description:
Hands down....best garlic crab eva!

I really enjoyed myself for my birthday dinner here this past weekend. I would say the grilled calamari I had was fantastic and the greens that were the garnish were excellent. I usually don't touch the garnish but for this place, I did!

My boyfriend had the grilled beef skewers and they were marinated in something awesome!

The garlic noodles we shared were not that great. They were bland but maybe its to not overshadow the huge roasted crab we each had in front of us. I got mine precracked for an additional $5 and it was worth it.

Crab is one of my favorite foods but its hard to wrestle with the legs and look cute. Thankfully they have plastic bibs that make you look more like you are at a buffet table in a casino than at an upscale joint. 

All in all the food was excellent. The service could have been better but hopefully the next time we come, oh there will be a next time, we get a better server who is more attentive.

~$150 for two drinks, apps and crab with a shared garlic noodle. $$$.

Bathroom only has one stall and you must get a reservation because this place was crowded. Parking is HORRIBLE. We were lucky, LUCKY to get a street park not far from the restaurant.
author: Gina H.

description: Best crab and garlic noodles ever. Nice ambiance, but a little dated inside. Who cares if it its on the third floor of a shopping complex. Must do in SF.
author: James B.

description:
I don't have much to really complain or compliment about Crustacean.  I didn't hate their food but I don't think it really lived up to the fanciness of the restaurant and how I expected the food to taste.  

For appetizers I ordered the crab puffs and the salmon on shrimp chips and both were okay but pricey for what I got.  Nothing amazing.  

The garlic noodles were good too but a little on the heavy side.  The Roasted Crab was just how crab is suppose to be, tough to eat and not really worth the effort in the end.  There was quite a bit of oil/butter/lard or whatever that greasy stuff was over the crab that made it kind of gross to handle though.

One thing I was really impressed by though was hot towel they give you at the end.  Man, that towel took the grease right off my hands and left them probably cleaner than they were when I walked in there.  

3 stars for their awesome hot towel that didn't leave my hands smelling like crab all night.
author: Frank W.

description: The crab was Amazing the ravioli was great! Servers were good atmosphere was a little louder than expected given the decor, but there were several larger groups dining. Did I say how AMAZING THE CRAB WAS!!  When we return we will definitely return here!
author: Tony T.

description: OVERrated!!' Stinky place and very poor customer service...  Next time I go to San Francisco, I will look for Panda Express instead...
author: Elaine J.

description: Every dish we had was tasty and of course we had to have the garlic noodles; did not disappoint. Going back for the drunken crab.
author: Delia F.

description: When in San Fran you must eat here if you like seafood! Enough said, period. Great calamari and Roasted Crab. Not a seafood eater no problem my friends beef was great as well!
author: Myesha D.

description: I have eaten here a few times before, and have never been disappointed! Love, Love, LOOOOOVVVE the garlic crab, and garlic noodles. The waits can be a little long, so try to make reservations if you can, if you can't just be patient and wait for an available table. The crab is definitely worth the wait!!
author: Mika D.

description:
Appetizer: raw beef salad
Meal: Garlic Noodles and Roast Garlic Crab
Dessert: Baked 'Alaska' (choc mousse w/ caramel icecream)
Total: $85.00 w/ tips 

I really wanted to fall in love with Crustacean and was a bit disappointed that i'm not. I LOVE crab but the roasted garlic here just didnt hit the spot at all! Parts of the crabmeat were dry and the crab itself was a bit small compared to what they offer at PPQ or Thanh Long.

The raw beef salad was the best i've ever had. The meat was soooo tender and there was just the correct amount of flavor. The garlic noodles were also pretty good, but again, the portion was smaller than what they offer at other similiar restaurants. 

Service here was excellent but the crab was really a disappointment.
author: M W.

description:
Crustaceans is a pretty nice place to dine at, but I still don't see why there is a dress code to eat crab - especially since cracking those legs can get quite messy! At least they put a cute little bib thingy around your neck for you to save your clothes from getting splattered on :)

For appetizers, we had the green lip mussels, salmon carpaccio, and salmon on shrimp crisps. All were really tasty - especially the salmon carpaccio because although raw, it was still infused with so much great flavor!

We then ordered the tamarind crab and roast crab paired with their famous garlic noodles. I personally loved the tamarind crab more - it was cooked to perfection and tasted soooooo delicious. I thought the roasted crab was a little plain. Garlic noodles were pretty good and better here than most places, but the best will still have to be at PPQ. 

For dessert, we had their fried banana and fried pineapple ice cream. I wasn't too crazy about either of them because the best FBI will still go to Krung Thai in San Jose. The fried pineapple was something different and new to try, but it ended up tasting a little on the odd side.

Overall, food was was really yummy and service was wonderful! But i still think the dress code thingy is a bit much for crab cracking.
author: Cathy N.

description:
I took some friends from Sweden to this place as they requested seafood for dinner.  Right from the start I noticed how old and depressing the place was.  I had to interrupt the bar tender from reading the news on his iphone to wait on me while I awaited my friends.  He was the most unfriendly and miserable person and I could not believe a manager would have someone like that behind the bar.  We were seated at a corner four top table where it was quite dark and dingy.  I had to ask to be seated in one of the many open tables by the window.  Our waiter spoke so fast it was difficult to understand him.  He was forcing two entrees on us...roasted Dungeness Crab and the Prawns with garlic noodles both which were the most expensive on the menu. I chose the Prawns with garlic noodles to the tune of $35.00 for the entree.  It was horrible! they were filleted and flat and loaded with butter.  The noodles were dripping with butter and garlic and so thick you would hurt someone if you dropped them off a one story building.  $75.00 for two glasses of white wine and 4 flat greasy shrimp with a pile of vile noodles.  

STAY AWAY!!!!!   DO NOT GO TO THIS RESTAURANT!  Overpriced and bad service and especially poor quality food.
author: Gretchen H.

description:
Roast Crab.  Order it.  Love it.  Live it.

Also, the Garlic Noodles.  This place is so phenomenal...I will never ever stop eating here.  The Crab is cooked in a separate kitchen from everything else and only family members are allowed to be in the Crab kitchen...now THAT is legit.  The fried banana is also divine!  A little pricey, but I am a firm believer in, "you get what you pay for!"
author: Jessyca M.

description:
We made the mistake of ordering the fried rice, DO NOT ORDER THE FRIED RICE! So gross & flavorless. 

& they had not lobster on week nights?! LAME!
author: Patrisha B.

description: Highly Recommended Drunken crab and garlic noodles . Been coming here for at least 15 + years as well as Judah st location . Have not been here recently not sure if anything change as I'm reading new manager running the show .  Will give a try and will update review .
author: SF G.

description: Really great food! Service was decent but food is amazing! I am also a HUGE seafood fan! This place has history as well.
author: Elena D.

description:
Wonderful seafood restaurant with very tasty garlic noodles.
Crustacean is a special occasion restaurant.  If you haven't been here the one-liner to describe this place is a "fine dining Vietnamese fusion seafood restaurant".

Food - excellent
If you like crab then for your first visit you should order the garlic roasted crab with a side of garlic noodles.  This can be shared with another person.  Simply put, I have never had similar crab/noodle elsewhere.  
During our last visit our friends ordered the royal tiger prawns (also served with the garlic noodles).  This was a big surprise because I like it a little better than the crab.  While the portion was a bit smaller the prawns were fresh, juicy, and very tasty.
For starters we went for the jumbo prawn wontons (fantastic) and the papaya salad (good, not great as I prefer them a bit spicy).

Price - good
This isn't a cheap place.  We had two main courses, one side garlic noodle, three appetizers, one desert, about 4-5 drinks and the bill came to $200.  However, you are getting quality food with very decent portion, so overall I think the price is good.

Service - excellent
Attentive, quick, waiter was knowledgeable about the menu, left nothing to be desired.

Overall - excellent
I'm a fan of this place.  Definitely a good place to go from time-to-time on special occasions.
author: Andi H.

description: Amazing service, great decore, to die for noodles and crab, all hidden up in a lil building on polk. This place is a must if you want yo just have amazing crab done in soooo many ways.
author: Keo Y.

description:
Got invited by friends when we visited them in San Francisco.

According to my husband, the crab was good. ( I am allergic to Crustaceans).
I liked the garlic noodle and the sea bass was AMAZING!!!
author: Storm C.

description:
Crustacean's is two block away from my work. I remember the first time I ate here. The crab was delicious and it was my first time to try garlic noodles. I fell in love with the place. The restaurant is pricey, and you cannot come in street clothes. Guys have to wear a sports coat. Over the years I've been only back three times because I would go to their sister restaurant Thanh long off Judah street, which is the same owner and same food. 

For appetizers I've tried Tempura Style Coconut Prawns with a tangy orange-mustard sauce, & Crab Puffs minced dungeness crab meat marinated with a creamy cheese sauce wrapped in a wonton shell, served with a peanut-mustard sauce. 

Dishes: Shaken Beef flambéed in Chardonnay, sautéed green beans, cherry tomatoes and red onions. 

Steamed Seabass with scallions, asparagus, shitake mushroom and a ginger-citrus infusion 

The Roast Crab an entire dungeness crab roasted to perfection with garlic and spices 

An's Garlic Noodles egg noodles infused with An's famous garlic sauce 

I've had friends that went recently and told me it's not the same as when we first went. Has that ever happen to you where the food does not taste the same as before? I suggest if your craving for crab and garlic noodles go to PPQ in the Sunset district in SF.
author: Kathy V.

description: This restaurant was HIGHLY recommended to me and so I went here. Great tasting crabs (i got the roasted garlic crab) and the FAMOUS garlic noodles...both were very good but the downfall was the service......geez, our waiter (shoulda got his name) was so BLAH and at some points came off as rude, especially when he was heavily sighing when setting up our table when the food came. His service sounded FORCED and just ruined it for us. I dont know what happpened to him before he came into work (as we were one of the first tables seated), but it was obviously bad....or terrible. It reflected in his service and made our dining experience below what I was expecting from a fine dining restaurant like Crustacean. His helpers were friendly and nice.....he on the otherhand, total opposite. He really needed an attitude adjustment that day. He just really seemed like we were bothering him by coming in there to eat. UGH. If his service was better, i would have given 2 extra stars, but his service or lack of really brought my review down.
author: Aline D.

description: Roast Crab with garlic noodles is soo good. Everytime I come here I get it. Come on an empty stomach since it can be filling! :)
author: Arielle T.

description:
OMG...I haven't found better than this, so if you did, please inform me!!!!

Came here on Friday night for my bday dinner.  OMG!!!!!!  

I had the roasted crab with the noodles.  The restaurant favorite.  

My mouth is still salivating!!!!!!

The crab was a bit oily but please by no means take that as a negative.

The waiter knew it was my birthday and bought me out a little treat; for free; a warm donut w/ice cream.  Awwww

For dessert; mango cheesecake.

The only thing that I wish I could change of course was the price.
It was super expensive.  For 2 people, we ate the same thing plus dessert was $123.00!  WOW!!!!!!  And...I don't like how they don't post the crab pricing on the menu.  Soooo NOT COOL!!!

Great decor, excellent waiter service, and on point with the water refills and the bowl clean up. 

I love it!!!!!!!
author: Sandra S.

description: I love love loved the garlic noodles. .came here to celebrate my anniversary with hubby and it did not let me down.. yummilicious crab, garlic noodles and a beef entrée (I think it's the shaken beef). .ambience was good and so was the service.. it's a bit expensive but definitely worth it.will definitely go again!
author: Neena S.

description:
Wow, not worth the money. Go to PPQ Dungeness instead.

To be fair, at least the crabs are the best thing on the menu here. Don't even bother with the other entrees -- they're overpriced and overcooked. But even still, one of the roasted crabs we ate was grey inside. GREY. Like eating a dead limb.
author: Albert L.

description:
This place, gave me a lady boner.

Beef carpaccio-YES.
Garlic noodles- YES.
Garlic crab- ZOMGFUCKYES.

Olivia Newton John, words it perfectly for me:

"Maybe I hang around here
A little more than I should
We both know I got somewhere else to go
But I got something to tell you
That I never thought I would
But I believe you really ought to know

I love you
I honestly love you

You don't have to answer
I see it in your eyes
Maybe it was better left unsaid
This is pure and simple
And you should realize
That it's coming from my heart and not my head

I love you
I honestly love you"
author: Thao L.

description:
I came here a few times, and I think their garlic noodles is definitely one of a kind! 

I have tried making the garlic noodle twice, and failed twice! I added 1 pound of butter and one pound of garlic, and it still doesn't turn out the same ;)!

I tried the Dungeness Crab, and I think it was decent--I think I had such high expectation that it didn't live up to my expectations.

oh, my gf and i were able to grab some drinks at the bar when we were under 21 ;)
author: Jen H.

description:
um all i gotta say is $42 dollas and u dont get to pick yo crab?!?!?!?!.. So coming here with a large party i guess might not be the business... they took so long to take our order and we was hungeerrraaayy!!!! soooo $42 bucks for some crab??? LOL  i actually split a crab with my friend so that makes it $21 dollas for 4 legs... 10 dollas for some garlic rice and 10 dollas for some garlic noodles..... and why you dont get no bread and butter to fill u up? cuz the crab sho didn't... it was good though until i found out it was $42 dollars :(

I ordered a margarita with patron "thumbs down" it was watered down, but the waiter let me change it for a lychee martini which was actually good 

service was ok they could have been more attentive to us and when my friend was giving her order the man in the suite "manager?" i guess, his arm was all up in her face grabbing something off the table multiple times in between her and the waiter... RUDE!!!! was it because she was black?haha just kidding... but for real though 

oh and there is a cake charge, which means they charge 2 dollas per slice to cut your cake.. yesss "your" cake but what had happened was... lol  when they told us that, there were so many stank faces all around the table and questions and remarks filled the air... they waived it.... that was nice 

P.S the water was fresh and icy 

would i go back? i dont think so 

2 stars because of mediocre service, hot towels were not hot and crab was not meaty and worth the price garlic rice was dry and gratuity was a high percentage.... daaaam gina!!!!
author: YennyMack L.

description: I came here last night for my gf's bday and the service was horrible. The server acted like she didn't care and wanted our party out as soon as possible. I got the tiger prawns which were nothing special and cold. My gf got the crab and it was drenched in butter. And on top of that we brought our own cake and they charged us $35.00 for an open food charge. Will never come back to this restaurant.
author: Chris A.

description: I've been dying to try this place in LA and never had the chance. I was told that there was a crustacean location in sf and had to go! We got the salt and pepper calamari, two orders of roast crab, and garlic noodles (and of course some drinks!) - the food was good, but not great. The crab was very flavorful but in my honest opinion, I don't think it was worth the cost.
author: Katarina D.

description:
Okay, so everything at Crustacean was pretty amazing and I can't wait to go back again!  This is a place where the atmosphere was nice, but the food was just so good we could have eaten it in a cardboard box and it wouldn't have mattered, because it just tasted great.  We started off with drinks - I had a Mai Tai and it was perfectly made.  My friends drinks all looked great too, but I have a soft spot for Mai Tais.  Our appetizers included salt and pepper calamari (excellent, not always on the menu there but if you go I would ask them to make it), spring rolls, fried spring rolls, and papaya salad.  We had a few other things too, but I can't remember - they were all excellent though!  
For entrees we all shared:
-An's Garlic Noodles - these were amazing! I was a little concerned that they would be overly garlicy, but not the case at all. The noodle quality was excellent and they were perfectly seasoned.  Like everyone else says, this is a 'must try!'
-Helene's Ravioli - filled with shrimp in a creamy sauce, also excellent
-Shaken Beef - very tasty, tender beef and great vegetables
-Short ribs (daily special) - excellent as well, but I think the Shaken Beef was better... served with bok choi and rice
-Steamed Seabass - great as well
Everything was super tasty and like I said before, I can't wait to get back there - I will probably visit the Beverly Hills location next since I live in LA, but I just hope it's as good!  Well done, Crustacean!
author: Anthony B.

description: This restaurant has really fallen off! My boyfriend and I visited for a Valentine lunch and we ordered two garlic crab (52.95 ea.) two garlic noodles, garlic bread, and coconut shrimp for appetizer. When we received our crab it was not clean and had crab guts on our plates. (For 52.95 each the crab should be clean!) Also, I looked up to the ceiling to noticed that their drapes were ripped giving this place an unkept look. I don't know what has happen in the past couple of years but we will not be patronizing this place ever again, however the garlic noodles still ROCK!!
author: Kimberly A.

description:
Not bad, but not as good as PPQ, It's expensive and PPQ definitely is the way to go.

I'll keep it simple this time ;)
author: Eric A.

description: The crab is addictive. Asian style appetizers are also nice. So sad that I can't find this kinda garlic-buttered crab in Japan.
author: Yuko F.

description:
A bit too fancy for me! And a bit more expensive than the other crab joins ( i guess, really, just more expensive than PPQ. R&G is also pricey)

The good thing about this place? the garlic noodles and garlic rice! they rocked - the best garlic noodles/rice out there. However, PPQ has the better crab, in my opinion.

Crab ratings:
PPQ (better than) R&G (better than) Crustacean

Garlic noodles:
Crustacean (better than) PPQ
author: Carol L.

description: A bit overpriced for Vietnamese food, but the crab (though a bit oily) and garlic noodles are delicious. Apps were fine - nothing stood out. Not sure how often I would come back; I'd probably go to the cheaper sister restaurant (which I heard has the exact same menu). The venue feels a bit antiquated, too. Could use an upgrade.
author: Erica L.

description:
Went here with a friend from Japan who loves seafood. I had the salmon; he had the king crab; we shared some garlic noodles. Delicious, tasty food. I tried the crab -- it was light and buttery.

I didn't really like the ambience of the place though. It seemed kind of stodgy and East Coast.... very dark.
author: Max H.

description: I have heard alot about this place from others saying that its the greatest, decided to try it out on Valentines Day very overrated to start off felt very uncomfortable with the other customers there needs to be a dress code customers coming with their pants down around their ankles come on, the staff was nice I had the Tiger Shrimp with Garlic Noodles it was ok they did not have dessert that I wanted overrall experience for what I paid was too much I could have did better at home.
author: Vada P.

description: Always a treat. The best roasted crab and garlic noodles in the land. Pricey but great service and good food that you can't get anywhere else. Our last experience wasn't the best as we were seated next to a birthday party of 16. A real downer. They should have s private room or not book big parties. I hate paying that kind of money and not be able to talk to my party.
author: Jodi F.

description:
The garlic noodles were great. I had it top with giant prawns instead of the usual dungeon crab. We reserve for a party of 15, so you can inmagine it was very pricey . Let just say it was well over 500 dollars..

     Ok so let me get to the point. Most of you guys are wondering why I gave this location a one star..prior to us getting done with our meal the sever address that he cannot separate the bill.. So we brush it off like ok.. What he forgot to mention was that we have to figure out our portion of the bill. That was very upsetting due too the point that it took us about half the time it took us to eat trying too figure out everybody's tab.  That wasn't cool.
author: Cee S.

description:
This was hands down, the best place that we ate during our short visit in San Francisco!

For the appetizer portion, we ordered the salmon carpaccio and calamari. Both were good. However, we weren't "wow-ed" until we tried their famous roast dungeness crab. I have to say that it was damn finger-lickin' goooood!! It definitely lives up to the hype. The portion was huuuuge and I had a tough time trying to finish my whole entree as I didn't want any of it to go to a waste. Talk about food coma afterwards!

My only complaint about my experience is An's garlic noodles. They were dry and very bland and we hardly touched it. It definitely needed some seasoning. 

Overall, very pleasing experience and I would definitely love to return again the next time that I am in SF.
author: Lynda N.

description:
Dropped here last Saturday for dinner for two.

We didn't have a reservation (impromptu decision) but the wait wasn't too long (~30 minutes).

Ordered Roast Crab ($39), Deep Fried Lobster Wontons (~$11), Garlic Noodles (~$10), and baked alaska (~$8) for dessert - it was enough food for two because we weren't too hungry, but people with bigger appetites should consider ordering one crab per person or sharing a large plate between the two in addition to a crab.

The crab was really great - what was amazing was the garlic oil that it came with that you could dunk the noodles and crab into. The garlic noodles were amazing, and the portions seemed small at first but it was more filling than it looked. Went well with the crab.

The appetizer was decent, the lobster went well with the bacon it was wrapped it but wonton is a wonton. 

The dessert was amazing - the baked alaska came with a small side of banana foster and the balance between caramel ice cream and chocolate cake was perfect. 

Service was great overall and prompt in most instances. Some room for improvements but no complaints here.

All in all, great Vietanmese seafood experience and would go back again. The whole bill came about to ~$75 for two people which doesn't make this an everyday occasion, but definitely worth the food we've had.
author: Sean L.

description: The Roast Crab and the Garlic Noodles are a must! Everything else is up to you. Best tasting crab I have ever had, nuff said
author: Silvino R.

description: I came here a few years ago with my friends and really enjoyed the Roasted Crab.  On this trip, I wanted my girlfriend to try here so I made reservations a week before.  We came here and it wasn't too crowded.  We went straight to the bar and had a drink while they got our table ready.  My girlfriend was thinking about getting the Drunken crab and the Roasted crab to half each one.  I told her that we should both get the Roasted crab.  The waiter explained that the Roasted crab was by far the most popular dish and that the Drunken crab wasn't that special.  I wish she would've explain more about the menu.  I like when the waiter goes into further detail of the menu and have to wipe the drool off my mouth when they are about finished.   So we decided on 2 Roasted crabs and the garlic noodles.  We both enjoyed it and was glad that we decided to order our own Roasted Crab.  Little messy so it was good they gave us a bib.  Garlic noodles was excellent.  I would definitely come here again.
author: Reid I.

description:
EXCELLENTÉ !

Love there food. Nice atmosphere. Must have $$$$. Garlic noodles and Roasted crab are delicious.
author: Nichole H.

description: Lots of businesspeople here as it seems to be a favorite place for sales people and their customers.  The crab has lots of oil on it but it is tasty and mostly easy to eat.  The food is okay but not great.  I suggest valet parking and forget trying to find a spot around here.  The valets did a nice job with all our cars.  The service was good but the ambience didn't impress me.
author: Steve T.

description:
Price- overrrrrr priced! 
Service- great 
Parking- horrible
Food-great crab "the roast" not the drunken crab 
Ambiance- romantic
author: Nia Q.

description:
I went here last Friday night with a party of 8. I had reservations for 8:30pm but we were running late. They were able to seat us as soon as everyone arrived. It was pretty busy but the service was fast and friendly. Food was delish but I thought the appetizers were just a bit lacking for the price that they were going for. 

Here is what we ordered:

Appetizers
Salmon on Shrimp Crisps - Norwegian salmon with sun dried tomatoes, capers and a garlic aioli on fresh ground shrimp chips 
(TDF ~To Die For but you only get like 6 pieces)

Crab Puffs - minced dungeness crab meat marinated with a creamy cheese sauce wrapped in a wonton shell, served with a peanut-mustard sauce

Seafood Cakes - prawn, basa fish, and calamari with shallots, garlic and Vietnamese fish sauce served with Asian cured vegetables

Papaya Salad with Calamari lightly marinated calamari, tossed in our spicy Vietnamese vinaigrette with green papaya, "rau ram," and fresh Asian basil
(Would've been better if the calamari were fried/grilled)

And then for the main entrees everyone paired up and shared The Roast crab and garlic noodles.
(The noodles were sooo good and so was the crab but the crab tasted very similar to the crab that I cook at home)

Perhaps when I do decide to go back, I will try a different crab.

Also, one of my friend ordered the Shaken Beef flambéed in Chardonnay, sautéed green beans, cherry tomatoes and red onions.
(This one is good too but I don't know if it is worth $20.95)

One thing that I didn't like about this place was that while we were waiting for the rest of my party in the waiting area, there was a large group (my guess is that it was their holiday party) and there was this very loud and obnoxious woman. I mean you can hear her loud and clear (think Janice Chandler's ex-girlfriend from friends, Fran Drescher laugh and Shanaynay all in one).
