Yeah I know not a very pleasant thing to hear when you're trying to enjoy your food and company. Anyway, all was good once their party left. Everything seemed too quiet. LOL.

If you've never been here, at least try it once. It'll be worth it.
author: Anna P.

description:
Man...I'm glad we shook hands before dinner.  This was an important deal I wanted our team to close, and we wanted to impress the customer.  House of Prime Rib?  Harris? Scoma?  Crustacean?  Luckily our customers suggested Crustacean before we gave them the choices.  It sure would not have been my choice.

Lotta glitz, lotta wow factor, lotta hype.  Too bad notta delivery.  Crustacean is the same restaurant as Than Long, just with higher caliber clientele and much steeper prices.  Their signature dish of Roasted Crab didn't thrill me; I was expecting the flavors to permeate through, but unless you sucked the shell, all you got was in essence steamed crab.  I wish they cracked the crab before they cooked it so the spices would have a chance to marry up with the crab.  Their other signature dish, garlic noodles, was overcooked and in time turned gummy.  A light toss in oil or wine would have kept the noodles from bunching up into a massive glob of wheat.  Saigon beef is pretty good but pricey at over $21 for an appetizer of about 8 pieces.

Wet napkins after our meal would have been a nice touch.  We all had to parade to the rest room to wash up...good thing we already shook hands.  Service and ambiance is what's keeping this at a three and not two.  Next time I'm picking the place.
author: Ron L.

description: If you like crab and if you like garlic then you'll find the food at this restaurant to be worth the price and your time. We had a delicious meal with wonderful service!
author: Charles N.

description:
I haven't been in here in a while, but I was here for a special occasion and I must say that I really liked the ambiance and the classy feel of the place. I mean, it's not THE classiest place around, but with the amount of people they seat, I think they did a pretty good job.

Lighting is good and jazzes it up for a special date or occasion. You probably want to get out of your jeans for this place and definitely make reservations. 

The garlic noodles are a definite MUST. Crab is good, not the best, but still good. Unless you, your party guests, friends, partner is super snobbish about food, then this would be a great place to celebrate or to just have a nice special dinner.
author: Janis M.

description: This is one of my favorite spots to go when I'm in San Francisco. The crab is delicious and so are the garlic noodles. The service is always excellent and for the amount of food you get the pricing is affordable. I would definitely recommend trying this place at least once.
author: Leslie A.

description:
Let me be frank. Out of the 5 times I've been here, I've only eaten two items on the menu every time. So don't ask me about their pasta, or steak or whatever else is on the menu. 

I order

Roast Dungeoness Crab and Garlic Noodles

Your bill will be around $130 with tip. 

But man alive, your woman will have a fat grin on her face. ear to ear baby.

P.S. probably the best service in town
author: Jon H.

description:
I have been eating seafood MY ENTIRE LIFE, and this place is friggin incredible.

I went here recently for dinner and was more than satisfied with both my meal, and the service. I ordered a dirty martini that tasted fantastic. The waitress was extremely hospitable, even endearing... She boasted being a mother of a three-year-old; I genuinely got that warm n fuzzy feeling you'd get from the sweet mother of a three-year-old. Me and my date both ordered the roasted crab with garlic noodles on the side, and as expected, the crab was succulent and seasoned to perfection. Next time, I'll holler at the lobster salad because it looks and sounds amazing. This is a great place to go for special occasions, or if you're from outside of the city and looking for a good seafood dinner spot.

I will add -- I've been to Thanh Long in the Sunset also (their sister restaurant), and anyone that says it's better than Crustacean is smoking a doobee. Their menus are almost identical, and Crustacean offers a more sophisticated environment with dark wood booths and a more intimate layout. Thanh Long is like a giant house gutted and turned into a restaurant... Totally no comparison. This right here is the one.
author: Joe H.

description:
So, I have been reving about this place to my now wife for over three years now.  Naturally this is the first time we've been able to make it up here.  And again, as advertised the place hit a homerun.

Tiger Prawns and garlic noodles are to die for!!!  Spend the money you cheap-skates its really, really the best prawns dish you'll ever put in your mouth.

Had to order that extra side of noodles to go, cuz you can eat just one.

Mama got the baked alaska, and next time I will be ordering one for myself because she hogged the whole thing.
author: Sean B.

description:
Pretty darn good. Roasted crab is what you must get - all the way. Drunken was unimpressive next to it but still good. Side of garlic butter is pretty much a must.

Garlic rice and seasonal veggies are great sides and a nice buttery chardonnay pairs very well.
author: j m.

description: My partner enjoyed his meal but I feel like this place is a hype spot to eat crab in a bougie environment. Maybe it was what I ordered but I did not enjoy the Blackened crab with garlic rice. I didn't find the crab to have any flavor and felt like it was something I could make BETTER at home. I'll admit I don't enjoy my experiences if I don't enjoy my meals. For me, we paid for the environment and experience, not the food. We also ordered the Vietnamese carpaccio and Vietnamese salad. They were good, but no wow factor with my tastebuds. There were three tiers the tables were posted up on and the set up was nice, but I expected the bathroom to be better. The staff were really nice and pleasant to talk with. I  felt like some of it was rehearsed, but that's understandable. Great tip comes with great service.
author: Vanessa C.

description: Always amazing!! I'm a fan I the prawns & garlic noodles but recently I tried the crab...AMAZING!!! It's pricey but worth it! A whole crab? To yourself? I'll be back in December for my anniversary
author: Shalonda A.

description:
Yummy garlic noodles and crab. I loved the food they served overall. Bring a group of friends and share to make it a fun experience. If you love crab, this is the place for you :)

Bring your own strong mints ladies - lots of garlic in the food :) Crazy parking - I think we used Valet because parking was impossible.
author: May B.

description:
Perhaps it was my date.
Perhaps it was our excellent server Dawnette.
Perhaps it was the outrageously tasty Roasted Crab, Tiger Prawns and Garlic Noodles Dawnette suggested we get.
Perhaps it was the appetizer, fried calamari, seasoned to perfection.
Perhaps it was the Baked Alaska.

Perhaps it was everything!!!

 Having lived in this city my whole life, and not been to this restaurant till last night, is a shame. Crustacean delivered a great experience for my boyfriend and I. So much so that I had to come back to Yelp and let everyone know just how wonderful it is. The food is packed with so much flavor it had me wanting to the dam crab shells. Forget about a hot towel, I just wanted to lick my fingers clean! 

I can't wait to go back!
author: Angelina F.

description: This place is garbage! The hostess was rude, waiters rude, and they had my husband and I waiting to be seated for such a long time that we even saw parties larger than ours being seated before us! Don't waste your time or money at this place.
author: Noelle S.

description:
Friend: Your face looks oily and you smell like crab! 
Me: And...your point is? 

If you come here to get anything besides the Roast Crab then you are a damn fool! 

Also keep in mind their Calamari as a starter. Nice app. to share before the BIG GUY comes out! 

Don't forget your bib!
author: Antonia L.

description:
My friends and i will never come back to this place again. The server was very rude and sarcastic. I ordered 3 Roasted Crabs, Garlic Noodles and Calamari. I waited about 30mins for my food. The people who came after us got their food before us, on top of that i have to ask my server 3 times where is my garlic noodles. 

I left the restarurant very upset and did not tip my server. UUGH!
author: Khe N.

description: Went with a group of 12, celebrating a friends birthday; everyone ordered the Roasted Garlic Crab expect for 1 person who ordered the Drunken Grab. The crab was not good at all and actually tasted as if it was old or overcooked.  I have patronized Crustacean's since I was a kid and never had a bad experience until now.  My only regret is not informing the Manager on Duty because the entire party experienced the same thing. One a good note, the Calamari was excellent.
author: Terri H.

description: I was going to make reservations as I have been before but thanks to Yelp, I was able to see their last inspection from the health department. I don't think I will be eating there in the near future. It's sad but I am glad I saw this. Way too expensive for them to not care about hygiene for their clients.
author: Stuart T.

description:
Menu? No thanks!

2 orders of roasted crab & 2 orders of garlic noodles. Every time.

Crustacean Noob: "Cat, do you want to share a crab?"
Me: *stares blankly*
Crustacean Noob: "Ok.... no sharing. Got it.."
Me: *Shakes head*
author: Catherine W.

description:
The garlic noodles and tiger prawns are always a hit. But the halibut was also a winner. Halibut was perfectly cooked. The baby bok choy was steamed, simply and delicious. The sauce was the icing on the cake, or in this case, the mashed potatoes. You know how you have dishes where everything perfectly complements each other?? This is one of those dishes..

I tried the Shaken Beef. I couldn't believe how delicious it was. If you eat beef, go for this dish instead of the signature crab.
author: Sunita M.

description:
Came here for a employee dinner and it was magnificent! The restaurant is beautiful and the servers are highly trained. 

We had the Crab Plate and we shared 5 orders among 9 people! The seasoning had so much flavor. The best part of the meal was licking my fingers!
We also had their signature garlic noodles. Very intense garlic flavor and noodles had great texture! Don't recommend ordering this if you're on a date...
author: Hideo M.

description:
My friend's small wedding reception was held here so the dinner option was limited to three choices to choose from-  the drunken crab, shaken beef in Chardonnay with sauteed green beans, and the pan roast halibut with mashed potatoes. I opted for the shaken beef simply because the crab would have been too messy and too much work to eat for a wedding dinner.

I'd have to say, that was probably the most flavorful beef dish I've had. The garlic noodle was good, though probably a bit too greasy for me, drenched in the garlic (and oily) sauce. I had a bite of the halibut, but was not a fan of it at all.  And I thought the mashed potatoes did not pair well with the halibut.  I'd be curious to try the drunken crab on another trip here, as it looked really indulgent. But it's going to be on a night where I'm ready to get my hands, and possibly, my clothes dirty.

I looked at the prices for the beef and halibut dish...it is a little pricey for dishes you can get elsewhere that probably tastes the same, if not better. I would say, if you come here, try the crab and garlic noodles.  Forgo the halibut, as it wasn't worth $28.

The staff was nice, as they tried their best to squeeze by everyone in the tight space. They accommodated our group very well, and helped with the cake cutting, picture taking, refilling everyone's wine/water/sodas.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I've only been here twice, but my boyfriend goes religiously. For apps we had the salmon on shrimp crisps and crab puffs. The salmon did taste a little like it was frozen and thawed instead of fresh like sushi taste, but I enjoyed the crispy chips that came with it. For our entree we had Chicken fried rice which was eh ok, the garlic noodles which don't have any sauce, but taste really good, and two roasted crabs. The crabs had too much pepper on them, it overpowered the actual crab to the point I needed to drink lots of water to enjoy it. The first time I went here I loved it, but for what we paid, this time I wasn't very impressed. However, the owner also has another Asian fusion restaurant in San Fran I will try:) 

P.S. Our crabs took exactly 1hour and 23min, it may have been because the guy next to us returned one of his, but if someone orders an appetizer and has to wait over an hour for their entree that's a huge NO NO.
author: Malisa D.

description: Based on the monumental amount of reviews which stated that the garlic noodles were   so good, I was mildly dissappointed. I had the prawns and garlic noodles. It was alright.  I made a dish from a recipe which tried to mimic the dish and it was delicious. I thought that I would try the original that inspired the recipe. Boy was I dissappointed by the lack of garlicky goodness. The noodles were adequate. Just run of the mill egg noodles on the slightly mushy side. The prawns were  good but to pay an extra $27 for 4 prawns is a tad bit much. Service is great. No need for reservations on a Monday night (restaurant was half full at 8pm).
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Same feelings as my previous review.... food is good. 

Salt and Pepper Calamari - skip the shrimp toast.
ROASTED CRAB - the Tamarind crab has more flavor. 
Garlic noodles - 2 orders.

Baked Alaska - just ok. 

Service was just ok again, and the place seems so beat. My review moved down due to an incident with the manager:

We ordered wine and had not realized the price was the Half bottle price - if the place offers full and half bottles of the same wine the waiter should confirm what you are ordering - "the half of that or the full bottle?" - basically we ended up paying $100 more than we wanted to on wine - the manager was VERY forceful and condescending, rather than be compassionate and claim his hands or tied or something he tried to make the person in our group who ordered it seem wrong and stuck with that happened - he didnt met us halfway in any form. Just plain bad customer service.
author: Jessica L.

description:
I usually do not give bad reviews and I'm going to preface this by saying our waiter was *excellent* and I LOVED him which is one of the reason why this place gets a 3 star rating.  I also want to say I *wanted* to LOVE this place because I enjoy crab and nice restaurants. Plus, my best friend raves about it. Maybe the one in Beverly Hills is better. 

All right, here we go. 

1. The Hosts (the men in the black suits at the front desk) were complete jerks. In fact, I walked in and they sneered at me.   I'm just going to say, maybe I'm a little sensitive. I'm here studying for a bar exam.  I came to this restaurant because I wanted to let off a bit of steam by taking my mother out for a nice dinner and knew I was going to spend $$. I don't need some jerk glaring at me like I was trash. 

2. My mother requested to be sat next to a window or at least not be cramped on a very small table. They said oh, we can't do that we are completely booked up for the night. 2 hours later... there were still empty tables. Booked up? Sure.

3.The lychee martini was excellent and I highly recommend it. I suggest drinking it after dinner to clear your palate. You WILL need it because...

4. The crab is GREASY. Seriously, my hands were super shiny with grease right after I finished the crab. Thank heavens they give you a towel because you *will* need it! 

5. Our garlic noodles came out lukewarm! Are they supposed to be cold or hot -- these noodles came out like they weren't sure if they should make the noodles hot or cold so they served it to us warm. Euw! is this how it is supposed to be? I'm not sure. Maybe someone else could enlighten me? 

6. The Fried Banana was awesome! ( I thought). But my mother didn't like it because there was too much batter. The ice cream was high quality and you could see the little vanilla beans. YUMMY!

7. The decaf coffee was Awesome! Thank you Mr. Waiter for brewing my mother a fresh pot! I'm sorry I don't remember your name but you deserve 5 stars because you were THE BEST!

I am going to go to PPQ tonight after reading the rest of the yelp reviews and will be back with a comparison ;)
author: Kat R.

description:
This restaurant is amazing, and I joined Yelp to rave about it.  I went to Crustacean for dinner with a friend on a Wednesday evening without reservations and we were seated in a few minutes.  The restaurant was surprisingly busy, but we still got great service.  Our waiter also made some great recommendations.  

We ordered Crab Puffs for appetizer, Roasted Crab with garlic rice, Saigon Beef, and one of the Calamari specials.  All of the dishes were delicious, and we couldn't have asked for more.  I ordered a Bellini Martini and it tasted just right.  I love this place, and even though it IS pricey I think it's worth the money.  The decor is comforting, and I have nothing to complain about.  I'll be back soon.
author: Cora L.

description: The garlic noodles are amazing. The crab's killer. Wish the building was a little nicer. Best crab in the city though.
author: A K.

description:
I hosted my husband's birthday dinner at Crustaceans to rave reviews from guests.  Crustaceans seated our party of 15 at a long table across from the bar. They deliberately sat us away from the rest of the diners as I mentioned on the phone that our group was a bit rowdy.

Our 2 waiters were polite, prompt, and respectful as they tried to outfit our entire party with crab bibs  =)

We ordered 7 roasted crab specials and 5 bowls of garlic noodles which were shared among all of us.  Overall a great time and no complaints from me!

I'd love to go back to Crustaceans to try other items on their menu.
author: Karen L.

description: Great steamed crab, and really fast service.
author: T S.

description: This place was one of my favorite restaurants on my San Francisco treat! From the point that we were running super late for our 7:30pm reservation, they were able to accomodate us at 8:30 because I called and said we were running super late. They could have easily cancelled but they understood our situation. Our server was super sweet and very helpful with the menu items so that was another star. Now onto the grand finale of mouthwatering and amazing food. We shared the roast garlic crab and oh em gee, was it amazing! I want to come back to Cali just for this crab, so much better than any lobster I've ever had, it was just sweet and tasteful, yet garlicy and super fresh. We loved it! Now onto these talked and hyped about garlic noodles. Even though, I'm not a fan of overwhelming garlic anything, but these noodles were just perfect buttery garlic goodness. They totally complimented the crab and I would definitely get them again with the crab. This place is also super cute inside, cozy and I love the bibs they give you along with the hot towels to wash your hands afterwards. So if you get a chance, go go go here!
author: Elina S.

description:
I wish I could do 2.5 stars, but since I couldn't, I rounded up.

A group of friends and I decided to go here after watching the Nutcracker. We made reservations a few days in in advance so we were guaranteed a table. I had read they a strict dress code but when we got there some people were dressed in slightly casual. 

The staff were super nice and seemed to be very knowledgeable. We ordered a few drinks and lots of food. The king crab was very yummy, but I'm not to big of a fan of the prawns, but what was to die for was the GARLIC NOODLES! I've been trying to recreate the garlic noodles ever since but I haven't never been able to crack it. For dessert we had the backed alaska which I wasn't too impressed with. 

I'm not sure if this place is worth the pretty penny I forked out but the experience was. I wouldn't mind going back here, but only for a very special occasion. In the city of San Francisco, I'm sure I can find a better and more affordable place for some king crab.
author: Crystal V.

description: Was very yummy.  My friend took me here for my bday.  I loved everything, the noodles, the crab, the fish.  I wanna go back soon.
author: Mary Ann A.

description:
We had our latest monthly dinner club at Crustacean.  Having lived a few blocks from this place for the past 10+ years I can't believe that I had never been here and was really looking forward to the experience.  The restaurant is tucked away in the top of a building so I was surprised to see so many people dining there.

The overall ambiance was pretty cool but I found the food to be lacking any real substance.  Since we were in a large group we ordered numerous types of dishes and the entree that I ordered was the jumbo shrimp which weren't that large and lacked flavor.  The service was very good though.  The bill ended up being rather expensive per person but we were drinking quite a bit so that is to be expected.
author: Blake B.

description: Excellent Roasted crabs & garlic noodles. Just simply that is good for 2. They have carried their business for 30 years with those 2 dishes. Will come back again.
author: H H.

description:
Crab was good!
Garlic noodle is great ! 
Cream bullet for desert ! 
3 stars since over price :)
author: Diem H.

description: this restaurant used to have the freshest food.  we went last night and were quite disappointed. though the service was good, the drunken crab tasted tired and the side dish of fried rice was inedible.  we also shared a few appetizers, but nothing notable or worthy of another visit.
author: R H.

description: Absolutely my favorite seafood spot in San Francisco. The garlic crab and garlic noodles are a must have. You can make reservations but the last few times I've been there I was able to walk right in and be seated. The wine list is extensive. I would like to see a little more variety in mixed drinks though.
author: Terry W.

description:
3.5 stars.

I never knew Crustacean existed having been to R&G, PPQ and Thanh Long (sister restaurant in Sunset). The location is perfect for downtown dwellers like myself, though the location is completely random and nestled on the third floor of what looks to be like an abandoned plaza.

We made reservations for our group of 7. They have all the essentials like the other restaurants: dungeness crab and garlic noodles.

We were strategic in buying one crab each:  tamarind, roasted garlic, drunken. We tasted each to determine which to order. It was unanimous at the tamarind crab had the most flavor in the sauce, some ordered two more of those. The crabs each had a lot of meat. Dip into sauce. Delicious. The garlic noodles were also great: we ordered at least 3 since the plate it came on was kind of small.

I can say that our server was kind of a grouch when we first met him and didn't smile or want to serve us at all, but as the night went on he warmed up a little bit. I wish they didn't include 18% for mediocre service, but whatever. I still think thanh long and PPQ are better in terms of quality (and decor). But be prepared to spend at least $50 each easy (without alcohol included). Each person can probably eat their own crab, which runs at $43 a pop. 

I'll stick to PPQ in terms of price. Way more affordable and conducive to large groups.
author: Jeanne C.

description: I had never been to this restaurant before. But I went with a co-worker who has been going for several years. The front of the building isn't much to look at and the decor seems to be tired asian. But the food was excellent. We ordered family style. There was plenty of food for everyone. The cocktails were just right. The waiter was very good and attentive. I look forward to going again.
author: Jacqueline H.

description: The only reason i am giving them 2 stars is because they have the best roasted crab. But I do not like being extorted. I made reservations for father's day today. Went with my husband and three sons. (5 of us) when I recieved my bill i noticed a 43.00 18% service charge, in addition to another 9.00 fee. I thought maybe they made a mistake and thought we were a party of 6 or more and added the gratuity of 18%. When I enquired about it we were told that they add the service charge for father's day, mother's day, valentine's day, etc. holidays. The manager told me it could not be adjusted and that it was in small print on the menu. My issue with this is that I should have been notified of this when i made the reservation.  But wait it gets better. They then gave me a receipt to sign and put bold writing on it that read. "This does not include gratuity". I told him to enjoy that because it would be my last time patronizing them. I think they are completely taking advantage of their customers and that does not sit well with me. If you do patronize them. Make sure it's not on a holiday or with a large party.
author: Teana H.

description:
An early Valentines gathering with four couples. Out of the eight attendees six had the roasted garlic crab and no one was disappointed.

But before the crab an entourage of appetizers was ordered:
The shrimp rolls...prawns wrap in a light crepe. 
The calamari...they were crisp and not oily, they could have had a dipping sauce
The lobster tail ...I didn't try so I can't comment.

I did not order the garlic noodles but my date did and she had the Royal prawns, quite tasty with grilled with garlic but not overpowering. But it is all about the crab. On my previous review about crabs I said it all about the size. Yes it is and the size of the claws were big. I think the crab weighed approx. 1 1/2 so it was good size.  The garlic seasoning gave the crab awesome flavor and I munched everything down. 

I thought the service was good, they offer the bibs, hot towels and refilled the water.
author: Jim D.

description: Hmm.. I don't get it. Food was ok... Overpriced crabs ($41.50/ each) and $10 lukewarm seafood dumplings (6 pieces). Maybe I expected too much from this place.
author: J T.

description: Absolutely delicious! Especially what they are known for. The roasted crab so good for $42, but the garlic noodles was devine for $10. I definitely recommend this place if you're in the area.
author: Daerleth D.

description:
Food was mediocre.  Had the tiger prawns with the garlic noodles. Prawns were dry and overdone.  Seemed as though the dish was sitting under a heat lamp before being served.  Garlic noodles were greasy.  Hubby had the roasted crab.  He had the same type of crab dish on the wharf for half the price.  

Got some grief from the host when we first entered the restaurant.  He asked us to remove our "athletic wear looking coats" (which we had planned to remove before being seated).  That started the evening off on the wrong foot.  

Was totally unimpressed with the whole experience.  Rather disappointing after reading all the rave reviews.  

Probably won't go back and won't recommend to friends and fam either.
author: Ms. N.

description:
Reservations for this place is taken seriously, and you still have to wait approximately 20-30 minutes even on a slower night.  I don't understand why there is a strict business casual dress code to this place b/c the interior of the place could use a bit of a update itself.

The waitstaff here is very attentive and was quick to bring out beverages, table settings, changing out table settings, and bringing out additional items per my request.

As for the food, the dungeness crab was fresh and the market price is not overly expensive. 

The garlic noodles was pretty decent to me.  It just seemed like slightly cold soba noodles flavored with oil, salt, pepper and garlic.
author: Angel N.

description:
Wow ....I had to give myself 2 weeks to calm down before I wrote this review. And to say the least it deserves -5 stars!I have been dinning  here for about 3 years. And every time I come In town on business ,I bring  a minimum of 4-5 guest with me, so that's at least $700-900 tab everytime ,so I expect after coming here at LEAST once a month for 2-3 years to get good service (half the waiting staff knows me). So me and my guests order the same ... Crab cracked and pulled. So, the waiter comes
back about 10 minutes later setting up crab cracking utensils. We asked him directly why he was setting those on our table ??? Since we orders ours cracked and pulled. ?.? He says to us ,it's cause they make him do it ?? So we didn't think much. Then our crab comes out.....  Crab cracked ? NO! Crab pulled NO! as pleas hold butter on side...NO AGAIN!! . So in a nice manner I ask the waiter why is this ALL wrong ? Not even one part of our order is right . He does not say one word goes and grabs a manager who come to our table and says to me and my guest (with the worst possible attitude) "well you want these cracked and pulled its going to be 45 minutes to a hour!" At that point I felt totally mistreated!! 1 hour to pull 2 crabs ?! Being that the restaurant was only 20% capacity or less this might even made it seem more insulting. So let's say they took our crab back and cracked and pulled it ,as well... It still had butter all on it like we didn't order!!! So our order would still be wrong even if they cracked and pulled in 1 minute !! So as I said keep your crab and paid for my drinks. I will never recommend this place to anyone! I won't ever try than long which is crustaceans sister Company . To me crustacean waiters need a I.q. Of at least 29 to work there! Never step foot in here again .... The valet is a great thats the only thing great at crustaceans.
author: R H.

description:
We went there as a party of 8 for a brithday dinner and it was fabulous! Comfortable but not too fancy. I have read other reviews and I agree, that the place could use a remodel and update.

We went for the roasted crab and it was AMAZING. Did I say amazing, cuz it was better than all the glowing reports I had heard. Roasted in amazing spices and butter oil. Oh boy! The garlic noodles are al dente and perfect. Tender but with a bite and just enough flavor to complement the crab. Yummy to swirl your noodles in the herb butter/oil. Heaven. This is the place for crab-period.
author: Melanie H.

description:
There was a time when I ate at this restaurant and I thought to myself, "it doesn't get any better than this." To relive these moments, I dropped in today for dinner. Since I didn't have reservations, the host seated us in the "loud" people section. And because there were only two of us, we were seated in the aisle (a half table) against the wall next to the waiter's water pitcher refill station. 

Environment: The other customers were super loud and made a lot of ruckas. Because we were in the aisle, the waiters swiftly walked by our table like some 20 times. At one point, my fork fell on the ground and I was hesitant to reach down for it for fear of being stepped on by a waiter. 

Food: Ordered the specialty crab and garlic noodles. Crab seemed not fresh. Like it was cooked earlier and then after I put in the order, it was cooked in the garlic butter. Typically, Asian restaurants cook their crustacean fresh (i.e. like out of the tank fresh). When a crab is cooked fresh, crab meat texture quality is much more fine. This one tasted like rubber. I was really disappointed. I had hoped for better. The noodles were a great disappointment too--they were too soft and dry. We asked for additional garlic or sauce, and the host said that the sauce was not possible because the noodle was reboiled in the sauce and then removed. We thought.. weird..but explains why the noodles are overcooked. 

Waitress/Waiters: Our waitress was ok. Not that attentive. Our drinks ran out and so we try to order more. Our waitress didn't come by that often and all the other waiters kept passing by (like a foot from our table) and deliberately ignored us (even when we waived at them). We finally got a waiter to stop for split second--in which we said we'd like more drinks. That waiter went and told our waiter. Then, our waiter made her way back to us and repeated to us what we had told the other waiter. The funny thing was that she kept asking if we wanted anything else because all we ordered were crab and noodles. What I wanted to tell her but held back was, "this table you have me seated in only fits two plates--if I had more room, I might consider ordering--but I'm too disappointed to continue eating here." Overall... Tips should be a choice. I really should not have tipped at all. 

The Hot towels are HOT. Too hot to touch. Can be dangerous. 

Food - I've had way better
Service - I've had way better
author: mary v.

description:
So you're in San Francisco and you love crab or seafood for that matter, this place has a relaxed, upscale atmosphere where you can enjoy what you came for. 

The name in itself "Crustacean" says it all. They have seafood, and of course a selection of meet for those meat eaters. What they do that is so unique is the fusion that they mix from so many Asian countries. 

If you like trying new things with the ingredients you already love, give this place a try! I have been for the last 10 years when I went to their first location in Beverly Hills!
author: An R.

description:
This review is mainly for their service. I felt like we were being judged by what we ordered. Sure we got tap water instead of bottled water and excuse us for not ordering a crab each per person...BUT we had plans for takoyaki and dessert afterwards so we didnt want to over stuff ourselves. 
We ordered the crab cake entree, calamari, a crab and garlic noodles and we felt like it was enough food for the 4 of us. The food was good and my favorite were the garlic noodles. 
The waiter basically threw the plates in front of us and dish was wobbling. Our glasses of water werent filled often and when we were finished the waiter cleared our table and plopped down the dessert menu without saying anything in a pile. 
I expected better service in a more higher end restaurant. I dont think I would come back here again.
author: Shirley W.

description:
Came back here to celebrate my fiance's 28th birthday. And to clog up our ateries.

We started off with the salt and pepper calamari (not on the menu) and for our main dishes had the roasted crab (we each got one) with garlic rice and garlic noodles on the side.

Calamari was really good, especially with the aioli dipping sauce. Also came with salt and pepper stir-fried veggies which were also delish.

The crab was realy good with all it's buttery-garlic goodness. I'm not an expert at eating crab (and don't like getting messy) so I made my fiance dig out all the meat  for me. I also couldn't finish it so I made him eat the rest (our waiter said that each crab was 2 - 2.5 lbs). He had no complaints.

Make sure to spend a good 2 hours here for a complete meal. The crab takes a while to prepare and takes even longer to eat.

Since it was his birthday, they gave him a fried banana with a candle for free. I didn't want to feel left out so I got the baked Alaska. Both were good and even though my fiance shared his with me, I didn't share mine.

Our waiter was really sweet and attentive too. He kept refilling our waters even when they were only like half full.  

Crab that night was $42/each and with the appetizer, sides, dessert and my fiance's martini, the bill came out to $160. Not bad since I was planning on spending more fo the old fart's special day. At least we didn't end up having a heart attack from all the butter which would have cost way more.
author: Britney C.

description: i love crustacean's i cant wait to go back again!  our waiter was real nice, he made sure to always check on us. He also gave my boyfriend an extra head with his crab, (since he loves the stuff they clean out...gross). I had the prawns with the garlic noodles. I thought that was nice on his part, anyways goo experience, we got lucky with the garage around the corner too. $5 since they were closing within 2 hrs. we thought we would have to rush but the birthday evening went smoothly.  =)
author: Isa W.

description: Crustacean is a restaurant that I've been going to since 1998 or so and I'm still a fan.  The roasted crab and garlic noodles are my favorite items to order.  Every time we've gone, the service has been delightful, professional, and timely.  The food is delicious and filling; overall I've had great experiences here!
author: K L.

description: Best restaurant in the history of the world. Gain noodles, roasted crab and fried banana.
author: Tim J.

description:
At one time this was an excellent restaurant. Now the place is seedy and dirty looking. The food is WAY overpriced. I had 4 roasted shrimp over so-so garlic noodles that would feed a king...therefore, I paid about $45+ for NOODLES and 4 shimp. This is where they make their money. Save the $45-$50 for a really good San Francisco restaurant. There are so many out there, and less expensive. By the way---the price was just for noodles and 4 shrimp. No bread, no salad, no veggie, no dessert. Can you imagine the price, with tip and tax, if you wanted more??
The waiter was good.
author: Nancy F.

description:
I've been here several times.  But I haven't reviewed it.  I guess its a treat that I reserve for special occasions this being my brother in laws birthday. 

We had the roast crab in garlic sauce, which was really tasty.

My favorite is the garlic noodles.  I read that people think its overrated I guess you have to try it for yourself.  If you like it awesome.

I did try their Sea Bass and I really liked it.  Dare I say I liked it more then the crab. :)   

Calamari was good.
Crab wontons we're really good too.  

You have to dress up a bit which is fine.  I hardly do, and if you don't feel like dressing up there's a sister restaurant thanh long.
author: Homer S.

description:
5 stars for the garlic noodles.

I'm not a big fan of the crab, it's too salty. The other menu items aren't that memorable.

Not a worthy enough of an establishment to have a collared shirt rule as compared with their Beverly Hills location.

But dang, those garlic noodles are the bomb though.
author: Mark Y.

description: The service was good but I just feel like the food isn't worth the price. The ambiance is nice though, and it's decent if you want to bring someone there for a date.
author: Christl A.

description:
Three of us went to Crustacean because it was participating in Dine About Town.  However, we decided to go with only 1 DAT order, and two crabs.  Lucky for us that we did!  The DAT menu was just not worth it in any way!  The three of us being Vietnamese, we were appalled at the menu "Vietnamese fusion."  Reasons being:

- They featured spring rolls and chicken skewers as appetizers when you can get them better for $2 at any hole in the wall.  
- The main course was  listed as "stir fry shrimp on An's famous garlic noodles."  Pfffftt!  It would have been more appropriately named "Garlic noodles with 5 shrimp" (see uploaded picture).  
- An order of their "famous" garlic noodles are $9 for a tiny bowl of chow mein noodles cooked in butter and garlic!  
- The crab was fresh and soft, but still done wrong!  The tamarind crab wasn't quite right (too many spices clashed with the tamarind sauce), and their specialty roasted crab was too salty and dripping in oil... and not the good way (see uploaded pictures).
- At least you can't really mess up fried bananas... right?

We tried giving Vietnamese fusion yet another chance at Crustacean, and all three of us agreed it was not worth the $120 bill.  They only get an extra star because we asked for our crab heads "dirty" (with all the guts in it), and the waiter saw how much we enjoyed it and brought us two more heads!  :)  

Note: They have a dress code, and they will make you borrow a shirt from them or take off whatever offending items you are wearing, so come at least a little dressed up.
author: Carol L.

description:
No bouffant reviewing style here.  I can sum up Crustacean in a very short review.

+ Good Food...great tasting crab and even better noodles
- Stingy waiter...always trying for the upsell. Look dude, I'm already spending $100+ for a meal. You don't have to try to get me to buy another  add on to my meal at every turn.
- Crab cracking fee.  REALLY? A precut crab isn't included in your purchase. C'mon cut my damn crab and don't charge me $4 to do it!
- Dumpy location.  It's ok inside (if you like the way trendy restaurants looked in 1993) but it sits atop a run down 3 story strip mall from the outside.  And while you eat, you stare at a flashing sign for free HIV testing at the Goodwill-type store across the street.

Final verdict: Good tasting seafood but not a fantastic atmosphere. I wouldn't go out of my way to go here.
author: Jeff G.

description:
Truly dissapointed in the service of this establishment.  I can seriously get better service at a $ - one star restauarant.  The service was so bad it did not make me excited for the food.  The waiter acted as if he didn't want to be there and his negativity just rubbed off on our whole party.  Irregardless of how stressing it can be to wait on a table of 20+, I think waiters/servers should always put a smile on their face.  Fake it if you have to.  Their bad attitude just reflected the restaurant as a whole.  Don't think we'll be coming back. 

And to be honest, you can get better and cheaper garlic noodles at Perilla(whick I can vouch for) and PPQ(so I've been told).
author: Catherine G.

description: I am against writing negative reviews. If u look at my past reviews it is what I didn't want to do, but this place royaly screwed up my birthday dinner. Started it off nice, I love Thanh long, the swamp, ppq dungeness, the crab house etc.., so I though why not celebrate in the heart of my city?!? We were seated promptly, and it took a few minutes to get noticed by our waiter. He came over was very pleasant, took down our order, and even made a few suggestions. Brought out our champagne & had some trouble with opening the bottle... Then brought out two salads (1 we had ordered the other we were confused by) and hurried off... Then about 20 minutes later we caught his attention and he looked puzzled. We informed him we had ordered two more appetizers and he looked embarrassed. Hurries off and had no idea the food had been "sitting at the pickup window THE WHOLE TIME." He quickly tried to clean up the mix up by saying he has them making a new order at no charge. Great! By then it had been an hour since we had been seated and we still had nothing but the salads and champagne. Now I'm hungry and agitated! Where is my crab?!? Ok now I see my crab!! Yippee!! But wait it gets better.. The server questions who has this crab and I politely nod that I do!!! Then he hands me the plate filled with hot garlic butter oils and crab while it was HOT WITH NO WARNING OR HEADS UP. I panicked when I realized it was hot and didn't see a good place to set it down at and the plate tipped and hot oil spilled all over my legs  they tried explaining that the waiter was having stomach issues or what not but it just was a terrible experience. I definitely had higher expectations. The food was delicious, but I will b sticking to their sister restaurant!
author: LoveAlways J.

description:
We kicked off our mini family reunion in S.F. with dinner at Crustacean at the request of my bro visiting from out-of-town who had raved about this place for years.  The exterior of the restaurant was somewhat dingy, but the inside gives the impression that you'll be in for a fine dining experience, that is, until you see patrons with greasy faces donning plastic bibs and getting their hands dirty.  But that could only mean one thing - the food must be damn good. 

Our party of five ordered a crab each plus one and shared a couple orders of garlic noodles, a lobster roll, Vietnamese carpaccio, papaya salad with calamari, and some other appetizer I can't seem to remember.  The starters were pretty good but nothing extraordinary.  BF also had the overpriced $20.95 shaken beef which was comparable in taste and quality to what casual Vietnamese restaurants put out for less than half the price.  The crab, however, was excellent.  Everyone opted for the roast crab while I broke away from the norm and ordered a tamarind crab - both were delish, but the former takes the cake.  And I will note that the crab here was lighter in flavor and more amenable to repeat meals than the heavier, deep-fried crab I had from PPQ a few weeks earlier.  So...if you like crab and don't mind paying a pretty penny for it, Crustacean is a definite must-try.
author: Liz N.

description: We got 2 garlic noodles and 2 crabs (roasted and drunken) total bill was $120. It was so dang good! I tried making my own Crustacean-inspired garlic noodle but I could never make it like the real thing! Just enough amount of garlic for the rich taste but it's not overloaded with the parm. How the heck do they do it?? YUMM! Best garlic noodle. As for the crab, I would rather go to PPQ (cheaper and their pepper crab is da bomb!).
author: Natalia H.

description: Ate here two years ago.  Food still delicious - had the roasted crab and garlic noodles. Brought back fond memories of the first time.
author: Keith R.

description:
I ate here with a Japanese friend because this was his favorite restaurant.  Kind of an odd location for an upscale restaurant.  I told one of my friends that there was a nice restaurant in this area and my friend told me to shut up.  Yeah, you wouldn't expect a nice restaurant here.  However, Crustacean decided to do it anyways, making the neighborhood nicer.  

Everything I ate here was delicious.  It was years ago and I forgot what I had, some sort of fish, but I remember I did like it.  I hear their steak is good, but I don't eat steak myself.  My friend worked here for years and years and told me that they definitely have good food across the board.

The ambiance could have been better.  The space seems cramped.  Prices are high...but worth it I guess if you have money to blow.  Location isn't the greatest considering you are on the edge of the prostitutes area.  Also no parking lot, only street parking.
author: Cynthia B.

description: One of my favorite and best places in San Fran. Get the garlic noodles, drunken crab, anything shrimp ! Just go and get the crustacean drink.
author: Kathy G.

description:
I have been  going to Crustaceans since the mid 90's.  I came upon this restaurant while working as an admin in the city, coordinating a dinner event for an executive visiting our office.  Our dinner was a success and I continued to host company events there.

Since then, I have taken my husband and friends to this restaurant and it has always been a great place for us to go.  I have had many items on their menu, but my all-time favorites are the garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles.  

It is a bit pricey, and I'm sure you can find other restaurants that serve garlic noodles and crab, but they just don't taste the same.  The crabs they serve has always been meaty, juicy and never lacking in flavor.  Their bar drinks are definitely very expensive, so don't make the mistake of not minding what and how many drinks you've had and end up with a $800 tab!  Yes, we did this (among 5 friends).  

I've read some disapointing reviews about service, pricing, and we have been fortunate that the service we always receive has been superb, each and every time.  In fact, they always leave the tomalley for us in the crab shell, versus removing it. 

It's been awhile since my husband and I have gone to Crustaceans and we plan to do so this weekend.
author: Candice J.

description:
I was AMAZED by this place.  The service was great but the food was even better!  Im a big fan of the Garlic Herb Butter Lobster!  Im not much of a seafood consumer, but this won my heart.  But you can't order anything without the noodles...!!! So yummy...my mouth is watering just thinking about this place.  I guess I shouldn't yelp right before dinner?

They have a variety of food, and the portion size is just perfect!  I will definately go back and recommend it to everyone!
author: Aman G.

description:
Great ambiance and service. Roasted garlic crab was delectable. Secrete recipe garlic noodles were also delicious. 

I also liked the lobster rolls, very light with a tasty sauce.

When we asked about the lack of crab butter in our shells, they gave us two extra ones. Can't beat that for service. We proceeded to use them as cholesterol filled rice bowls. 

Sauv Blanc was perfect with the the crab.

A bit on the pricey side, but worth the splurge especially during crab season.
author: Derrick V.

description:
Crustacean just like Than Long - have the Best Garlic Noodles.

Their wine selection is not very exciting. But their garlic roasted crab is D'lish. And their appetizers are equally as yummy.

( oh their veggies dishes are not that grand. ) AND super expensive
author: ThuZ W.

description: Decided to try this place after passing it dozens of other times.  Waited to be seated, and after no assistance at the front desk, walked through the nearly empty restaurant (with only three tables occupied ) looking for someone to help me.  I was seated at a cramped small table and requested to be sat at one of the other larger tables.  I was told that they couldn't seat me at another table. I again requested to be moved, and was informed that, since I was alone, I had to sit at the small table. Needless to say, I walked out; never to return.  Poor service.  No wonder the place was empty.
author: Brian F.

description:
Really outstanding Vietnamese-style crab dishes. 

There are a number of Asian fusion style entrees to choose from, but my group definitely came here for the dungeness crab. You can order a whole crab prepared in 1 of 3 different ways (tamarind, roast, and "drunken"). I had the drunken crab, which is simmered in a blend of 3 wines (hence the name), and my girlfriend had the tamarind style, which was tasty, but very rich and messy. Both dishes were outstanding in there own ways. The crabs themselves were enormous, and it was very easy to get to the big chunks of meat. The dungeness is priced daily, and quite expensive, but well worth it if you're a fan.

We also had salmon carpaccio and seared ahi tuna for appetizers. Both were intensely flavorful and satisfying. The tuna is served with arugula and a blend of two Vietnamese sauces, while the salmon is also served with arugula and capers. They have a good wine list and some special cocktails as well.

They missed out on the fifth star because it was obvious to our party that several other tables had been served their food before us, despite having ordered after us. Our waiter was apologetic, but that was of little consolation to us since it took at least a half hour after we finished our appetizers to receive our entrees. Nevertheless, I would definitely visit this place again because the crabs were just that good.
author: Jeff S.

description:
I love this place. I was so glad the boyfriend and I decided to eat here. I was craving the crab here due to a disappointing experience I had with the Dead Fish restaurant so I decided that I wanted to fulfill my crab craving at Crustaceans. I've eaten here one time before and the experience was as good as my experience today. Although the price of this restaurant is on the higher end I must say it was truly worth it. Everything about my experience was a positive one. 

The restaurant is a wonderful place for a dinner for two or a group meal with friends. The dress code is business casual or dressy if you prefer to dress up to eat dinner.  The restaurant is very clean and the service was superb. Our waitress was very attentive and on top of everything. We did not have to ask her for anything. She filled our waters, cleared our dishes, and was very knowledgeable about everything on the menu. I really appreciated her professionalism and friendly attitude. 

She recommended the salt and pepper calamari that is featured every so often on their menu. It was so good! The calamari was very tender and had just enough crunch to it. The calamari was accompanied by a delicious sauce that made the calamari taste even more flavorful. 

The boyfriend and I both ordered their roasted crab and garlic noodles and let me say the crab definitely fulfilled my craving. The crab was so succulent and savory. I was in heaven! I loved the flavors and how fresh the crab tasted. The crab was definitely the star tonight. I also enjoyed the garlic noodles, however I did not eat as much of them because I didn't want to get full and not enjoy the crab. My boyfriend however finished his meal and at the end of the meal we were so full but were extremely satisfied with the whole dinning experience.
author: Kathy M.

description:
One of the best ways to figure out if a San Franciscan knows good food is to ask them if they've eaten at the Crustacean. If they liked it, you know they have more dollars than sense. You can safely ignore any recommendations they have. They'll probably tell you that Pier 39 is a really cool place to hang out and that Chevy's has the best Mexican food. Crustecean is a place for tour buses. 

I am surprised at how methodical they are about hiding the fish behind sauces. Sauces like that were invented so that people can't see that their food is rotten, or so they don't mind that it is cooked to dryness, or otherwise ruined. Red Lobster is a better deal if that's the kind of food you are looking for. 

As a consumer, you should demand better food than this, or else restaurateurs will continue to ripoff the lowest common denominator.
author: Jeff K.

description: Love their garlic noodles and garlic roasted crab. Yep it is pricey but I go here one a year. It is so good I keep going back.
author: Jerreece J.

description:
Let me start by saying it's a bit pricey, but if you're up for some damn good dungeness crab and decide to splurge once in a while, this is the spot to go! It's one of my favorite restaurants. It's very upscale, the restaurant is gorgeous....and the service is great here. We also got valet parking bc it's ridiculous to find parking in the area.  They're famous for their dungeness crab & garlic noodles dish. It's a definate must if you come here. They give you a whole crab...can get a little messy if you don't like getting your hands dirty. We usually split a garlic noodles dish, which is usually good for 2 people. I hear their other items are fabulous too...but i can't resist but order anything besides their crab. The crab is based on market value, so go during crab season.

If you want the same food w/ a more low-key atmosphere/ family/kid friendly atmosphere...their sister restaurant is thanh long. If you want to impress someone on your first date, or want to celebrate a special occasion, then go to crustaceans.  I recommend reservations.
author: Gina N.

description:
Love this place!

I tried the famous roasted crab, garlic noodles, both are really good-!
and also baked alaska for the dessert - this is awesome!
author: Jikhan J.

description: I loved this place when I went, about a month ago. The garlic roasted crab? Delicious. The garlic noodles? Fantastic. I tried my dining partner's drunk crab and it was also great. I recommend this place to anyone who loves buttery, delicious crab. I especially liked that they serve the whole crab. Next time I am in San Francisco, I will go here.
author: Kathie X.

description: They played theme music from the lord of the rings, titanic and interstellar, which was quite an odd choice! Food was okay, nothing incredible, and the waiter spilled a calamari dipping bowl all over the floor on the way to our table.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Ambience is more  of a dark and romantic feel. The service  here is great.  
Appetizer were ok. Not too impressive for over priced pot stickers and egg rolls. 
A though the  "roasted crab " is the house special and the most popular item....My vote is for the  tamarind crab.  It's  to die for! One of the best crab place I've eaten. Ooooo and don't forget the side of garlic noodles. For dessert we tried the Creme brûlée. It's ok. I've had better. Over all 5 stars for the grab! The rest is about 3/4 stars.
author: Calee C.

description:
Yummm! Best roasted garlic crab ever! If you love garlic, you have to order this crab dinner!  It's a spectacular combo of salt, butter and garlic perfection! I don't normally lick my fingers, but here, its really hard not to! Definitely order the garlic noodles to go with the crab. I know that they literally have a secret kitchen in the restaurant... I don't know what makes the crab and noodles so insanely good.. But I think the mystery ingredient is crack, cause I keep coming back! 

I also love the Vietnamese salad. It's so refreshing, a little tart, and has a nice crunchy texture. The crab puffs are also really good. They are super rich though! I can only eat one or two and my husband devours the rest.

The last couple of visits I actually stepped out of my comfort zone and ordered the tamarind crab. Omg, its almost as good as the garlic crab! The crab is sitting on a sour, tomato-ey soup.. The flavors are just amazing! Hear this, my husband likes to dip his already garlicky flavored crab in my tamarind juice! Great explosion of flavors, you must try it!

However, I am not a big fan of their orange sherbert dessert. We ordered it one time and our sherbert was as hard as a rock. I remember stabbing the frozen dessert with our knife. We usually cut out the dessert and go elsewhere. No big deal! This place still gets five stars from me!

So fan-crabulous!
author: Tia M.

description:
Roasted. Garlic. CRAB!! Uhhh-sooo good!

I was in SF for half a second for a conference. Totally not familiar with this way of cooking crab as I'm from GA. Ran into someone in my hotel lobby who suggested I try this place out. Basically told me to order the crab and garlic noodles.

I wish I had someone else with me- I would have ordered more things to try on the menu. But since I only had one shot I went for those two items. The garlic noodles were tasty but to me just okay. The garlic crab is like nothing I've ever tasted in my life. It's salty, sweet, garlicky- I wish I could pinpoint all the ingredients to recreate at home since I don't know if I"ll ever get to go back to SF and not sure if it's available here in GA.

It was a pretty good sized portion. For one person- I stuffed myself sick finishing it up. I could only muster a bite or two of the noodles. It is pretty pricey- but it's crab after all. 

I agree that the building is kind of sketch and the interior could use an upgrade. . . .But I can overlook it for the wonderful crab!
author: Anjali S.

description: The lobster salad was pretty good, with huge pieces of lobster! I liked the roasted crab, but wasn't too impressed. The garlic noodles were a little disappointing since I didn't see pieces of garlic throughout it and it wasn't very strong in taste. The atmosphere is nice and our server was great. I'm glad they don't have a dress code since we just stopped by after hanging around the city. I would rather go to PPQ - this place is so pricey.
author: Katherine L.

description:
Celebrated one of my birthdays here and the ambiance with beautiful.

The food is okay.  The Secret Kitchen Specialties like the garlic noodles and crab are good - a cholesterol nightmare for me - but ok as a treat once in a while.

the shaken beef was good.  It's tender beef, green beans, and tomatoes flambed with white wine.


It's a fancy Vietnamese fusion restaurant.  Nice place to bring a date or business dinner.
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
1} went here with an old friend (back in February) but the memory of the yummy crab and garlic noodles is still fresh in my mind!

2} great window view! (at least where WE sat :)

3} baked alaska = wow. loved that it wasn't suck-in-your-face sweet. yum.

4} friendly staff, felt LOVED. never made our glasses go empty, and you can't go wrong with a waitstaff that actually KNOWS the menu and gives great suggestions!

5} yes. need to take the hubby here. the place has "Great Anniversary Spot" written all over it. YES!
author: DeVille I.

description: this place is just as good as its sister restaurant thang long. one this i like about this place more is parking is much easer to find that the sunset location. the food here is great and quality is a1. that is the biggest reason why people always dine at this place.
author: Art N.

description:
I am torn b/t a 3 & 4 star rating. I am a definite crab lover but was too dressed up to put a bib on and get my fingers crabby before going out. I am saving the crab crackin for a jeans and t-shirt day in the city. 

What I did try, I liked.

We ordered crab/shrimp wontons. I was craving crab cakes but I didn't see any on the menu. These were OK. I don't like cream cheese on seafood. 

Fried Calamari was delicious! I am not big on calamari unless it looks like a proper squid but this was excellent. Salt & Peppa, onions..mmmm!!

Garlic Noodles were good. I think they compliment the crab so you need to have both. Alone, they were just noodles and garlic to me. 

Good thing is I know what to order and dress for next time. Don't dress up too much if you're comin for crab!
author: Lily M.

description:
This isn't a place you come to for fine dining or great menu. It's a place you come to when you crave oily and salty. I agree with the prior mentioned recommendations on what to order:

Roast Dungeoness Crab and Garlic Noodles.  Don't order anything else.  Why? Because when you find something that hits the spot perfectly and makes you want to sing and dance, you don't go off searching for something of unknown.   Nothing's better than this to hit the spot when you're on your monthly you know what.  Take the left over roast crab oil and pour it over the garlic noodles.  gahh I think I'm craving another!

Their waitstaff are more of a dimsum worker type and not something you'd expect at a $150 for two.  Also, since I'm the creepster that always eyes everyone else's entrees when walking in/out, I can tell that their other food probably wouldn't make me sing and dance as much (the other foods I've experienced were almost offensive).  It's also not in the best area of nob hill/russian hill.   You know what to order!
author: Hannah W.

description:
The only thing good here is the ambiance and the garlic noodles, and the mixed drinks. The garlic crab is better at ARTS CRAB SHACK in Oakland or Hayward. The lobster roll is lobster meat stuffed into a rice paper roll and deep fried...nothing spectacular and something that you can do at home.

This place is pricey but I don't understand why...the food is not seasoned and they aren't salt and pepper shakers on the tables. If i ever eat here again it will be for a special occasion brunch, and for the garlic noddles and alcohol.
author: Michelle F.

description:
I was invited to a friends birthday party here, and the food was Fantastic!!
A little pricey, so will save this place for a special occasion. Love the garlic crab and the garlic noodles, WOW. I will be back!
author: Patricia G.

description: Crustacean is my sister's favorite special occasion on someone else's dime restaurant so we come here a lot.  The crab is excellent though I think the place overall is a little pricey for what you get overall, food, service, special touches so four stars.
author: Daniel Y.

description:
First time here.  Started at the bar, and asked for recommendations on the food.  The bartender said that if we have never been to Crustacean before, that we should definitely try the Roasted Garlic Crab and the Garlic Noodles.  The rec was great!

Roasted Garlic Crab - Awesome! Just a tad bit on the oily side, but very tasty and left me wanting a little bit more.  

Garlic Noodles - Awesome as well!  

These two items are a must.  Some people have written reviews on how this was a lot to finish, but I went with 4 other people, and 3 of us ordered this meal..it was just fine.  It's not too much at all.  If your not a garlic fan, then I can see how it would be a little much and hard to finish since it is a little on the heavy side for garlic.  

Can't wait to go back and try something else there.
author: Chris L.

description:
Although a great restaurant I'm reluctant to give them 4 stars.

Ambiance is very nice. Laid back with dim lighting. The booths were super comfy. Staff was quick and friendly. I started with the seared Ahi tuna which frankly was the best part of my meal. I also ordered one of their infused cosmos which was way to sweet and had to return it back to the bar and just opted for the house chardonnay. 

We then got our main course which was the full crab. I've never had crab in my life. No one told me how messy it was! I tried my best to look cute while getting my fingers all dirty and saucy from the garlic butter sauce and cracking the legs and what not. The meat was great- a little rich near the end I couldn't make it to the finishing the whole thing. It came with these garlic noodles which I could only have about 5 bites full of. It tasted exactly like garlic bread but in pasta. It was amazing. 

What bothered me was there was only one effing bathroom. Although we came rather early for dinner (6:45-7ish) there was a line of 6 people in front of me. What the hell is that?! When walking into this place is seems like a very nice establishment- I would think there would be more than one stall. 

I glanced at the bill - a hefty price for a dinner that honestly didn't WOW me. Yeah I had good service, and the food was nice (very rich, but nice) however I wouldn't write home about this place.
author: Amanda S.

description: We are obsessed with the roasted crab and garlic noodles here.  Yes, it is pricey, about $40 for the crab and $10 for the noodles - but it's so worth it!  We recently also tried the seasonal vegetables which was also amazing and a slightly healthy addition to our gluttonous feast.  Even though we don't live in the city anymore, we still make a special trip here at least once a year!
author: Julie C.

description: Want to eat frozen dead crabs that smell like they've been dead a year ago?  If you answered "yes" then eat here!  Chances are, you'll get sick or feel ripped off. They got employees who ratted on them and now I know they don't even use fresh live crabs...even their kitchen is heavily guarded...I just saw a tv food show that featured Crustacean restaurants and even the show's reporter couldn't get into their kitchen!  Instead, he had to talk through a metal window that was slightly lifted and you can't peep in.  What do they have to hide exactly?  Why is cooking crabs such a well guarded secret unless you don't want customers to know they've been using inferior ingredients while charging primo pricing?  Go elsewhere people!  Or, by your own crabs and cook them yourself-- it ain't that hard to boil crabs and stir fry them with some garlic and some curry powder...

The crab deserves 4 stars at least. Really delicious. 

But the thing is huge! I'm not sure how anyone would be able to finish one by themselves, let alone a whole crab AND a side order of garlic noodles. Our waitress recommended that each person get a crab and garlic noodle which just left us with a massive amount of food left over. 

And I guess that's fine, but I would have preferred to share and save that extra $50. I was actually leaning towards sharing and was convinced out of it by the waitress. 

And those garlic noodles, honestly I wasn't a fan. They're not bad or anything, I just felt like they weren't anything special. And after a few bites, I just wasn't interested in eating anymore. It's one big bowl of a single taste and single texture. Not very interesting. 

Overall, a very pricey meal for an ok meal. And it's a little strange to wear a bib and get down and dirty with your food in such a reserved sort of environment with piano tinkling in the background. Just a little weird, and we kinda felt like had to keep our voices down and whisper our conversation.
author: Hannah S.
R F.

description:
It's not in a very posh location but once you're inside it's very nice. 

I ordered the lobster salad, for $24. Probably the cheapest decent dish on the menu. 

The service was friendly and helpful.
author: Kathy S.

description: yummy garlic noodles and crazy goodness garlic roasted crab ftw! I heard the shaken beef is to die for, must come back for that.  Overall great food, location.  Even a valet for parking...dont skimp out. Whole crabs arent meant to be shared, order your own. You'll thank me later. 4/5 judochops
author: Dustin G.

description:
This evening I celebrated my 46th birthday with my gal pal Lori at Yamasho Karaoke. After a couple hours of belting out some songs we were parched and hungry and needed some nourishment along with liquid libations but where to go? We decided to just walk up Polk St and sooner or later we'd fine a cocktail bar. When we arrived at California st Lori saw Crustacean's and up to the 6th floor we went.

I have lived in the city since 90 and have walked past this restaurant 100's of times but have never dined here, not sure why not. The only thing I knew about Crustacean's was there's a family receipe for something really good, turns out it's the garlic noodles. 

We were greeted by the maitre'd and offered a table for two or sit at the bar, who can say no to a seat at the bar? I had no idea this place was going to look as nice as it did, almost seemed out of place for Polks st! Our bartender Fisel (Hope I spelled it correctly?) greeted us and offered to make whatever our hearts desired. In our case it was two "Hangar One" vodka martinis dry with lemon twists. I asked him about the infamous dishes and he explained the garlic noodles were the best and also the roasted crab. We decided to get one of each and split it. The crab was roasted whole and brought out on a large dish with a couple bowls for the shells. Another assistant helped us with our bibs because apparently eating this crab was going to be a bit messy!? 

I wanted to wash my hands before eating and Fisel read our minds, he brought out two very hot/wet towels so no need to leave our seats. Our large roasted crab and generous serving of garlic noodles were brought out with plenty of napkins and two crab crackers to help break the shells, bon appetit! The crab was meaty, cooked perfectly and moist and worked well with the garlic noodles.

After this delicious meal Fisel brought out two bowls of hot water, a couple of cloth napkins so we could clean up; nice touch.

Would  I go back? Abosolutely but only for a special occasion, it's a bit pricey but the quality of the food, the ambiance and the service from the staff is well worth it (Are you listening Madjool?)
author: David P.

description:
When I lived in LA, I dined at the Crustacean with my girlfriends, and loved it!  I was excited when I found out that there was a Crustacean Restaurant in SF.

I visited Crustacean with my boyf and his fam on Christmas Eve.  Awesome garlic noodles, the best crab I've had in SF, terrific service and great wine!  I can't wait to go back!
author: Zaneta C.

description:
One evening after training, my colleague made reservations to partake of her fave meal-- roasted, garlic infused crab.  She bragged that this was the BEST place for crab in the city & while I wasn't thrilled, joined the group for camaraderie sake.

As I perused the menu, I initially thought I'd get the roast salmon (my fave fish) or halibut but realized I should take a leap of faith & try the crab.  

Now, while that sounds like a no-brainer, I'd never had crab prior to that point.  My entire family loves seafood but I tend to refrain from those entrees during dinner.  My colleague persuaded me that crab was a must @ a restaurant acclaimed for their special recipe.  And with that, the waiter came over to tie a plastic bib around my neck.

When my plate arrived, the crab was already 'cracked' so that I wouldn't have to fight w/the shell too much and my first bite was AMAZING.  The succulent meat was wonderfully seasoned with the garlic & butter....My mouth is watering now, as I think about that delicious meal...we also ordered a side of garlic noodles which were thick and seemed really heavy compared to the crab but were just as tasty.  I didn't finish my entire crab and decided to get it wrapped so I could give it to homeless person downtown.   I ended up leaving in the back seat of the cab...I wonder if the cabbie tossed it or decided to sample the enticing nourishment in my little bag?

I am now a FAN.
author: Michelle O.

description:
So I've heard a lot about this place and how great it is.  As a result, I had high expectations.  Eh.....I'll start with that for now.

Started with the rice paper shrimp roll.  For the price, there was nothing special about it.  About the same as what I would get at pho hoa.  But they sure make it sound good on the menu!  

Then had the roast crab and garlic noodles.  I will say that they both taste good....but it's the butter that makes it taste good.  I'm guessing within those 2 dishes, I probably consumed 5 sticks of butter.  You can make anything taste good if you put in that much butter.  As a result, I do have to grade down for that.  

Lastly, this was rather disappointing.  I ordered a coke.  I think it was 4 bucks.  Most restaurants for that much, include free refills.  When I finished my drink, I was told that it would cost me another 4 bucks. Are you serious???  That much and no refills?  Plus, the glass was more than half filled with ice.  Man oh man I got ripped off.  

In the end, I wasn't that excited.  The place was decent but nothing special.
author: Patrick L.

description:
I came here for the first time with my boyfriend after the chocolate festival last weekend. My boyfriend and I walked in casually dresses not knowing that they required a certain attire. The hostess was glad to seat us but my lover had to wear one of there dress shirts. After being seated I was not very impressed with the decor its was an old fashion setting with a mediorce view. 

On the other hand, the food was immaculate. We started off with there skwered beef and a lightly breaded calamari...The best calamari I've ever had. For the main course I had the dungeness crab and my lover had the lobster with garlic noodles. The crab was marinated in a white wine and garlic butter delicious. I enjoyed every last bite. For dessert we shared the fried bananna a la mode. OMG, it was some of the best banana I've ever experienced and I can't wait to get back to have another bite.
author: Carolina H.

description:
I went there in Feb, as I remembered. 
1. The elevator scared me, so I would suggest to use stairs. I used stairs when I left.
2. Didn't make reservation, step in. Was told to wait for being seated, I wasn't getting used to this.
3. Atmosphere is modern plus Asian scent. of course, its background.
They have bar in the front. Compared to the entrance (outside), can't imagine there is such a restaurant hiding inside.
4. food, here it came. I agreed with one of reviewer here, it is a bit over priced. Same price people likely can get similar food. 
We ordered the crab and garlic noodles, chicken kabob as appetizer. Creme Brulee as desert. 
Have to say, food were a bit over salty. Crab is super fresh. 
5. Service is super and super. 30% more tip.
author: Gloria W.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here this weekend because he loves this place.  I was not impressed at all.  From the moment we walked into the elevator until we left the restaurant.  The place has no smell.  I wanted to smell the garlic or something similar but there was nothing.   The inside looked run down and the paint was chiping off the place.  We sat extremely close to another table and could almost eat from their plates.  This place is not romantic in the slightest way.  
Our server was fine, although when I asked him what came with the crab and he said nothing but the crab for $40 and I changed my mind, he became a little distant like I was low class because I didn't want to pay $40 for just a crab. 
I ordered the miso ginger beef cubes.  They were hard and dry and so saltly I needed a glass of water with each bite.  The green stuff in the middle of plate was crusty and old and stuck together too much to eat.  The only good thing on the plate was the bok choy and I don't even like leafy vegtables, but it was the only thing not soaked in salt or too dry to eat.
They charge for refils on sodas and the glasses are so small.  
My boyfriend ordered the royal tiger prawns and he said there used to be 6 and now there are only 4 on the plate and they weren't even good.  I may be use to Red Lobster where they just give you butter with every dish, but this place you have to ask for butter. 
We were so displeased that we didn't even want to look at the desert menu.  I was not willing to have him spend one more penny than what was necessary.
Perhaps I'm not ready for fine dining yet.  I will stick to Red Lobster and Old Bay Port for my seafood.
author: Michie M.

description: Crustaceans for some reason, was just okay.  The venue was very small and I felt like I didn't have much privacy from the neighboring table.  I also felt like the decor was a bit outdated. The crab was all right the noodles were blah and the service was not worth the price of the food.
author: Chaz'a B.

description: Love the ambiance. Garlic noodles. Roasted crab. Nice service. Sometimes not attentive but I guess they get busy.
author: Michelle H.

description:
My favorite restaurant in San Francisco.  Hands down!

Garlic Noodles and Roasted Crab, a must.  

I've gone to the one in Beverly Hills and the old Aladdin Hotel Crustacean restaurants, but I still like the San Francisco location the best.
author: X M.

description:
Don't bother me when I eat at The Crustacean! I've learned, since my first visit (years ago), to NOT share a Dungeness Crab with any other table guests! I might order a vegetable side dish, just to say I ordered something healthy... but I have to have the Crab (hopefully with a LOT of garlic butter, pepper, etc). I order The Crustacean Fried Rice just to dump into the Crab Shell to sop up their special sauce after I've consumed the Crab meat. That's the only purpose of the Fried Rice or just plain Rice! I might have a couple of beers along with the Crab, but I really don't care what I'm drinking when I'm consuming this Crab! DON'T BOTHER ME ONCE I GET STARTED ON THE DUNGENESS CRAB!

I am a total embarrassment to myself and others with me when I eat at The Crustacean!  One table napkin is NOT enough. Once you get started consuming this Crab, you're going to need a pile of napkins to clean up your mess! You're aware of the warm water and lemon concoction used to clean yourself up after a meal? It doesn't work! No matter how many bowls you ask for.
