I've tried other Vietnamese restaurants in San Francisco, Las Vegas, Los Angeles, Phoenix, etc. NO other Vietnamese restaurant can make Dungeness Roast Crab like The Crustacean! IMO, any other Vietnamese Dungeness Crab dish is a faint facsimile of the Crab at the Crustacean! I LOVE THIS PLACE!

I especially like the tiered seating (in the back) where, no matter where you are seated, any table can have a view out onto Polk Street. The view is especially nice at night! But, who's looking at anything but their Crab!

The run down neighborhood around Polk, where The Crustacean is located belies the trendy mod Euro Asian atmospheric theme after you enter. After you are seated, you will notice the most diverse clientele, in terms of demographics, in a Vietnamese restaurant.

After 3pm reservations, typical of any fine restaurant in San Francisco, are a necessity.
author: r l.

description: Great food and great service! Not cheap, but the experience worth your time and money. The best dishes are a dungeness crab and garlic noodles. The place is not as fancy as the one in Beverly Hills, however, when you are in a gateway you can not go wrong but choosing this place. Reservation is highly recommended! Not the place to impress on the first date, but definitely advised for a nice dinner!
author: Anthony K.

description:
Because I love crab so much, my girlfriend took me here for dinner on my birthday.  I'm glad she did.  We were seated immediately.  We went there on a Tuesday evening, and there weren't a whole lot of people around.  Anyways, we each ordered a whole Roast Dungeoness Crab, and garlic noodles.  The crab was really good (of course).  They use a lot of garlic, which was fine with me.  The garlic noodles were good too, albeit a little salty.

Overall, I had a very nice evening and a hearty meal.  I wish I could tell you the price though....but hey, it was my birthday!
author: King T.

description:
Every time we head out to San Francisco, we always make sure to plan a trip to Crustacean. The garlic crab is just excellent. It is a lot of work, but you will enjoy it! 

In previous visits, I always ordered the standard garlic noodles. This past weekend, I went with the jasmine rice. I am glad I did. The garlic noodles are good, but they are heavy and greasy. It can be a lot to digest on top of buttery crab. My suggestion; skip the noodles and go with the rice.
author: Aaron S.

description:
I am willing to say that my dinner here was quite possibly the best I've ever had, hands down, in my life.

We were in town for a conference, and my co-worker had already been to Crustacean several times to enjoy the dungenous crab.  Although we were exhausted, he insisted that it would be worth our while.  And he was very right!  

For starters-- the lobster rolls and crab puffs.  The lobster rolls were delicious, especially the dipping sauce.  The crab puffs weren't quite as good, a little fishy, but still enjoyable.

Entrees-- I had the salmon with spinach and my dining companion had the sea bass.  It was love at first bite.  The salmon just melted in my mouth, it was so fresh and well prepared.  The sea bass was equally good.  Both entrees were a generous portion.  We also had a side of garlic noodles, which is perhaps not the best side if you're there on a date but that wasn't the case here and they were amazing.  

Dessert-- the baked alaska.  There's always room for dessert, and this is worth every calorie.

They also have a respectable wine list.  Overall a delightful dining experience.  We will be talking about this food and looking forward to our next business trip to San Francisco to visit again!
author: Leah A.

description: Their garlic noodles is simply amazing! Although the place is run down a bit, thats expected for an asian restaurant, right? Made reservations and still had to wait a few minutes to get in but it was worth the wait.
author: Michelle N.

description:
I am a master crab eater with no shame at all with a bib on my neck and all my finger into it. . .so I enjoyed the Crustacean very much.Went to this restaurant with David's Co-worker's on Sunday night.  Sometimes it's just good to sit for a long meal and get ridiculously stuffed. Everyone on the table ordered a whole crab. You could pick which sauce the crab seeped in. I chose the garlic butter and David chose the one with a wine based broth.  

I give it five stars because it was finger licking good. Of course we didn't pick up the tab and if we did I might be way more critical, so keep that in mind as you continue to read on.   The calamari was nicely fried and not too much coating. The spring rolls and coconut shrimp were good, but the papaya salad with octopus is the best appetizer of the four we ate.

The crab in butter gets cold if you don't eat fast but it was tasty since the salt, pepper and garlic is added on top so you don't have to be dipping anything. Oh and you have to get all of your hands involved in this one, two fingers ain't going to cut it.  The one in the wine broth was okay.

The garlic noodles are really really tasty that even after a whole crab you can still eat the noodles. . .it's that tasty.

The desserts weren't anything out of this world, but nicely prepared and decent.

Overall the wait staff was very attentive. I don't think any of the crab shells pilled to any rim before it was replaced with a clean bowl.  One thing to note is that you can't be wearing a regular t-shirt if you go in. David had to borrow a collar shirt from the restaurant to meet dress code. The host however was very pleasant when he told us the dress code so it didn't ruin the evening at all.
author: Louise G.

description: Pricey but delicious. Sometimes I just want to go in with my pajamas and dig in but you have to be descent at least. Put some pants on!  This place is uhmazing minus the price. Call me a cheap-o but in my country crab does not cost an entire economy.
author: J C.

description:
Came back for a business dinner and got to try a lot more dishes (gotta love the expense account of business associates!)

Overall, I'd say...the crabs were good but definitely not as good as PPQ (and PPQ is a ton cheaper). 
The crab here was a little mushy (as opposed to the firm, sweet texture of PPQ's) and the garlic noodles at PPQ is TONS better and more generous in terms of portion size. The crabs here were also smaller. 
Whereas we could get 2 crabs for 3 people @ PPQ, we needed 4 crabs for 5 people and a ton of sides and apps.
The flavors here were also more subtle, which is not bad...but once you've gone bold and flavorful...it's hard to go back. 

- Tamarind Crab: The surprise fave of the night. gravy was tasty
- Roasted Crab: Good and flavorful
- Drunken Crab: Least fave. Flavors were too subtle
- Garlic Noodles: I know everyone raves about this and I love myself a good garlic noodle dish, but this is not that great 
- Lobster Roll: Puny sizes. What we Did taste was good
- Steamed seafood wontons: OK
- Salmon Carpaccio: Could have done without it. Not very good
- Garlic Rice: Eh. Should have ordered more garlic noodles
- Fried Banana: Good but completely overpriced
- Baked Alaska: Eh
- Creme Brulee: Eh

The location is also very weird. It's on Polk in a really run-down building. The restaurant is also looking Very dated. They may need to spiff it up really soon. 

The dinner (with 1 bottle of champagne, 2 bottles of Sav Blanc and 4 glasses of Port) was easily $700++

So, to summarize, go to PPQ, even if you're not paying for it.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: One of my all time favorites.  The roasted  crab is out of this world.  Do not waste your time with other items.  Do not think oh let me try the tamarind or drunken crab to be different.  You will be forlorn, sorry and feeling like an idiot for trying to be "adventurous"as you watch other diners eyes rolling back in their heads. Roasted crab, garlic noodles and veggies.  Worth going out of your way, consistent quality, great service, excellent white wine list.  I have visited at least annually for the last 15 years.
author: Celeste B.

description:
Sigh. 

Save yourself the trouble and go to Thanh Long. Seriously. 

The food was good. I got my usual garlic roasted crab, garlic noodles and rice. Prices were same as Thanh Long... but the uptightness... ugh. 

I walked in and asked them to put a cake in their fridge... the lady told me there was a $2 cake fee per person. I thought she was joking. She gave me a glare and proceeded to tell me that they serve their own desserts there so would charge if anyone brought there own... and then gave me another glare. Okay. I may look young, but PLEASE do NOT treat me like you are better than me. 

Second... dress code. Granted, I don't usually come in all scrubbed out.... but seriously. A friend put it well when she said, "they want you to get all dressed up and then give you ridiculous plastic bibs?"

The table next to us... an older group of folks were given royal treatment for some reason... the manager even came out to greet them. 

Our server, when taking our picture, made a slightly rude comment (I hope he didn't mean it, but I'll leave that for you all to judge), "Okay, now open your eyes guys!"..... seriously? 

Great food. Pricey as expected (stupid $2/per person cake cutting fee). 

Sub-par service. I haven't felt so .... snubbed... in awhile. 

Valet parking on California street. It's kinda tucked into the building so be on the look out as soon as you turn from Van Ness.
author: Rosemarie d.

description:
6 years ago after my first visit, I thought this place was excellent and surely would have given 4-5 stars (was yelp even around back then?). However, either my taste has grown more refined or the quality here has broken down. I suspect the latter, as I've been out of the loop for a while. 

We had a bunch of small plates along with the famous garlic noodles and the drunken crab. Yes, I am aware The Roast is what they are famous for. However, my date chose otherwise, despite the waiter's repeated prodding, so I backed her up. Later on, my date scolded me joking that I was supposed to step in and choose the "right" one. Because you ladies never know what you want, right? *duck* Just kidding!

Here were my thoughts:

Rice Paper Shrimp Roll - I saw "green mango" and I could not resist. I've had green mango in my Fantasia drinks, but never with real food, so I was intrigued. Big mistake, this tasted exactly like a spring roll you find at any vietnamese sandwich shop. No green mango taste whatsoever.

Seafood Cakes - did not realize it was just a triangular fishball/fishcake. Nothing special here.

Lobster Roll - could not taste the lobster, the rich cream/cheese overpowered everything.

Vietnamese Carpaccio - I liked this a lot because any raw beef is good beef =) however, my date casually commented that she'd make me this in 10 min at home and it would be just as good, if not better.

Garlic noodles - the garlic taste was unique, but the noodles were mushy and stuck together. There really isn't anything special about this dish in my opinion. 

Drunken Crab - crab is delicious plain, so it's pretty hard to mess this up. It wasn't overcooked, the sauce was ok, overall pretty tasty.


I don't mean this to be a scathing review, but I just don't think this place is up to par with what you'd expect from a $$$ establishment. I do think they were better from what I remembered the first time I visited. However, their service is good, which is something you should never take for granted.
author: alan w.

description:
In the 14 years I have lived in SF I have driven by this place numerous times. I always look at it and wonder what it is like inside. Of course I have heard from others who have gone here how yummy it is and thought what is the draw? It is an odd looking place from the outside in a weird building. A funny little place if you ask me. 

First you arrive and there are two valets outside near the elevator. You walk up the little path and enter the waiting area. It is decked out in clay pots, bamboo and a waterfall with soothing music. A nice atmosphere while you wait for your chariot to the shrine above. 

Enter the glass elevator and turn around for a view of ...Polk Street....not exactly an oasis. The elevator cracks me up. It belongs on the side of a hi-rise building but I will say it works and does add to the experience. Chariot doors open and you are in another tropical oasis as you make your way around and greeted immediately by your host. 

What happy host. He made you know you were welcome there and with the utmost sincerity. He brought us around to the first room, where he was going to seat us but there was not a soul in the room. I think that room was for larger parties. Very nicely appointed but it was so remote. Bring me to the bar I say! 

Off we go to the next room with the bar and stairs going up to another level and a back room that was very lively and inviting. We chose tables across from the bar which was perfect. 

Our waiter was just lovely. He was so nice and quick and unobtrusive but attentive. He recommended the special calamari that was lightly battered and deep fried with pepper and salt crust and sauteed peppers and onions with a yummy spice aioli sauce. it was amazing! We got a bunch of small plates: coconut prawn, Vietnamese salad, crab puffs and tuna. All were yummy but the tuna was just too much. It was spicy, the arugula was spicy the sauces were spicy it was not a good experience. 

We can't end on that note so let us have some Crème brûlée . Ah redemption. It was amazing. I judge a Crème brûlée by the texture of the sugar crust and if there are little vanilla beans in the bottom of the dish. Passed with flying colors! 

Crustacean you are a funny little restaurant but you delivered! Thanks!
author: Scott P.

description:
My 300th review: Dedicated to Crustacean's! I loved every morsel, from beginning to end. 

What is better than sex?

Two weeks of Dine About Town!http://www.onlyinsanfrancisco.com/taste/dineabouttown/


As a big foodie, we were counting down the days to this major event. Our first restaurant on our list is: Crustacean!!!
Since the 3 course meal is $34.95, their menu is very limited. I was a tad disappointed when I called to ask for their Dine About Town menu. Everyone and their mom told me to get the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles, but that wasn't on the menu. Instead, your choices are:
For Starters:
~Fresh Rice Shrimp Roll with Peanut Sauce
~Skewered Chicken
~Vietnamese Salad
For the Entree:
~Shaken Beef with Jasmine Rice
~Prawns with Garlic Noodles
Last but not least, dessert:
~Fried bananas a la mode
~Orange Sherbert

For appetizers, we got the Fresh Shrimp on a rice paper roll and the Skewered Chicken. The peanut sauce that came with it had the perfect taste for a dipping sauce-not too peanut-y nor salty. Just right.
The skewered chicken was marinated and the meat was tender, you know, those fall off the bones type of thing. It definitely got my approval!
For our entree, we both got the Prawns with Garlic Noodles. I don't want to be redundant and I'm sure you all know that they are known for the garlic noodles, but let me tell you...(AGAIN) You HAVE to order their Garlic Noodles! It was amazing! Whatever they're doing in the kitchen, they are definitely doing it right!
For dessert, we both got the fried bananas a la mode. I've had numerous fried bananas and this one definitely was one of the best. The bananas were gooey and piping hot, the outside was crispy, and the vanilla ice cream cooled off my mouth from the hot, gooey bananas. 
Everything was perfect from beginning to the end. The service was stellar-We had a 7:30 reservation, but got there around 7:00 and they seated us right away. Our dishes came so quickly and methodically-our server Joel was always there and never abandoned us.As soon as we were finished with our entree, he didn't leave time for our stomach to growl for our next course-the food came out right away and our water was always re-filled.
When we got our check, the General Manager introduced himself and asked if the service met our expectations, and it sure did. 
I can't wait to celebrate another anniversary here,maybe my birthday in July, a promotion, or anything for that matter! Next time, I'm definitely ordering The Roast Crab! The poor guy next to me ordered one and I couldn't help staring at his dish. My poor date definitely didn't get my full attention that night! LOL

PS, I want to give a shout out to the retro looking elevator with a giant bright crab that goes up and down....and up and down...and up and down...
author: Jojo N.

description:
I've been to Thanh Long so I wanted to check out Crustacean as well. Unfortunately, I was quite disappointed - the crab and garlic noodles were both bland.

The best part of the meal was the Lobster Salad that they had for the special that day. That is the only reason why I would go back. I'd give this place 5 stars if I were only rating the Lobster Salad.
author: A. A.

description: Awesome Baked Crab and Garlic noodles.  I've been a few times and im sure other things are good, however i order the SAME thing every time, and i don't normally do that....
author: Jeff W.

description: Yummy. Great place, best Dungeneous crabs bar none; thus far. You have to have the garlic noodles, standard issue.
author: Ade A.

description:
The garlic noodles are a must have as well as the crab, any style!  I usually get one for myself.
The service has been great whenever I was there.  Just be wary of flying crab pieces from other people!
author: Serena L.

description:
I must admit that it has been a while since I have eaten here but I am dying to go back.  

Their crab puffs and salmon with rice are my favorites!  They have a great wine selection and the staff is really helpful!

I cannot wait to go back!
author: Priya B.

description: We're on a quest to find the best garlic noodles in SF so we of course had to try Crustacean. I had the tiger prawns and garlic noodles. The food is good, very tasty, but grossly overpriced. For what I was getting I just couldn't fathom why I was spending $35. There was a hefty portion of noodles but only 4 prawns. If I'm spending that much on a meal I expect to be blown out of the water by the food, I enjoyed it but not enough to make it worth the cost so I would probably not come back. The interior is pretty though the location is a bit strange (up on the third floor of an otherwise dead complex.
author: Jenny A.

description: The crab is just awesome and one of a kind.  PPQ has it too but this was my first and had a better decor so its a little better for dates, even being more expensive.  I would recommend it if you are looking for seafood and Vietnamese fusion is on your radar.
author: Ethan Y.

description:
OMG can you say STUCK-UP?
I really want to give this place a 3-star but because of the stuckup-ness and strictness, I just have to give it a 2. 

A good experience in restaurants is a nice combination between how delicious the food is and the ambiance. The ambiance fucking sucks. 
They try so hard to be expensive and high-end, but sorry girl it does not work. 

Now with the food. 
Honestly, the crab is FUCKING DELICIOUS! the garlic noodle is not as good as I expect it to be. I think everybody loves it cause it compliments the crab so well. 

The calamari was delicious though! Loved it! 

Oh, a little note about the stuckupness. We had a party of 6 and 4 of us were there. the other 2 were late cause they were coming from Santa Clara. My uncle was wanted everybody to be seated first but this guy was like 

"Sir we can sit you first, but when your party comes, we cannot guarantee that we can sit you in the same place."

come on mannnn. my uncle comes all the way from Hong Kong and the other two are my aunties. My uncle was even willing to pay the price of the two seats even if they didnt come. 

He was such a tight-ass. sheeesshhh. 

Food was excellent but the atmosphere was HORRIBLE.
author: Miss C.

description:
The crab is yummy! I really like it, and it's not even crazy expensive or anything. Coco's crawfish charges about the same amount, I would much rather have crustacean!
The bib looked a little funny on my dress but I din't care, try the garlic crab, I hear the rest is not that great.
The neighborhood is a little sketchy, but the crab is worth it!
author: Jenny W.

description:
Frankly I am shocked that there are so many disapproving reviews of Crustys. This place is as Don King would say, Splendivarous! Yes the dress code is a bit annoying but who cares. Why don't you grow up and look like an adult for once and leave the jersey and rocker tees at home??? The hosts are a bit stuffy but the servers have for the most part been very cheery and responsive. I have visited this location maybe 10-12 times in the past 2+ years and maybe only one time was the service sub par. 

Lets just talk about the food here.  If you have something against buttery oily goodness please stop reading now and tend to your rice cakes. The rumors and raves are true, the garlic noodles here is like food from heaven. I haven't tasted better, period. The roasted crab is fantastic! Maybe slightly too salty for some but its not overboard and I'm not someone who loves salty foods. And God-forbid you have to do some work to crack your own food. Have we gotten that lazy as a people? Maybe you'd like someone to chew it for you also? Cracking the crab is part of the whole experience! That leads me to another point. This does get a bit messy so it might not be a good place for a 1st date. 

Other dishes that a fantastic are the Royal Tiger Prawns (which includes a side of garlic noodles). I can't comment on further main courses b/c there is ZERO reason to order anything else. Roast Crab, Tiger Prawns, Garlic Noodles. Eat and repeat. End of story.

If you'd like to explore the starters, the appetizers are great too though a bit on the small side. My favs are the salt and pepper calamari (the waiter will tell you its a special, but its been on "special" since '07), crab puffs, jumbo prawn wontons and salmon shrimp crisps. 

Make reservations if you are attempting to go on Friday or the weekend w/ a party of 3 or more it does get packed. Better call a week in advance just to guarantee your spot. Side note: they won't seat you unless all your party is there and will only hold reservations for 15 mins past your scheduled time. Restrictions, restrictions but the food is worth it. Cheers.
author: Lenneal G.

description: Garlic messy goodness. Atmosphere is upscale, but what turns it into a regular visit instead of a fancy shcmancy one  is when people do not act accordingly and bring down the atmosphere and integrity of the place. Honestly I'd rather go to Thanh Long just cause the atmosphere is very different. You can never go wrong with garlic especially on noodles and crab! Drinks are really good, but it depends on which bartendar makes your drink. The service can also be hit or miss here. One day the service will be up to par and enjoyable, especially when the server has personality. Then other times the service sucks, you just have someone that's serving you who hates life, rarely checks up on the table, and have to wave down because they are hiding to text on their phone. Pretty much you see the bussers more than the server. If I came back here I would rather go during lunch time, at least servers are more attentive and have no problem with large groups.
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
At first, I couldn't even figure out where the restaurant was because it was in this sketchy neighborhood. After looking around, I saw that Crustaceans was located at the top of this building which had a lot clothing shops. Once we got inside, the place was really quiet and dim. It was dinner time and not that many people were there. The staff was really nice and attentive. The funny thing was that the interior was decorated nicely, but there were huge windows that gave view to the unattractive buildings across the street. There's nothing romantic about that and it's a shame because this place is definitely a date restaurant. 
 
So about the menu...  I had the Dine About Town menu. Started off with chicken skewers. It was tender, juicy, and the lemongrass was flavorful. Next up was the Stir Fried Prawns on a bed of garlic noodles. The prawns were okay. Nothing different from any other prawns I've had at a mom and pop Chinese/Vietnamese restaurant. The garlic noodles reminded me of chow mein noodles that you'd get at a fast food joint. My friend got the Shaken Beef and that was really good. Dessert was delcious! We had fried banana al la mode and orange sorbet. The sorbet was incredibly satisfying and refreshing. The sorbet was frozen in a peeled orange. So clever!  Overall, this place was okay. I don't think any of the food was special or unique for the price you'd have to pay.  I have yet to try the infamous crab, so I'll come back one more time just to try that out. 

p.s. I don't know why they require a dress code! No t-shirts for guys. Really??? I've been to fancier places and they don't even have these rules. In such a neighborhood and in such dim lighting, I don't think wearing a t-shirt would hurt.
author: Lynn V.

description: My dad came here a long time ago when he was in town for business and wanted to come back. He raved about the garlic crab & garlic noodles. We called ahead and they said we can just walk in. When we got there we had to wait a bit but eventually got seated. He was right the garlic crab & noodles were yummy! The service was alright, could have been better. It's also a bit pricey but it was good to try! :)
author: Randi I.

description:
Bottom line: Yes, the roasted crab does live up to the expectations and the garlic rice was an excellent side pairing. The waiter suggested a delicious Gewurztraminer that didn't compete with the flavors. The Vietnamese traditional salad and the rice paper rolls (like egg rolls) were standard. The ravioli and creme brulee were decent.
 I'd definitely go here strictly for the crab. I was expecting a slightly more fancy ambiance, but it was surprisingly laid-back and rather informal (for better or worse.) The restaurant has a unique lay out, spread narrowly along the top floor. We were seated promptly, but near the waiters hang out spot (didn't really need to know the details of his late date.) They accommodate families, so feel free to bring your kids here. If you don't like kids, be specific in your request in your reservation.
Yes, the crab is messy. You do have to crack it yourself. There are plenty of napkins (and a bib if you so chose) and you can request for a hot towel to clean up afterward.
PS. Skip the cappuccino (tasted burnt leaving you with an aftertaste of cigarettes.)
author: Naomi K.

description:
Hands down the BEST crab in town!!!!  Pair with the garlic noodles & a nice glass of white wine, it's delectable. 

Definitely pricey but worth every penny!
author: Melissa J.

description:
Jeremy and I took my mom to Crustacean last Friday night. She's a huge crab lover, so we knew this would be a nice treat. The Chef sent out two complimentary appetizers: One was the Tempura Shrimp Coconut Prawns with a tangy/sweet orange sauce and the other was their perfectly fried Calamari. My mom also filled up with the Lobster Salad which was also quite good. For the main event, we had 2 Roasted Crabs and 2 bowls of their famous Garlic Noodles to share. The only noise at our table was the sound of shell cracking and me saying "mmm....mmm.....mmmmm". 

Towards the end of our meal, my mom was dipping her finger in the plate of garlic oil which our Roasted Crab was sitting in. All of a sudden she says "Aha, I know the secret!...I figured out how they make their crab so good!" She said they remove the crab fat, which is the orange paste-like fat inside the crab shell and cook it together with garlic and oil. I didn't doubt it for one second. My mom's a true detective for this sort of stuff. No wonder they served the crab without the crab fat inside. 

That said, you MUST leave your cholesterol concerns at home and go in here with an "I only live once" type attitude. Crustacean's crabs are truly sinful and wickedly good!!! To top it all off, we ordered the Mango Cheesecake and Fried Banana & Ice cream for dessert. Everything was simply delicious.
author: Anne E.

description:
One of the TOP 5 Restaurants, I have ever eaten at....
Mmmmmmm Goodddddd
author: Thomas A.

description: Not very impressed, garlic noodles and crab puffs deserve 4 stars but the other dishes were over cooked seafood. Not good food for the cost.
author: Carol G.

description:
Keeping this short and sweet

Don't bring a date her as you will be wearing bibs and have a messy time crackin and eating crab

Get the roasted crab and garlic noodles those are the best and pretty much what this place is known for

get the baked alaska for dessert - its amazing :)

Place is pretty damn expensive so I would go here for a super duper special occasion not just a causal dinner.
author: Christine W.

description: Everyone that comes to Crustacean knows that they come here mainly for the famous crab and garlic noodles. Need I say more? Our service was excellent! Our waiter was super efficient throughout our course and so was everyone else we encountered. It was such a smooth flow I almost forgot to enjoy my food! Haha... Everything about this place is great except for the elevator ride. Take the stairs to your left instead.
author: Tina V.

description:
Restaurant is shabby and completely run down.  Roasted crab was good but I don't understand the rave reviews.  Garlic noodles were good as well.  I was really put off by the condition of the restaurant and the location outside the restaurant is filthy, filled with flies and stinking of urine.  It really took my appetite away. 

I did find a ladybug on my arm after we were seated and I take that as a sign of good luck.  I won't be back because the crab wasn't good enough to overlook the condition of the restaurant and its surroundings.
author: Laurie K.

description: I've been to the other sister restaurant Thanh Long which I enjoyed alot! and heard so much about this restaurant so I had to try it. I got the roasted garlic crab which was very greasy and bland. I heard so much about the garlic noodles so of course we had to try them, Very disappointed the garlic noodles dry and very bland. The crab wontons appetizers with the peanut sauce was very tasty. Would I go back to this location again, probably not.
author: Nichole H.

description: We went here to celebrate the beginning of crab season! The food was good, not amazing, The resturant is dated but have a charm. It was EXPENSIVE! That being said it was good, I have been to the Thanh Long location and like it better.
author: Jill T.

description: I had dinner here last Friday. It was quite pricey, but once in a while it is worth to dine in a restaurant like this. Roasted crab and the garlic noodles were delicious. The restaurant has very good cocktail list. For appetizer I really liked grilled calamari. The service was professional and friendly. The parking in the neighborhood is little difficult. The restaurant has Valet Parking for $12, but we find a  much cheaper place to park on Sacramento st, just one block up. It was $8 and they were open till 2 am.
author: Janesse M.

description: $213 bill for two,the food was well worth every dollar,my highlight was the Tiger butterfly prawns with anns garlic noodles yes!!
author: Marceliano J.

description:
They make it pretty obvious that you need to order the crab here.  The name is Crustacean, with a cartoon crab serving as the logo.  Your server will be sure to highlight the "Secret Kitchen," which is their name for the "market price" seafood menu.

We ordered 3 appetizers: Shrimp paper roll, Buddha roll and the fried calamari.  The calamari was very good, as was the Buddha roll.  The shrimp paper roll was good but nothing special compared to a typical Vietnamese restaurant.

On to entrees: 1 Garden Vegetables (for my vegetarian mom), and from the Secret Kitchen an order of tiger prawns with garlic noodles and a Roast Crab.

Garden vegetables were excellent; my mom is picky on top of being vegetarian and she really enjoyed it.  The crab was good; not the best crab I've ever had, but it was good.  

The tiger prawns were a disappointment  They were a bit overcooked and thus dry, and I don't think they were really tiger prawns because they weren't very big.

The garlic noodles are awesome.  

Dessert was fried banana with ice cream.  It was very well-executed and delicious.  We got a free one because we were there for my dad's birthday, and we ordered another because it was so tasty.

Our server was awesome.  Ambiance was pretty nice.  The meal was pricey but overall worth it.
author: Joseph N.

description: Went with a work group.  It was good, but I couldn't seem to get enough to eat.  Takes too long to crack the crab.  Maybe it was just me, lol.
author: Christine C.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurant in the city. I always get the roast crab with An's famous garlic noodles. It's a perfect match! My family enjoys coming here.
author: Mohamed A.

description:
My sisters and I took our parents out to dinner for their xmas gift. It was raining so having to climb up three flights of stairs with heels and an umbrella was not fun (yes, I know there was an elevator but for some reason wasn't working!!) We actually arrived maybe 20-30min ahead of our reservation, but they still sat us after waiting about 5 min!

The dining area was pretty packed and we got seated at a booth with an additional chair set at the edge (we had a party of 5). Frankly, I don't know why they didn't just seat us at a round table which was only a few feet away that seated 6 people. Our table felt cramped enough AND I was literally back to back with the person at the next table. 

On to the food! We ordered a couple of appetizers.. the calamari special (just pepper and salt) and  mushroom spring roll. Both were alright, my mom liked the calamari a lot. As for entrees, i checked yelp (yay!) for recommendations. The waiter and yelpers both exclaimed about the roast crab & garlic noodles so I HAD to try! Mom got the crab cakes, Dad got the sea bass, one of my sisters got the halibut and my other sister got the garden veggie plate. I agree with everyone that the garlic noodles are so good! It's definitely coated with garlic flavor that I'm sure made my breath smell awesome. As for the crab, kinda disappointed it it. I mean it was HUGE so portion wise was good for the amount it cost but taste wise, it could have been better. We ordered three desserts to share: creme brulee, chocolate bread pudding and fried bananas. Desserts were alright, nothing spectacular. 

Overall, experience was alright. My parents appreciated the meal and we were all extremely full. The waiter was pretty attentive although the way he presented him self was a little off (maybe he was nervous or just started working there??) The bill came out to be over $200 (appetizers, entrees, desserts and drinks). Pricey for my taste and not much was that memorable except maybe the garlic noodles. I don't think I'd be coming back any time soon.

Oh and I looked at the DAT menu, didn't seem that impressive.. I'd just order off the regular menu.

Also, I read a few yelpers saying that attire is dressy, but i felt like a lot of people were very casual. One guy had baggy jeans on with a tshirt and puffy vest!
author: Vicki C.

description: Fly, drive, or walk.  Sleep on the street.  Just get here and order the Roast Crab.  Wear the bib. Enjoy!
author: H Dwayne D.

description:
So sad! My husband and I used to love this restaurant. The crab was delicate and sweet, the tiger prawns sublime. Unfortunately that is all gone! We had not been to Crustacean for a few (4-5) years, and thought it was time to take a drive for a nice night in the city. HA! It was pouring rain...oh well.

I would say that the wait staff is pleasant and attentive. Our waiter took great care of us. 

The food is another story. Yuck! We started with the Green Lip mussels. They were overcooked and difficult to take out of the shell. The pesto had an acceptable flavor but was very buttery. (Little did I know this was going to be the theme for the evening!) Then we had the seared Ahi. It was dry, no sheen or glisten on the "raw" center. Strange and tasteless. We followed that with the Crab Puffs. Didn't even taste crab in them...just a cream cheesy goop. We wanted to finish off the meal with our favorite (well used to be) roasted crab and tiger prawns. The crab was seriously DRENCHED in butter...so much so that my husband looked like he should have been hosed off after digging through for the small morsels of crab. The towels, yes very hot, but there was no way they could absorb the amount of butter coming off that crab. My husband was all shiny (greasy) afterwards. Needed to head to the bathroom for a wash down...oh wait more on THAT later. The tiger prawns were so over cooked I could not get them out of the shells..the prawns ripped and tore apart, but no pieces to eat. The garlic noodles did NOT taste like garlic...and I don't know if it was oil, butter, or both, but they were greasy and tasteless. 

Okay, so now to the restroom situation. The restrooms were "OUT OF ORDER". Seriously! Both the men and women's. We were required to use the "basement" (their word not mine) restrooms. I can not even describe how disgusting the restroom was. So, through the rain, escorted to a dirty, filthy restroom was the way we ended our time at Crustacean. Overall, one of THE worst experiences I have ever had at a restaurant. I will never go back!
author: Brenda B.

description: Although we didn't make a reservation we didn't wait too long. The atmosphere is really nice. The food was yummy. I wanted to try the drunken crab but the preparation was about an hour. So I ordered what I saw on the couples table next to me, calamari and veggies. The waiter didn't go over any specials with us which is why we sat for 20 minutes trying to locate the calamari on the menu. I opted for the garlic noodles to accompany my calamari. Those noodles were absolutely delicious. I wish I had an order of them now!
author: Miriam U.

description:
If you've got the dough, go! If you've got the cash, make a mad dash...to Crustaceans. Okay, enough rhyming. Here's my perfect, highly caloric meal to get at this place:

Appetizer: Coconut Prawns
Meal: Garlic Noodles, Roast Garlic Crab, Green Beans
Dessert: Crème Brûlée

Om noms! Almost $80 later, I'm sure you'll be satisfied. Oh yeah, get a cocktail too!

Can I add a p.s. that they're a little picky when it comes to takeout and you can't call in an order, you must go in, sit and wait and then you can take your meal out. Just an FYI.
author: Ieesha C.

description:
My boyfriend and I had been wanting to try Crustaceans' sister restaurant (thanh long) since Valentines 2011, but seeing as I was pregnant at the time we opted out and went to something more low key. With it being my birthday, the anh family restaurants came up when he asked me where I wanted to go. We narrowed it down to the two, but when Grandma said she would babysit the baby, Crustaceans became the obvious choice. 

The location is nice, very dimly lit and romantic for the occasion so its perfect for any date night for you and yours, but the food didn't blow me out of the water. The food was tasty, we ordered: fried calamari, shaken beef, garlic noodles & garlic crab. Each was good in it's own right, but I don't feel like it lived up to the hype. Typically these days having a newborn at home, the fact that we get to go out at all, the restaurant becomes an instant hit, but we've gotten a few date nights in since having our son, and this one though among the fancier restaurants we've been to isn't at the top. I would say that Crustaceans is one of those restaurants you should go to to say you've been, but isn't somewhere you'll be begging to come back to. Honestly I think the expectations were set so high for this restaurant, and with the restaurants reviews being so good that even after we both agreed it was just okay, I feel like maybe we'll have to give it another chance. We'll see.
author: Jessica Y.

description:
I recommend taking a date or a group of family or friends here for a lovely dining experience.

I was impressed with the dark, brown Asian fusion-y interior.  Nice and classy.

My roommate and I had our co-birthday dinner (we have the same birthdays!) here and I was extremely satisfied with our meal.

Fried spring rolls, an order of roasted grab, garlic noodles, steamed rice and 3 lychee martinis each.  Yes, we were definitely "getting our grub on."  Each and every flavor was full of life.  

Our server constantly checked up on us and was very cool about letting us take our time with the meal.  We were the last of the customers inside the restaurant.

We were both very happy during the cab ride home.  Phenomenal!
author: Christine E.

description:
Had dinner this evening and it was very enjoyable overall.  Easy to find and easy to find parking in front of building.  The neighborhood is really cleaned up compared to 20 yrs ago when i lived there.  Someone in my party wore a hoodie and a t shirt and front desk guy politely asked him to check in the hoodie and put on a dress shirt they had for these situations.    This could have been a deal breaker but the guy was professional and polite.  The shirt was clean and actually looked good.  We waited about 10 minutes for our table for our 5pm reservation.  They didn't seem busy at the time.  We got a GREAT window seat over looking California Street.  Seemed like a bay window.  
Appetizers were fish cakes and calimari:  Super good!
Main dishes:  garlic crab, sea bass , snow peas, garlic noodles, fried rice.  The crab, sea bass, and snow peas were OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!  
Dessert was: baked alaska, creme brule, and fried bananas.
The fried bananas were the best of the group.
Service was excellent.  Our water and tea was filled without asking.  The waiter, Ron, gave good recommendations and described the food we were ordering flawlessly.  He came around to ask how we were doing, cleaned our table multiple times (crab can be very messy) and took our photos.
Intimate decor, clean restrooms (super important), professional staff. 
Total bill: $200 plus $45 tip.  $245 for 6 people.  
Overall, excellent dinning experience.  I just not sure it was worth $40 / person.  Could be I'm just a tight wad.
author: Glenn B.

description:
Long-time customer (15 years).

Garlic noodles.  Garlic roasted crab.  Enough said.
author: D. S.

description: This place never ever gets old.  I can come once a month or once a year!  The roasted crab is still my favorite with the garlic noodles of course.  Love Crustacean's :))
author: Monique M.

description: We went  there for dinner...the place is too small and the air is stuffy. We ordered shrimp fried rice and the food was very cold. We asked for soy sauce but they never brought it to the table. They spilled water on our table as well. The service was slow and customer service was very poor. We were approached by the manager named Sean. He was extremely rude and was trying to argue. We didn't want anything free, we just want him to hear our complaint. He never apologized but tried to tell us we were wrong. Overall the service was very poor, the food quality is very poor - food was too expensive, management sucks! I will not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Liz J.

description:
I LOVE the roasted crab and garlic noodles at Crustacean.  The SF location is slightly difficult to reach (it's on a hill), but at least they have valet parking.  You have to take an elevator to get to the restaurant, and they have an indoor and outdoor (covered) seating area.

I like the food at the SF Crustacean slightly more than the food at the Beverly Hills Crustacean.  However, the decor of the Beverly Hills location is much more beautiful.  (They have a dimly lit front dining area with draped booths, a glass walkway/fish tank, another dining area in the middle which is much more crowded, and an upstairs dining area which is quieter and more suited for couples).  From my experience, I think the SF location is quieter overall.  But I guess it really depends on when you go.

Great food, great service, what more can you ask for?  Make reservations, there's a dress code, and it's pricey.  But, it's kind of worth it once in a while.  The only downside of this place is they can be a little snobby to you if you aren't old and middle aged.

Edit: 6/26/08 - I'm giving the San Francisco location an extra star for the superb service I received the last time I was here.  I took "the guy I'm like dating or whatever" here for his birthday, and they were absolutely wonderful.  He loved it :)  We ordered the shrimp toast (I think the ones at the Beverly Hills location were better), the lobster rolls (mmm drool!), the roasted crab & the garlic noodles (delish as usual), and the creme brulee (light and creamy, a perfect way to end the meal).  It was a truly wonderful dining experience.  

The Beverly Hills location still receives 4 stars for being snooty to my friends and I.

Don't forget to make reservations!
author: Grace C.

description:
The last time I was in SanFran, I ate here with a coworker.  I have a feeling he had never spent so much money on a meal, but it was worth it.  This place was highly recommended by a friend who was from SF, so we sought it out.  

We had the garlic crabs and noodles and they were incredible.  The atmosphere was nice and we had a lovely evening.  I can't wait to return to the city to visit this place again!
author: Kim J.

description:
It was a feast for my taste buds! Believe the hype. 

The roasted crab is worth the drive from San Jose to San Francisco.

Crab is one of my favorite food but this one is exceptional. Very flavorful. Every nook and cranny of my crab was inspected and devoured. It was soo good. 

For some reason I didn't like the garlic noodles this time. It was somewhat sweet for me and not as I remember it from before. 

Hmm...has my taste changed? Did San Jose changed me? Anyway, in the cocktail section I had the Ginger Pineapple Fusion Drink and I really enjoyed it! For desert I had the Rice pudding. The pudding was dark and it came with some ice cream. It was a perfect combo to end the night.

I remain very impressed with this place and would continue to come back.

One advise: Valet park your car.
author: Janet D.

description: Even if Steve wasn't a good friend I'd still always be at Crustacean.  First class all the way and look forward to every meal there.
author: Michael R.

description: I've done PPQ and Crustacean, the quality and service are much better in Crustacean.
author: Brian F.

description:
This is my absolute fav place too eat. I have been coming here for over 10 years. Its a treat when we do go to Crustacean becuz of the price. My husband & I usually have a bill of over $130 when we each get a crab, appetizers, garlic noddles & a drink, if we share, which was our most recent visit it was $84. The banana desert it to die for as well! We were stuffed even sharing a whole crab!
Although its a bit pricey I truely enjoy the atmosphere, service and esp the food! As well as getting dressed up!
I highly recommend this place to everyone. 
Remeber to: Make a reservation & allow time for parking. Just keep in mind that the weekends are busy so dont not be late to your reservation or you will wait a while for an available table.
author: chantel r.

description: I miss the taste of "Roasted Crab", soon after I eat it! I can't avoid stopping at the Crustacean in San Francisco. (Beverly Hills either.) when I travel CA. I always regret I don't have big stomach enough to choose, other than magically seasoned "Roast Crab and Egg Noodle" super combination. I really expect the other menu must be excellent, but I've not had a chance to taste them thus far.
author: Toshifumi O.

description:
What can I say about this place, except....AMAZING!!!

I was a little hesitant to go here after reading some reviews about the service, but my boyfriend had already made reservations.

Since we made reservations, we got seated pretty quickly. The section we were seated at was very cramped; the tables were too close together. I could practically reach over to the next table and eat from their plates.

FOOD: 
We had 2 crabs, garlic noodles, garlic rice & baked Alaska for desert. It doesn't seem like a lot of food, but we actually had left overs, which we took home.

The crabs had so much butter, that every time I picked up a crab leg, it slipped from my fingers. Don't get me wrong, it was still delicious. 
The garlic noodles and garlic rice were also very tasty. 
My boyfriend loved the baked Alaska. I was pretty full, so I didn't enjoy it as much.

Service:
Great! They even tied the bibs around our necks for us, before we started eating our crabs. Now that's service!
They refilled our water without us asking and they checked back regularly to make sure we were doing OK. 

Overall the food, service, and experience were great. I would definitely go back again.
author: Karen B.

description:
Oh where oh where art thou Garlic noodles?

I remember when the garlic noodles were only $6. I really can't speak on their crab or prawns, as I am allergic to shellfish/seafood. However, I used to go for the noodles & Saigon Beef (Fillet Mignon wrapped in Pancetta=Italian bacon), arugala salad w/mango salsa, fried bananas, and a lemon spritzer. Total for a party of 2 + valet parking=$115.00. I gave them 4 stars only because I stopped eating the now over priced noodles. No, not because they're $10 a bowl, but because every time I eat them, my urine smells like garlic for a whole day. Yuck! Other than that, they're cool with me. Also, make sure to dress business casual/formal attire, or they will seat you outside on a patio or roof top. There is a dress code.
author: Nikki T.

description:
(Apr/ 2006)

Fried, fried, and more fried! But oh- so- good...

We had the buttered garlic noodles which was oily but a definite must have. Try the combo platter of fried wontons, eggrolls, and shrimps-- a great way to sample a little bit of everything. And don't think you can skip dessert; it's fried! Fried battered bananas topped with homemade vanilla ice cream to be exact.
author: Gerard B.

description: This is our date night spot. Great service and great food. We love the crab!
author: Christina C.

description:
For years, the An Family restaurants has distinguished themselves by their sophisticated style and unique cuisine. I would give this place 2 1/2 stars, but no better.  Roast crab and garlic noodles were good, but no longer the only game in town.  You can order the same at several Vietnamese restaurants around the Bay Area.  The biggest disappointment was with the service.

I guess the waiters felt as if the dining room was a place to discuss their personal business and work politics.  The acoustics are ridiculous because I could hear every detail of the restaurant staff, while it was next to impossible to listen to my own dining party.  The staff was discussing some type of disciplinary action for a work transgression.  Oh, the management was equally culpable, since we heard a couple of the guys in suits chastising some of the waiters.  Further, we had to remind our waiter to bring bibs and bowls for crab shells.  Call me picky, but I don't appreciate the waiter reaching over me in random directions.

The dessert selections were mediocre; baked Alaska and chocolate bread pudding sounded like interesting choices, but I was also underwhelmed by the actual product.

I think Crustacean Restaurant has gotten a bit tired and resting on it's past success.  Time for an overhaul.
author: Collin W.

description:
A friend took me here for my birthday. I was so excited because I had never been and always wanted to go. 

To make it clear, all of our appetizers were fried. We did not know that, it does not state that on the menu. But fried is not bad tasting, can I get an amen?! 

The crab was whack. I've had better at a hole in the wall. It was way over salted and hardly cracked. Like my dental bill is not high enough already! 

OK, the garlic noodles that I have fantasized about having for over a decade are also whack. Are you kidding me? Noodles are suppose to be sticky after cooking (al dente), that is what they do, that is their purpose in life and only so the sauce can adhere to it. 

Not in this case. The garlicky sauce (If  there is even a sauce to begin with, maybe it's part of my fantasy), was hardly present so the noodles just stuck. And they were more sweet than savory and I could not taste garlic. 

I don't like that. 

Too expensive to return again with these types of results, but however there were 2 good looking brothas dinning close to us and I got a nice glimpse with a little interaction upon entering. That works but that is about it. Oh and they seated us in the walk way. No BUENO. There should not even be seats there. It was not crowded or anything.
author: S. L.

description: Love this place. Roasted crab and garlic noodles are the signature combo. Loaded with butter, I try to go here only once a year as I'm scared to develop atherosclerosis. Service is great. Area surrounding the elevator can be sketchy as mentally ill/druggies will jump from behind the load bearing columns and give you a spook.
author: Chloe K.

description: garlic noodles,  classic crab, Shakkin Beef  is the standard,  very very good. There is still a lot more on the menu to try so Ill be back there for sure.
author: Robert L.

description: The best crab I ever had.  Enough said.  And yes the garlic noodles are everything everyone says they are.  Fantastic!!!
author: chazz l.

description: Havent been here in years.  This place makes great garlic noodles and roasted garlic crab.  It's a on the pricey side though.  I love their garlic noodles!
author: Abigail L.

description: AWESOME SERVICE, GREAT food.  Garlic crab is buttery, garlicky, and SOOO delish!  Garlic noodles are the PERFECT accompaniment!  I have been here a few times and it NEVER disappoints!  It can be a little pricey but totally WORTH EVERY PENNY!  Great place for special occasions or to spend some quality time with someone special.  Wine selection is great also.  This restaurant will always be one on the top of my list.
author: T A.

description: The crab was **excellent** at Crustacean.  The garlic noodles are fantastic as well, and I highly recommend them to complement your crab or seafood dinner.  The appetizer portions are small, but they are quite tasty.  I would skip the garlic bread, however, in favor of the noodles!
author: Amy H.

description: I ate too much.  This food was.......unbelievably good.  The noodles, the crab.  Delicious.  No room for dessert.  Pricey - worth every penny.  You have to try this place.
author: Doc D.

description:
After all these years of listening to my friends rave about this place, I can now understand what they were talking about.  All I can say is WOW! This place rocks!

From the outside I didn't have much expectation but as soon as you step inside it's a whole different world.  The decor was fancier than I expected but then again as long as the food is good I could care less what the decor looks like.  Overall the service was good.  

Now to the food.  There are only two things you need to order off the menu. Don't waste your time with the apps,  GO straight for the Roasted Crab.  For a side it's a must to have AN's Garlic Noodles.  If you have room for dessert I recommend another helping of Roasted Crab.

The only drawback unfortunately was a faulty fire extinguisher that happened to explode at the tail end of our dinner. Otherwise I will be back the next time I'm in the Bay area, which I hope is soon.
author: Scott L.

description: I used to love the garlic noodles here. On my last dine-in visit here I was so looking forward to the noodles. I was very disappointed in the thinner and barelh seasoned garlic noodles. I wanted to try them again to see if they just had a bad night. Nope! I ordered garlic noodles to go on this visit and again was extrememly disappointed. I think I finally give up on these noodles being the best. This was actually my third try to see if I was mistaken about the taste of the noodles. I will not waste my money here again.  I don't want to give any stars. Very disappointed and what a waste of money!
author: Vivian C.

description: BEWARE !!!!! WE JUST GOT SCAMMED BY Sean Crume the Restaurant Manager of Crustaceans and Thanh Long.  This is the scam - last week we went and had the worst service by the waitress, Ora, from beginning to end.  We went to the Manager, Sean Crume, to complain and asked that the tip be removed.  Sean Crume then said please come back and let me show you how we really do it.  Everything is on me.  We told him we were not here to get anything for free, we just felt she did not deserve her tip, but he INSISTED and said "Please come back and let me show you how we really do it here, ON ME". He then told us he wrote it down in the book and he looks forward to taking care of our party entire party of 6.  The restaurant then called today to confirm our reservations for tonight.  THE SCAM BEGINS - We showed up and then were given everything from appetizers to desserts and drinks.  When we were done, we got the bill, to our TOTAL SHOCK, we were charged for everything except 1-appetizers and 2-desserts.  Sean Crume said he never agreed to comping our meal and never would.  Sean Crume now got more money out of us.  He LIED and it seems to us he has done this before.  WE WERE COMPLETELY TAKEN ADVANTAGE OF BY SEAN CRUME. IF YOU COMPLAIN ABOUT THE HORRIBLE SERVICE OF ORA, GET IN WRITING THAT HE WILL COMP YOUR ENTIRE MEAL.  I will never go to this restaurant nor recommend this restaurant to anyone.
author: Latonya W.

description: If you like crab this place in SF is a must do on your restaurant list. I have been here several times and although it has been over a year since the last time I went I still dream of their whole crab. My mouth is just watering right now! The food is like couture Asian grub. Delicious.
author: Krystle L.

description:
I love this place!!!
went here on Saturday with friends visiting from D.C., so glad that they enjoyed it as much as I did.  If I need my roasted, garlic crab fix, and garlic noodles, I come to Crustacean.  Been here many times.  And all I can say is Love it, love it, love it!!!  
I highly recommend it to everyone.
author: M S.

description: Wonderful dining experience, best crab in the city along with it's sister restaurant thanh long. Had the sweetest and lovely hostess (big curly hair) last time I was there a few months ago. Last time I went to thanh long she was working there so I think she transferred but she is a very hospitable and friendly. These are two of my favorite restaurants in the city. Well worth the money.
author: John M.

description:
Crustacean's Roast Cracked Crab is simply AMAZING! If you are in San Francisco, make a reservation and go crab crazy.  The Roast Crab is one of my favorite dishes. If I could eat this every day I would.  No matter what order DO NOT forget to order a bowl of the Garlic Noodles.  Dinner at Crustacean is not complete without one bowl of garlic noodle goodness!

If the garlic and butter crab is too much for you, try the Drunken Crab.  It is cooked in a wonderful wine sauce, this dish really allows you to taste the crab. I have never had this dish before last night, and was surprised  at it's light taste. After tasting the Drunken Crab several friends stated they would try this dish next time.  

Grab a bib and lick your fingers, this is the spot in San Francisco for great food.
author: Scott and Katie B.

description: Was seated next to the door on a cold night on a table that was not big enough to fit our order. Garlic noodles were good everything else was subpar. All appetizers seemed premade. Not impressed will not be going back on my next trip to SF I'll stick to ANQI for my garlic noodle fix knowing I won't get placed in a hallway.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Crustaceans is my favorite restaurant since I'm a seafood lover.

We came here for a pre-valentine's day dinner. Brought someone here for the 1st time since I always rave about this place. Got there 20 minutes before our reservation and got seated right away. 

I'm picky with food so I always order the same thing. I love their grilled calamari for the appetizer. I can eat this for an entree as well because it's just so good to me. I always order the roast crab which is so flavorful. I haven't tried their garlic noddles before but my date ordered it so I tried it and it has really good flavor. He also ordered the halibut which is good but I'll stick to my roast crab which I can eat everyday if I can. We had room for dessert so we went for the Baked Alaska. Wow. It was chocolate cake, with chocolate mousse, caramel ice cream and meringue. It was heavenly. That topped off a great tasting dinner. This restaurant is pricey but I think it's all worth the money. I'll keep coming back to Crustaceans. I wonder if  I can order for pick up next time I go to the city. hehe
author: Mike O.

description:
I'm not a big crab/seafood eater so I was kind of iffy about my boyfriend taking me here. 

Well I'm certainly glad he did because I thought it was delicious. We started out with the seafood salad which I wasn't too big of a fan of. It was literally just a few pieces of seafood on top of bell peppers.For our entree we had the garlic crab and garlic noodles. The waiter recommended it and he said that the majority of people who go to Crustacean's order that. The crab was expensive but it was very meaty so that was a plus. But the best part about eating the crab is eating it with the garlic noodles. It's sooo good together. I'm still drooling over it today!

For dessert we had the baked alaska. It was rich but not too rich. I enjoyed it. The service was great as well. Constantly filling up our waters and being attentive to us. The atmosphere is romantic and subtle. Very good for dates or big groups.
author: Olivia W.

description:
I've been here on a couple of occasions and of that, 99% of the time I order the crab.  That 1% of the time that I didn't (wanted to try the lobster), I deeply regretted it. Must order Sebastian! lol.  Everything is on point from atmosphere, service, and especially food! Sad to say, they don't offer any amazing dessert - or I'd for sure give them a 5 star.

Pros:
- Valet Parking
- Window seating is nice
- Knowledgeable and professional staff (love their serving uniforms)

Cons:
- Might be a bit pricey for people, but I think the food is worth it. No one can replicate that oh so delicious garlic noodles

Recommendations:
- Tamarind Crab if you want something sweet and tangy. Beware - it's super saucy but super good!
- Garlic Crab is always a simple favorite
- Garlic noodles (your breath will still feel garlicy the next day - don't try eating this before a job interview or something)
- I think their food menu is EXACTLY the same as Thanh Long.  I'd rather go to Crustacean because the location and atmosphere is better
author: Kathy D.

description:
The garlic noodles here are so damn addictive! Even if you're not a fan of seafood, the garlic noodles themselves are worth a trip. 

Now if you are a seafood lover such as myself, the roasted garlic crab is a MUST-TRY! Some of the best crab that I have ever had in my entire life. A little pricey, but it was definitely worth it. Another favorite was the salmon carpaccio. 

Service was excellent, and the food came out pretty quick considering our big group of about 16. The only downside of the meal were the tiger prawns with garlic noodles, the dish came with four tiger prawns that were split in half, but they just weren't as juicy as other tiger prawns I have had.
author: Julia K.

description:
We went to this restaurant on X'Mas eve Dinner ... 

It was wonderful dishes we always have here .... 

We ordered 

Spring Role (Raw) : with the source, it was very nice to have it , tasty !
SeaFood Salad : this also fantastic taste with little bit miso in source... 

Garlic Crab : 2 pcs costs 75.2us$ : however they are wonderful , off course, they are oily and garlic taste but we can not forget them at all ... 
 
Garlic rice : I like it however look at menu, the price of Fried rice is almost same as this ... you may be able to order some fried rice instead .... 

Garlic noodle : my wife likes it ... little sweeter for me ... 

After we took the all, we , three of us felt full of stomach and enjoy the dinner at this place ... 

We visited here every year at least 1 or 2 when we visited SFO ... 

Cheers,
author: Taro A.

description:
This place is cool, dim, upscale, but youthfull, and delicious! Very cool place for brunch, drink, or a bite b4 the main event.  Nice & effortless, you can't go wrong with anything you order. I had the Seabass & Garlic noddle that was oh so good! The service is friendly & prompt. 

parking is hard to find, but there is valet service.
author: Bianca C.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants.  I have been to this restaurant quite a bit over the years.  

Only order the roasted crab and garlic noodles.  The roasted crab is the best ever.  The garlic noodles are also the best ever.  

I would pass on the appetizers because they are very average and pricey.  The deserts are also very average and pricey.  There are no refills on the sodas.  I have tried every appetizer on there menu but have yet found one worth recommending.
author: Al W.

description: My friend introduced this fusion restaurant to me on the first nite of my San Francisco trip. We  had the green salad, the famous garlic noodle, and the mouthwatering roasted garlic crab. The nite was wonderful as well as the food. :)
author: Yvonne X.

description: I had a great experience here. Came for one of my good friends bday, we had a prefixed menu. All the apps were really good, and I got the crab. It was huge!!!!! I think it was about $75 per person, but it was worth it. I'd come here again, it's good for a date or a special occasion.
author: Irma R.

description:
nothing like eating with your hands in a fancy restaurant!

roasted garlic crab, drunken crab, garlic noodles, tiger prawn, crab puffs...seafood salad..delish....you get to wear a bib and get to see everyone's funny behavior while doing "dirty work' at the dinner table. :)
author: Gracee G.

description:
Crustacean crustacean, you failed me because I've had much better from your twinsie Thanh Long.

Same food as Thanh Long but I swear the atmosphere and the service was top notch at Thanh Long, not so much at Crustacean.  Our waiter was super nice, but he seems preoccupied with the other tables and we were only trying to get more drinks.  In my head, more drinks = higher tab = bigger tip?  Sad to read that some of the waiters here say you should get one crab/garlic noodle order per person.  Since I've been to Thanh Long, I know that's not the smart move.  You can easily share one crab and garlic noodle order and be super satisfied.  I do give credit to the lobster salad we ordered, that dish was on point!  The bar/server messed up on one of my drinks, but I drank it anyways because bottom line, it's alcohol.  When I told the server, there was no apology, he just went on his happy way to get me another one and charge it.  Fail.  When it came around to ordering desserts, my boyfriend and I opted for the Baked Alaska because not many places make this AND this is my fave dessert hands down.  The dessert came out and I was expecting the hot meringue to be a yummy contrast against the vanilla ice cream inside!  The meringue was cold.  Wait, what?  Total disappointment.  Their desserts seem to come fresh from the....FREEZER. 

Crustacean, I'm giving you one star for the crab and another for the garlic noodles.  In all other aspects you failed me.
author: Meryl P.

description:
Overpriced, overhyped, and I'm underwhelmed.

Service was not nearly as pampering as I expected from such a nice place.  After sitting there a half hour, having ordered my food, I was ready to leave.  Call it instinct, but I knew after perusing the place a bit that nobody really seemed to be enjoying their meals.

Anyway, it was my first time there, so I figured I'd go for something cheap and usually delicious at other restaurants...crusted tuna.  Pretty hard to get that wrong right?  Besides, nothing else on the menu sounded appetizing and most items were unnecessarily smothered with butter in their description.  

Well, the tuna arrived and was very disappointing.  4 thin slices, about half the thickness of carved Sashimi for twice the price.  I decided to forget the pricing aspect of it, and had a taste.  Nothing special.  I don't know what they breaded the crusted portion of the tuna with, but it didn't add anything but texture, and in fact tasted a bit like cardboard.

We were there with a bunch of midwesterners who perhaps didn't know GOOD seafood, so they were all way too content.  But I knew better and was very unimpressed.  There's nothing fancy about this place, so that's not going to be a selling point if somebody tries to drag me back.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
The crab was good, the garlic noodles was oily but good, the wine is good.

Why only 2 stars?! The price is horrible!! I paid around $70 per person for just crab, noodles and wine. PPQ has better pricing and taste about the same! Who wants to dress that fancy to eat messy food!?
author: Jannifer H.

description:
It pains me to give an An Family restaurant anything less than 5 stars, but I was disappointed when we ate dinner here last night. Normally we go to Thanh Long in the outer Sunset, but now that we live in Nob Hill Crustacean seemed more practical. Unfortunately, it's just not the same. 

Criticisms:
-The crab was cold! While cold crab is easier to eat (meat separates from shell easier), it tasted weird. If you roast something recently, it shouldn't be cold. So my guess is that our crab was cooked before and pan fried with the butter stuff when we ordered it. 
-Fried rice was worse than Thanh Long. The chicken had no seasoning, so it took on a gross gamey taste.   
-Shaken Beef had an off texture, almost like a moister version of beef jerky.

The good news is that the garlic noodles (my fav) tasted the same as usual. If you want the best experience, I'd recommend trekking out to the Sunset. Thanh Long is definitely better.
author: Amanda C.

description: The crab and garlic noodles are great, I come whenever I'm in town!
author: Mike P.

description: Awesome roasted crab and garlic noodles.  The best crab I've ever had. The food and service was excellent.  I give it a two thumbs up.
author: Leonard D.

description:
It's a dining "MUST" when traveling to SF!

I was introduced to this place by a close friend who resides in San Francisco. after my first visit, i came back 3 times in that very same month! this is by far one of my favorite restaurants to go to. when it's a special occasion and i am asked where i want to go, the place crustacean instantly comes to mind! 

I just love the food they serve at this place! I am a very picky person, especially when it comes to food, service, ambiance and prices. Although a bit pricey, it is well WORTH it. It is a little difficult to find the place, since it's up above on a second floor building. it's definitely out of no where. The great thing about it, is that they offer valet parking (since San Francisco is soooo difficult on finding parking). 

Now on to the menu...My favorite is the tamarind crab and garlic noodles. Usually the garlic noodle is enough to share between two people, but i always order my own because the garlic noodles are so delicious and full of flavor! i once had my friend to-go me 2 orders of garlic noodles and bring it back to San Jose for  me. hah! The Pepper calamari was also very tasteful. Some might think that it's a bit salty, but i love salty fried foods! more flavor! 

The only negative side about this place is that there is a mandatory dress code. collar shirts for men (no sports attire), and no open toe shoes for the ladies. On the flip side, they also own another location but it is called "thanh long." (also in sf). Thanh long is more casual with no dress code, but with the same exact menu. Other then that, the food, the service, the atmosphere were an A+ for me! 

Somebody owes me a birthday dinner, and i wanna go to crustaceans!! ;)
author: Lien T.

description:
I went to Crustaceans 3/22/12 for my bday as I have been doing for the last 3 years.
We ordered the roasted garlic crab and the garlic noodles.  My husband and I were'nt seated 10 minutes before the waiter brought us our food.  My crab was the littlest crab I had ever had.  It was good but I was not full at all and we usually have some to take home for a snack later.   I was VERY DISAPPOINTED IN THAT LITTLE CRAB.  I will doubt if I go there next year, too much money for that little crab. I should have sent it back!!!!!
author: Karen F.

description:
A friend of mine took me here for my birthday.  I thought the look of the place was really snazzy.  We went on a weeknight so it was rather quiet.  We had drunken crab and garlic noodles.  The noodles were very tasty and the crab was decent.  The waiter was friendly and very efficient but I don't think it was worth the price.  

I'd go here again but only if someone else suggested it.
author: Jennifer C.

description: I've been dining here for years and it has always been consistently pleasant.  My usual order is their famous roasted crab with garlic noodles.  It has NEVER disappointed me!  The crab is roasted & flavored perfectly, and it is best accompanied with their garlic noodles.  I usually dine here for special occasions (friends' birthdays/my birthdays).  I literally dream about this meal periodically, which is my usual indicator that I'm due for another intimate date with their roasted crab & garlic noodles.  Also, I've seen a lot of famous people dining here, including NBA players, NFL players, singers, actors etc. ...but they're just ordinary people just like us, (except wealthier), enjoying a good meal.  Lastly, after overindulging on the roasted crab & garlic noodles, if I'm feeling a little adventurous, I'll order my favorite dessert on their menu, the "baked Alaska!!!"  Oh my goodness!!!  Don't ask me what's in it...All I know is that it tastes like PURE BLISS!!!
author: Anne H.

description: My wife, Shelly and I went to the restaurant with 4 other friends which was an expensive outing.  We ordered their "famous" roasted crab and garlic noodles - both Shelly and I (the only ones that ordered the dish) got violently sick.  The place is dirty, dark and upon letting the manager know the next day of our discomfort he told us that we were probably not used to the excessive butter that they use.  We both barfed our guts out and that is caused by butter?  He offered no reimbursement or apologies.  I would think twice before going to this restaurant, unless you need to lose a quick couple of pounds and some extra cash.  Tom & Shelly Hogan - Concord
author: tom h.

description: Roll up your sleeve, grab a bib,  and start cracking some crab! 5 of us went to dinner at Crustacean last night. We ordered the calamari appetizer, 2 roasted crabs, 1 drunken crab, the beef short ribs, garlic noodles and the salmon. It was a massive feast and bits of crab were flying everywhere! I made a total mess since this was my first time having to work for my crab meat. The roasted crab was defintely better than the drunken crab because of the garlic. Garlic noodles go nicely with the crab that was also drenched in garlic. The short ribs came with a pretty good polenta type side that was quite tastey. The food was good but the wait was not. We had called in advance and they told us we did not need a reservation and would be seated quickly if we showed up before 6:30PM on Saturday. We ended up waiting over an hour! Don't forget to make a reservation and be ready for greasy fingers.
author: Debbie C.

description: It's aiiiight crab was really oily and salty. Sure not worth 140 spent
author: Jeff G.

description:
I love Crustacean!!! I go here at least ONCE a year with my boyfriend. I love their roasted garlic crab with their garlic noodle. Its VERY favorable and yummy in your tummy. Its a place where you have to be willing to spend some money. Its at least 30-50 per person but totally worth the money.  I also ordered the lobster salad which isn't on the menu, so you would have to request it. Its VERY good but pricey for a just a salad (~$35)

Overall, I really enjoy dining here. The down side is parking is a pain in the butt.
author: Betty T.

description: Came here for the crab. Was not disappointed! The crab cooked to amazing quality and lives up to the name. Although the price is expensive it is well worth it! Also the noodles that they had were amazing!
author: Johnny A.

description: Best Garlic Crab in the City!! Must also have the Garlic noodles. I would recommend ordering the crab cracked(costs a little bit more) but worth the price!
author: Cathie B.

description:
Yo this place is pretty fancy I must say and I am not sure why really. If I had been paying for it I would have been a tad disappointed at the bill. Disappointed with a frowney face perhaps...but like I said it wasn't my check. The food was very good but you would expect it to be I guess. We had no idea what this place was as we were a couple of corporate types being taken out for a company deal so it was a good choice (dress code, really?).

 We all shared / tasted each other's meals and I have to report that everything was extremely good both in presentation and in the flavor. I had the most generic meal I think of on the menu being mixed vegetables for a main course but with the amount of starters it was just what I needed. Obscure location but I could certainly see coming here for a date maybe (if I had the cash). Not a place I would recommend or return to but it was A o.k. considering everything.
author: Robert H.

description: AMAZING CRAB! The garlic noodles were on point, the salt and pepper calimari is to die for and the Lychee Marini's are tasty!
author: James B.

description:
I love this place,  I never knew it was there because it is up stairs and pushed back off Polk Street.

I love the ambiance and the decor.  I was there when lots a well behaved families (except for a group of loud grown women) there all eating and enjoying themselves.  We had a great wait staff person and their timing was impeccable.  The synchronization of service was excellent.

Of course i had the Salmon dish.  A lot of people were wearing plastic bibs and cracking all that crab.  That was too messy for me 'cause I was all dressed up with a silk top on.  So the Salmon dish was my pick.  I am glad I did.  Excellent dish.  The salmon was perfectly prepared and the portions were just right.  

For anyone who is a seafood lover who does not want to go down to fisherman's wharf, this is the place to eat great fish dishes in an elegant setting where you can get dressed up and have a nice dinner.
