description: I know people who only eat here when they come to the city. The best part are the garlic noodles. I don't think I need to keep coming back just to eat them. You can find better crab elsewhere. But the service is nice! We sat next to Barry Bonds the last time we went.
author: Mama C.

description: It was okay. I had the lobster dish and my boyfriend had the crab. Lobster sucked. You barely get anything. On the other hand, the crab was delicious. They're noodles were good. However, it was expensive. Our server sucked! She was extremely clumsy and dropped everything, including our camera that nearly broke!
author: Mimi R.

description: I'm not easily pleased when it comes for food and this one takes it home.  The food was absolutely delicious.  I will probably have to go back soon for the garlic crab!!!  The only thing I did not like was the wait to get served; hence, the 4 stars.  Our waiter did take some time before she got to us and I was starving.
author: rob m.

description: I'll give any place that has super cold beer at least 3 stars.  Not only do they have cold beer, but the food is good too.  The crab is heavenly.  I just wish it wasn't dripping in so much butter.  It can get pretty messy.  The garlic noodles are really good too, but the overload of garlic kind of upset my stomach.  It was worth it, though.  That's all the menu items I can speak for.  It's a really nice place with a business casual dress code.  It's just in a weird spot in the city.  Polk & California.  Don't go there on a warm day, because all you'll smell is bum pee.
author: Katie N.

description: I don't know what it was... but I just wasnt thoroughly impressed with the restaurant. Maybe It was because I didn't order the crab ("quoted price" on the menu didn't quite fit my college student budget) but.. everything just seemed alright. The service could have been better but maybe because we didn't look like luxurious moneyholders we didnt receive top notch service. The ambience is nicely dim and the cuisine is mos def euro-asian. Not quite sure if I'd come back if what we ended up paying we could have had meat instead of fish... haha
author: Liane T.

description: Roasted Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles.  Been there 4 or 5 times and haven't been able to try anything else!  I'd love try some of their other dishes ... but that would mean not getting my own Roasted Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles.
author: Antonio S.

description: Took my man here for his bday and we loved it.  The food and the service was on point.  Garlic noodles were perfect, drunken crab was delicious.  Our waiter was great, and they always had someone refilling our water, giving us extra napkins, replacing our crab shell bowls when it got full.  We'll be back.
author: Kali L.

description: Ordering something other than the roast crab (any style) and the garlic noodle in Crustacean is equivalent to ordering vegetarian lasagna at a steakhouse.
author: Ange L.

description: I've never been to a restaurant where everyone is eating the same thing - Dungeness crab, with a side of garlic noodles.  All you need to know, and I crave this everytime I come to SF.
author: Paul K.

description: This place is great! I absolutely loved it. I cant wait to go back. I went for dinner with my boyfriend and we had a memorable experience. The place was very nice and trendy, must have resservations! Must try the roasted crab and the tiger prawns with the garlic noodles. Prices were worth it!
author: Azizi A.

description: It's a great fun place to dine at with a group of friends. Each person with their own roasted crab and a bib! Noodles are buttery and garlicky and compliments the crab very well. Then a wet napkin to wipe down those sticky fingers!
author: Oanh N.

description:
eh-

it's good.. but not worth the premium price they put on it. Honestly, if you like seafood, there are far better places. The noodles are tasty but often too greasy. The waiters are not the sharpest. I would recommend trying it out once but if you are on the bubble.. go somewhere else.
author: Peter K.

description: This was my first time to embark on the whole Dine about Town thing that goes on twice a year in SF...Always wanted to try Crustaceans so suggested it to my friends, made reservations and we were set and excited to go. I have always heard good things about this place, but upon entering the restaurant I was not impressed..The elevator to the front was very outdated and just in need of a renovation..We were seated and the tables seems very cramped up off the bat...I couldnt even stretch comfortably..We had a table that sat 4 so it was a tight place..We started out with the calamari appetizer and that was good, just a little on the salty side...next we ordered from the dine about town menu...we all ordered different things so that we could share and try everything....Our service was acceptable in the beginning of the night but then it slowly went downhill as the night progressed. It started when one of my friends ordered a cocktail and it never came till we just forgot about it. Our waitress started to give us attitude when we accidently spilled water on the table and the table cloth had to be changed, but maybe if the tabled wer'nt so cramped up we would have more room to sit at ease.....we were seated at 8pm, did not get our dine about town food until 945ish...it was almost ten and we just started to eat?!? My appetite was slowly diminishing...we asked for small plates and ordered more drinks and we all felt this attitude from our waitress escalating. She had this look she would give us when we asked for things. The Garlic noodles that everyone raves about was completely oily. To the point where I would move the noodles and in the middle of the plate was orange oil that would drench the noodles. We also had some beef and that was tough  to taste and unappealing. Sometimes service can eithier make or break your dinner experience, I have been to places where the food was not that good but the customer service of the place would make the difference for the food unless something out of the ordinary went bad with your food selections. To top off the night was receiving our desserts, 2 of my friends ordered the fried banana and the vanilla bean ice cream, another friend of mine and myself ordered the orange sorbet. The banana dessert was up to par, but my orange sorbet was like right out of the freezer or something, it was rock solid, could not even break my spoon into it to try it. We asked the waitress for hot water and we poured the water under the orange sorbet cup to soften it. it was awful...At this point I was so upset and just wanted to get out of there considering it was almost 12 midnite!! We were eating dessert at 1130pm...thats crazy! Another ill moment was when the waitress came with the hot towels to wash our hands. The towels were out of control SCORCHING HOT. It was so hot that I could not hold it and dropped it on the table, when I would hold the towel on the ends, steam was rising out the towel like there was no tomorrow.....If we were to wipe our hands with them off the bat they would probably give us a 1st degree burn ....The bill came out to 200 plus..we were not at all happy with the service we tipped less than what was average.This place is overrated.over-priced and because of other peoples experience years ago to this place could of been better, but as of today in 2010, I would not recommend it... I most likely will never go here again, first-impression is lasting on an establishment and word of mouth can be detrimental...if I could give no stars for my experience at Crustaceans I would...but im forced to give it something.
author: Apple S.

description: Great place to go if you love crab cuz they have the yummiest whole dungeness crab you'll ever taste along w/the garlic noodles. It is definitely messy but prepare to lick those fingers cuz it's that good. Their menu is pretty pricey to me but worth it.
author: LANI W.

description: Love the noodles, love the crab.  Garlickly goodness!  I have yet to find a restaurant that can prepare garlic noodles better than this place.  If you know of one, send me a yelp msg=)
author: Lauren S.

description: Garlic Noodles+ Whole roasted Dungeness Crab= heaven. Took my cousin here. He loved it and told me he would moved to SF just to eat here everyday..but my cousin is overrated
author: Prescott T.

description: It felt like a typical fusion restaurant in Vegas (not in a good way). When we walked in, the staff gave us a look, and told us there's a dress code (which wasn't even mentioned in the menu). The sauce on the Pan Roasted Halibut was too salty. Ravioli wasn't bad at all, but they didn't serve it with any bread - I had to order a side of garlic bread. Granted I did not have their famous crab (because crab was not in-season), this restaurant is overrated and overpriced. If they were 30% cheaper, I would give it 4 stars. They should stop pretending to be a high-brow gourmet restaurant and adopt more family friendly atmosphere.
author: Min L.

description: What happened to my favorite restaurant??? I still give it 3 stars but it used to be five!!! I've been eating here for years but I probably haven't gone in the past year. I always order the roasted crab and garlic noodles. Though the crab is still good, I noticed that it lacked flavor. The garlic noodles is totally different - from the kind of noodles they used to the seasoning. It's now bland & similar to all the garlic noodles out there. This used to be my favorite :-( There were empty seats on a Friday night. We easily made reservations the day before. We should've known something was wrong... Crustacean, please bring back old recipes. Don't listen to one time customers complain about the fat, oil & seasonings. You're losing your repeat customers :-(
author: Rose V.

description: Never had a bad experience here. Great roasted crab w/garlic noodles, can't get enough!
author: Katie W.

description: If you're craving great seafood and got the money to burn, Crustacean serves up great crab and shrimp.  If you don't mind gettin' dirty while eating, definitely order the roasted crab, which is the dish that this place is known for.  For a cleaner, yet equally delicious experience, order the prawns with garlic noodles. These dishes are definitely heavy; each bite will be loaded with buttery goodness.
author: Peter C.

description:
This place is always good... Although I think their selection of crab choices has decreased. I ordered the pepper crusted crab, recommendation of our waitress... I wouldn't exactly say it was great.... too oily/greasy for my taste, left me feeling bloated. My boyfriend had the sea bass, he said it was good, I didn't try it because I hate sea bass. We didn't have an appetizer this time. The five stars I give is for making my boyfriends birthday special, I told them it was his birthday and they sang and brought dessert... oh and the garlic noodles... finger licking good.... yummmo


Visit #2:
I am sorry I have to deduct a star for the terrible service we had recieved this saturday. We had reservations for a nice quiet romantic area. We arrived early, and had a chance to sit at the bar to enjoy a few cocktails, we didn't wait much longer before the maitre'd had come to the bar and took us to our table. 
Sooo, the reason I had to come and deduct a star. As known this place is always busy, and this was a saturday night around nine-ish... we were accomodated to all our requests, except our waitress (server) was terrible. We had just sat down, didn't even have a chance to pull off our jackets, she was already standing there reciting the specials and asking what we will be drinking, when we still had cocktails. Anywho after all that she quickly disappeared, when we returned we took her up on the calamari appetizer special... which arrived literally 3 minutes later after we ordered...weird... calamari usually takes a lot longer to cook... regardless... I requested some water with a lemon, water came with no lemon... we then asked a few more times... no lemon... :( !!!! So we finally decided on sharing a crab and their fantastic garlic noodles... we put that order in and were about to decide on a bottle of wine when she magically disappeared again, so finally she came back and was annoyed with how long it was taking us to pick a wine... on top of that she kept trying to remove the full plate of our appetizer and asking if we were done... she definetly was either rushing to get home or rushing to get more tables... she made our experience very unwelcomed!!!! as she did the table next to us... I wish I remembered her name!!! as for the food, it was good as always... but the service was very poor!!!
author: yana Z.

description: Garlic noodles and crab. That's all that needs to be said. That is the only thing to order on the menu. You will slap your mama.
author: Safiya N.

description:
I've been here a few times but I ultimately prefer Thanh Long better because of the atmosphere.  The setting here is too formal and stuffy.  It makes a great place to take someone out for a new business dinner or hot date.  However, I like more casual places because I feel more comfortable there.

The menu is essentially the same as Thanh Long so I ordered the same things.  Garlic crab + garlic noodles.  The food is still really good and this is one of the times where the spin-off is very similar to the original.  

Less one star because parking sucks!
author: Scott L.

description: The first time I tried their garlic noodles with their infamous roasted crab, I fell in love.  Then I went a couple more times, and they started slacking.   It's about $55+ a person and I think you can go to a better asian fusion restaurant.  I like the decor inside the restaurant but I would prefer to go to Thanh Long, more laid back and the food I think taste better even though they are sister restaurants.
author: Jen V.

description: I've been here 3 times... the first 2 times I really enjoyed the food and the service. Me and my boyfriend got the garlic butter crab, garlic noodles and beef carpaccio. everything thing was made perfect. The last time I went here the I ordered the same thing and the crab was too buttery and the beef carpaccio had no flavor , we also tried their crusted seared tuna, which was the only thing that was ok. The mojito was watered down. Just everything was all bad. Over priced
author: amy n.

description: It's a tad pricey, but the food is pretty good though.  I had garlic noodles and jumbo prawns. Yum!  It's a quaint atmosphere with low lighting.  I'll probably go back again and try their crab.
author: Jeff H.

description:
Ah yes, the high light of my birthday! My family took me here last night to celebrate my birthday. I was impressed as I thought we were really going to Crustacean's sister restaurant Thanh Longs. Hm...anyways, to the review.

Service was fast, fun, and friendly...well not really fun...just thought I'd throw that in :). Lets just say I wasn't disappointed with the service. Food was delicious. We had started with three small plates and later we had 3 crabs, and 4 garlic noodles to share amongst 6 people and a bowl of rice. I will start with the appetizer's. We had ordered the Fried Calamari, Skewered Chicken and the Vietnamese Carpaccio. I enjoyed all three, but the only one that didn't WOW me was the Skewered Chicken. I like those more at Thai or Malaysian Cuisines. As for the Crab, We had 2 roasted crabs and 1 Tamarind crab. Both crabs were DELICIOUS but I loved the roasted one more as I like my crab seasoned in a simple way. Aside from the crab, the next best thing were the garlic noodles. I think I've died and gone to garlic noodle heaven. I mean wow, I can't describe it. All I can say is you should go there, and just get the garlic noodles just to try it out. 

Overall, they get a 4.5/5 from me. Service was great, food was great and experience was great. Hooray for Crustaceans.
author: Roger C.

description: Their roasted crab and garlic noodles are excellent! It's a little pricey, but worth it.
author: Jeremy J.

description: Delicious!!!!! Of course the roasted crab and garlic noodles kick some major ass, but the lobster salad and lobster were great too! I loved the cocktails too...the....crap, I can't remember the name of the cocktail (perhaps I had too many!!!) but it was great. Haha! It is expensive...definitely for a special occasion. Lots of butter....Paula Deen would love it!
author: Kristen C.

description: This is definitely one of those typical, over-hyped restaurants on yelp. I came to their dine-about-town special a few months ago and I can't tell you how typical the food was here. I'm surprised people rave about this place, but then again I've seen worse. The one thing I'll give it though is that it's far nicer inside than it is out (which is kind of cool in it's own right). But the food is so-so.
author: Simon L.

description: While watching "The Best Thing I Ever Ate: Filled With Envy" on Food Network, featuring the famous garlic noodles at Crustacean, I was taken back down memory lane to remember  life once upon a time in San Francisco (and before Yelp). The An family restaurant legacy lives up to expectations both at the Crustacean and Thanh Long establishments - truly home to the famous garlic noodles. This is where families can get your crab bibs on. I can't decide which was better, the drunken or cracked whole roasted crab, but just thinking about it makes me miss those good ol' days of splurging on southeast asian style shell fish. It's been nearly a decade but I've never forgotten the amazing dishes there. From time to time, I'll read about the An family in food magazines. I even interviewed there for a PT hostess job once upon a time. I'm glad to see they're still around and looking forward to revisiting their concept restaurants.
author: Maly L.

description: I heart my sister. She always treats me to the best food (& the most expensive too). So I told her I craved garlic crab, so she suggested Thanh Long or somewhere in Fishermen's Wharf. I've been to ThanhLong & didn't want to drive to the Wharf. So we decided here. The atmosphere is very nice, upscale & has an Eastern flair to it. Both host & waiter were polite. Now, the price can be on the steep side. They consider their garlic noodle of $8 to be "side order". That's not a "side order" price man! Don't' get me wrong - the noodle was good. I got a soup - it was small, but full of flavor and good amount of seafood too. You gotta order the garlic crab! So I did & it was a good size, with finger-licking aromatic garlic oil & seasoning all around it. I definitely liked the coating of my crab. The downside is that I enjoy licking the crab shell more than savoring the crab meat. Why? The seasoning is all on the coating; it didn't get cooked into the crab meat. The crab meat tasted plain - like how I would steam it at home. This place is definitely worth the visit, I just don't know when I'll come back again - moving on, next.
author: Yum Y U M.

description:
The chef at this place must be quite an incredible guy.

For garlic noodles to taste so uninspiring is really a feat.  I guess that's why they charge so much for the dishes.  They work so hard to use what should be exciting aromatics and spices and turn them really, really bland and boring.

I'm surprised this place has stayed in business for so long doing what it does to customers.  It should be illegal.  If they can do it by jacking up the price and pretending they care about the food they serve, just imagine what it could really be like if they actually put some TLC into the food they cook.  Radical concept, yes?
author: Dave M.

description: Yes the prices are high and yes the crab is frozen...but who cares when it's slathered in butter with salt and pepper. I've never tried dipping a whole crab in a deep friar and then dunking the whole thing in butter but I'm sure it probably will taste as good as it is here. But then again maybe not. I enjoyed the food but i was also with good company. Nobody complained and the garlic noodles were delicious. However the noodles were a bit "clumpy" for my taste. I suggest to go here if you don't know any other places that serve this type of crab, but if you already know of  a good place recommend it to me!
author: Kato D.

description:
garlic crab and noodles were really good.. exceptional infact.. but for the price.. it made me frown a little.. and the crab gets really messy.. but you're all dressed up.. 

it's weird. i was confused.
author: Lisa C.

description:
im a fan of the food...scratch that mostly the garlic noodles! but i have to give it only 2 stars because the the people working the front desk aren't that personable...and the wait staff is somewhat sketchy! im thinking if there is only two and you don't have a reservation they put you in the shitty two seating along the walkway entrance idk! it wasn't that busy and our waiter seemed to be M.I.A a lot! if it wasn't for this really nice lady who seemed to just be helping everyone we wouldn't have gotten much help. so THANK YOU TO HER!

aside from that i have probably eaten at this place 3 times in the past 4 weeks! im sure my arteries are clogged by now from all that roasted crab, oodles and oodles of those yummy garlic noodles and not to mention my new favorite dish the royal tiger prawns!!! as far as desert goes the deep fried banana with vanilla bean ice cream is decent but i wish it was more along the lines of a banana lumpia! haha that would be awesome! im sorry im filipino so when i hear deep friend banana i think of lumpia!!!

ill be back to eat, and not for the service...lets work on that crustaceans!!! the job that i was at prior to my current one, we frequently checked yelp to see how we were doing and how we can improve! and my current job well we're ranked number 1 on city search and yelp! so may they should jump on the yelp band wagon and see what their customers have to say! after all yelp seems to be the thing to do these days!!!
author: Jessica L.

description: This upscale restaurant has great service! I love their garlic crab and noodles!!! This place is a little pricey for some but it's worth it because the food and service is an A+
author: Kee G.

description: LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOVE the FOOOOOOOOOOD! VERY DELISH! I've been here 2 times in one month! The servers are super friendly! A have to is the Garlic noodles, the Roast Crab, and the Crab Puffs, and Shaken Beef! I have yet to go back and try other things on their menu. Also the Lemon Drop cocktail was also delish! Whenever I want to satisfy my craving for crab, this place is #1 on my list.
author: Melissa H.

description:
parking is always an issue for most places in the city and same goes for this place. they do have valet but that can always be a little sketchy. the restaurant is in a weird location, because the entrance isn't right off the street.

but the food here is really good, but not as good as thanh long even though they are somewhat related. the service was good, but lighting was a little too dark.
author: Kelly D.

description: OMG!  What can you say about this place!  We weren't able to make a reservation, but when we showed up they seated us in a very nice spot. Everything we ordered we absolutely fantastic.  From the lobster salad, the calamari & crab & beef dish. Let's not forget the garlic noodles either! Nothing was wasted and we could have eaten here every night.  Wonderful service, seating, food, atmosphere!  Who can ask for more....
author: Kyle R.

description:
Really disappointing. If there was a choice, this will be the first restaurant in my 40yrs of life giving a zero star rating, but such is life, one star will do.

Garlic Noodle with special sauce from the "secret kitchen" was nothing special. I only had half. I would have stopped after the first couple of mouthful but kept shovelling the noodles in because I'm half a pig and the allure of the special sauce that was playing in my head.
Had to stop as I was gagging..no kidding.

Broiled fish was also nothing special, in fact there was a little too much spices that completely took the subtle taste of the fish away. I do better at home by lightly seasoning the fish with turmeric and some salt, lightly pan fry or broiled.

The salt and pepper squid was tasteless. Really the food was no big deal. 

Crabs was so so too. Crabs are so easy to cook. I can cook better with a simple recipe of Chilli crab available online. I only took 25mins all up.

The place is overpriced, severely. It's full of make up and not much essence...one word..Hollywood. Just put up the plywood and veneer facade, not much underneath. It appeals to peoples vanity, especially stupid guys wanting to impress their GFs for a good night. You're better off twittering business like koji bbq truck and take her out to a club later. Save your money for something better, not the Crustacean. 

Have you also seen what the place looks like? It's kinda grotty and dingy. Do you really want to take your special GF here? Really? What about parking and the yucky area. It's not really Nob Hill. If you think it is, then you're a knob.

What about the pretentious waiters? All trying hard to part you and your cash with expensive wine suggestions. I tried a 12.50 glass and you guessed it......no big deal.

I grew up eating asian food and quite good at Vietnamese, Thai, Malay, Singaporean and Indian food, so I know good food. This place is as it describe: serving Fusion food...ie: a compromise. They change the great asian/vietnamese tastes for the local palette. So, some people with little or not  much food experience may be wowed by this place. However, I think they are wowed by how much their boyfriends spent and the pretentiousness of the place but not the food.

So, before you go, please check out other reviews. Ponder and think for a moment. The secret sauce may be secret but certainly not special. In fact is quite the opposite. Ask your BFs to take you out elsewhere...get a recommendation by word of mouth/friends/family/talk to people.

Good Luck
author: Joe C.

description:
DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!

Our waiter was full of it.......asked if I could get the roasted crab without garlic.......said he had to check with the manager.  After a long while, he came back and said anything without garlic would be tasteless............in other words, they really didn't want to make any special concessions.  All I wanted was for them to leave the garlic out;  I was willing to order any other dish on the menu.  All I could get was a steamed, tasteless (per the waiter) crab.

This place was too tah-ti-tah for me.
author: moira m.

description: Somewhat pricey, but the baked crab is so worth it. Prepare to wear a bib and get messy. I usually get thee standard crab (not the sake) and share a side of garlic noodles. In my opinion, any date who is down for this meal is a good sign to keep.
author: Peter Y.

description: Went here last week for labor day weekend. Took the bart, then cable car, since  the bay bridge was closed.  I don't know what they put in the garlic noodles, but they are delicious.  The hostess and the servers were very  friendly and efficient.  Will definitely be back the next time I get a craving for those noodles; the crab was ok , but nothing  super-spectacular. My wife really liked the royal prawns dish.
author: Eric Q.

description: I admit it, I love Crustacean.  This is the place where I had my first crab, and so it holds special memories for me.  Everyone raves about the garlic noodles and garlic crab, and there is a reason for that.  It's damn good!  However if you're on a diet, or counting calories, this is not the place to frequent.  There is a dress code, which may be annoying to some.  Anyhow, try ordering the crab bisque soup.  It is delicious.  The lobster paper rolls are yummy, as well as all the appetizers I've tried there.  When I eat here, I am always surprised by the number of people on dates, and what appears to be 1st dates.  I would hate to go here on a first date!  Why?  Because when I'm eating my crab, there is little conversation!  I am lost in peeling, cracking, slurping, etc.  Ah, just thinking about it makes me hungry!
author: Sarah F.

description:
Overall, it was a good experience. The atmosphere was very nice, staff well dressed and polite. When I was eating the crab, waiter changed out my "discard" bowl multiple times so that I didn't have an unsightly bowl of shell sitting on the table. 

What we ordered:
1. Crab Puffs - Very disappointing, incredibly small and miniscule amounts of crab inside. 
2. Tempura Style Coconut Prawns - Also disappointing, they were not crisp at all, almost like they had been sitting under a heat lamp for awhile. 
3. Vietnamese Carpaccio - AMAZING!!! Flavorful with the capers and red onion. Next time I will order 4 of these!!!
4. Pan Roasted Halibut - Very good, great flavor, fresh. 
5. Roasted Crab - No wonder this is their signature dish. Flavor was amazing, seasoning perfect, and the crab was great! 
6. An's Garlic Noodles - Second only to the Vietnamese Carpaccio, I would come here just for these noodles!
7. Baked Alaska - =(
8. Fresh Mango Cheesecake - Mediocre at best
author: Matt K.

description: One of the best crabs in all of the Bay Area! I've been here numerous times and so have many of my friends. I always order the roasted crab and garlic noodles. The staff is very nice and make you feel welcomed. Be sure to wear a collared shirt for the guys. But that should be expected at any fine restaurant. So if you like crab, you HAVE to give them a try. I guarantee you'll love it.
author: Allen L.

description: It's deceiving from the outside and a pain in the ass to find your way up to but overall it was a good experience.  The food, and particularly the Dungeness crab, is outstanding but very much overpriced.  It should cost about half of what they charge.  Nevertheless, it was a good experience.
author: Merritt W.

description: I think this place is a little overated and overpriced for the ambience. It's very early 90's-ish. The Roasted Crab was good and the garlic noodles complimented the dish well but I was just as happy having steamed crab down at the Wharf for a much less expensive meal and better view. All the butter makes it really rich.  The entree is enough to split if you're having appetizers as well. We also had the salt and pepper calamari and shrimp toasts--both of which were tasty.
author: trinh v.

description: I absolutely love their roasted crab and garlic noodles. This is a place you should go for special occasions like a date, celebration, etc. So that no one really complains about the bill =P Anyways, the last time my boyfriend and I ate here we had nothing to complain about. We ordered 2 roasted crabs, 1 garlic noodles, 1 appetizer ahi tuna special , and an alcoholic drink = $110.00. Which I thought was pretty good. I've at least gone here twice a year for the past 5+ years. If you haven't tried their food yet- you're totally missing out.
author: Genevieve L.

description: Decent. It's all about the hype right? The City has so many great spots and this one seems to get all the credit. Needs some work on the atmosphere and maybe they should drug test their employees. Or IQ test them or something.
author: JA R.

description: This place is over rated.  Dont get me wrong, I dont think that the food here is bad nor is the ambience nasty, however for the price you pay to eat buttered up garlic crab, you can get probably a better deal on the pier on Fisherman's Wharf.  Honestly, as a seafood lover, I love seafood done in various ways.  However, the excessive butter and garlic at Crustacean gets a little overboard.  Their garlic noodles are great but I seriously felt like I was going to get a heat attack after I left.
author: Charles C.

description: I was proposed to here, so of course I am going to give it 5 stars. The only thing I ever order from here are the garlic noodles and crab. MMMMmmmmm! Delicious! Can't speak for the rest of the menu, but the Crab and Garlic Noodles are DELICIOUS!!!!
author: Danielle G.

description: I didn't really enjoy the food.  I actually ended up feeling like that was a waste of one hundred dollars on lunch.  I only went there because my girlfriend suggested it, but as some other reviewers mentioned it must have been better  under a different chef.  The server I had recommended the roasted crab.  GROSS!!!!  Way too much oil grease whatever.  If the crab was fresh you wouldn't need to conceal the flavor under all that crap!!!  The spring rolls were unremarkable and the dipping sauce had way to much fish sauce in it. I have had better Fried Rice from a place in Oakland that gives it out free with every meal.  ( Perhaps the chef could use a refresher course).  And eating my One hundred dollar lunch with the homeless man laying directly outside made me feel indulgent.
author: Amma N.

description: We had girls night out to celebrate a birthday at Crustaceans.  It had been a while since I've been there so I was really looking forward to it.  The food was great as usual.  Tiger Prawns, garlic noodles, shrimp toast, lobster roll, and plum wine.  The parking however was terrible!!! There were no valet attendants available when we pulled up, one finally showed up and told us to just leave the car, no ticket or  anything. Of course we didn't do that.  He finally brought us a ticket and we left the car. Upon returning, it took over 30 min to retrieve the car the passenger seat was laid down as if someone had been sleeping, the radio station and heater settings were all changed.  The attendant laughed.  No tip for him of course but this left a bad impression of the resturant experience.  I really hope they do something about this.
author: Gwen B.

description: roasted crab is better than garlic noodles is better than baked alaska
author: Alan V.

description:
Always make reservations ahead of time! 

Drinks and food are great here! The tiger prawns is a must with the garlic noodles. The best garlic noodles I ever had!

I was a little disappointed in their shaken beef dish. I had more flavorful and tender beef at other places for less than what I paid for at Crustacean. 

Overall Crustacean is one of my favorite restaurants whenever my wallet can afford a $120 meal for 2.
author: Carry H.

description: I looooooooove Crustaceans!  I was just there over the weekend with 5 other people and we all ordered crab except for one.  Because it's crab season, my roast crab was particularly moist and fresh.  Next time, I'm ordering my own garlic noodles.  Forget sharing!  Yes, It's that good!  The crab and noodles will probably be my last meal on earth when the time comes!
author: caroline r.

description: The snooty door person with his self important attitude was a deal breaker for us.  Why be such a prick?  This place is tired and touristy and with so many great places in SF there's no excuse for being either.  My co-worker swears by Thanh Long, so maybe we'll give that place a try.
author: Amy K.

description:
Crab Delight. Garlic Lovers Delight.

Tasty Roasted Garlic crab that will leave you smelling for weeks. Whole Crab, Cracked with yummy oily butterygarlic sauce..Served in a large tray. Absolutely a delight!!! Get the garlic noodles too. Get the bib or wear a shirt you wouldnt mind getting greased up with garlic and oil. Ambiance is okay, multi level seating. Asian Fusion.  I found the recipe online for garlic roasted crab and made my version at home, pretty good but doesnt compare to the their secret sauce. Dress Accordingly, they have a dress policy... no t-shirt and flip flops allowed lol.

Very Expensive if you go for the full 4/5 course meal.
author: S S.

description: It was quite awhile ago when I went here.  But I remember that the garlic noodles and crab was good.  Very nice restaurant.
author: Jeremy C.

description: OMG--3 words: Crab and Garlic Noodles!!! Get there a little early and enjoy the bar...very fast service!
author: Anne N.

description: Was in town on business, simply put the crab was absolutely amazing.  The roasted Garlic crab was the best i have ever had and was perfect with the garlic noodles and rice.  Service was friendly and helpful, pointing us in the right directions with apps and made it an enjoyable experience.  Would suggest to anyone in the city.
author: Matthew L.

description: A friend recommended this place and after trying it, I have to say yuuuuuuuummy!  Everyone rants and raves about their crab and garlic noodles and now I can say I taste why.  I will definately be coming back....but only for special occasions.  It's pricier than I'd like it to be so I need to be able to justify it.
author: Kalee C.

description:
Tamarind crab is far inferior to Yummy Yummy Pho on Irving. Prices are high for food that could be had elsewhere in SF for much cheaper - and better tasting.

Inside ambience is nice though..
author: service p.

description:
The girlfriend and I went here Sunday night after reading some reviews about it.  Overall the place was extremely good.

We showed up half an hour early for our reservation but were seated immediately (probably because it was a Sunday).

The staff were great, especially our waiter who was fantastic.  

The food was excellent, a bit pricey but excellent.  We had a salad of seafood appetizer, an order of the garlic noodles, the crab cake entree, and the roasted crab entree.  My only complaint with the whole evening is the price of the crab cake entree ($20.95), I'd have expected two crab cakes, not one.  For dessert we ordered the fried pineapple and the ice wine that was paired with it.  Both were quite good.

The place really seemed to pick up after 8:30pm (mainly larger groups) and the background noise level started to rapidly increase.  Just something to keep in mind.

Overall my experience was a nice restaurant with awesome food and excellent service but a bit on the pricey side.
author: Chris P.

description: I have been here many times with my cilents and they truly deserve great reviews. the food is always exceptionally fresh and garlic noodles no copy cat restuarant can ever make the exact same. Roast crab YUM!!!!!
author: jacqueline c.

description: you'll love crustacean if you are into crabs and garlic noodles. Forget about the rest. Those two are the reason why you should eat at this place.
author: freewill m.

description: Changing this to 5 stars.. had thang long the other day and you know the food actualy tasted better here...
author: Joey N.

description: the roasted crab and garlic noodles are as good as it gets.  no complaints here.
author: Eric and Crystal F.

description: This is the best crab experience anywhere in the freakin world. Don't bother with the shrimp or fish. Just have the garlic roasted crab. Its buttery, garlicky and heavenly. Couple this with the heavenly garlic noodles and green beans and you have yourself a great meal. Minus one star because it's overpriced. They should lower the prices and I would go there more often. Atmosphere is kinda fancy and wierd at the same time. Food is delicious.
author: Greg A.

description: This was my 2nd time here, against my better judgement. And again, even though I had a reservation, they made me wait, albeit only 5 minutes. Even better was when I walked past several empty tables. Anyways, being Vietnamese, I abhor restaurants like these, because 1) my mother cooks better (including Slanted Door), and 2) there's no Vietnamese on the menu. Would you eat in a French restaurant in France if it had no French on the menu? This place is overpriced and Americanized. Crowd was mixed, so at least it doesn't violate the "judge an Asian restaurant by its Asian patrons", but I don't think I heard a lick of Vietnamese there. Not that I would, the place is loud, very loud. And of course, the only reason to come here is the crab and or garlic noodles, both of which you can get cheaper and better at plenty of other places. I went for Dine About Town, since Crustacean usually costs $49 a meal. First course is a choice of shrimp and green mango rolls, skewered chicken with asian pickled vegetables, or mixed greens with candied walnuts and orange vinaigrette. After looking at the normal menu, I noticed that the mixed greens were more expensive than the shrimp rolls and the skewered chicken, at $9.50! Rather odd, since when does cheap iceberg lettuce cost more than meat (and chicken at that), much less seafood, in this case, shrimp? So I had the mixed greens, which consisted of iceberg lettuce, baby spinach, red lettuce, and one piece of frisee, as well as the candied walnuts, a few pieces of orange, and orange vinaigrette. It was a sizeable amount, and gave me more bites than my friend's shrimp rolls. It was quite decent, not bad at all really. Second course was a choice of shaken beef (aka bo luc lac aka look luck beef) with jasmine steamed rice or prawn stir fry with An's garlic noodles. I suppose the garlic noodles are what Crustacean is famous for, but i think you get like 5 prawns (not much, even when they're jumbo). And one of my favorite Viet dishes that I always order is bo luc lac (along with ca kho tho and the sour [because of the pineapple chunks] catfish soup), so I got the shaken beef. It came with cherry tomatoes, like 2 or 3, not the generous amounts of tomato slices you get at other Viet restaurants. Also, the onions were sliced thin and were too few in number. You get a bowl of rice, which was just enough, and better than say a tiny cup of rice that some places offer. The beef was alright, but anybody who knows anything about bo luc lac knows that you serve it with a small saucer of salt, pepper, and lime juice on the side to dip the beef in. I asked for that, and was brought it, which made the entree so much better. Dessert was fried banana a la mode (vanilla ice cream) or orange cream sorbet. I had the fried banana, which was good. I liked the vanilla ice cream, it had a very good flavor. The decor has improved after an extensive remodeling. Service was fine. But I won't be coming back unless it's at a discount such as Dine About Town. Places like Crustacean annoy me because they proffer unauthentic food and whitewash themselves. The dumbasses will come if you call fish sauce a vinaigrette...The emperor has no clothes, and in this case, Helene An doesn't have an ao dai...
author: Hao L.

description: mmmmmnnnnnnhhhnnn, garlic noodles!!!! So so good!  Service was fast and efficient last time we went.  The crab delicious and they even made us a couple of nice cocktails at the bar.
author: Mike and Nance B.

description: Crustacean is not worth the time or the money...I don't get what why people think its so good.  Our food was tasteless, cold, and served within 10 minutes.  The meals looked liked they were premade and heated up in the microwave...gross! I thought it would a great dining experience for being rated well and in the city. But that was not the case...not to mention the expense...it roughly ran 45.00 dollars a person...so not worth it...The vietnamase in Palo on University is so so much better!  I think the name is Taoram...something like that. Look it up its worth every moment and dollar!
author: Cindy N.

description: This place probably doesn't deserve 5 stars but it's getting 5 because it saved my Valentine's Day.  (See my Long Thang review).  After a ridiculous experience at Long Thang, my Valentine's Day date (bf at the time) and I came here.  They have valet parking and I love that.  That's deserving of a few stars.  We arrived without reservations and were seated within probably 15 minutes.  Amazing!  We waited at the bar where the bartenders were very friendly and whipped up some delicious drinks for us.  We were told by the bartender that Jerry Rice was in the house and I thought that was pretty cool.  So then we finally got seated and who do we sit next to, Jerry Rice.  I'm not going to lie, but I didn't actually know what he looked like.  Yes, he was pointed out to me.  Anyway, besides that little celebrity sighting, we had a great little romantic spot in the restaurant.  We ordered crab, garlic noodles, and green beans.  I've never worn a bib in public, ok, that IS a lie, but at least not in a restaurant like that.  It was quite funny, but I'm glad I did because those crabs are messy.  And HUGE!  I only ate like half my crab and some of it went to my date.  I felt that the portions were pretty big.  I loved the food as it was a delicious treat.  As far as pricing goes, I'm not really sure about that, but life is too short to think about what you are spending money on.  It's just money and memories last forever.  Overall, I think my great experience here was based on the friendly service and tasty food.  I'd definitely go back.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: the garlic crab and tamarind crab are a fantastic.  the restaurant decor is thrifty considering MP of fresh seafood. the maitre de is a terrible human being, by the way.  The rest of the wait staff are courteous and friendly.  If you like crab you have to try it here.  It is excellent.
author: Kurt T.

description: Had dinner here a few weeks ago upon a friend's recommendation.  Turned it my wife and I find the place too overpriced for the quality of the food.  As recommended by most diners we ordered the dungeness crab which came cooked heavily in oil (very greasy), and the garlic noodles.  Each crab costs $40.  While service is impeccable overall this place is way overpriced.  You can eat dungeness crab done better, less greasy at an authentic chinese restaurant in Chinatown for half the price.  And frankly the noodle is nothing to brag about.   The dress code requirement is also funny, especially since the location of this restaurant does not merit such a dress code....go figure out yourself if you want.
author: Harry L.

description: I took my wife here for her birthday today. We ordered the baked crab, an order of baked salmon, a side order of garlic noodles and 2 martinees. We ended up paying $102. I wouldn't cry to much about it if I at least got a baked potato, a soup or side salad or a piece of bread with the crab, or a 6 to 8 inch piece of salmon, but I got two 3 x 1 x  1 pieces and about 4 ounces of spinach.   Any bread,  salad,  potato come with the meal? I asked the waiter about it, although very nice, looked at me like I hadn't had my psychotropic meds for the day and said quite dryly, "no". I spent $102 and all I got was a crab on my plate with nothing to go with it, 2 small pieces of salmon that would have had my 4 year old daughter still starving and a bowl of noodles. In Chicago, for that amount of money, I could sit down with 2 20 ouch steaks, a side salad, twice baked potato, 2 drinks a piece ,still have enough to tip the waiter the 17 percent and put a little gas in the tank. Very, very disappointed, very disappointed. my wallet feels like it's been assaulted and my stomach feels like going down the street to the nearest jack in the box. so much for a happy birthday.
author: Jacob B.

description: We had dinner there for Valentine's Day and the food was not that great like everyone said it would be. The crab was so salty and the fried noodles were too buttery. The service was not great either. It was very disappointing.
author: Jenn B.

description: i know im gonna get a lot of sh*t for posting this but i did not like this place...first of all they wouldnt let me and my friend in cause she was wearing a giants jersey (we went to fanfest) so they made us sit outside...it was hella cold and windy...ordered the garlic crag (i uploaded pictures) and it was NOT fresh...it tasted rancid...kinda like perm (and NO i've never tasted perm but it smelled like it)...i really dont understand why the crab wasnt fresh...it WAS crab season and half moon bay is only a hop, skip and jump away. this place is overrated.
author: ayyyych m.

description: Awesome garlic crab.  You must try it.  I minus-ed two stars because the decor is really old and starting to look very shabby.  Wish they would redo the interior.
author: Leigh F.

description: Their crab will have you begging for more... every time.... YUM YUM YUM.  The ambiance leaves much to be desired, but you don't care when the crab is that good.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Yum...garlic noodles. but don't get the garlic crab with it b/c it'll be HOLY GARLIC.
author: Candy L.

description: Part 3 of my Crustacean report.  Being an avid supported of this restaurant, I decided to take my mom to the SF location for her b-day last week.  Okay, first of all, the location of this place is NOTHING like the ones in Beverly Hills and Vegas.  You had to take an elevator to the third floor and the elevator was old and rotten.  Once you stepped inside you were greeted by the usual Crustacean's decor.  However, the view leaves much to be admired.  I swore that in any moment I'd see a drug transaction go down or a transsexual hooker would approach one of her/his clients.  I kept looking out the window expecting to see a police chase or something while my boyfriend kept singing "The Freaks Come Out At Night."  Well, gotta give it to them for the street entertainment.  The food was splendid as usual and our waiter was very attentive.  I swear he never let our water glasses get more that halfway empty.  I would come again but try to request a table away from the window :o)
author: Andrea B.

description: If you want to pay top money for bad food, this is your restaurant .  Crustacean is incredibly overrated and overpriced.  We have calamari for appetizer.  They were gummy and tasteless.  I had their famous garlic noodles with tiger prawns as main dish.  The noodles were overcooked and so salty that you couldn't taste anything else.  A $1 Cup-O-Noodles would have been a lot better. The cost of this dish was $35 (for 4 prawns and bad noodles).  A total ripoff.
author: Alfredo M.

description: 3.5--ive been to both crustacean and thanh long. they pretty much taste the same. prices are cheaper at thanh long.. but only by a couple bucks. i actually thought the tamarind crab was better than the roasted one.. theres more flavor to it. i loved the garlic noodles.. but theyre kinda oily. but for $40/crab, id rather buy some alaskan king crab on sale at safeway or costco. crustacean is definitely a good place to take parents who love the stuff.
author: Nancy L.

description: Long wait for table even with reservation; even longer wait for food. Quality is mediocre but way over-priced. You can easily get better seafood at a Chinese restaurant instead. I'm not coming back again.
author: kenneth y.

description: Crustacean is one of those restaurants that is far too impressed with itself.  The prices are high and the food is mediocre at best. The crab in the crabcakes was minced into tasteless shreds then overpowered with pepper.  The pasta-esque envelopes on the shrimp ravioli were mildly interesting at first bite, but faded into boredom by the end of the second ravioli when it was totally overwhelmed by the fennel.  And so on and so on... silly amounts of a single spice overwhelmed the bland base of nearly every dish--including the specialty drinks.  The single exception was the chocolate bread pudding, which had a nice mix of tastes.
author: Jeannine K.

description: I ordered the Yellow Crab Bisque with Dungeness Crab, Garlic Noodles, and The Roast Crab.  The corn bisque was very simple and unimpressive and garlic noodles were mushy and overcooked.  The crab, on the other hand, was drenched in butter and couldn't be more delicious.  I think this place is a little too expensive to have mediocre items but if you're coming for the crab, I think it's well worth it.
author: Marianne L.

description: Ok.  I was starving, so eating every last bit of my food was MOSTLY due to that reason.  However, I still enjoyed the food.  I was looking forward to eating here after watching WICKED the musical and I was in a super ecstatic mood, singing songs and breaking down the play with the bf.  It was also my 23rd, so who wouldn't be happy?  Although the food was a little too oily for my usual liking, I enjoyed it sooo much.  The service was on point, being that it was also Father's day and slightly busy.  I'd go again, but when I've conjoured up more money to eat here.  This place is on the expensive side, but who cares?  It was my bday and the bday girl gets what she wants, right?  BF had the roasted salmon and I came to try their famous ROAST CRAB and GARLIC NOODLES.  One taste of the garlic noodles, and I was in love.  =)  Sorry bf!  I fell in love with the garlic noodles. The reviews I've read have been pretty much hit or miss with the garlic noodles, but for me it was a GIGANTOR HIT! *SMACK*  The roasted crab was HUGE and it was prepared differently than I thought it would be.  All the sauce (is that what it is? seemed like it was just oil with spices) was on the outside, so u kinda had to suck on the shell to get the REAL flavor.  But I enjoyed it.  (I was with my 2 loves! WHO WOULDN'T?) =)  The manager was super nice and thanked us for dining with him, and even told us about Thanh (sp?) Longs, the sister restaurant, thats more casual with the same exact menu, and he even mentioned that Thanh Long's Garlic Noodles were better than theirs!  So I definitely have to try that sometime... =) mmmm.... garlic noodles.... *lost in wonderland*
author: Kristine S.

description: looks kinda dirty  outside but its definitely a bit upscale once you stepp in. i believe this is the sister restaurant to thanh long so of course order  the roasted crab and garlic noodles. i think id go to thanh long or ppq if im craving for some crab and garlic noodles because this is definitely pricer than these other restaurants.
author: Bren L.

description: I bet a friend who claims to be a Pats fan (he has like 3 or 4 favorite teams, so its tough keeping track) that the Giants would beat them in the Super Bowl. Mind you, the Giants were a 13-point underdog, and being a real fan, I offered the bet straight up. Winner picks the restaurant, loser pays. Karma rewarded my faith, and we hit Crustacean (www.anfamily.com). Crustacean is a family-run Vietnamese seafood house. Their signature dish is their whole dungeness crab prepared 3 different ways- the Roasted Crab (garlic), the Drunken Crab (wine, scallions and black pepper), and the Tamarind Crab (red Vietnamese sweet and spicy sauce). This night, I went with the Drunken Crab, but I have had all three and probably lean toward the Roast Crab. But seriously, it's not like you can make a bed selection. We started with numerous appetizers- the salt and pepper calamari were excellent. But the absolute must here is getting the An's Garlic Noodles as a side dish to whatever you get. There is a secret kitchen in each Crustacean location, protecting the family recipes, and my guess is that the Garlic Noodles is the dish they are most concerned with protecting.
author: Steakhead ..

description: I live around the corner from the Crustacean, and I am tempted by the delicious smells of their garlic noodles and crab on a daily basis. The restaurant seems to always have a steady flow of customers on the weekend, and they always seem packed whenever I go. They take reservations and are a bit on the "fancy" side in that they don't allow athletic wear; however, they have shirts on hand for anyone who isn't appropriately dressed. I think this is a bit over the top and unnecessary, but I guess it works for them. The ambiance is cozy and dimly lit, and in my opinion the best tables are the booths that overlook California Street. I always order the garlic noodles - they are lovely and oily and drenched in garlic. Probably the best noodles I've ever had. Their crab is also fantastic - this is what most people seem to go there for. I've also had a few of their seafood appetizers as well as the salmon entree - always perfectly cooked and delicious. They don't accept phone orders for takeout; however, if you go over  there, you can place an order in person and then wait and/or come back to pick up your order. They have a 'sister' restaurant over in the sunset called Thanh Long which is just as good and is a bit more on the casual side. Crustacean is the kind of place you go on a date and/or a special occasion.
author: Maren P.

description: We went to Crustacean on a whim to celebrate the beginning of Dine About Town. The food did not disappoint. We started with the poached shrimp spring roll and then moved onto The Roasted Dungeness Crab in a buttery garlic sauce that was truly exceptional and well worth the steep price ($38). I enjoyed the shrimp "stir-fry" over their infamous garlic noodles. We ended the meal sharing the fried banana a la mode. All in all the food was tasty. The service on the other hand had much to be desired. I think our server was having an off night, as we overheard other patrons complaining to the front-of-house manager about items he had forgotten. When they delivered the crab, I had to ask for the bib, cracker and bowls from the busser. Having said this, I overheard the FOH manager's delivery in addressing the patrons and he is a very good communicator, good at his job. I will continue to recommend Crustacean to others and am continuing to dream about trying the Coconut Prawns next time (with garlic noodles, of course)!
author: Annelies Z.

description: All I can say is garlic or tamarind crab and noodles. That's it. The BEST!!!
author: Rona m.

description: the Food was just ok including the wait staff. I was approached by a manager which had a sears suit on, he asked if I had a t-shirt under my jacket which I had a prada sweater on. After my food came I took my sweater off so that the butter didn't get on it. I was appoached by a front desk person to bring me which look like a  Wal-Mart shirt  to put over my sweater. I didn't want to wear a such a thing. I was asked later by a manager  that If I didn't wear it that they wouldn't serve me anymore. Beware of this place they don't know what style is if you don't wear  what they think is good you won't get served. BEWARE!! THis place should get a zero stars!
author: John J.

description: I've been here a total of 2 times and both times I was very satisfied.  I do not eat seafood (allergic to shell fish, uhhh) but I do enjoy watching my husband and my friends eat the roasted crab.   They rave over it and cannot wait to get it, once it comes to the table everybody shuts up. The garlic noodles are THE BEST noodles period - gotta get some with every meal there.  I always order extra to take home because they are so good.  I do also eat the 5 spice chicken which is very flavorful.  The only thing I thought was ok and could have been better was the eggplant on my plate with the 5 spice chicken.  The eggplant was fried but it was soooo over done that it was soggy - weird.  Anyway, my husband complained about his drink, he couldn't taste the tequila in his cadillac margarita - he sent it back twice.  For a appetizer we got the beef skewers, very regular but tasty.  Overall, I will visit Crustecean again, again, and again.
author: Stefanie R.

description: At least now I can say I have tried it. Been in San Francisco for 10 years and had my first experience at Crustaceans. There was a lot of hype going in, and I would have to say coming out, wasn't very impressed with the overall experience. The Garlic Crab is a must and really good, but outside of that, everything is average and overpriced. Service was ok (The hot towels were a nice touch after destroying my crab). Told them about GF Birthday and they forgot about it.
author: Chris L.

description: Delicious garlic noodles, garlic rice, roasted crab, and tiger prawns!!!  They also have these crab puffs appetizer that come with this sauce that is yummo!!!  Our servers have always been great.  They also give free desserts with a candle for birthday celebrations.  This place is definitely worth the price.
author: Grace G.

description: I've had better garlic noodles. The shaken beef was not that great. If you're allergic seafood, don't come because the seafood alternatives are not that good.
author: Christine N.

description: when we first walked in, we noticed that a lot of brothas and sistas must really love crab (we were the only asians up in there)! like others said, go for the crab and garlic noodles (although, i'm sure you can get it anywhere else for like $2). everything is else is just blah. if you're in the peninsula are make sure to check out chu kong (see my review)!
author: Jane Y.

description: These are the Garlic Noodle creators...the noodles are to die for and soooo delicious...they have a another restaurant called Thanh Long (inexpensive version). Crustacean is a high-end vietnamese restaurant and the food speaks for itself. I really enjoyed their dishes and would definitely come back again.
author: Janet T.

description: same food as thanh long but the pretentious snobby factor turned WAY up...  i'll make the drive out to the outer sunset to get my roasted crab on...
author: Swarup B.

description: The food is still good, the service has gotten so much worse. The also need some interior design upgrade. The place looks dark and outdated.
author: angela s.

description: exactly the same as Thanh Long's, but more expensive and cloth napkins and tablecloths.  i'd go here if i was too lazy to make it out to the outer sunset.
author: jen b.

description: excellent garlic noodle and orange sherbet.  their salad dressing is also surprisingly good.
author: Sydney L.

description: I used to come to this place even when I lived in HI because my mom loves this place.  I always thought it was good, but my last visit was very good.  My bf brought me here last month for my bday.  We ordered 3 appetizers: duck wontons were okay, lobster roll was just a vietnamese egg roll and I couldn't taste the lobster but it was still good.  Our 3rd appetizer however was a special of the night, a lobster salad, mmmmm this was good, greens, half a lobster, slices of mango with a vinagrette.  We both had the roasted crab and it was better than I remember.  This was the first time I didn't get garlic noodles since we ordered all those appetizers.  I like noodles, I like garlic, but I never thought that their garlic noodles were all that.  This place is pricey though, we paid a little over $200 including tip for the 3 apps, 2  roasted crabs, 3 cocktails, 1 coffee and 1 dessert...what can I say, we both can eat!  Oh and the service was a lot better than I remembered too.  I read other reviews about waiting even with reservations, we didn't have to wait last month for just the two of us.  The time before last month there were 6 of us and we didn't have to wait either, maybe I've just been lucky.
author: Casey F.

description: SO OVER HYPED.   In terms of food, there are places in SF that offer better food at cheaper prices.  Crab and noodles are not exclusive only to Crustacean.  In terms of look/feel, there are also places that look and feel a lot better.  We ended up sitting in their patio area which felt a little bit makeshift with the giant umbrella's holding up the patio cover.  The garlic noodles are amazing and I'll have to admit that I did go partly just to try them.  Their sorbet is also pretty good; it has a natural citrus taste that I could not seem to get enough of.  But it was not worth having to sit through an entire dinner of over-priced mediocre food.
author: Raz R.

description: It's all about the crab... I wanted the drunken crab but the waiter talked me into the roasted one... and I was very pleased... I have to say that it's probably the best marinated crab I've ever eaten (and also the most expensive dungeness crab)... the garlic noodles also lived up to its name... my friend is a lazy eater so she skipped the crab and got the easy put-in-your-mouth Saigon Beef dish... she was very impressed that it had salad and greens included and the sauce that came from the meat was exquisite... all the dishes I tried... I have to say... I really want to go back to try them again... the environment is really nice and the ambiance is perfect... since it's just after Tet New Year, it was decorated very well... since it was Valentine's weekend, they were very crowded and there was a long reservations line... but we were just too cute... and the nice receptionist got us a table in a matter of minutes... but I guess we won't risk that again and put in a reservations before we come next time during the holidays...
author: yelp p.

description: wow, there are some interesting reviews down there. look, plain and simple: if ure looking for a good place to get good garlic crab and even GREATER garlic noodles, this is the place to be. i was really being stingy and didnt want to share my garlic noodles with anyone!! lol
author: PauLine R.

description: I go here and just get the roasted crab and the garlic noodles...perfect combination!  It is pretty pricey but since I only go about a couple times a year, it doesn't really bother me.
author: Camille T.

description: Delicious!!!!! Of course the roasted crab and garlic noodles kick some major ass, but the lobster salad and lobster were great too! I loved the cocktails toothe.crap, I can't remember the name of the cocktail (perhaps I had too many!!!) but it was great. Haha! It is expensivedefinitely for a special occasion. Lots of butter.Paula Deen would love it!
author: lilalaune12

description: The garlic noodle is great and very addicting, but the price seemed a bit overpriced just for noodles. the service was fair but not great. overall i would recommend the place.
author: cuong l.

description: omg!!!! one of my FAV places. i go about 2x per month with my boyfriend. yes, the location could be better, but the restaurant makes up for it. parking is easy with $10 validated parking. typical. the staff is great, the manager knows us now, so always a friendly experience. we always like to enjoy the lip mussels over toast, a bottle of champagne (no moet white star though :(  ) and of course 2 garlic roast crabs and some garlic noodles. mmmmm. chocolate martini for dessert ~ call that a perfect night! :)
author: Sephora X.

description: The crab is good but the service is horrible.   I went there with a friend and there was one other couple dining in the whole restaurant and the hostess sat us at this small table in the back of the restaurant.  We asked for a bigger table so that we would have more room for the crab, garlic noodles, drinks and appetizers.  She said she couldn't seat us anywhere else because we didn't have a reservation.  Ok...aside from the ONE couple that we saw at a table there was no one else in the restaurant so what the hell difference did it make where we sat.  I am sure 100 people with reservations were not coming all at once!  Anyway it was so stupid we just decided to leave and go to Thanh Long where they seem to have better sense!
author: Tammy W.

description: I love this restaurant. They have the BEST CRAB I have ever had. It is such a treat to dine here. The staff is very nice and pleasant the ambiance is beautiful they are opening another location in Palo Alto and I can't wait ! If you dine here the Garlic noodles and Butter Garlic Crab is a must! This is by far my favorite restaurant.
author: Lexi T.

description: My worst dinner experience, food was lousy, crabs tasted like days old dead crabs, which were charged at  "market price'.  The maitre d' looked like he's working for a mortuary.  High price, bad food, unlow average service.  I won't go back even if they pay me.
author: win win w.

description: garlic noodles was the siete holmes!!!!!
author: Fre D.

description: The first time I went here I took my ex to dinner for his birthday (I know I was too good for him). The food was wonderful I enjoyed everything I ordered, but I do agree with others who think it needs a makeover really bad.
author: Johnell H.

description: This place is owned by the same people at Thanh Long.  Both places have the best garlic noodle and crabs, they probably put a ton of butter in it but who cares, it's SO good.  Minus one star for being in a shady ghetto area and prices are a bit higher compared to other places like PPQ (garlic noodle and crabs are just as good).  I guess we're paying more $$$ for the ambiance.
author: Kate L.

description:
For all the many years I've been living in S.F., I've never heard of Crustacean's as THE place to go for good Vietnamese fusion food.  I have certainly heard rave reviews about The Slanted Door which lives up to its reputation of excellent and innovative Vietnamese food.
So I was quite curious to try this Crustacean's restaurant. Maybe it will be another good place to go for decent Vietnamese food.  
We arrived at the restaurant on time and were told to wait because one of us was not there. The missing person was actually trying to park the car in a busy neighborhood.  We told the maitre d', to no avail,   that we would be ordering immediately and did not need to wait for the missing person.  When the latter joined us, we were told courtly that since we did not make it to our reservation within 15 minutes, we'd have to wait for  the next available table, 1 hour and 45 minutes later. The staff at Crustacean need to be taught that no reputable restaurant will condone such poor demeaner and total disregard for their customer.  While we were waiting, I also witnessed them "toy" with other customers by making them go and change their clothes as if we, their customer, must oblige by their rules to be deserving of their food and service. Who would pay for overpriced food and subject themselves to their humiliating scrutiny and lack of manners?
author: Tracy D.

description: My first time here is my last time here. I like the decor and the food. I too had the garlic noodles which was the best I have ever had. However, it wasn;t an inviting restaurant. It is true if you have money, you like to splurge or have a special ocassion then it is a okay place to go. I can find other restaurants with the same quality of food and pricing of food and recieve good service and a welcoming atmosphere. This place lacks the welcoming atmosphere. As my husband and I walked in we were not greeted but was told that my husband had to have a dress shirt on before he can step into the restaurant. They had some dress shirts to borrow. A restaurant that makes you dress a certain way is not a place for me, because you can't be yourself in a restaurant. Our waiter didn't come and visit our table often. I have counted only once to check up on us. We thought maybe we didn;t order the more expensive stuff. We didn;t get a friendly welcome and we felt that we weren't treated equally as well. So I will never come back.
author: L C.

description: Went to Crustacean Thursday night and had a great time.  My date loved the Roast Crab and Halibut.  It  was made perfect.  Great wine list.  The bartenders were awesome.  Made some great drinks.  I'm not sure why other people are complaining about this place, must have been in a bad mood.  This was my second time there and this time we sat across from Jerry Rice, he was such a gentleman, said he's been coming here for over 10 years.  The server was efficient but I was paying attention to my date.  Of course I'll be back......
author: Jeffrey H.

description: we went here on our honeymoon per a friend's recommendation. we got the roasted crab and garlic noodles and shared them. they were great and it was enough food for the two of us. it was on the pricey side, but since we split the crab and noodles it wasn't too bad. very tasty and a fun place to visit.
author: Kristen T.

description: Compared to the parent restaurant where this originated from they solely need a revamp themselves on how Thanh Long does their food. We ordered the lobster rolls and got a crunchy but hot wet  Lobster(?) filling. l Could not identify what it was but it did not taste like lobster at all. The accompaning sauce was too sweet and obtrussive to anything delicated as lobster. The waiter recommeded the seafood salad and roasted crab. The seafood salad was a mix of thick jullienne chops of red and green pepper with a creamy sauce that was dilluted by the wetness of the vegetables that it made it look like tasteless coleslaw with seafood on top. The crab was weired also, it was hot one side but cold on the other. The oil they cooked and drenched it with tasted burned and we could see burned pieces of onion underneath the crab. So for $75 dollars, I am sure I would have gotten better food somewhere else.
author: T S.
